b5c8ac99cf701b71475a969146edec4a.source_excerpt: The strength of Mulready and the skill of Wilson were often called into requisition.

b5c8ac99cf701b71475a969146edec4a.constraint_text: The major moves only as much as necessary, no more, no less.
b5c8ac99cf701b71475a969146edec4a.source_excerpt: he only moved as much as was necessary, no more, no less, and mounted the path by an almost insensible motion.

a658b574718359c95686d2c809284d18.constraint_text: Ayrton's agreement to reveal the whole truth about Captain Grant and the Britannia is explicitly stated as the condition for Glenarvan's trust.

c8959157ff9a174193a99d9c27008de4.constraint_text: The major is never in company and never out of company; his cigar is insured, and nothing else is wanted.
c8959157ff9a174193a99d9c27008de4.source_excerpt: And as to the major he was never in company and never out of company; his cigar insured, nothing else was wanted.

77dba8f3eb86b91677d26db7776a6498.constraint_text: Paganel did not request a mission to Patagonia due to his continual abstraction.
77dba8f3eb86b91677d26db7776a6498.source_excerpt: I do not doubt that at my request the Society would have sent me to Patagonia as well as to India; but I did not think of it.

77dba8f3eb86b91677d26db7776a6498.constraint_text: Paganel's continual abstraction caused him to overlook opportunities.
77dba8f3eb86b91677d26db7776a6498.source_excerpt: The result of your continual abstraction.

8f08c23b60683f070aeaa2286579086f.constraint_text: The usurper left Elba on 26th February and landed on 1st March
8f08c23b60683f070aeaa2286579086f.source_excerpt: "the usurper left Elba on the 26th February, and landed on the 1st of March."

db81fb3b3c62f0f731fd5cf5bc07c9f8.constraint_text: The general will not break his vow in behalf of the ex-emperor due to his recent declaration for Louis XVIII.
db81fb3b3c62f0f731fd5cf5bc07c9f8.source_excerpt: I say that it is too soon after declaring myself for Louis XVIII. to break my vow in behalf of the ex-emperor.

db81fb3b3c62f0f731fd5cf5bc07c9f8.constraint_text: The general's titles (baron and field-marshal) are explicitly attributed to Louis XVIII's return to France.
db81fb3b3c62f0f731fd5cf5bc07c9f8.source_excerpt: I shall never forget that for these two titles I am indebted to his happy return to France.

5272f2516a0367d5a6d523acd4a8c822.constraint_text: Paganel possesses a consistent and reliable skill as a traveler, demonstrated by his ability to navigate in darkness and choose paths unhesitatingly.
5272f2516a0367d5a6d523acd4a8c822.source_excerpt: Paganel assumed the guidance of the little party, and his marvelous instinct as a traveler was displayed anew during this perilous journey. He managed with surprising dexterity in the thick gloom, chose unhesitatingly the almost invisible paths, and kept constantly an undeviating course.

52b183041624df808f8377e6c8db4119.constraint_text: Franz continued to ponder the singular history he had recently listened to without arriving at satisfactory replies.
52b183041624df808f8377e6c8db4119.source_excerpt: he continued to ponder over the singular history he had so lately listened to, and to ask himself an interminable number of questions touching its various circumstances without, however, arriving at a satisfactory reply to any of them.

ca029328190782d0e9d2ae445fe211f9.constraint_text: A notary cannot legally perform an act without being thoroughly convinced they have interpreted the client's will and wishes faithfully.
ca029328190782d0e9d2ae445fe211f9.source_excerpt: "The first thing necessary to render an act valid is, that the notary should be thoroughly convinced that he has faithfully interpreted the will and wishes of the person dictating the act."

ca029328190782d0e9d2ae445fe211f9.constraint_text: Valentine arrested the notary's departure due to Noirtier's expression of grief.
ca029328190782d0e9d2ae445fe211f9.source_excerpt: Noirtier looked at Valentine with an expression so full of grief, that she arrested the departure of the notary.

d60725887ae1f9fc5b46f1879b2cc16a.constraint_text: Harry Grant must have been made prisoner by the natives as soon as he landed, because he did not reach any English colony.
d60725887ae1f9fc5b46f1879b2cc16a.source_excerpt: He knew his position exactly, as the document proves, and, as he has not reached any English colony, he must have been made prisoner by the natives as soon as he landed.

d60725887ae1f9fc5b46f1879b2cc16a.constraint_text: The Australians are not cruel, and Europeans have lived among them without experiencing brutality.
d60725887ae1f9fc5b46f1879b2cc16a.source_excerpt: The Australians are not cruel, madam... some Europeans have lived a long time among them, without having any reason to complain of brutality.

6986918bdd81d3219a2746c9868592ed.constraint_text: Water is extremely scarce in the region due to a drought, making it impossible to obtain even for a prisoner.
6986918bdd81d3219a2746c9868592ed.source_excerpt: Oh, water is even more scarce than wine, your excellency,—there has been such a drought.

6986918bdd81d3219a2746c9868592ed.constraint_text: Wine is prohibitively expensive near Rome, creating a fixed economic limitation.
6986918bdd81d3219a2746c9868592ed.source_excerpt: Your excellency knows that wine is beyond all price near Rome.

7149c4d9a151983f32e8cc9c11300bba.constraint_text: Dantès read the incriminating letter three times and committed its wording to memory
7149c4d9a151983f32e8cc9c11300bba.source_excerpt: "Oh yes, I read it over three times, and the words sank deeply into my memory."

c7e217c9f4f8e4036b92edb3d61ff7a1.constraint_text: Must guard the secret of her birth and avoid allusions to her past
c7e217c9f4f8e4036b92edb3d61ff7a1.source_excerpt: Guard carefully the secret of your birth. Make no allusion to the past;

c7e217c9f4f8e4036b92edb3d61ff7a1.constraint_text: Must never pronounce the names of her father or mother
c7e217c9f4f8e4036b92edb3d61ff7a1.source_excerpt: nor upon any occasion be induced to pronounce the names of your illustrious father or ill-fated mother.

2f20395dfc7ecbffa2ca24d4469b5036.constraint_text: In France, marriage requires civil papers to establish identity, making it impossible to marry 'orthodoxly' without them.
2f20395dfc7ecbffa2ca24d4469b5036.source_excerpt: Marriage is a civil affair in France, and in order to marry in an orthodox manner you must have papers which undeniably establish your identity.

11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.constraint_text: M. Noirtier has consistently been a Jacobin more than anything else.
11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.source_excerpt: My father has been a Jacobin more than anything else

11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.constraint_text: M. Noirtier never projected Utopian schemes and applied the theories of The Mountain to realize possibilities.
11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.source_excerpt: he never projected any Utopian schemes which could never be realized, but strove for possibilities, and he applied to the realization of these possibilities the terrible theories of The Mountain

11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.constraint_text: M. Noirtier's conspiracies were explicitly directed against the Bourbons, not for the emperor.
11b80b1a1f00c83633958a8c3c9dc0d3.source_excerpt: When my father conspired, it was not for the emperor, it was against the Bourbons

f61b9f08cef4d5374a921a0d41fb051f.constraint_text: Valentine's will has been thwarted and spirits broken since childhood due to her father's stern rule.
f61b9f08cef4d5374a921a0d41fb051f.source_excerpt: whose will has been thwarted, and spirits broken, from the age of ten years, beneath the iron rod so sternly held over me

f61b9f08cef4d5374a921a0d41fb051f.constraint_text: M. Villefort is described as having a stern character that prevents him from showing tenderness to his daughter.
f61b9f08cef4d5374a921a0d41fb051f.source_excerpt: The general remark is, 'Oh, it cannot be expected that one of so stern a character as M. Villefort could lavish the tenderness some fathers do on their daughters.'

f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.constraint_text: The banker requires explanations to understand motives.
f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.source_excerpt: "You must be aware, at all events, that it is impossible for me to understand motives before they are explained to me"

f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.constraint_text: The count has a proud and irritable temper that influences his behavior.
f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.source_excerpt: his proud and irritable temper scarcely allowed him to restrain

f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.constraint_text: The count's inability to restrain his anger is caused by his proud and irritable temper.
f7f09eb16cfe208560089a829945abdb.source_excerpt: his proud and irritable temper scarcely allowed him to restrain

8414c82471ebb5406c4d4301f68d9ceb.constraint_text: His proud and irritable temper is the cause of his inability to fully restrain his anger.
8414c82471ebb5406c4d4301f68d9ceb.source_excerpt: the proud and irritable temper scarcely allowed him to restrain

516ea73ac7f4b512b8d124f5c886dfe3.constraint_text: Monte Cristo refuses to protect a society that does not protect him and assigns society a low place in his esteem
516ea73ac7f4b512b8d124f5c886dfe3.source_excerpt: I never seek to protect a society which does not protect me, and which I will even say, generally occupies itself about me only to injure me; and thus by giving them a low place in my esteem, and preserving a neutrality towards them, it is society and my neighbor who are indebted to me.

92f2dbb3dc159bc847a6c9f39fd3b92a.constraint_text: Eugénie has not manifested any opposition since the affair began
92f2dbb3dc159bc847a6c9f39fd3b92a.source_excerpt: since this little affair began, I have not manifested the slightest opposition

92f2dbb3dc159bc847a6c9f39fd3b92a.constraint_text: Eugénie finds it impossible to proceed despite having tried to obey until the last moment
92f2dbb3dc159bc847a6c9f39fd3b92a.source_excerpt: I have tried to the very last and now that the moment has come, I feel in spite of all my efforts that it is impossible

d966e518960f39327002263fc18c6c9f.constraint_text: Cannot molest Napoleon without breaking the treaties of 1814
d966e518960f39327002263fc18c6c9f.source_excerpt: "there are the treaties of 1814, and we cannot molest Napoleon without breaking those compacts."

d6266ca2d6b0c6348a9fc07f702783f4.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès is labeled as an inveterate Bonapartist who took an active part in the return from the Island of Elba, and is ordered to be kept in strict solitary confinement and closely watched and guarded.
d6266ca2d6b0c6348a9fc07f702783f4.source_excerpt: Edmond Dantès. An inveterate Bonapartist; took an active part in the return from the Island of Elba. To be kept in strict solitary confinement, and to be closely watched and guarded.

16298f5455a8be9c280781c6e7ab6e16.constraint_text: Villefort has always believed General de Quesnel was assassinated, not killed in a duel, due to M. Noirtier's omission.
16298f5455a8be9c280781c6e7ab6e16.source_excerpt: he had all his life entertained the belief that General de Quesnel... fell the victim of assassination, and not that he was killed fairly in a duel.

27c2328135de4e6d1a3a4c967d351a26.constraint_text: Noirtier's calm resignation was caused by the abbé's Christian exhortations, kind charity, or persuasive words
27c2328135de4e6d1a3a4c967d351a26.source_excerpt: Perhaps it was the Christian exhortations of the abbé, perhaps his kind charity, perhaps his persuasive words, which had restored the courage of Noirtier, for ever since he had conversed with the priest his violent despair had yielded to a calm resignation

27c2328135de4e6d1a3a4c967d351a26.constraint_text: M. de Villefort had not seen his father since the morning of the death
27c2328135de4e6d1a3a4c967d351a26.source_excerpt: M. de Villefort had not seen his father since the morning of the death

f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.constraint_text: Faria's political plan was conceived in 1807, directly preceding Napoleon's similar attempt in 1811
f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.source_excerpt: Because in 1807 I dreamed of the very plan Napoleon tried to realize in 1811

f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.constraint_text: Faria's imprisonment resulted from his political ambitions and betrayal by a trusted ally
f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.source_excerpt: because I fancied I had found my Cæsar Borgia in a crowned simpleton, who feigned to enter into my views only to betray me

f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.constraint_text: Faria's political vision for Italy persisted as a fixed belief
f06a876e1bf695af0dd0a817dbbbdcba.source_excerpt: because, like Machiavelli, I desired to alter the political face of Italy

a54ff6bd9eab44fd8fbc661d254c0c63.constraint_text: The speaker declares an irreversible vendetta to kill the Corsican man who killed his brother.
a54ff6bd9eab44fd8fbc661d254c0c63.source_excerpt: ‘...I will kill you. From this moment I declare the vendetta against you...’

a54ff6bd9eab44fd8fbc661d254c0c63.constraint_text: The Corsican man’s behavior (self-isolation, relocation) is directly caused by the vendetta declaration.
a54ff6bd9eab44fd8fbc661d254c0c63.source_excerpt: he knew so well, that from that moment he shut himself in his house... he was nominated to Versailles.

fc06ee5672b08d466662310b5e79e000.constraint_text: John Lateran will be executed by mazzolato for being an accomplice of Luigi Vampa.
fc06ee5672b08d466662310b5e79e000.source_excerpt: John Lateran; and the latter convicted of being an accomplice of the atrocious and sanguinary bandit, Luigi Vampa, and his band. The first-named malefactor will be _mazzolato_, the second culprit _decapitato_.

fc06ee5672b08d466662310b5e79e000.constraint_text: Luigi Vampa's identity as 'Sinbad the Sailor' is explicitly linked to his prior activities in Porto-Vecchio and Tunis.
fc06ee5672b08d466662310b5e79e000.source_excerpt: In all probability, therefore, the Transteverin was no other than the bandit Luigi Vampa himself, and the man shrouded in the mantle the same he had known as 'Sinbad the Sailor,' but who, no doubt, was still pursuing his philanthropic expedition in Rome, as he had already done at Porto-Vecchio and Tunis.

97cd6dfdbbba450da8cc44963c1b1a96.constraint_text: Caderousse's revenge plan cannot have consequences for himself
97cd6dfdbbba450da8cc44963c1b1a96.source_excerpt: now your revenge looks like common sense, for in no way can it revert to yourself

c0a70ebe5d61a6b07d644bf98bccf148.constraint_text: On the 20th of November, he left companions behind to reduce the group size for a northward journey.
c0a70ebe5d61a6b07d644bf98bccf148.source_excerpt: Again, on the 20th of November, he still further diminished his numbers by leaving behind at an encampment several of his companions, that he and three others might press on towards the north with as little incumbrance as possible.

c0a70ebe5d61a6b07d644bf98bccf148.constraint_text: By the 7th of January, they had reached the southern limit of the tropical heat.
c0a70ebe5d61a6b07d644bf98bccf148.source_excerpt: By the 7th of January they had gone so far as to reach the southern limit of the tropical heat;

785236ea93e9af2254193ea0bce8b935.constraint_text: Dantès had never considered escape as a possibility before this moment
785236ea93e9af2254193ea0bce8b935.source_excerpt: Escape had never once occurred to him.

ac86c3cda33d5663ab484163476d67fe.constraint_text: Noirtier has been on his guard as a persistent trait

37e0d3f481ee2a4e4003ca2ed5f9ba15.constraint_text: All individuals who knew the Comte de Morcerf at the vizier's court are either dead or have disappeared, leaving no available witnesses to corroborate his claims.
37e0d3f481ee2a4e4003ca2ed5f9ba15.source_excerpt: 'all those who surrounded the vizier, or who knew me at his court, are either dead or gone away, I know not where.'

37e0d3f481ee2a4e4003ca2ed5f9ba15.constraint_text: The Comte de Morcerf is the sole survivor of his countrymen from the war that destroyed the vizier's court.
37e0d3f481ee2a4e4003ca2ed5f9ba15.source_excerpt: 'I believe that I alone, of all my countrymen, survived that dreadful war.'

12f2015496b6a21d480aa89763326d7b.constraint_text: Noirtier uses closing his right eye as a consistent method to communicate requests.

dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.constraint_text: The captain will not leave his post for an instant
dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.source_excerpt: The captain would not leave his post for an instant.

dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.constraint_text: The captain's face remains impassive despite internal fear
dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.source_excerpt: He was tortured by fears that his impassive face would not betray

dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.constraint_text: The Duncan is currently being driven toward the Australian coast with unstoppable speed
dff3cfb58dd7d5f2f927fac3751d5717.source_excerpt: The Duncan, driven out of her course, was running towards the Australian coast with a swiftness that nothing could arrest.

be61a05d1353d589b6e216492955545e.constraint_text: During the entire period of exile, only two or three ships appeared on the horizon
be61a05d1353d589b6e216492955545e.source_excerpt: During the entire period of our exile only two or three sails appeared on the horizon, and these soon to disappear again.

be61a05d1353d589b6e216492955545e.constraint_text: The narrator and companions maintained a state of partial despair without complete hopelessness for two years and a half
be61a05d1353d589b6e216492955545e.source_excerpt: We no longer hoped, but still did not wholly despair.

20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.constraint_text: He is lying on his bournous in a bed of dry heather
20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.source_excerpt: He rose to his seat, and found himself lying on his bournous in a bed of dry heather

20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.constraint_text: The vision and statues vanished at his waking
20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.source_excerpt: The vision had fled; and as if the statues had been but shadows from the tomb, they had vanished at his waking

20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.constraint_text: He touched stone when stretching forth his hand
20592bbf4bf7c8563cdf706bc538b2df.source_excerpt: He stretched forth his hand, and touched stone

96b7e44d7c3a7a30c400a15dc75231e4.constraint_text: He died on the 5th of June, 1866
96b7e44d7c3a7a30c400a15dc75231e4.source_excerpt: he died on the 5th of June, 1866

c640e168958bb63ae4121f9e7712ed6b.constraint_text: Thalcave possesses highly-trained senses and natural instincts that allow him to foresee danger, distinguishing him from others who would not suspect threats in similar circumstances.
c640e168958bb63ae4121f9e7712ed6b.source_excerpt: But where a stranger would have suspected nothing, the highly-trained senses and natural instinct of the Indian foresaw the coming danger.

5bb8b511b1f9429ebe846ade6682e6f0.constraint_text: Captain Mangles had only one possible course of action: to rig a storm-jib
5bb8b511b1f9429ebe846ade6682e6f0.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles had but one resource,--to rig a storm-jib.

d7bc2981167cc2cc31f4b3693577df30.constraint_text: The speaker has always been opposed to Valentine’s marriage, and the contract was entered without their consent or approbation.
d7bc2981167cc2cc31f4b3693577df30.source_excerpt: I have always been opposed to this marriage, and that the contract was entered into entirely without my consent or approbation.

b53968c167b07b8842f06432f57f449a.source_excerpt: Yes, yes; and now I believe you are right, and that you have really saved my life

b53968c167b07b8842f06432f57f449a.constraint_text: Noirtier exhibits an easy swagger as one of his principal characteristics
b53968c167b07b8842f06432f57f449a.source_excerpt: walked about with that easy swagger which was one of his principal characteristics

f589a79167c4f77271164832d5c91841.constraint_text: The abbé has exercised patience over a long period through daily repetitive tasks.
f589a79167c4f77271164832d5c91841.source_excerpt: As for patience, I consider that I have abundantly exercised that in beginning every morning the task of the night before, and every night renewing the task of the day.

588b2068ff48ad6a6ca5c41abe85b838.constraint_text: The luxuries in his life rendered it 'so easy and so happy' since his infancy.
588b2068ff48ad6a6ca5c41abe85b838.source_excerpt: since his infancy; he looked at the pictures, whose faces seemed to smile, and the landscapes, which appeared painted in brighter colors.

0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.constraint_text: The narrator was not characterized by their current traits during youth or on the night of the betrothal.
0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.source_excerpt: I was not so in my youth, I was not so on the night of the betrothal

0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.constraint_text: The narrator's current traits and behaviors emerged after the betrothal event.
0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.source_excerpt: But since then everything has changed in and about me

0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.constraint_text: The narrator persists in bravely confronting obstacles and adversaries.
0d4aef9a16ff4e9ab9139adad0ca54ee.source_excerpt: I am accustomed to brave difficulties, and, in the conflict to crush those who... interfere with me in my career

d63b49f1908588337722027defb6010c.constraint_text: The yellow paper in the breviary was kept there by the explicit request of the heirs and had served as a marker for centuries.
d63b49f1908588337722027defb6010c.source_excerpt: I had seen in the famous breviary, which was on the table beside me, an old paper quite yellow with age, and which had served as a marker for centuries, kept there by the request of the heirs.

b38bde53d267a80933c0a5b0405c8826.constraint_text: Only the heads of his enemies are displayed in his pah's collection
b38bde53d267a80933c0a5b0405c8826.source_excerpt: In Kai-Koumou's pah only the heads of his enemies formed this frightful museum

1a842e9a6c373a97353a7ab52f159a29.constraint_text: Traces of the shipwrecked seamen can only be found in the Pacific Ocean, not in desert regions.
1a842e9a6c373a97353a7ab52f159a29.source_excerpt: There only could traces of the shipwrecked seamen be found, and not in these desert regions.

7b1295c654a2489f9405c4d01293a792.constraint_text: Noirtier disinherits Valentine because she married against his wishes
7b1295c654a2489f9405c4d01293a792.source_excerpt: ‘And you disinherit your granddaughter,’ continued the notary, ‘because she has contracted an engagement contrary to your wishes?’ ‘Yes.’

7b1295c654a2489f9405c4d01293a792.constraint_text: Valentine would have been Noirtier’s heir if she had not married Franz d’Épinay
7b1295c654a2489f9405c4d01293a792.source_excerpt: ‘So that, but for this marriage, she would have been your heir?’ ‘Yes.’

0f7a6d377237dc88a41e40982cf277b7.constraint_text: Morcerf has only one son and this is the first time he has considered marrying him.
0f7a6d377237dc88a41e40982cf277b7.source_excerpt: as I have but one son, and it is the first time I have ever thought of marrying him

0f7a6d377237dc88a41e40982cf277b7.constraint_text: The marriage proposal has been under discussion for exactly eight years.
0f7a6d377237dc88a41e40982cf277b7.source_excerpt: the eight years which have elapsed since this marriage was first discussed between us

5a735a48fc78fff7d5ec29c02eb6f97f.constraint_text: Cæsar's skin remained permanently spotted by poison after surviving the poisoning
5a735a48fc78fff7d5ec29c02eb6f97f.source_excerpt: Cæsar, poisoned at the same time, escaped by shedding his skin like a snake; but the new skin was spotted by the poison till it looked like a tiger’s.

5a735a48fc78fff7d5ec29c02eb6f97f.constraint_text: The Spada family did not resume their former position after the pope's death and Cæsar's exile
5a735a48fc78fff7d5ec29c02eb6f97f.source_excerpt: After the pope’s death and his son’s exile, it was supposed that the Spada family would resume the splendid position they had held before the cardinal’s time; but this was not the case.

e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.constraint_text: M. Noirtier has been pursuing a treatment for the last three years to neutralize the effects of poison.
e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.source_excerpt: the treatment he has been pursuing for the last three years neutralized the effects of the poison

e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.constraint_text: Valentine's system was already impregnated with poison, which caused the treatment to fail.
e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.source_excerpt: your system was already impregnated with it

e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.constraint_text: Valentine shared all her grandfather's beverages during the last month.
e3f9c029ddf8e92e833c111c966c3ede.source_excerpt: grandpapa has made me share all his beverages during the last month

5efa7f6a36bf7b7cd622f59b39164ec0.constraint_text: Carlini slew Rita because she would have been the sport of the whole band, and he loved her.

aabbf9e10409746810690aedf0524a4f.source_excerpt: The sharp albatross bone, used by Maori tattooers, had furrowed his face five times, in close and deep lines. That he had reached his fifth promotion was evident from his haughty bearing.

8ac19326be2f67a16d9edb048544777e.constraint_text: The Indian must attack the nandou directly rather than attempting to decoy it, due to the bird's swiftness and evasive movements.
8ac19326be2f67a16d9edb048544777e.source_excerpt: The Indian did not try to decoy so nimble an animal, but urged his horse to a gallop, straight towards the bird, so as to overtake it at once, for, if the first attack should fail, the nandou would soon fatigue both horse and rider with its giddy backward and forward movements.

e79bbbf57efb287ab1229f4d4b83ffd0.constraint_text: The owner claims his name is 'Sinbad the Sailor' when asked, though this is doubted by others.
e79bbbf57efb287ab1229f4d4b83ffd0.source_excerpt: "If you ask him, he says Sinbad the Sailor; but I doubt if it be his real name."

e81407267d986387f5a158ee47dc9b9a.constraint_text: Is identified as the father of the young man
Sent a ransom to the frontier of Piedmont after receiving a letter about his son's abduction
e81407267d986387f5a158ee47dc9b9a.source_excerpt: At length, he one day received a letter, stating that the abductors of his son now offered to restore him, or at least to give notice where he might be found, on condition of receiving a large sum of money, by way of ransom. Your father did not hesitate an instant, and the sum was sent to the frontier of Piedmont, with a passport signed for Italy.

3755416f05bd21f29e7228e21c79a22c.constraint_text: The narrator deposited the child at the asylum on a specific day and hour.
3755416f05bd21f29e7228e21c79a22c.source_excerpt: having written down the day and hour at which I had deposited the child at the asylum

3755416f05bd21f29e7228e21c79a22c.constraint_text: The narrator's moments of sadness since the assassination of the procureur are explicitly caused by abandoning the child.
3755416f05bd21f29e7228e21c79a22c.source_excerpt: the only moments of sadness I had known since the assassination of the procureur were caused by the recollection that I had abandoned this child

d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.constraint_text: The narrator explicitly states that Israel is dead and avenged, fixing this as an irreversible fact.
d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.source_excerpt: “Console thyself, sister; Israel is dead, but he is avenged.’

d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.constraint_text: The narrator retains half the linen marked with a letter as proof to reclaim the child if they become rich, assigning a specific cause (future wealth) to a future action (reclaiming the child).
d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.source_excerpt: In reply I gave her the half of the linen I had kept in order to reclaim him if we became rich.

d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.constraint_text: The linen was split into two pieces at a specific time (after the child was taken), with one half retained by the narrator.
d13007e202c811f9450573dfc8720a96.source_excerpt: after having taken the precaution of cutting the linen in two pieces, so that one of the two letters which marked it was on the piece wrapped around the child, while the other remained in my possession

e80b9b2ba3a22590022783a7b2899237.constraint_text: Believes Corsicans always keep their word
e80b9b2ba3a22590022783a7b2899237.source_excerpt: you know that they always keep their word.

e80b9b2ba3a22590022783a7b2899237.constraint_text: Refuses to act because the request was made two months too late
e80b9b2ba3a22590022783a7b2899237.source_excerpt: you should have told me this two months ago, it is too late now.

2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.constraint_text: The speaker determined that 150 well-chosen books contain all essential human knowledge a person needs.
2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.source_excerpt: I found out that with one hundred and fifty well-chosen books a man possesses, if not a complete summary of all human knowledge, at least all that a man need really know.

2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.constraint_text: The speaker spent exactly three years studying 150 books until he knew them by heart.
2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.source_excerpt: I devoted three years of my life to reading and studying these one hundred and fifty volumes, till I knew them nearly by heart

2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.constraint_text: The speaker retains perfect recall of the 150 books' contents even in prison.
2f84f8cb613b5a0fb4304f4f80d7c2b7.source_excerpt: so that since I have been in prison, a very slight effort of memory has enabled me to recall their contents as readily as though the pages were open before me

8cfcf50db3863c0848ae1586c92bb633.constraint_text: The count's serenity increases as the distance from Paris increases.
8cfcf50db3863c0848ae1586c92bb633.source_excerpt: As the distance increased between the travellers and Paris, almost superhuman serenity appeared to surround the count;

132e7fac6bf1d4d435b40016bcf94826.constraint_text: Must examine wrecks along the continental shore as per Lord Glenarvan's orders
132e7fac6bf1d4d435b40016bcf94826.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles, according to Lord Glenarvan's orders, had kept close to the shore of the continent, examining the numerous wrecks that lined it.

25bd7d6e888b98aceccde1bd29a01e9b.constraint_text: The major awaits the end with the indifference of a Mussulman.
25bd7d6e888b98aceccde1bd29a01e9b.source_excerpt: the major awaited the end with the indifference of a Mussulman.

ba3c3c4fe5d0f7b1937bb0f18b15bae3.constraint_text: Andrea's wife's fortune is explicitly stated as five hundred thousand livres, as confirmed by M. Danglars.
ba3c3c4fe5d0f7b1937bb0f18b15bae3.source_excerpt: "Is my wife’s fortune five hundred thousand livres?" "That is the sum M. Danglars himself announced."

fd206ba036a327a76e24100b90f5d153.constraint_text: If the man returns to Beaucaire without the diamond, he will inform against them, and they will likely never see the Abbé Busoni again.
fd206ba036a327a76e24100b90f5d153.source_excerpt: ‘If he returns to Beaucaire without the diamond, he will inform against us, and, as he says, who knows if we shall ever again see the Abbé Busoni?—in all probability we shall never see him.’

8f37d1e5403c14a9e4e20b3e4b6d654b.constraint_text: Danglars had never read any book other than Don Quixote
8f37d1e5403c14a9e4e20b3e4b6d654b.source_excerpt: the only book he had ever read

8f37d1e5403c14a9e4e20b3e4b6d654b.constraint_text: Danglars’ knowledge of the time depended on having wound his watch the previous night
8f37d1e5403c14a9e4e20b3e4b6d654b.source_excerpt: which he had carefully wound up on the previous night

a5f413ba62dd044b5810804273e76e40.constraint_text: The count always carries a key around his neck that never leaves him.
a5f413ba62dd044b5810804273e76e40.source_excerpt: which he wore round his neck, and which never left him

e86616f27f33768a15d8d6ad23c3a6f1.constraint_text: The steel mail tunic worn by Monte Cristo is explicitly identified as the last of its kind in France, historically associated with Louis XVI's fear of daggers.
e86616f27f33768a15d8d6ad23c3a6f1.source_excerpt: the last in France where daggers are no longer dreaded, was worn by King Louis XVI., who feared the dagger at his breast

fc18248eabab768dcde896d3cd4fb845.constraint_text: The discovery of the secret was caused by a great event that must remain unknown to others
fc18248eabab768dcde896d3cd4fb845.source_excerpt: "the discovery of this secret has been occasioned by a great event which you must never know."

18f9ce8ffc02ec7006ba82265dd4ec38.constraint_text: The sun and earth never vary in their appointed paths
18f9ce8ffc02ec7006ba82265dd4ec38.source_excerpt: the sun and earth never vary in their appointed paths

18f9ce8ffc02ec7006ba82265dd4ec38.constraint_text: Believed the sun moved rather than the earth
18f9ce8ffc02ec7006ba82265dd4ec38.source_excerpt: he had always imagined, from seeing the sun rise from behind the mountains and set in the Mediterranean, that it moved, and not the earth

184d0bb7b86e067bdfe73d899cedd776.constraint_text: A sentinel was stationed at Danglars' door from 8:00 AM until 12:00 PM, after which they were replaced by another guard.
184d0bb7b86e067bdfe73d899cedd776.source_excerpt: During all this time a sentinel, who had been relieved at eight o’clock, had been watching his door. ... At twelve this man was replaced by another functionary

dfc67dd50e9480bfe4b332c1a3489db7.constraint_text: The count assigns the ease of dying to the observation of others dying, stating that 'the more men you see die, the easier it becomes to die yourself.'
dfc67dd50e9480bfe4b332c1a3489db7.source_excerpt: the more men you see die, the easier it becomes to die yourself

dc06ac45cddb4d7cae720879133f5c3b.constraint_text: Villefort remains eternally encircled in a round of general conditions and has never dared to transcend them.
dc06ac45cddb4d7cae720879133f5c3b.source_excerpt: Because you remain eternally encircled in a round of general conditions, and have never dared to raise your wings into those upper spheres which God has peopled with invisible or exceptional beings.

c3f3784cb83a14ba4c056d8d9c8685e1.constraint_text: The son could not find his father's grave ten years after his death, as the tomb had disappeared and no one could confirm its location.
c3f3784cb83a14ba4c056d8d9c8685e1.source_excerpt: his tomb had disappeared, and no one could say, 'There sleeps the father you so well loved.'

c3f3784cb83a14ba4c056d8d9c8685e1.constraint_text: The woman was faithless and married one of the persecutors of her betrothed.
c3f3784cb83a14ba4c056d8d9c8685e1.source_excerpt: she was faithless, and had married one of the persecutors of her betrothed.

9e4bbec539920bc08ce621dd3c45de87.constraint_text: Cocles' single eye became dim over the course of nine years
9e4bbec539920bc08ce621dd3c45de87.source_excerpt: as he had but one eye, and that eye had become somewhat dim in the course of nine years

17069ca3495e73d1260f6fdf48eb114c.constraint_text: Villefort's father remained fundamentally Jacobin in nature despite external roles
17069ca3495e73d1260f6fdf48eb114c.source_excerpt: my father has been a Jacobin more than anything else... the senator’s robe... only served to disguise the old man without in any degree changing him

17069ca3495e73d1260f6fdf48eb114c.constraint_text: Villefort's father conspired against the Bourbons rather than for Napoleon
17069ca3495e73d1260f6fdf48eb114c.source_excerpt: When my father conspired, it was not for the emperor, it was against the Bourbons

e3c9b6bc96193daf8f9fb52365534c83.constraint_text: M. Andrea inherited papers proving his noble lineage as the son of the Marquis Bartolomeo and the Marchioness Oliva Corsinari.
e3c9b6bc96193daf8f9fb52365534c83.source_excerpt: M. Andrea at his departure inherited all the papers which proved that he had indeed the honor of being the son of the Marquis Bartolomeo and the Marchioness Oliva Corsinari.

e0658b4a86a94a30409b936b5f56e7b9.constraint_text: Paganel practices the difficulties of the Spanish language daily using a specific book.
e0658b4a86a94a30409b936b5f56e7b9.source_excerpt: "Here is the book in which I practice daily the difficulties of the Spanish language!"

459f3e9aafc1a6c7677fb6312079b3f1.constraint_text: Paganel has a recurring tendency to commit blunders, particularly in linguistic judgments.
459f3e9aafc1a6c7677fb6312079b3f1.source_excerpt: "Ah, my learned friend!" said the major, while a half smile played about his lips, "you have committed one of those blunders peculiar to you."

b37fc1703a6d596bb8bbad0ae58690e8.constraint_text: The speaker learned modern Greek through the aid of ancient Greek, but does not speak it as well as desired.
b37fc1703a6d596bb8bbad0ae58690e8.source_excerpt: "by the aid of ancient Greek I learned modern Greek—I don’t speak it so well as I could wish, but I am still trying to improve myself."

02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.constraint_text: The word 'austral' must mean 'southern countries' in the document's interpretation.
02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.source_excerpt: "It is what it was at first. It simply means the southern (_australes_) countries."

02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.constraint_text: The term 'indi' is explicitly defined as the first two syllables of 'indigence' (destitution) to resolve prior interpretations.
02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.source_excerpt: "The third and last time, it shall be the first two syllables of the word _indigence_ (destitution)."

02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.constraint_text: The word 'contin' cannot mean 'continent' because New Zealand is an island.
02061c828765e618387587a4bc8176c2.source_excerpt: "No, since New Zealand is only an island."

a1035e3299c3e994d767fb9d1c033317.constraint_text: The prisoner's death was inevitable due to the fall's mechanics: either killed instantly by falling flat or dragged to the bottom by weight if falling upright.
a1035e3299c3e994d767fb9d1c033317.source_excerpt: he must either have fallen flat, in which case the blow, from a height of ninety feet, must have killed him instantly, or he must have fallen upright, and then the weight would have dragged him to the bottom

fe86a6664950e0dc3b72591ad21d721b.constraint_text: The major explicitly states he will shoot any sailor who approaches.
fe86a6664950e0dc3b72591ad21d721b.source_excerpt: "The first of these wretches who approaches," said the major calmly, "I will shoot like a dog."

62d4dfaaaad60e6a9becb1c37a04a966.constraint_text: The character's capture was caused by being tracked by a customs-officer who summoned comrades to intercept him.
62d4dfaaaad60e6a9becb1c37a04a966.source_excerpt: I had been tracked by a customs-officer, who had lost sight of me near the tavern; feeling certain that I intended to pass the night there, he had returned to summon his comrades, who just arrived in time to hear the report of the pistol, and to take me in the midst of such circumstantial proofs of my guilt as rendered all hopes of proving my innocence utterly futile.

d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.constraint_text: Glenarvan forbade any single attempt to cross the plains alone due to the risk of bandits.
d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.source_excerpt: A man risks too much to venture alone across this desert, infested with bandits.

d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.constraint_text: Glenarvan's decision to wait for a practicable passage was adopted 'rather tardily,' fixing the timing of this measure.
d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.source_excerpt: These measures were wise, but they had been adopted rather tardily.

d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.constraint_text: Sending Mulready with the letter explicitly caused the misfortunes (including the attack on the sailor).
d8cef0dee6c2e67b5e0874a094f28d7c.source_excerpt: If they had not sent Mulready with the letter, what misfortunes would have been avoided, not to speak of the attack upon the sailor!

af0f5ec48b07fd9bfa9bfcb7594eab46.constraint_text: The swollen state of the Snowy River is caused by an unusual seasonal fatality against which Ayrton is powerless.
af0f5ec48b07fd9bfa9bfcb7594eab46.source_excerpt: "It is unusual to find a river so much swollen at this season; it is a fatality against which I am powerless."

f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.constraint_text: The Government refused to lend their aid in his project of colonization and raised obstacles against it.
f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.source_excerpt: the Government refused to lend their aid in his project of colonization; nay, they even raised obstacles which in any other country would have overcome the project.

f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.constraint_text: Harry Grant would not be discouraged by obstacles in his project.
f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.source_excerpt: Harry Grant would not be discouraged.

f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.constraint_text: No news of the Britannia was received after June 1862.
f814c0f4ff0551ae467b4a88bed1423b.source_excerpt: Until May, 1862, they had received news of him, but since his departure from Callao, in the month of June, no one had heard anything of the Britannia...

a5b6fc76b5f20de0e2f813cc9823c25d.constraint_text: It was impossible to learn secrets concealed by a man from all the world.
a5b6fc76b5f20de0e2f813cc9823c25d.source_excerpt: it was really impossible to learn secrets which that man concealed from all the world.

14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.constraint_text: The middle window at the Café Rospoli will be hung with white damask bearing a red cross if the reprieve is obtained.
14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.source_excerpt: "the middle window at the Café Rospoli will be hung with white damask, bearing a red cross."

14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.constraint_text: All three windows will have yellow draperies if the reprieve is not obtained.
14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.source_excerpt: "And if you fail?... all three windows will have yellow draperies."

14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.constraint_text: The Transteverin pledges absolute obedience and will carry out any request from the stranger, regardless of location or time.
14e8a730558909e015f05e59d7ff74f1.source_excerpt: "you may regard it as done, for done it shall be, on the word and faith of——... depend upon me as firmly as I do upon you."

40229ff48c6149cb502647cc68427f83.constraint_text: The police have a fixed description of Noirtier's appearance (dark complexion, black hair/eyebrows/whiskers, blue frock-coat, etc.) from the morning of General Quesnel's disappearance.
40229ff48c6149cb502647cc68427f83.source_excerpt: the description of the man who, on the morning of the day when General Quesnel disappeared, presented himself at his house.

7381cb1aba61ea2a783ccde0bd251981.constraint_text: His calm expression and demeanor are unaffected by personal grief or human emotions
7381cb1aba61ea2a783ccde0bd251981.source_excerpt: Everyone looked with astonishment on that grave and severe face, whose calm expression personal griefs had been unable to disturb, and the aspect of a man who was a stranger to all human emotions excited something very like terror.

27cd947f37e0646ce378c73731090bf4.constraint_text: Talking politics with M. Debray led to the false belief about Don Carlos's return, causing a 700,000 franc loss.
27cd947f37e0646ce378c73731090bf4.source_excerpt: Well, three days after that you talked politics with M. Debray, and you fancied from his words that Don Carlos had returned to Spain. Well, I sold my shares, the news got out, and I no longer sold—I gave them away, next day I find the news was false, and by this false report I have lost 700,000 francs.

27cd947f37e0646ce378c73731090bf4.constraint_text: You are obligated to repay 175,000 francs as a fourth of the 700,000 franc loss attributed to your actions.
27cd947f37e0646ce378c73731090bf4.source_excerpt: since I gave you a fourth of my gains, I think you owe me a fourth of my losses; the fourth of 700,000 francs is 175,000 francs.

68304a1096640ee6f7e45c1b88e3256c.constraint_text: Maintains an agreement with the man who pastes execution announcements to deliver them to his hotel for guests
68304a1096640ee6f7e45c1b88e3256c.source_excerpt: I make an agreement with the man who pastes up the papers, and he brings them to me as he would the playbills, that in case any person staying at my hotel should like to witness an execution, he may obtain every requisite information concerning the time and place etc.

3f946300e39a728682c9ad36551a61e0.constraint_text: Villefort's grief protected him despite his acknowledged guilt
3f946300e39a728682c9ad36551a61e0.source_excerpt: Though he had acknowledged his guilt, he was protected by his grief.

592202dd6fafc7a0992689a5232ed8b0.constraint_text: The narrator's fortune is explicitly assigned a divine purpose from the time of their restoration to light and liberty.
592202dd6fafc7a0992689a5232ed8b0.source_excerpt: From that time I looked upon this fortune as something confided to me for a particular purpose.

592202dd6fafc7a0992689a5232ed8b0.constraint_text: The narrator explicitly states they did not consider a peaceful life with Mercédès after their restoration to fortune.
592202dd6fafc7a0992689a5232ed8b0.source_excerpt: Not a thought was given to a life which you once, Mercédès, had the power to render blissful.

a951f7e6142d443c1ba431f95bee0bb1.constraint_text: Has resolved to stop at nothing to restore Peppino to liberty
a951f7e6142d443c1ba431f95bee0bb1.source_excerpt: "one thing I have resolved on, and that is, to stop at nothing to restore a poor devil to liberty, who has got into this scrape solely from having served me."

25b6d528ba8fb26902a79073d32b6d12.constraint_text: Baptistin must not take profits beyond those from purchases for the speaker's toilet.
Baptistin will immediately lose his position if he speaks about the speaker to others, either favorably or unfavorably.
25b6d528ba8fb26902a79073d32b6d12.source_excerpt: that very instant you would quit my service.

4911d62118bc3bb692383fb6d11f3212.constraint_text: Contentment is a new experience for him, implying he lacked it before
4911d62118bc3bb692383fb6d11f3212.source_excerpt: contentment is so new a sight to me, that I could never be weary of looking at yourself and your husband

4911d62118bc3bb692383fb6d11f3212.constraint_text: They have known unhappiness and undergone bitter sufferings
4911d62118bc3bb692383fb6d11f3212.source_excerpt: we have also known unhappiness, and few have ever undergone more bitter sufferings than ourselves

4911d62118bc3bb692383fb6d11f3212.constraint_text: He acknowledges their past 'bitter sorrows' as part of their family history

5cc7d6b60a19b99cbe28b43a93985563.constraint_text: Albert believes that once habituated to a spectacle, it becomes the only source of emotional response
5cc7d6b60a19b99cbe28b43a93985563.source_excerpt: "...when you have once habituated yourself to a similar spectacle, it is the only one that causes you any emotion."

006044665533e52831cd65c9ed34ed9c.constraint_text: Caderousse claims to have been an honest man 'with truth' and asserts this is more than others can say, implying this trait is self-identified and persistent.
006044665533e52831cd65c9ed34ed9c.source_excerpt: I can boast with truth of being an honest man; and,

0baee22831fb7d2f04caa70576894354.constraint_text: Monte Cristo passed a portion of his existence in Eastern societies
0baee22831fb7d2f04caa70576894354.source_excerpt: ‘these Eastern societies, in the midst of which you have passed a portion of your existence’

930ccd836c6ba58d062ef2560d2fd351.constraint_text: Monte Cristo always carries the drug (opium and hashish mixture) with him.

6140986adc626c1d395dde9d3293aafe.constraint_text: M. Bertuccio resolved not to send the money to his brother but to take it to him personally.
6140986adc626c1d395dde9d3293aafe.source_excerpt: I loved my brother tenderly, as I told your excellency, and I resolved not to send the money, but to take it to him myself.

45ea2b4ea93e6a426efa7f29b9ad94ca.constraint_text: The general must die if he refuses to swear allegiance, as explicitly declared by the president.
45ea2b4ea93e6a426efa7f29b9ad94ca.source_excerpt: “Then you must die,” replied the president calmly.

08d26a4c633175aa03194026ee3ad6a5.constraint_text: Benedetto remained perfectly unconcerned during the tumultuous scene

c6959f41dce7604a97cb55c2227485f6.constraint_text: The speaker would not have retained Danglars in employment if the choice had remained with them, due to observed inaccuracies in his accounts.
c6959f41dce7604a97cb55c2227485f6.source_excerpt: Not if the choice had remained with me, for I had frequently observed inaccuracies in his accounts.

8e1968b771cf26a36f5bae59fd3c40a4.constraint_text: Baron Danglars became a baron and chevalier of the Legion of Honor due to negotiating a loan for Charles X. in 1829
8e1968b771cf26a36f5bae59fd3c40a4.source_excerpt: he negotiated a loan of six millions for Charles X., in 1829, who made him a baron and chevalier of the Legion of Honor

8e1968b771cf26a36f5bae59fd3c40a4.constraint_text: Baron Danglars' baron title and Legion of Honor status were granted in 1829
8e1968b771cf26a36f5bae59fd3c40a4.source_excerpt: he negotiated a loan of six millions for Charles X., in 1829, who made him a baron and chevalier of the Legion of Honor

cffd173c6714124410eecb8e4fdc0509.constraint_text: Gaetano and his crew cannot refuse help to a 'poor hunted devil' when bandits seek refuge on their vessel.
cffd173c6714124410eecb8e4fdc0509.source_excerpt: you can’t refuse help to a poor hunted devil; we receive them, and for greater security we stand out to sea.

390a3ed59dca3779f1ddda2f4f05be0f.constraint_text: Smugglers are not thieves according to Gaetano's belief
Their status as bandits is attributed to the authorities' pursuit
390a3ed59dca3779f1ddda2f4f05be0f.source_excerpt: ‘It is not their fault that they are bandits, but that of the authorities.’

390a3ed59dca3779f1ddda2f4f05be0f.constraint_text: Corsicans have an inherent nature to revenge themselves
390a3ed59dca3779f1ddda2f4f05be0f.source_excerpt: ‘as if it was not in a Corsican’s nature to revenge himself.’

114fdf3cce08ad9d33bc4ff9c3f6d897.constraint_text: The Château d’If has been used for political prisoners for over three hundred years.
114fdf3cce08ad9d33bc4ff9c3f6d897.source_excerpt: this gloomy fortress, which has for more than three hundred years furnished food for so many wild legends

f1933512bb6b9e0b97d77a6c3d59045c.constraint_text: The son fulfilled the role of a royalist during a specific period, which justified his actions (e.g., cutting off a head of an opponent).
f1933512bb6b9e0b97d77a6c3d59045c.source_excerpt: when you were fulfilling your character as a royalist, and cut off the head of one of my party

8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.constraint_text: The narrator is a Corsican who has sworn to avenge himself, making distance irrelevant to his pursuit.
8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.source_excerpt: a Corsican who has sworn to avenge himself cares not for distance

8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.constraint_text: The narrator must kill M. de Villefort without being discovered or arrested, as he is now responsible for protecting his sister-in-law.
8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.source_excerpt: I no longer belonged to myself, for I had my sister-in-law to protect and provide for

8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.constraint_text: The narrator spent three consecutive months following M. de Villefort without interruption.
8c9a25889e0a9378502588072ccfbe4c.source_excerpt: For three months I watched M. de Villefort, for three months he took not a step out-of-doors without my following him

d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.constraint_text: Her age was explicitly stated as sixty-six years old.
d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.source_excerpt: Franz assured me... that she was sixty-six years old.

d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.constraint_text: Her death was explicitly attributed to grief, not old age.
d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.source_excerpt: she has not died of old age, but of grief

d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.constraint_text: Her temperament was explicitly described as nervous rather than sanguine.
d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.source_excerpt: was of a much more nervous than sanguine temperament

d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.constraint_text: She did not recover her reason after the death of the marquis.
d8c5742adbbb2e784ed2a6463d9d8965.source_excerpt: since the death of the marquis... she has not completely recovered her reason

398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.constraint_text: The Maoris have superstitious notions that influence their behavior
398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.source_excerpt: Paganel's plan was therefore adopted, and really, with the superstitious notions of the Maoris, it might and ought to succeed.

398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.constraint_text: MacNabb is scarcely ever enthusiastic due to habit
398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.source_excerpt: And although from habit I am scarcely ever enthusiastic...

398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.constraint_text: The mountain's taboo becomes more rigorous if it devours profaners
398871ea0acf129caa77c415e7561b31.source_excerpt: The mountain is tabooed, and if it shall itself devour its profaners the taboo will be still more rigorous.

e1ef0c8dfa9479b7158e3efeaaf261a5.constraint_text: The old man's grief is so intense that it would drive a father to despair if he lacked similar resilience.
e1ef0c8dfa9479b7158e3efeaaf261a5.source_excerpt: I am very glad that I have not any children; for if I were a father and felt such excessive grief as the old man does, and did not find in my memory or heart all he is now saying, I should throw myself into the sea at once, for I could not bear it.

e1ef0c8dfa9479b7158e3efeaaf261a5.constraint_text: The old man's solitude increased progressively over time, to the point of refusing visitors.
e1ef0c8dfa9479b7158e3efeaaf261a5.source_excerpt: From day to day he lived on alone, and more and more solitary... his door was closed; and, although I was certain he was at home, he would not make any answer.

a3976bc9e33a8776263974c2861a655b.constraint_text: Fernand had never been hated—he was only not precisely loved
a3976bc9e33a8776263974c2861a655b.source_excerpt: And then, it must be confessed, Fernand had never been hated—he was only not precisely loved.

20b724241028d931f1d8a9352e96ca91.constraint_text: Once thought of leaving Villefort’s house and taking an apartment away from M. de Villefort’s
20b724241028d931f1d8a9352e96ca91.source_excerpt: grandpapa once thought of leaving this house, and taking an apartment away from M. de Villefort’s

a9d84d9321f4dfa1bd678879274a44f5.constraint_text: Valentine must form a suitable alliance immediately due to her approaching nineteenth birthday
a9d84d9321f4dfa1bd678879274a44f5.source_excerpt: "you are aware that Valentine is about to enter her nineteenth year, which renders it important that she should lose no time in forming a suitable alliance."

509fc879c264f99087cc682920565442.constraint_text: Andrea explicitly forbids political discussion with Caderousse
If arrested, Andrea would be identified as 'No. 106' and lose his freedom
509fc879c264f99087cc682920565442.source_excerpt: "I should then be escorted back to the shores of the Mediterranean. Then I should become simply No. 106..."

509fc879c264f99087cc682920565442.constraint_text: Andrea is described as a 'wilful fellow'
509fc879c264f99087cc682920565442.source_excerpt: the reputed son of Major Cavalcanti was a wilful fellow

f6cdb75345fd1dd29b0dab3cbc295f84.constraint_text: Prison caused Edmond Dantès to become prudent and risk-averse
f6cdb75345fd1dd29b0dab3cbc295f84.source_excerpt: Prison had made Edmond prudent, and he was desirous of running no risk whatever.

4e95bd966b11b553d3efffbbf79efb54.constraint_text: The key with an iron point causes death when pressed to open a difficult lock due to a negligent design by the locksmith.
4e95bd966b11b553d3efffbbf79efb54.source_excerpt: the famous key which was given to certain persons with the request that they go and open a designated cupboard. This key was furnished with a small iron point,—a negligence on the part of the locksmith. When this was pressed to effect the opening of the cupboard, of which the lock was difficult, the person was pricked by this small point, and died next day.

4e95bd966b11b553d3efffbbf79efb54.constraint_text: The ring with the lion’s head causes death after a handshake because the lion’s bite is mortal within twenty-four hours.
4e95bd966b11b553d3efffbbf79efb54.source_excerpt: the ring with the lion’s head, which Cæsar wore when he wanted to greet his friends with a clasp of the hand. The lion bit the hand thus favored, and at the end of twenty-four hours, the bite was mortal.

7a8b7144a6e9e97a6239881f08b7dec5.constraint_text: Julie's father was prevented from committing suicide when he had a pistol in his hand
7a8b7144a6e9e97a6239881f08b7dec5.source_excerpt: "Your father was not allowed to fall."

1c4c1bf770dfd6cdce26f84dfebea042.constraint_text: The count's immense wealth rendered the fire's destruction financially insignificant to him.
1c4c1bf770dfd6cdce26f84dfebea042.source_excerpt: As the count was immensely rich, excepting the danger Carmela had run,—and the marvellous manner in which she had escaped, made that appear to him rather a favor of Providence than a real misfortune,—the loss occasioned by the conflagration was to him but a trifle.

05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.constraint_text: The stepmother's infernal project began after the encounter in the arbor of the Hôtel des Postes in Perugia.
05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.source_excerpt: Do you recollect in the arbor of the Hôtel des Postes, at Perugia, seeing a man in a brown cloak, whom your stepmother was questioning upon _aqua tofana_? Well, ever since then, the infernal project has been ripening in her brain.

05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.constraint_text: Valentine must not confide in anyone, not even her father.
05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.source_excerpt: You must not confide in anyone—not even in your father.

05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.constraint_text: Valentine's grandfather is allowed to live because his death would have been legally and practically futile.
05c8de06c52d423a58c8968f72a7c328.source_excerpt: It was considered, that you dead, the fortune would naturally revert to your brother, unless he were disinherited; and besides, the crime appearing useless, it would be folly to commit it.

5aa3a7c96acc79a389e18642ada0c7bd.constraint_text: Albert's presence at the count's house yesterday was caused by his lack of knowledge about the count's identity.
5aa3a7c96acc79a389e18642ada0c7bd.source_excerpt: "Yesterday I was at your house, sir; because then I knew not who you were."

5aa3a7c96acc79a389e18642ada0c7bd.constraint_text: The count's calm tone and penetrating eye are characteristics of someone who knows their cause is good.
5aa3a7c96acc79a389e18642ada0c7bd.source_excerpt: the count, with that calm tone and penetrating eye which characterize the man who knows his cause is good.

7fe61bff4dc3cf87a5fa21c0a668af0a.constraint_text: Monte Cristo occupies his leisure moments by engaging in activities like shooting swallows.
7fe61bff4dc3cf87a5fa21c0a668af0a.source_excerpt: "I must occupy my leisure moments in some way or other."

7fe61bff4dc3cf87a5fa21c0a668af0a.constraint_text: Monte Cristo fights only with friends, as stated explicitly as a rule.
7fe61bff4dc3cf87a5fa21c0a668af0a.source_excerpt: "Of course; it is always with friends that one fights."

8ff21604c8813002136cddbc21df0d60.constraint_text: Robert was twelve years old at the time of the climb

e20090c6d5ee6a2431ac7ff72c8de4a8.constraint_text: A being was explicitly commissioned to prevent Emmanuel's father from committing suicide
e20090c6d5ee6a2431ac7ff72c8de4a8.source_excerpt: A being was commissioned to arrest the fatal hand of death about to descend on him.

acfc29d46922b6e00237421119f96d00.constraint_text: Believes that saving a man or sparing a father’s/mother’s feelings is not a 'good action' but a 'simple deed of humanity'
acfc29d46922b6e00237421119f96d00.source_excerpt: ‘To save a man, to spare a man’s feelings, or a mother’s sensibility, is not to do a good action, but a simple deed of humanity.’

acfc29d46922b6e00237421119f96d00.constraint_text: Must attend a sitting that begins at two o’clock, which is now three o’clock
acfc29d46922b6e00237421119f96d00.source_excerpt: ‘The sitting commences at two; it is now three, and I am to speak.’

70b34a1f08c880f9e0c436f9f9a56a51.constraint_text: The president did not utter a sigh despite displaying wounds and enduring pain.
70b34a1f08c880f9e0c436f9f9a56a51.source_excerpt: Still he had not even uttered a sigh.

2891419bddf0aa0f1c122b4b07c46bb2.constraint_text: The ladies' decision to repose in their berths was directly caused by the young captain's words.
2891419bddf0aa0f1c122b4b07c46bb2.source_excerpt: The ladies, relying upon his words, were reposing in their berths.

2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.constraint_text: The abbé exercises patience by beginning every morning with the task of the night before and every night renewing the task of the day.
2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.source_excerpt: I consider that I have abundantly exercised that in beginning every morning the task of the night before, and every night renewing the task of the day.

2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.constraint_text: The abbé believes the person he is trying to free is innocent and has committed no offense.
2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.source_excerpt: one who had committed no offence, and merited not condemnation.

2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.constraint_text: The abbé has consistently believed he is waging war against circumstances, not men.
2ae0f33254b09c5ea3c1d02d2a5449eb.source_excerpt: Hitherto I have fancied myself merely waging war against circumstances, not men.

1757de34cc38b24b8b2a09125a50cbe4.constraint_text: No vital organ was injured, and his weakness was solely due to blood loss.
1757de34cc38b24b8b2a09125a50cbe4.source_excerpt: MacNabb ventured to affirm that no vital organ had been injured, the loss of blood sufficiently explained the patient's weakness.

1757de34cc38b24b8b2a09125a50cbe4.constraint_text: Only time and rest were needed for his complete restoration after his wound healed and hemorrhage stopped.
1757de34cc38b24b8b2a09125a50cbe4.source_excerpt: Thus, as soon as his wound was healed and the hemorrhage stopped, only time and rest were needed for his complete restoration.

564df9163e0a324b67e2f4363364d56c.constraint_text: The Duncan requires repairs to its bent screw flange, which can only be done in Melbourne
564df9163e0a324b67e2f4363364d56c.source_excerpt: One of the flanges of the screw is bent, and this work can be done only at Melbourne.

564df9163e0a324b67e2f4363364d56c.constraint_text: Ayrton exhibits singular persistency in questioning about the Duncan

ec8a9d96859f336d2bacbd52e56e2110.constraint_text: As a subordinate, Danglars is bound to inform the shipowner of all occurrences but must conceal certain matters from others.
ec8a9d96859f336d2bacbd52e56e2110.source_excerpt: I am too well aware that though a subordinate, like myself, is bound to acquaint the shipowner with everything that occurs, there are many things he ought most carefully to conceal from all else.

ec8a9d96859f336d2bacbd52e56e2110.constraint_text: M. Morrel had already considered Danglars' interests in the event of Edmond Dantès becoming captain of the *Pharaon*.
ec8a9d96859f336d2bacbd52e56e2110.source_excerpt: I had already thought of your interests in the event of poor Edmond having become captain of the _Pharaon_.

86cd550c6604254c7f50bf3c6c7c6793.constraint_text: Danglars had ill-will towards the narrator due to a prior quarrel and challenge to fight, which he refused.
86cd550c6604254c7f50bf3c6c7c6793.source_excerpt: There was only one person among the crew who had any feeling of ill-will towards me. I had quarelled with him some time previously, and had even challenged him to fight me; but he refused.

86cd550c6604254c7f50bf3c6c7c6793.constraint_text: The narrator observed frequent inaccuracies in Danglars' accounts, which would have led to his dismissal if the narrator had been captain.
86cd550c6604254c7f50bf3c6c7c6793.source_excerpt: Not if the choice had remained with me, for I had frequently observed inaccuracies in his accounts.

de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.constraint_text: In well-organized brains, the predominating idea is always the first thought upon waking and the last before sleeping
de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.source_excerpt: In all well-organized brains, the predominating idea—and there always is one—is sure to be the last thought before sleeping, and the first upon waking in the morning.

de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.constraint_text: Andrea consistently applies logical reasoning to suppress alarm at unexpected sights
de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.source_excerpt: ‘There is nothing astonishing in seeing a gendarme at an inn; instead of being astonished, let me dress myself.’ And the youth dressed himself with a facility his valet de chambre had failed to rob him of during the two months of fashionable life he had led in Paris.

de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.constraint_text: Andrea retains an innate ability to dress quickly despite external attempts to alter this trait
de44c08094987d3ae1db5e4b1ca59ad0.source_excerpt: And the youth dressed himself with a facility his valet de chambre had failed to rob him of during the two months of fashionable life he had led in Paris.

a8964941466ec3ade8716870642541e3.constraint_text: The beverage prepared by the doctor to allay her fever was previously effective in dispelling illusions by causing a reaction in her brain.
a8964941466ec3ade8716870642541e3.source_excerpt: the best method of dispelling such illusions was to drink, for a draught of the beverage prepared by the doctor to allay her fever seemed to cause a reaction of the brain, and for a short time she suffered less.

6e863bc377ae02ea5f780bebe95531bd.constraint_text: Maximilian finds common, everyday attachments unexciting due to his immersion in poetry and imagination
6e863bc377ae02ea5f780bebe95531bd.source_excerpt: A man who accustoms himself to live in such a world of poetry and imagination must find far too little excitement in a common, every-day sort of attachment such as ours.

6e863bc377ae02ea5f780bebe95531bd.constraint_text: They previously agreed to be 'as two voices, two shadows' for each other
6e863bc377ae02ea5f780bebe95531bd.source_excerpt: "we said we would be to each other as two voices, two shadows."

7965043b6f74265a0883cee34d2bfe90.constraint_text: Villefort's unnatural strength to move the armchair was caused by powerful excitement
7965043b6f74265a0883cee34d2bfe90.source_excerpt: This could only have been accomplished by means of unnatural strength supplied by powerful excitement.

7965043b6f74265a0883cee34d2bfe90.constraint_text: Every encounter with Noirtier (his father) has been followed by a terrible event
7965043b6f74265a0883cee34d2bfe90.source_excerpt: Each time he had been brought into contact with his father, something terrible had happened.

86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.constraint_text: Valentine’s expertise in interpreting Noirtier’s wishes has been perfected over six years of practice.
86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.source_excerpt: During the six years which had passed since Noirtier first fell into this sad state, Valentine’s powers of invention had been too often put to the test not to render her expert in devising expedients for gaining a knowledge of his wishes, and the constant practice had so perfected her in the art that she guessed the old man’s meaning as quickly as if he himself had been able to seek for what he wanted.

86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.constraint_text: Noirtier communicates by fixating his eye on specific words in a dictionary.
86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.source_excerpt: she opened it, and, seeing that the old man’s eye was thoroughly fixed on its pages, she ran her finger quickly up and down the columns.

86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.constraint_text: Valentine’s ability to interpret Noirtier’s wishes has persisted and improved over six years.
86189edc2fe373d7d92602e458009166.source_excerpt: the constant practice had so perfected her in the art that she guessed the old man’s meaning as quickly as if he himself had been able to seek for what he wanted.

cc5de2621b0caf99f4056d7ca6b8f663.constraint_text: They believed they would not survive the night due to the storm
cc5de2621b0caf99f4056d7ca6b8f663.source_excerpt: They wished each other good night without much hope of passing one

653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.constraint_text: Their fate was settled after the warrior confirmed Tohonga's death
653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.source_excerpt: The fate of Glenarvan and his companions was settled.

653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.constraint_text: They are to die at daybreak the next day
653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.source_excerpt: You shall all die to-morrow at daybreak!

653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.constraint_text: They are required to attend the funeral of the dead chief that day
653b417a8f7a9079e0db0e3d4023a400.source_excerpt: They were to attend that day the funeral of the dead chief

1f282c261aa61fdbe11a4fbff76f7033.constraint_text: Beauchamp bought the pistols eight or ten days ago
1f282c261aa61fdbe11a4fbff76f7033.source_excerpt: I have brought some weapons which I bought eight or ten days since, thinking to want them on a similar occasion.

ab10fe9a5cbe6bf34050430dd5514e3a.constraint_text: Andrea's recognition as a bandit was caused by learning a Masonic sign from Caderousse
ab10fe9a5cbe6bf34050430dd5514e3a.source_excerpt: It was a Masonic sign Caderousse had taught him.

79d9cf29ad7a9d47e35b72e234c56153.constraint_text: The narrator never plays games because he is neither rich enough to afford losses nor poor enough to desire gains.
79d9cf29ad7a9d47e35b72e234c56153.source_excerpt: I never play, for I am not rich enough to afford to lose, or sufficiently poor to desire to gain.

7a69c8c3865c1a5cfa5646aca8cdfd2b.constraint_text: Conscience remains and provides excuses after actions requiring exertion
7a69c8c3865c1a5cfa5646aca8cdfd2b.source_excerpt: “Yes,” answered Monte Cristo “happily, yes, conscience does remain; and if it did not, how wretched we should be! After every action requiring exertion, it is conscience that saves us, for it supplies us with a thousand good excuses, of which we alone are judges;

aa93c8e834ad382b0008592af02d7169.constraint_text: Faria is employed to avoid seeing himself grow old
aa93c8e834ad382b0008592af02d7169.source_excerpt: They were thus perpetually employed,—Faria, that he might not see himself grow old

aa93c8e834ad382b0008592af02d7169.constraint_text: Dantès is employed to avoid recalling the almost extinct past
aa93c8e834ad382b0008592af02d7169.source_excerpt: Dantès, for fear of recalling the almost extinct past which now only floated in his memory like a distant light wandering in the night

ec1a67986bd73b0d1bf221053f1a2c87.constraint_text: The action (retraction or duel) must occur exactly three weeks after the agreement.
ec1a67986bd73b0d1bf221053f1a2c87.source_excerpt: But I require three weeks’ preparation; at the end of that time I shall come and say to you, ‘The assertion is false, and I retract it,’ or ‘The assertion is true,’ when I shall immediately draw the sword from its sheath, or the pistols from the case, whichever you please.

efe1ae2b97ba9dbe71a734f4a9d54666.constraint_text: Beauchamp must either retract the assertion or initiate combat exactly three weeks (24 days) after this conversation
efe1ae2b97ba9dbe71a734f4a9d54666.source_excerpt: "...I shall come and say to you, ‘The assertion is false, and I retract it,’ or ‘The assertion is true,’ when I shall immediately draw the sword from its sheath, or the pistols from the case, whichever you please."

efe1ae2b97ba9dbe71a734f4a9d54666.constraint_text: Beauchamp cannot harm Albert de Morcerf for 24 days (three weeks) starting from this conversation
efe1ae2b97ba9dbe71a734f4a9d54666.source_excerpt: "I cannot throw you out of window for three weeks—that is to say, for twenty-four days to come—nor have you any right to split my skull open till that time has elapsed."

41435d56a076503427b3a964fa75729a.constraint_text: Edmond's heart was in the process of petrifying, indicating a hardened emotional state.
41435d56a076503427b3a964fa75729a.source_excerpt: his heart was in a fair way of petrifying in his bosom

41435d56a076503427b3a964fa75729a.constraint_text: Edmond's affection for Jacopo was caused by Jacopo's sympathetic devotion during Edmond's injury.
41435d56a076503427b3a964fa75729a.source_excerpt: As a result of the sympathetic devotion which Jacopo had from the first bestowed on Edmond, the latter was moved to a certain degree of affection

afa57dd6b0f062192c7ede1c8503b836.constraint_text: An agreement existed for Maximilian to accompany the count, and he was instructed to prepare for departure the previous day.
afa57dd6b0f062192c7ede1c8503b836.source_excerpt: “has it not been agreed that I should take you with me, and did I not tell you yesterday to prepare for departure?”

48353f64f56a465c40cbe827482ef6f9.constraint_text: Dantès recognized the Spada family crest because Faria had drawn it for him repeatedly
48353f64f56a465c40cbe827482ef6f9.source_excerpt: Dantès could see an oaken coffer... the arms of the Spada family—viz., a sword... Faria had so often drawn them for him.

34f3f62856057b4c0250ad9598f156cf.constraint_text: The abbé will execute Edmond’s last wishes by obtaining the addresses of Fernand and Danglars.
34f3f62856057b4c0250ad9598f156cf.source_excerpt: "You will have the goodness to furnish me with the address of both Fernand and Danglars, in order that I may execute Edmond’s last wishes."

710f88759b9258af80979be42633ad5b.constraint_text: Thalcave's knowledge of Thaouka is the cause of his ability to use agility and speed for safety.
710f88759b9258af80979be42633ad5b.source_excerpt: He... explained that not a moment was to be lost; that the danger, if this plan failed, would be greater for those who remained; in short, that he alone knew Thaouka well enough to employ his marvelous agility and speed for the common safety.

710f88759b9258af80979be42633ad5b.constraint_text: Glenarvan's resolve to sacrifice himself persisted despite increasing danger.
710f88759b9258af80979be42633ad5b.source_excerpt: Glenarvan blindly persisted in his resolve to sacrifice himself, when suddenly he was pushed violently back.

2c3a54824d084d6725397792ad1d7cd3.constraint_text: For more than a month, Benedetto had an unshakable desire to possess a monkey, which he pursued by stealing it from a tree.
2c3a54824d084d6725397792ad1d7cd3.source_excerpt: For more than a month past, the mischievous child, who knew not what to wish for, had taken it into his head to have a monkey.

8d9ff70d19263ce2e43ec47c9adba6c1.constraint_text: The stock-keeper's journey began seven months prior and will last three months longer at a rate of ten miles per day.
8d9ff70d19263ce2e43ec47c9adba6c1.source_excerpt: He had set out seven months before, and had made about ten miles a day, at which rate his journey would last three months longer.

8d9ff70d19263ce2e43ec47c9adba6c1.constraint_text: Wild oxen and sheep must advance separately because they do not associate well, necessitating oxen to lead the drove.
8d9ff70d19263ce2e43ec47c9adba6c1.source_excerpt: The different classes advanced separately, for wild oxen and sheep do not associate well; the first will never graze where the second have passed. Hence it was necessary to place the oxen at the head;

be3f5f6050173734e79a5bbdbdda769a.constraint_text: Madame de Villefort has a persistent passion for the occult sciences, which she compares to poetry and algebraic equations.
be3f5f6050173734e79a5bbdbdda769a.source_excerpt: "Oh, I am aware of that," said Madame de Villefort; "but I have a passion for the occult sciences, which speak to the imagination like poetry, and are reducible to figures, like an algebraic equation; but go on, I beg of you; what you say interests me to the greatest degree."

cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.constraint_text: The speaker spent three years studying 150 volumes until memorizing them nearly by heart
cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.source_excerpt: I devoted three years of my life to reading and studying these one hundred and fifty volumes, till I knew them nearly by heart

cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.constraint_text: The speaker's ability to recall the contents of the volumes remains unchanged since being imprisoned
cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.source_excerpt: so that since I have been in prison, a very slight effort of memory has enabled me to recall their contents as readily as though the pages were open before me

cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.constraint_text: The speaker's method of creating and arranging a vocabulary enabled his ability to express thoughts in modern Greek
cb79ca2b1497a6e413a55f08ce249228.source_excerpt: I made a vocabulary of the words I knew; turned, returned, and arranged them, so as to enable me to express my thoughts through their medium

95e92a42b7cc46402813ae5b29505fbc.constraint_text: In 1642, Abel Tasman's boat was attacked and capsized by islanders, resulting in casualties among his crew.
95e92a42b7cc46402813ae5b29505fbc.source_excerpt: when first he landed, there seemed to be amicable feelings expressed by the islanders toward himself... the next day, as he sent his boat to find good anchorage... seven canoes of the islanders attacked it most violently... causing it to capsize... leaving those of their companions who were not drowned to be butchered by the natives.

95e92a42b7cc46402813ae5b29505fbc.constraint_text: Surville's visit to the island resulted in bloodshed and misery.
95e92a42b7cc46402813ae5b29505fbc.source_excerpt: a French navigator, Surville by name, was the next to visit the shores, and that his visit likewise was the cause of bloodshed and misery.

6517859ef14b7df48b01923ed963a986.constraint_text: The chief will either exchange the captives for ransom or kill them if ransom is refused
6517859ef14b7df48b01923ed963a986.source_excerpt: "To exchange you, if your friends will ransom you; to kill you, if they refuse."

6517859ef14b7df48b01923ed963a986.constraint_text: Paganel has a changeable disposition that carries him from one extreme to another
6517859ef14b7df48b01923ed963a986.source_excerpt: Paganel, whose changeable disposition carried him from one extreme to another

51c27424d19a64ccc36e224d2bbb611a.constraint_text: The escape route's opening was concealed with mats, making the outlet entirely hidden.
51c27424d19a64ccc36e224d2bbb611a.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles... closed with the mats. Their outlet was therefore entirely hidden.

27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.constraint_text: Teresa was the most beautiful and best-attired peasant near Rome due to Luigi’s generosity.
27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.source_excerpt: thanks to her friend’s generosity, Teresa was the most beautiful and the best-attired peasant near Rome.

27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.constraint_text: Vampa’s character led him to consistently imagine himself as a captain, general, or governor during his childhood.
