27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.source_excerpt: giving themselves up to the wild ideas of their different characters. Thus, in all their dreams, their wishes, and their conversations, Vampa saw himself the captain of a vessel, general of an army, or governor of a province.

27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.constraint_text: Teresa’s character led her to consistently imagine herself as rich, superbly attired, and attended by liveried domestics during her childhood.
27ab13fd4097e7d6b3bcabb271e5b233.source_excerpt: giving themselves up to the wild ideas of their different characters. Thus, in all their dreams, their wishes, and their conversations, Teresa saw herself rich, superbly attired, and attended by a train of liveried domestics.

864fa70dbc973754a51a50bf86284e80.constraint_text: Penelon transitioned from being a quartermaster to a gardener
864fa70dbc973754a51a50bf86284e80.source_excerpt: Penelon, count, is the old sailor you saw in the garden, and who, from quartermaster, has become gardener

864fa70dbc973754a51a50bf86284e80.constraint_text: The Englishman recognized by Penelon in Trieste is explicitly identified as the person who called on Julie's father on June 5, 1829, and wrote the letter on September 5
864fa70dbc973754a51a50bf86284e80.source_excerpt: Penelon, when he was at Trieste, saw on the quay an Englishman, who was on the point of embarking on board a yacht, and he recognized him as the person who called on my father the fifth of June, 1829, and who wrote me this letter on the fifth of September

f85d0253d420729871da445e9a705b57.constraint_text: Danglars' banking house does not handle small sums of money
f85d0253d420729871da445e9a705b57.source_excerpt: ’tis not for such trifling sums as these that your banking house is to be incommoded.

ce330b1fb9f31c7e485404ce698dba1f.constraint_text: The sailor has sailed the Mediterranean since childhood
ce330b1fb9f31c7e485404ce698dba1f.source_excerpt: "I have sailed over it since my childhood."

ce330b1fb9f31c7e485404ce698dba1f.constraint_text: The sailor possesses exceptional harbor navigation skills
ce330b1fb9f31c7e485404ce698dba1f.source_excerpt: "There are few ports that I could not enter or leave with a bandage over my eyes."

eec16ffd3e3511763cbf2cda48908f80.constraint_text: Ayrton's dexterity in driving is explicitly attributed to his apprenticeship at O'Moore's farm
eec16ffd3e3511763cbf2cda48908f80.source_excerpt: Ayrton had served his apprenticeship at O'Moore's farm, and his employer guaranteed his dexterity.

57ec4ceb2512716350589711cde33fc5.constraint_text: Could not have perceived Glenarvan and his companions because he did not approach the shore
57ec4ceb2512716350589711cde33fc5.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles could not have perceived them, for he did not approach...

3057201c893529fecf3b54e64473b681.constraint_text: Captain Mangles did not know his position after rescuing the brig from peril
3057201c893529fecf3b54e64473b681.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles's prompt management had rescued the brig from her peril; but he did not know his position.

9952bd476501c6519df1de12dc3a2638.constraint_text: Villefort's hardened heart is explicitly caused by the 'blows' he has received in life.
9952bd476501c6519df1de12dc3a2638.source_excerpt: If my heart be petrified, it is that it might sustain the blows it has received.

9952bd476501c6519df1de12dc3a2638.constraint_text: Villefort's current approach to conflict is to 'crush those who... interfere with me in my career', a trait established as persistent.
9952bd476501c6519df1de12dc3a2638.source_excerpt: I am accustomed to brave difficulties, and, in the conflict to crush those who... interfere with me in my career.

f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.constraint_text: Their mother died at the birth of Robert.
f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.source_excerpt: Mary and Robert Grant were the only children of Captain Harry Grant, whose wife had died at the birth of Robert,

f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.constraint_text: They were left to the care of their cousin during their father's long voyages.
f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.source_excerpt: during his long voyages his children were left to the care of his good old cousin.

f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.constraint_text: His thorough education was caused by his father's belief that it would help even a sea-captain.
f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.source_excerpt: His father, a minister of Saint Catherine's Church, had given him a thorough education, knowing that it would be sure to help all, even a sea-captain.

f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.constraint_text: His home was at Dundee, in the county of Forfar.
f88c9e2194da0e858cc012ed1d238dc1.source_excerpt: His home was at Dundee, in the county of Forfar,
and he was moreover, by birth, a child of that 'bonnie' place.

262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.constraint_text: The old cousin of Harry Grant died, leaving Mary and her brother alone in the world.
262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.source_excerpt: At this juncture of affairs the old cousin of Harry Grant died, and the two children were left alone in the world.

262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.constraint_text: Mary Grant was fourteen years old in 1861.
Mary must bring up and instruct her brother due to their situation after being left alone.
262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.source_excerpt: She must bring him up and instruct him.

262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.constraint_text: Mary consistently sacrifices her own needs to educate and care for her brother over an extended period.
262779c0457f3ff3f34e487eeed9a03a.source_excerpt: By dint of economy, prudence, and sagacity, laboring night and day, sacrificing all for him, denying herself everything, the sister succeeded in educating her brother and bravely fulfilled her sisterly duties.

12dbbbe1b1b625b3ce95216a2beacdc2.constraint_text: Marriage in France requires civil papers establishing identity, unlike in Italy where verbal declarations to a priest suffice
12dbbbe1b1b625b3ce95216a2beacdc2.source_excerpt: You must know that in France they are very particular on these points; it is not sufficient, as in Italy, to go to the priest and say, 'We love each other, and want you to marry us.' Marriage is a civil affair in France, and in order to marry in an orthodox manner you must have papers which undeniably establish your identity.

10c205c5345b14e469787caf2994b120.constraint_text: Valentine has a melancholy disposition and taciturn habit that persist despite efforts to change them
10c205c5345b14e469787caf2994b120.source_excerpt: Mademoiselle de Villefort is, in spite of all we can do to rouse her, of a melancholy disposition and taciturn habit, which frequently injure the effect of her beauty.

2eaaac628636983efaaac27e0467d594.constraint_text: Must retire to her estate of Saint-Méran for a prescribed three-month period
2eaaac628636983efaaac27e0467d594.source_excerpt: Mademoiselle de Villefort may retire during the prescribed three months to her estate of Saint-Méran

c56402316dee4f468da234179460855d.constraint_text: Politics has caused Beauchamp to laugh at everything and disbelieve everything.
c56402316dee4f468da234179460855d.source_excerpt: "Politics has made you laugh at everything, and political men have made you disbelieve everything."

aab73f7a3e9c20c5a0fa706e6aae5180.constraint_text: Her lack of being loved by anyone since earliest recollections caused her to love no one, establishing an irreversible trait.
aab73f7a3e9c20c5a0fa706e6aae5180.source_excerpt: From my earliest recollections, I have been beloved by no one—so much the worse; that has naturally led me to love no one—so much the better—now you have my profession of faith.

aab73f7a3e9c20c5a0fa706e6aae5180.constraint_text: She has consistently seen and understood much about her surroundings since childhood, making misfortune powerless over her.
aab73f7a3e9c20c5a0fa706e6aae5180.source_excerpt: from my childhood I have seen too much, and understood too much, of what has passed around me, for misfortune to have an undue power over me.

5ff19e96620a97fc9d5af5cd2f133caf.constraint_text: The house is part of Valentine’s marriage-portion and cannot be altered or sold independently of this arrangement.
5ff19e96620a97fc9d5af5cd2f133caf.source_excerpt: This house is part of Valentine’s marriage-portion, and M. de Saint-Méran wished to sell it; for if it had remained another year or two uninhabited it would have fallen to ruin.

865e062435361b5493ca8ad271901e24.constraint_text: Cocles did not recognize the count because his single eye had become dim over nine years
865e062435361b5493ca8ad271901e24.source_excerpt: In the concierge that opened the gate the count recognized Cocles; but as he had but one eye, and that eye had become somewhat dim in the course of nine years, Cocles did not recognize the count.

865e062435361b5493ca8ad271901e24.constraint_text: Emmanuel purchased the property and reserved the house and half the garden while leasing the rest
865e062435361b5493ca8ad271901e24.source_excerpt: The whole of the property... had been purchased by Emmanuel, who had seen at a glance that he could make of it a profitable speculation. He had reserved the house and half the garden, and building a wall between the garden and the workshops, had let them upon lease with the pavilions at the bottom of the garden.

88c5b29d7d24f1ff50f6732ef55789b4.constraint_text: The character was unconscious for an unknown duration prior to being awakened by the pistol shot.
88c5b29d7d24f1ff50f6732ef55789b4.source_excerpt: How long I had been in this unconscious state I know not, when I was suddenly aroused by the report of a pistol

88c5b29d7d24f1ff50f6732ef55789b4.constraint_text: The character's forehead was wet and clammy at the time of observation.
88c5b29d7d24f1ff50f6732ef55789b4.source_excerpt: when I passed my hand across my brow, I felt that it was wet and clammy

8aa916dfdee847021ed11866e55679e5.constraint_text: Edmond was accustomed to the noise of loathsome animals in the prison, which generally did not wake him.
8aa916dfdee847021ed11866e55679e5.source_excerpt: So many loathsome animals inhabited the prison, that their noise did not, in general, awake him;

fe7031f7ea966a7fcdab2a2f32aa4e1f.source_excerpt: The murdered man lay on the floor...

6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.constraint_text: Two years ago, she asked the same questions about Mithridates' poison tolerance methods.
6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.source_excerpt: but what you tell me, madame, what you inquire of me, is not the result of a chance query, for two years ago you asked me the same questions

6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.constraint_text: Her regret about not being a man to study alchemy/medicine has persisted since her youth.
6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.source_excerpt: I have regretted that I was not a man, that I might have been a Flamel, a Fontana, or a Cabanis

6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.constraint_text: After a month of gradual poison tolerance, drinking poisoned water would kill others while causing only slight inconvenience to the tolerant individual.
6109924ee7c0577b3f6c6e767d711022.source_excerpt: Well, then, at the end of a month, when drinking water from the same carafe, you would kill the person who drank with you, without your perceiving, otherwise than from slight inconvenience, that there was any poisonous substance mingled with this water.

f781eac63c914df8aca9fdfe5af08669.constraint_text: Madame de Villefort had been deeply interested in the history of Mithridates for a long time prior to this conversation, and this interest persisted over at least two years.
f781eac63c914df8aca9fdfe5af08669.source_excerpt: ‘...at the end of twenty days, increasing another milligramme, you would have taken three hundred centigrammes; that is to say, a dose which you would support without inconvenience...’ ‘I have often read, and read again, the history of Mithridates,’ said Madame de Villefort... ‘but two years ago you asked me the same questions, and said then, that for a very long time this history of Mithridates had occupied your mind.’ ‘True, sir.’

347fe37b3da693c76c24407d8df19e85.constraint_text: Robert's good health during the journey is caused by the pleasant weather.
347fe37b3da693c76c24407d8df19e85.source_excerpt: As the weather continued pleasant, all the travelers, not excepting Robert, were still in good health; and, since the journey had begun under such favorable auspices, they thought it best to profit by it, and push on.

a1bd6d9b64488efefe8d78aedce74078.constraint_text: The colony has preserved its original customs, costume, and language for three or four centuries without mixing with the Marseillaise population.
a1bd6d9b64488efefe8d78aedce74078.source_excerpt: For three or four centuries they have remained upon this small promontory... without mixing with the Marseillaise population, intermarrying, and preserving their original customs and the costume of their mother-country as they have preserved its language.

a1bd6d9b64488efefe8d78aedce74078.constraint_text: The colony settled on the promontory three or four centuries ago and has remained there since.
a1bd6d9b64488efefe8d78aedce74078.source_excerpt: For three or four centuries they have remained upon this small promontory, on which they had settled like a flight of seabirds...

1f99d150d8a3dc6cd72f3be32d355a3e.constraint_text: The elect obey Hassen-ben-Sabah's orders as if they were divine commands due to the effects of the herb.
1f99d150d8a3dc6cd72f3be32d355a3e.source_excerpt: obedient to his orders as to those of a deity, struck down the designated victim, died in torture without a murmur, believing that the death they underwent was but a quick transition

1f99d150d8a3dc6cd72f3be32d355a3e.constraint_text: The elect's belief in the herb-induced paradise persists until their death.
1f99d150d8a3dc6cd72f3be32d355a3e.source_excerpt: believing that the death they underwent was but a quick transition to that life of delights of which the holy herb... had given them a slight foretaste

5caf63780b671b7cfb0acf27f08e00e8.constraint_text: The catapaz has crossed the pass of Antuco

2485979964ff613c78f1aeb5e2d8ac40.constraint_text: Paganel did not propose the pass of Antuco because it is only a cattle-track for Indian herdsmen
2485979964ff613c78f1aeb5e2d8ac40.source_excerpt: I have crossed it, and did not propose it because it is only a cattle-track for the Indian herdsmen

3590a9cebe7ee05151beb2eece7787a4.character: the tribes commanded by the caziques Calfoucoura, Catriel, and Yanchetruz
3590a9cebe7ee05151beb2eece7787a4.constraint_text: They have been subdued as much as an Indian can be since being driven beyond the sierras thirty years ago
3590a9cebe7ee05151beb2eece7787a4.source_excerpt: Chiefs of tribes that were very powerful thirty years ago, before they were driven beyond the sierras. Since that time they have been subdued as much as an Indian can be, and now scour the Pampas as well as the province of Buenos Ayres.

0879e79eff5e9e705b4bf3d19ba32e1a.constraint_text: Thalcave's astonishment is caused by the absence of Indians and their traces on the plains
0879e79eff5e9e705b4bf3d19ba32e1a.source_excerpt: Thalcave is astonished at a circumstance that is really strange... At meeting neither Indians, nor any traces of them, on these plains, which are usually furrowed with their trails

2d068835d02a0885ae95e064ee5f9f58.constraint_text: Thalcave is assigned the duty to remain with Robert while Glenarvan goes alone.
2d068835d02a0885ae95e064ee5f9f58.source_excerpt: Thalcave shall not leave, Robert. He shows me what I have to do. It is my duty to go, and his to remain with you.

2d068835d02a0885ae95e064ee5f9f58.constraint_text: Glenarvan fixes the moment of his decision to go as the current time.

375e9b70b39732da94ed240f63bfc51f.constraint_text: Thalcave's urgency to arrive at Fort Independence by that evening constrained the group's progress.
375e9b70b39732da94ed240f63bfc51f.source_excerpt: Thalcave, meanwhile, hastened their progress, as he wished to arrive that evening at Fort Independence.

469034e5703cf6fb47776b97f3f376a2.constraint_text: Robert's father wishes to make him a sailor
469034e5703cf6fb47776b97f3f376a2.source_excerpt: "Well," said Robert, "but what will papa say, who wishes to make a sailor of me?"

469034e5703cf6fb47776b97f3f376a2.constraint_text: The father consistently showed kindness to his children and brought mementos from his voyages
469034e5703cf6fb47776b97f3f376a2.source_excerpt: He thought only of us, and every voyage brought us a memento of the countries he visited, and, what was better, tender caresses and kind words, on his return.

4b44f990a57031e7f471983df27ac168.constraint_text: Dantès was arrested on the 28th of February, 1815, at half-past two in the afternoon.
4b44f990a57031e7f471983df27ac168.source_excerpt: "The 28th of February, 1815, at half-past two in the afternoon."

4b44f990a57031e7f471983df27ac168.constraint_text: Captivity has subdued Dantès, as he has been imprisoned for seventeen months.
4b44f990a57031e7f471983df27ac168.source_excerpt: "captivity has subdued me—I have been here so long."

69c764af797c61b8bfc3c468fa85bbe3.constraint_text: The Abbé Faria died from an attack of catalepsy, which cut short the prisoners' escape plans.
69c764af797c61b8bfc3c468fa85bbe3.source_excerpt: the Abbé Faria had an attack of catalepsy, and died.

2b19c92100af2c2c6eb8617fcb8b7726.constraint_text: Villefort cannot claim ownership of any day, including his betrothal day, due to his professional obligations.
2b19c92100af2c2c6eb8617fcb8b7726.source_excerpt: I at least resemble the disciples of Esculapius in one thing [...] that of not being able to call a day my own, not even that of my betrothal.

0b07440226b1da66a7770eb292148078.constraint_text: Dantès has no knowledge of the length of time he was imprisoned.
0b07440226b1da66a7770eb292148078.source_excerpt: From this point everything was a blank to Dantès—he knew nothing more, not even the length of time he had been imprisoned.

a647bbc7661f324018affcf46f4f7c68.constraint_text: Every day of fourteen years, he renewed his vow of vengeance made on the first day of his arrest
a647bbc7661f324018affcf46f4f7c68.source_excerpt: every day of those fourteen years I renewed the vow of vengeance which I had made the first day

a647bbc7661f324018affcf46f4f7c68.constraint_text: He remained imprisoned in the Château d’If for fourteen years
a647bbc7661f324018affcf46f4f7c68.source_excerpt: I remained for fourteen years within a quarter of a league of you, in a dungeon in the Château d’If
my father had died of hunger

28a6a45275e45ec163dc7ad40524434b.constraint_text: Albert's favorite lounging place is the described room
28a6a45275e45ec163dc7ad40524434b.source_excerpt: This was Albert’s favorite lounging place.

ac95ae99abd3147cbb4d150e3846ddec.constraint_text: Selim remained at his post during the narrator's departure
ac95ae99abd3147cbb4d150e3846ddec.source_excerpt: Selim was still at his post, and smiled sadly on us as we entered.

e2ea034da338f238a18072be8920dfec.constraint_text: Vampa assumed the entire costume of Cucumetto
e2ea034da338f238a18072be8920dfec.source_excerpt: He had assumed the entire costume of Cucumetto.

a16785cc0087627bc5be27659c5fbfab.constraint_text: Villefort's father has abjured his past errors
a16785cc0087627bc5be27659c5fbfab.source_excerpt: I have already had the honor to observe that my father has—at least, I hope so—abjured his past errors

a16785cc0087627bc5be27659c5fbfab.constraint_text: Villefort's father is a better royalist than his son because he has to atone for past dereliction
a16785cc0087627bc5be27659c5fbfab.source_excerpt: he has to atone for past dereliction, while I have no other impulse than warm, decided preference and conviction

048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.constraint_text: The count refuses to admit a proposition.
048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.source_excerpt: I have told you, my dear count, that I would not for one moment admit of such a proposition.

048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.constraint_text: The count must not submit to a stain on his father’s honor.
048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.source_excerpt: A son ought not to submit to such a stain on his father’s honor.

048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.constraint_text: The count is advised not to take witnesses when visiting Beauchamp.
048dcabf269e6b73ff0ba1ae9ed15445.source_excerpt: Do not take any witnesses with you when you go to Beauchamp—visit him alone.

ac1d842d27fbb1d1abef0236aad50dbe.constraint_text: M. de Villefort will offer the choice of being present if a favorable opportunity arises.
ac1d842d27fbb1d1abef0236aad50dbe.source_excerpt: I will not fail to offer you the choice of being present.

ac1d842d27fbb1d1abef0236aad50dbe.constraint_text: M. de Villefort has already recorded sentences of death against political conspirators five or six times.
ac1d842d27fbb1d1abef0236aad50dbe.source_excerpt: I have already recorded sentence of death, five or six times, against the movers of political conspiracies

fcf187e6fe2e56ebc1ddf4d78a5f4403.constraint_text: Faria is permanently paralyzed in his right arm and left leg and has abandoned hope of ever enjoying the treasure himself.
fcf187e6fe2e56ebc1ddf4d78a5f4403.source_excerpt: As he had prophesied would be the case, he remained paralyzed in the right arm and the left leg, and had given up all hope of ever enjoying it himself.

fcf187e6fe2e56ebc1ddf4d78a5f4403.constraint_text: Dantès memorized the letter in its entirety due to Faria's compulsion to prevent it from being lost or stolen.
fcf187e6fe2e56ebc1ddf4d78a5f4403.source_excerpt: For fear the letter might be some day lost or stolen, he compelled Dantès to learn it by heart; and Dantès knew it from the first to the last word.

76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.constraint_text: Villefort's father was a Girondin and did not vote for the king’s death during the Reign of Terror.
76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.source_excerpt: “’Tis true, madame,” answered he, “that my father was a Girondin, but he was not among the number of those who voted for the king’s death; he was an equal sufferer with yourself during the Reign of Terror, and had well-nigh lost his head on the same scaffold on which your father perished.”

76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.constraint_text: The marquise's family remained staunch adherents of the exiled princes during the political upheaval.
76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.source_excerpt: “True,” replied the marquise, ... ‘that while my family remained among the staunchest adherents of the exiled princes, your father lost no time in joining the new government; and that while the Citizen Noirtier was a Girondin, the Count Noirtier became a senator.’

76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.constraint_text: Villefort has disowned his father’s name and political principles.
76f2081ed391d185a0d1afb35f8244b1.source_excerpt: ‘... I have laid aside even the name of my father, and altogether disown his political principles.’

c10199eec57a3640109159a2f6326fb2.constraint_text: Albert could not have killed her by the same blow and would have fled from his country.
c10199eec57a3640109159a2f6326fb2.source_excerpt: I could not have killed her by the same blow,—I should have fled from my country.

c10199eec57a3640109159a2f6326fb2.constraint_text: Albert cannot relinquish the respect, confidence, and pride inspired by his father’s untarnished name.
c10199eec57a3640109159a2f6326fb2.source_excerpt: I cannot thus, in a moment relinquish the respect, the confidence, and pride with which a father’s untarnished name inspires a son.

a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.constraint_text: Tom Ayrton is the quartermaster of the Britannia
a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.source_excerpt: "I am really Tom Ayrton, quartermaster of the Britannia."

a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.constraint_text: Tom Ayrton left Glasgow on 12th of March, 1861
a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.source_excerpt: I left Glasgow in Captain Grant's ship on the 12th of March, 1861.

a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.constraint_text: Harry Grant is described as 'like iron towards himself and others'
a02b6b954ed6e63db8a1f8c91b504f8a.source_excerpt: He is like iron towards himself and others.

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The narrator became chief of the runaways under the name Ben Joyce.
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: You will spare me, my lord, the account of my life for two years and a half. It is enough to know that I became chief of the runaways, under the name of Ben Joyce.

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The narrator was received as a servant at the Irishman's farm in September 1864 under his true name, Ayrton.
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: In the month of September, 1864, I made my appearance at the Irishman's farm, and was received as a servant under my true name of Ayrton.

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The narrator's primary objective during his time at the farm was to gain possession of a vessel.
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: Here I waited till an opportunity should be offered to gain possession of a vessel. This was my great object.

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The Duncan arrived at the farm two months after the narrator's September 1864 arrival (i.e., November 1864).
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: Two months later the Duncan arrived.

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The narrator resolved to appropriate the Duncan after learning about Captain Grant's story during the visitor's account.
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: During your visit at the farm you related, my lord, the whole story of Captain Grant... I did not hesitate, but resolved to appropriate the Duncan...

14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.constraint_text: The Duncan required serious repairs before it could be used.
14e6c071061cad37dbc47de978f54c53.source_excerpt: However, there were serious injuries to be repaired.

24115ad216d863ef17d4c2eb8f177182.constraint_text: The group cannot proceed with their search until the Duncan is repaired.
24115ad216d863ef17d4c2eb8f177182.source_excerpt: "Very good," said Glenarvan; "but we must wait till the Duncan is repaired."

5d9672fe7b5f5047abef1bdd74f1596c.constraint_text: Andrea always carries an unclasped, long-pointed knife with him, which is never absent from him.
5d9672fe7b5f5047abef1bdd74f1596c.source_excerpt: whose temper he well knew, and which was never absent from him.

23802c7065f8b444ad1075199e47f563.constraint_text: Danglars has pursued Albert's father with jealous hatred for a long period
23802c7065f8b444ad1075199e47f563.source_excerpt: ‘He!’ cried Albert; ‘yes, it is indeed he who has so long pursued my father with jealous hatred.’

73819c9d132c0255559d8ac75dbf2541.constraint_text: Danglars retains the same self-satisfaction he experienced the previous evening, which persisted through the night and into his current journey.
73819c9d132c0255559d8ac75dbf2541.source_excerpt: He still felt the same self-satisfaction which he had experienced the previous evening, and which had procured him so good a night’s rest.

777356e444c12ad4d265555f1a8e24b1.constraint_text: Gives millions to sons who marry according to his wishes, but only 30 crowns/month to those who marry against his consent
777356e444c12ad4d265555f1a8e24b1.source_excerpt: I know an Italian prince, rich as a gold mine, one of the noblest families in Tuscany, who, when his sons married according to his wish, gave them millions; and when they married against his consent, merely allowed them thirty crowns a month.

b904115372b6aaf9e0364f06ac778cc8.constraint_text: Caderousse's living is suited to his means
b904115372b6aaf9e0364f06ac778cc8.source_excerpt: I am not in any want, thank God, my living is suited to my means.

2a71424111966086be8342f993cf3f4c.constraint_text: Old Dantès must use Edmond's money moderately to avoid suspicion of having waited for Edmond's return to make purchases.
2a71424111966086be8342f993cf3f4c.source_excerpt: "Gently, gently," said the old man, with a smile; "and by your leave I will use your purse moderately, for they would say, if they saw me buy too many things at a time, that I had been obliged to await your return, in order to be able to purchase them."

2a71424111966086be8342f993cf3f4c.constraint_text: Edmond explicitly commands his father to acquire a servant to prevent being left alone.
2a71424111966086be8342f993cf3f4c.source_excerpt: "Do as you please; but, first of all, pray have a servant, father. I will not have you left alone so long."

764c047ce74bd77a602bd58d741cb4bf.constraint_text: The speaker possesses all the necessary proofs to support the article about Morcerf
764c047ce74bd77a602bd58d741cb4bf.source_excerpt: "we have received with the information all the requisite proofs"

01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.constraint_text: Morrel owes 200,000 francs to M. de Boville, who placed the money in his hands nearly five years ago.
01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.source_excerpt: he placed the money in my hands at four and a half per cent nearly five years ago.

01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.constraint_text: Morrel must pay half of 200,000 francs by the 15th of this month and half by the 15th of next month.
01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.source_excerpt: Half the 15th of this month, half the 15th of next.

01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.constraint_text: Morrel is obligated to pay 32,500 francs shortly, as these bills are signed by him and assigned to the Englishman's house.
01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.source_excerpt: here are 32,500 francs payable shortly; they are all signed by you, and assigned to our house by the holders.

01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.constraint_text: Morrel must pay 55,000 francs assigned by Pascal and Wild & Turner by the end of the month.
01b313f2dbd53204f99b28cf214c4bb1.source_excerpt: I have for the end of the month these bills... amounting to nearly 55,000 francs.

9b10a90abc722f0444cd277729f6bd04.constraint_text: Robert explicitly assigns the cause of his emotional collapse to his father's death, not someone else's father.
9b10a90abc722f0444cd277729f6bd04.source_excerpt: "If it had been _his_ father," answered the lad, with irrepressible energy, "he would not say so. It was _my_ father, my lord! my father, my father----!"

9b10a90abc722f0444cd277729f6bd04.constraint_text: Both Robert and his sister experienced a simultaneous loss of consciousness due to excessive grief.
9b10a90abc722f0444cd277729f6bd04.source_excerpt: "excessive grief has produced upon both at the same moment a similar effect."

a642d6bdc955ad734337479bdab80d21.constraint_text: Villefort has vowed to exact revenge for his child's murder within three days.
a642d6bdc955ad734337479bdab80d21.source_excerpt: Rest assured, gentlemen, that within three days, in a less time than justice would demand, the revenge I shall have taken for the murder of my child will be such as to make the boldest heart tremble;

a642d6bdc955ad734337479bdab80d21.constraint_text: Villefort has pledged his word to Noirtier regarding the revenge.
a642d6bdc955ad734337479bdab80d21.source_excerpt: He knows me, and I have pledged my word to him.

d0eb774f44e395ecf34d61eee40701e9.constraint_text: The speaker refuses to engage with or acknowledge M. Debray's influence, despite Debray being the suspected cause of the telegraph fraud.
d0eb774f44e395ecf34d61eee40701e9.source_excerpt: "Do I know M. Debray?—do I wish to know him?—do I wish to know that he gives advice?—do I wish to follow it?—do I speculate?"

fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.constraint_text: Villefort has been in mourning for exactly three months due to deaths that occurred.
fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.source_excerpt: the deaths which have kept me in mourning for the last three months

fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.constraint_text: The deaths were not caused by natural means, according to Villefort's assertion.
fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.source_excerpt: have not happened by natural means

fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.constraint_text: Villefort is characterized as someone who 'pursues crime so vindictively.'
fe29dbad7e618cd7f1c510d72c338218.source_excerpt: you, who pursue crime so vindictively

6a130be692937f9ece69e96e0addcc21.constraint_text: Debray rejects the idea of marrying Mademoiselle Danglars due to her 'independent, proud spirit', which he deems an insurmountable obstacle.
6a130be692937f9ece69e96e0addcc21.source_excerpt: still, when he recollected the independent, proud spirit of Eugénie, he positively rejected it as utterly impossible

5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.constraint_text: The count explicitly identifies himself as a 'chance count' rather than claiming nobility
5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.source_excerpt: Except this, he has no pretension to nobility, and calls himself a chance count

5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.constraint_text: The general opinion in Rome is that the count is a man of very high distinction
5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.source_excerpt: the general opinion at Rome is that the count is a man of very high distinction

5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.constraint_text: Albert explicitly states the count's manners surpass the leading aristocracy of England, Spain, and Germany
5746998dfef2b1db827296ff94070d2f.source_excerpt: they surpass by far all I have known in the leading aristocracy of the three proudest nobilities of Europe—the English, the Spanish, and the German

37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.constraint_text: Haydée was born to treasures greater than those in the Thousand and One Nights.
37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.source_excerpt: The poor girl originally possessed much more than that; she was born to treasures in comparison with which those recorded in the _Thousand and One Nights_ would seem but poverty.

37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.constraint_text: Haydée is one of the greatest princesses in her country.
37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.source_excerpt: You are right; and she is one of the greatest in her country too.

37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.constraint_text: Haydée became a slave due to the fortune of war and caprice of fortune.
37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.source_excerpt: How was it that Dionysius the Tyrant became a schoolmaster? The fortune of war, my dear viscount,—the caprice of fortune; that is the way in which these things are to be accounted for.

37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.constraint_text: Haydée's name is a secret to the generality of mankind.
37cd2ba881f9350e9adb2854fa76158a.source_excerpt: And is her name a secret? As regards the generality of mankind it is; but not for you, my dear viscount...

1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.constraint_text: No one can oppose him due to his high position and reputation for talent and integrity
1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.source_excerpt: my father is not a person whose orders may be infringed with impunity; protected as he is by his high position and firmly established reputation for talent and unswerving integrity, no one could oppose him

1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.constraint_text: Her refusal to resist her father’s commands is explicitly tied to her assessment of past events
1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.source_excerpt: if I do not attempt to resist my father’s commands it is more on your account than my own... Because I judge it from the past

1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.constraint_text: Possesses an unswerving integrity and talent that are firmly established
1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.source_excerpt: firmly established reputation for talent and unswerving integrity

1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.constraint_text: Social distinctions that once mattered no longer exist in France
1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.source_excerpt: The days when such distinctions were so nicely weighed and considered no longer exist in France

1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.constraint_text: First families of the monarchy have intermarried with those of the empire
1b4a0c91a59f745f3b4f35078d3fcf3f.source_excerpt: the first families of the monarchy have intermarried with those of the empire

f168a62e98e3ccbdb2b075b5aa2124b1.constraint_text: Their tattered garments, gory weapons, and wounds are explicitly attributed to having recently fought against the English troops
f168a62e98e3ccbdb2b075b5aa2124b1.source_excerpt: The new-comers had recently fought against the English troops, as could be seen by their tattered garments, their gory weapons, and the wounds that still bled beneath their rags.

7d3379b10baa5b07972b7e8919040aa2.source_excerpt: He was brave and bold, but his cruelty equaled his bravery.
About midnight, the travelers, surprised in their sleep, were made prisoners and carried on board the canoe.

7d3379b10baa5b07972b7e8919040aa2.constraint_text: Their arms and ammunition were in the hands of the savages
7d3379b10baa5b07972b7e8919040aa2.source_excerpt: Their arms and ammunition were in the hands of the savages, and their own bullets would have quickly stretched them on the earth had they attempted to escape.

7d3379b10baa5b07972b7e8919040aa2.constraint_text: Their feet were tied but hands free
7d3379b10baa5b07972b7e8919040aa2.source_excerpt: In the centre of this long canoe, with feet tied, but hands free, were ten European prisoners clinging closely to each other.

92ec2da8311c35c1b350bf0bc7d8a4fd.constraint_text: Their escape had been discovered by the pursuers
92ec2da8311c35c1b350bf0bc7d8a4fd.source_excerpt: the fugitives could not doubt that their escape had been discovered

92ec2da8311c35c1b350bf0bc7d8a4fd.constraint_text: They were seen by the savages at the moment the vapor rose
92ec2da8311c35c1b350bf0bc7d8a4fd.source_excerpt: They saw, but were also seen

de0e872b4a89e0b675c55da19e67b7a1.constraint_text: The major's suspicion of Ayrton began on the day of their meeting and persisted thereafter.
de0e872b4a89e0b675c55da19e67b7a1.source_excerpt: Since the day of his meeting with Ayrton he had suspected him.

de0e872b4a89e0b675c55da19e67b7a1.constraint_text: The major could not form a direct accusation until the events of the preceding night.
de0e872b4a89e0b675c55da19e67b7a1.source_excerpt: However, he could form no direct accusation until the events that had transpired the preceding night.

ef62c1570e18e1d61e8a8bec775e22f4.constraint_text: They must avoid the Maoris at all hazards during their journey.
ef62c1570e18e1d61e8a8bec775e22f4.source_excerpt: They therefore determined to avoid them at all hazards, and gain the eastern coast

da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.constraint_text: The crime is attributed to Ben Joyce and the escaped convicts
da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.source_excerpt: this crime is to be attributed to a band of convicts who escaped, six months ago, from the Perth penitentiary

da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.constraint_text: Ben Joyce arrived in Australia several months ago
da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.source_excerpt: who arrived in Australia several months ago in some way

da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.constraint_text: Justice has not yet succeeded in apprehending Ben Joyce
da962af3b95b47923fa9cc3ef0b0bce4.source_excerpt: justice has not yet succeeded in laying hands on him

c8573d470e9a1665eb88c3bf87139a26.constraint_text: Any communication between captives would be instantly destroyed if jailers discovered it.
c8573d470e9a1665eb88c3bf87139a26.source_excerpt: the results would be instantly destroyed if our jailers knew we had communicated with each other.

c8573d470e9a1665eb88c3bf87139a26.constraint_text: The speaker's physical state is a hindrance to Edmond's movements.
c8573d470e9a1665eb88c3bf87139a26.source_excerpt: you will no longer have half a dead body tied to you as a drag to all your movements.

f0df52b7a54503f936f856ccfff51c55.constraint_text: The brother was a soldier in the French army.
The brother's death was caused by a poniard, not the sword.
f0df52b7a54503f936f856ccfff51c55.source_excerpt: ‘You are mistaken, monsieur,’ I replied; ‘he has perished by the poniard.’

f0df52b7a54503f936f856ccfff51c55.constraint_text: The brother's death was attributed to a duel by the magistrate.
f0df52b7a54503f936f856ccfff51c55.source_excerpt: ‘Why, your brother has been involved in a quarrel, and killed in a duel.’

e9bf3e128ff1320f20f6586f169ab38c.constraint_text: His hair turned white due to suffering and sorrow rather than age
e9bf3e128ff1320f20f6586f169ab38c.source_excerpt: He had a deep-set, penetrating eye, almost buried beneath the thick gray eyebrow, and a long (and still black) beard reaching down to his breast. His thin face, deeply furrowed by care, and the bold outline of his strongly marked features, betokened a man more accustomed to exercise his mental faculties than his physical strength.

e9bf3e128ff1320f20f6586f169ab38c.constraint_text: His facial features and appearance indicate a lifelong focus on mental faculties over physical strength
e9bf3e128ff1320f20f6586f169ab38c.source_excerpt: His thin face, deeply furrowed by care, and the bold outline of his strongly marked features, betokened a man more accustomed to exercise his mental faculties than his physical strength.

57acaabd23f8d823397a2f95c1ade6c4.constraint_text: The kiss Ali Tepelini gave the narrator was the last one he ever gave, and its warmth is still remembered by the narrator.
57acaabd23f8d823397a2f95c1ade6c4.source_excerpt: he stooped down and pressed my forehead with his lips. Oh, how distinctly I remember that kiss!—it was the last he ever gave me, and I feel as if it were still warm on my forehead.

10895189771daa82e3474254e95f0e74.constraint_text: Thalcave's affirmation about the Pampas storms being violent is correct and not mistaken
10895189771daa82e3474254e95f0e74.source_excerpt: Thalcave reaffirmed it, and he was not mistaken; for the storms of the Pampas are noted for their violence.

de442bc284e718bc23fb84dc6d82aabd.constraint_text: The priest tied the horse securely using a handle from a half-fallen door.
de442bc284e718bc23fb84dc6d82aabd.source_excerpt: he tied the animal safely and having drawn a red cotton handkerchief, from his pocket, wiped away the perspiration that streamed from his brow

de442bc284e718bc23fb84dc6d82aabd.constraint_text: The dog exhibits determined hostility due to being 'abundantly proved' to be unaccustomed to society.
de442bc284e718bc23fb84dc6d82aabd.source_excerpt: snarling and displaying his sharp white teeth with a determined hostility that abundantly proved how little he was accustomed to society

0bb839b33fbba14dd23c62131ff54f78.constraint_text: Glenarvan knew how to travel and conform to the customs of different countries
0bb839b33fbba14dd23c62131ff54f78.source_excerpt: Glenarvan, who knew how to travel and conform to the customs of different countries, had adopted the Chilian costume for himself and his friends.
Paganel, always absent-minded, received three or four kicks from his excellent animal just as he was mounting.

0bb839b33fbba14dd23c62131ff54f78.constraint_text: Robert showed a remarkable capacity for becoming an excellent horseman from the first
0bb839b33fbba14dd23c62131ff54f78.source_excerpt: young Robert, he showed from the first a remarkable capacity for becoming an excellent horseman.

c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.constraint_text: Fernand Mondego sold Haydée and her mother to the merchant El-Kobbir
c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.source_excerpt: It is you who sold us, my mother and me, to the merchant, El-Kobbir!

c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.constraint_text: Fernand Mondego forsook Haydée and her mother
c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.source_excerpt: it is he who forsook us!

c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.constraint_text: Fernand Mondego has a large wound on his right hand from the gold pieces of El-Kobbir
c98917bb0f2afc188bde0f41a8935e61.source_excerpt: Look well at his right hand, on which he has a large wound; if you forgot his features, you would know him by that hand, into which fell, one by one, the gold pieces of the merchant El-Kobbir!

6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.constraint_text: The brother was a soldier of the empire returning from the army of the Loire, wearing a uniform and epaulets, which made him a target for assassination.
6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.source_excerpt: my brother, a soldier of the empire, returning from the army of the Loire, with his uniform and his epaulets, there was everything to apprehend.

6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.constraint_text: The brother was assassinated the previous evening at Nîmes, at the very door of the house where he was about to demand hospitality.
6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.source_excerpt: My brother had arrived the previous evening at Nîmes, and, at the very door of the house where he was about to demand hospitality, he had been assassinated.

6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.constraint_text: The speaker is a Corsican fisherman and smuggler, a role that made him personally unaffected by the anti-Bonapartist violence.
6f58ebfa79be7db6a3020570bdb82e03.source_excerpt: I, a simple Corsican fisherman, had nothing to fear; on the contrary, that time was most favorable for us smugglers

c5e16a76bf288083e25886db3810bce6.constraint_text: The brother perished by the poniard.
c5e16a76bf288083e25886db3810bce6.source_excerpt: ‘You are mistaken, monsieur,’ I replied; ‘he has perished by the poniard.’

c5e16a76bf288083e25886db3810bce6.constraint_text: The brother's death was caused by excesses tolerated under the emperor but no longer permitted.
c5e16a76bf288083e25886db3810bce6.source_excerpt: All these old soldiers commit excesses which were tolerated in the time of the emperor, but which are not suffered now...

0fc4ee07b24285aec3048fb03e8f099d.constraint_text: Danglars no longer possesses strength, will, power, or feeling and follows without resistance
0fc4ee07b24285aec3048fb03e8f099d.source_excerpt: He no longer possessed strength, will, power, or feeling; he followed where they led him.

ca9f99fd606c9e21103f34c74965e21f.constraint_text: The man of blood had never wept before this moment
ca9f99fd606c9e21103f34c74965e21f.source_excerpt: These were the first tears the man of blood had ever wept.

bc4dfbad213a72e5021cc9ffaf6d52e6.constraint_text: Will Halley's sense of danger is consistently superior to the brutishness of intoxication.
bc4dfbad213a72e5021cc9ffaf6d52e6.source_excerpt: Will Halley, whose sense of danger was superior to the brutishness of intoxication, was startled by these warning signs.

938badf72b343fdfe9afe7b6c73ff2e1.constraint_text: Dantès found himself on the deck of the tartan immediately after regaining consciousness.
938badf72b343fdfe9afe7b6c73ff2e1.source_excerpt: When he opened his eyes Dantès found himself on the deck of the tartan.

94ea35c6c21afc49ba900608b0a2c8a9.constraint_text: The passengers were forced to submit to confinement because they could not remain on deck.
94ea35c6c21afc49ba900608b0a2c8a9.source_excerpt: The passengers found their situation very uncomfortable; but, as they could not remain on deck, they were forced to submit to confinement.

94ea35c6c21afc49ba900608b0a2c8a9.constraint_text: Paganel is regarded as a source of knowledge about the land they are sailing to.
94ea35c6c21afc49ba900608b0a2c8a9.source_excerpt: just as naturally all turned to Paganel as to a bookcase, for some information thereon.

c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.constraint_text: Edmond administered the remedy only after life seemed extinct in the abbé's body
c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.source_excerpt: Edmond waited till life seemed extinct in the body of his friend, then, taking up the knife, he with difficulty forced open the closely fixed jaws, carefully administered the appointed number of drops

c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.constraint_text: The remedy was administered in a fixed, pre-determined quantity
c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.source_excerpt: carefully administered the appointed number of drops

c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.constraint_text: The abbé became rigid as a corpse after a two-hour convulsion
c9684e72b62c592c39734372067db9db.source_excerpt: he fell back, doubled up in one last convulsion, and became as rigid as a corpse

fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has features that are 'ordinarily so stern and cold'.
fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.source_excerpt: features ordinarily so stern and cold

fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.constraint_text: Monte Cristo set apart one hour at noon to be in Haydée's apartments.
fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.source_excerpt: Monte Cristo had set apart one hour to be passed in the apartments of Haydée

fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.constraint_text: Haydée occupies apartments 'wholly unconnected' with Monte Cristo's.
fb740148f9060c943cb3f0d86cab865d.source_excerpt: the young Greek... occupied apartments wholly unconnected with those of the count

ec2fc570d806e538f7ac81eb0e73bb20.constraint_text: Edmond's anxiety caused him to lose track of time during the rescue
ec2fc570d806e538f7ac81eb0e73bb20.source_excerpt: Edmond’s anxiety had put all thoughts of time out of his head.

ec2fc570d806e538f7ac81eb0e73bb20.constraint_text: The prisoner is habitually seated on the side of his bed when the jailer arrives
ec2fc570d806e538f7ac81eb0e73bb20.source_excerpt: the prisoner seated as usual on the side of his bed.

a272b4d58e11055e389d14697fc32ce8.constraint_text: Ayrton's reaction to Glenarvan's words is attributed to 'the shame of defeat' rather than remorse
a272b4d58e11055e389d14697fc32ce8.source_excerpt: A quick blush colored his hard features,--not the sign of remorse, but the shame of defeat.

86cb7ce36f829bed8f3e20ebbe63a01c.constraint_text: Wasilio was at Bastia during the attack on Assunta
86cb7ce36f829bed8f3e20ebbe63a01c.source_excerpt: It unfortunately happened that our neighbor, Wasilio, was at Bastia, leaving no person in his house but his wife

86cb7ce36f829bed8f3e20ebbe63a01c.constraint_text: Benedetto explicitly ordered the torture of Assunta to extract information about her money
86cb7ce36f829bed8f3e20ebbe63a01c.source_excerpt: none other than the accursed Benedetto exclaimed: 'Put her to torture and she’ll soon tell us where her money is.'

9305c39838f868a17856a9ec44e98d86.constraint_text: Monte Cristo prepared the receipt beforehand because he was in urgent need of money on that specific day.
9305c39838f868a17856a9ec44e98d86.source_excerpt: I had prepared it beforehand, for I am much in want of money today.

dc9f2963cf331b33444ef535fa0650b7.constraint_text: Valentine's father's orders cannot be disregarded without consequence due to his high position and reputation
dc9f2963cf331b33444ef535fa0650b7.source_excerpt: my father is not a person whose orders may be infringed with impunity; protected as he is by his high position and firmly established reputation for talent and unswerving integrity, no one could oppose him; he is all-powerful even with the king; he would crush you at a word

346571a85ee85aa0da264884046ca03f.constraint_text: Believes duels should not be undertaken without due reflection
346571a85ee85aa0da264884046ca03f.source_excerpt: I do not say that you ought not to fight, I only say that a duel is a serious thing, and ought not to be undertaken without due reflection.

9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.constraint_text: Resigned their office during the usurper’s reign
9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.source_excerpt: magistrates who had resigned their office during the usurper’s reign

9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.constraint_text: Deserted from the imperial army and joined forces with Condé
9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.source_excerpt: officers who had deserted from the imperial army and joined forces with Condé

9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.constraint_text: Brought up to hate and execrate the man who would later become a martyr/god
9d7c5cc67f51aaad19e2782e83414baf.source_excerpt: younger members of families, brought up to hate and execrate the man whom five years of exile would convert into a martyr, and fifteen of restoration elevate to the rank of a god

5abb041a3c9f69997ed9caed1402cfcb.constraint_text: Paganel has been studying Portuguese for six weeks
5abb041a3c9f69997ed9caed1402cfcb.source_excerpt: It is Portuguese that you have been studying for six weeks.

f390664753b6c022b50e097a995aa4e8.source_excerpt: The Indians are not cannibals; far from that, one of my countrymen whom I knew in the Society was three years prisoner among the Indians of the Pampas.

c7317a09a6106a74dd504e13761a42d6.constraint_text: The character's end will be achieved before they grow old
c7317a09a6106a74dd504e13761a42d6.source_excerpt: "My end will be achieved before I grow old."

c7317a09a6106a74dd504e13761a42d6.constraint_text: The character cannot be mad twice due to the criminal law axiom 'non bis in idem'
c7317a09a6106a74dd504e13761a42d6.source_excerpt: "I have been nearly mad; and you know the axiom,—_non bis in idem_. It is an axiom of criminal law, and, consequently, you understand its full application."

4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.constraint_text: Must attend a meeting with the count on 26th May at seven o’clock in the evening
4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.source_excerpt: Remember to go to the count on the 26th May at seven o’clock in the evening.

4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.constraint_text: Received a letter from an Englishman named Lord Wilmore (using the alias Sinbad the Sailor)
4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.source_excerpt: I received a letter almost to the same effect... From an Englishman, called Lord Wilmore, who takes the name of Sinbad the Sailor.

4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.constraint_text: Received a letter offering wealth and autonomy in exchange for action
4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.source_excerpt: ‘You are poor, and your future prospects are dark and gloomy. Do you wish for a name? should you like to be rich, and your own master?’

4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.constraint_text: Must take the post-chaise at Porte de Gênes and follow a specific route
4452c9946adc21f0af83d783fb3d308f.source_excerpt: Take the post-chaise which you will find waiting at the Porte de Gênes, as you enter Nice; pass through Turin, Chambéry, and Pont-de-Beauvoisin.

5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.constraint_text: Must meet the Count of Monte Cristo on May 26th at 7 o’clock in the evening.
5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.source_excerpt: Go to the Count of Monte Cristo, Avenue des Champs-Élysées, on the 26th of May, at seven o’clock in the evening...

5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.constraint_text: Is the son of the Marchese Cavalcanti and the Marchesa Oliva Corsinari.
5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.source_excerpt: You are the son of the Marchese Cavalcanti and the Marchesa Oliva Corsinari.

5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.constraint_text: Has an annual income of 50,000 livres.
5df9cf0967a2cd883859c9bd310c74dd.source_excerpt: an annual income of 50,000 livres will enable you to support it admirably.

baf7d9a7210a82267e28da1bc8e171b0.constraint_text: The abbé refuses to disclose secrets of confession, stating they must remain between him and God, not between him and human justice.
baf7d9a7210a82267e28da1bc8e171b0.source_excerpt: "I am a priest, sir, and the secrets of confession, for instance, must remain between me and God, and not between me and human justice."

9049459421ebf41fc2c14c17ce49c622.constraint_text: MacNabb had always opposed Ayrton's ideas on this subject prior to this moment
9049459421ebf41fc2c14c17ce49c622.source_excerpt: hitherto MacNabb had always opposed Ayrton's ideas on this subject

035dc4820e61d3ea37a98d4c352214d9.constraint_text: M. Noirtier is vice-president of the Bonapartist club at No. 53 in the Rue Saint-Jacques.
M. Noirtier's current state of being accustomed to hardship is caused by his past experiences of persecution during the Revolution.
035dc4820e61d3ea37a98d4c352214d9.source_excerpt: "when a man has been proscribed by the mountaineers, has escaped from Paris in a hay-cart, been hunted over the plains of Bordeaux by Robespierre’s bloodhounds, he becomes accustomed to most things."

bc6768fdf59595e9a0ed1c66446f590b.constraint_text: Faria's imprisonment is explicitly caused by his 1807 political ambitions to unify Italy, which he compares to Napoleon's 1811 plan and the schemes of Alexander VI and Clement VII.
bc6768fdf59595e9a0ed1c66446f590b.source_excerpt: "Because in 1807 I dreamed of the very plan Napoleon tried to realize in 1811; because, like Machiavelli, I desired to alter the political face of Italy... I fancied I had found my Cæsar Borgia in a crowned simpleton, who feigned to enter into my views only to betray me."

f080c0fa373d3ffcebf70123c4d0b47b.constraint_text: Edmond's arrest was caused by his hasty departure, which aroused the suspicions of the imperial police.
f080c0fa373d3ffcebf70123c4d0b47b.source_excerpt: my hasty departure, the cause of which they were unable to guess, having aroused their suspicions, I was arrested at the very moment I was leaving Piombino.

966fbd58ffad0bd4f19e3a07b0c67c07.constraint_text: Faria wrote his treatise on two shirts using a preparation that makes linen as smooth as parchment.
966fbd58ffad0bd4f19e3a07b0c67c07.source_excerpt: "On two of my shirts. I invented a preparation that makes linen as smooth and as easy to write on as parchment."

966fbd58ffad0bd4f19e3a07b0c67c07.constraint_text: Faria concluded that 150 well-chosen books contain all a man needs to know, after reading 5,000 volumes repeatedly.
966fbd58ffad0bd4f19e3a07b0c67c07.source_excerpt: "I had nearly five thousand volumes in my library at Rome; but after reading them over many times, I found out that with one hundred and fifty well-chosen books a man possesses, if not a complete summary of all human knowledge, at least all that a man need really know."

395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.constraint_text: He was taken to the Palais de Justice when he left here.
395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.source_excerpt: You know that when he left here he was taken to the Palais de Justice.

395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.constraint_text: He was carried off a week after the report was made.
395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.source_excerpt: I made my report to the authorities at Paris, and a week after he was carried off.

395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.constraint_text: He has been taken to Fenestrelles, Pignerol, or Sainte-Marguérite islands.
395c3c16e62401b0cff44d0f23f3ee67.source_excerpt: he has been taken to Fenestrelles, to Pignerol, or to the Sainte-Marguérite islands.

6ae3c50790900052e40d9053ad6ded5d.constraint_text: Paganel associates New Zealand and its Maori inhabitants with a painful impression and thoughts
6ae3c50790900052e40d9053ad6ded5d.source_excerpt: although evidently to the geographer's mind there was something of a painful character connected with the name, the impression, and the very thoughts of New Zealand and its Maori inhabitants

3ec8c7b77780dcf9e7ea6b1c0e1a59c6.constraint_text: The wound did not affect bones or large muscles
3ec8c7b77780dcf9e7ea6b1c0e1a59c6.source_excerpt: Neither bones nor large muscles seemed affected.

3ec8c7b77780dcf9e7ea6b1c0e1a59c6.constraint_text: Eighteen months of crime established his wide-spread notoriety
3ec8c7b77780dcf9e7ea6b1c0e1a59c6.source_excerpt: eighteen months of crime had given a wide-spread notoriety.

5b2a0203c610f2bf75d70180a557f138.constraint_text: Ali is forbidden from ever setting foot in Tunis again after his punishment is commuted.
5b2a0203c610f2bf75d70180a557f138.source_excerpt: the Bey yielded, and agreed to forgive the hand and head, but on condition that the poor fellow never again set foot in Tunis.

71943eb14178b0c6d430e914b894a5fb.constraint_text: The letter addressed to Tom Austin was removed from the sailor's possession
71943eb14178b0c6d430e914b894a5fb.source_excerpt: The letter addressed to Tom Austin was gone.

0b9919ff7f8aa183140a12b28ace1495.constraint_text: The child is dead and cannot be revived, as no skill has been able to recall it to life
0b9919ff7f8aa183140a12b28ace1495.source_excerpt: whom no skill had been able to recall to life

b65a2120526c3f7094b04192f94d6e1c.constraint_text: Valentine’s 'I am coming' is the customary signal of farewell for Maximilian
b65a2120526c3f7094b04192f94d6e1c.source_excerpt: The name of Monte Cristo sent an electric shock through the young man on the other side of the iron gate, to whom Valentine’s _“I am coming”_ was the customary signal of farewell.

3ac233fb8073e580d8258b16d25f754c.constraint_text: The Count cannot appear in public because he was duped by the Cavalcanti with false letters of credit, resulting in a financial loss of 100,000 francs.
3ac233fb8073e580d8258b16d25f754c.source_excerpt: besides, he could not well appear in public, since he has been the dupe of the Cavalcanti, who, it appears, presented themselves to him with false letters of credit, and cheated him out of 100,000 francs upon the hypothesis of this principality.

3ac233fb8073e580d8258b16d25f754c.constraint_text: The Count cannot appear in the hall because he is an actor in the drama, having been the target of an assassination attempt.
3ac233fb8073e580d8258b16d25f754c.source_excerpt: Because he is an actor in the drama... No, on the contrary, they wished to assassinate him.

2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo explicitly leaves the carriage at the disposal of the young men for the remainder of the Carnival.
2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.source_excerpt: "...today, and for the remainder of the Carnival, I leave the carriage entirely at your disposal."

2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo is perfectly well acquainted with the literature of all countries.
2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.source_excerpt: He was, as we have already said, perfectly well acquainted with the literature of all countries.

2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo is a connoisseur of pictures, as evidenced by the walls of his salon.
2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.source_excerpt: A glance at the walls of his salon proved to Franz and Albert that he was a connoisseur of pictures.

2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo is no stranger to the sciences and is notably occupied with chemistry.
2ae2b4546ac35fb40dbd754b73176e2e.source_excerpt: A few words he let fall showed them that he was no stranger to the sciences, and he seemed much occupied with chemistry.

15780dfcb671eff68016b2d88a4fd2ad.constraint_text: Maximilian must separate from Valentine forever
15780dfcb671eff68016b2d88a4fd2ad.source_excerpt: "...take a last farewell, sir, of her sad remains; take the hand you expected to possess once more within your own, and then separate yourself from her forever."

b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.constraint_text: The narrator must destroy all material vestiges of the past to prevent the Corsican from using the secret as revenge.
b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.source_excerpt: It was therefore necessary, before everything else, and at all risks, that I should cause all traces of the past to disappear—that I should destroy every material vestige

b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.constraint_text: The narrator's annulment of the lease, arrival at the location, and waiting were all motivated by the need to erase past evidence.
b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.source_excerpt: It was for this I had annulled the lease—it was for this I had come—it was for this I was waiting

b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.constraint_text: The narrator's persistent fear of the Corsican's vendetta and the lingering trauma of the buried child's death.
b2d0bf6ab2e9440166c70b71ea7ad322.source_excerpt: Too much reality would always remain in my recollection

8c504611d577212cffd6a152e61ba02c.constraint_text: Albert has signed a commitment that necessitates his departure
Albert's choice of regiment was motivated by vanity
8c504611d577212cffd6a152e61ba02c.source_excerpt: I declare, I expect to look magnificent in it, and chose that regiment only from vanity.

4ab91d423d0c02320c29316a35767b0a.constraint_text: On the fourth day, he became a living corpse
4ab91d423d0c02320c29316a35767b0a.source_excerpt: On the fourth, he was no longer a man, but a living corpse.

4ab91d423d0c02320c29316a35767b0a.constraint_text: He had consumed all crumbs from his former meals before the fourth day
4ab91d423d0c02320c29316a35767b0a.source_excerpt: he had picked up every crumb that had been left from his former meals

1b254c71deb024f081d2a3fa7e2df564.constraint_text: Noirtier is paralyzed and cannot move, relying on eye movements to communicate.
1b254c71deb024f081d2a3fa7e2df564.source_excerpt: Noirtier’s eye remained fixed and firm... the paralytic with the same solemnity

1b254c71deb024f081d2a3fa7e2df564.constraint_text: Morrel must swear an oath on his honor to fulfill Noirtier’s demand.
1b254c71deb024f081d2a3fa7e2df564.source_excerpt: I swear to you, on my honor... to await your decision respecting the course I am to pursue with M.

2c5c69b93c08faaabca0072162a85321.constraint_text: Noirtier is physically helpless and unable to assist others despite his mental alertness.
2c5c69b93c08faaabca0072162a85321.source_excerpt: Noirtier, burning with impatience and terror, was in despair at his utter inability to help his old domestic, whom he regarded more in the light of a friend than a servant. One might by the fearful swelling of the veins of his forehead and the contraction of the muscles round the eye, trace the terrible conflict which was going on between the living energetic mind and the inanimate and helpless body.

c8b4953407b2400f18a2960faa41e76b.constraint_text: Andrea's resolve to resist execution was caused by another person sharing his punishment and anguish
c8b4953407b2400f18a2960faa41e76b.source_excerpt: Do you know what gave him strength? do you know what consoled him? It was, that another partook of his punishment—that another partook of his anguish—that another was to die before him!

f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.constraint_text: Her death was caused by a violent blow with the 'méré' wielded by the chief
f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.source_excerpt: Suddenly the unfortunate victim rose; but a violent blow with the 'méré,' a formidable club, wielded by the hand of the chief, struck her lifeless to the earth.

f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.constraint_text: They could not act because the funeral ceremonies were not yet ended
f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.source_excerpt: But no one stirred, for the funeral ceremonies were not ended.

f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.constraint_text: The deceased required slaves to follow them for eternal life in the presence of Nouï-Atoua
f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.source_excerpt: But for the eternal life his faithful spouse could not alone suffice the deceased. Who would serve them in presence of Nouï-Atoua, if their slaves did not follow them?

f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.constraint_text: Six slaves were required to be brought before the corpse of their master and mistress
f312ad93e9c759844172d216d796648a.source_excerpt: Six unfortunates were brought before the corpse of their master and mistress.

0622b9c0adec8301d44c7fad09c4ea49.constraint_text: The two shots mortally wounded the narrator's father
0622b9c0adec8301d44c7fad09c4ea49.source_excerpt: These two shots had mortally wounded my father, and it was he who had given utterance to these frightful cries.

f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.constraint_text: The child's straight black hair resists all attempts to train or curl it.
f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.source_excerpt: A mass of straight black hair, defying all attempts to train or curl it, fell over his projecting forehead...

f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.constraint_text: The child exhibits a deep and crafty look that gives a predominant expression to his face.
f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.source_excerpt: the deep and crafty look, giving a predominant expression to the child’s face, belonged rather to a boy of twelve or fourteen than to one so young.

f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.constraint_text: The child acts with wilfulness unaccustomed to restraint, characteristic of a spoiled child.
f746a2a3a9db1a6433ec61f1c7dc44d3.source_excerpt: in all the wilfulness of a spoiled child unaccustomed to restrain either whims or caprices

0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.constraint_text: The character has considered himself the agent of vengeance for ten years.
0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.source_excerpt: I have during ten years considered myself the agent of thy vengeance

0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.constraint_text: The character's role as the agent of vengeance began ten years ago.
0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.source_excerpt: I have during ten years considered myself the agent of thy vengeance

0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.constraint_text: Their punishment has been decreed by Providence and will occur in another world.
0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.source_excerpt: their punishment, which had been decreed by Providence, is only delayed by my present determination, and although they escape it in this world, it awaits them in another

0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.constraint_text: The delay of their punishment is caused by the character's present determination.
0626fcd040e720caf0ebe2a1b7f1b18e.source_excerpt: it is only delayed by my present determination

23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.constraint_text: Selim was ordered to blow up everything (kiosk, guards, women, gold, and Ali Tepelini) at the first signal from the narrator’s father.
23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.source_excerpt: he had orders to blow up everything—kiosk, guards, women, gold, and Ali Tepelini himself—at the first signal given by my father.

23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.constraint_text: The slaves’ constant praying, crying, and groaning stemmed from their awareness of their precarious tenure on life.
23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.source_excerpt: the slaves, convinced of the precarious tenure on which they held their lives, passed whole days and nights in praying, crying, and groaning.

23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.constraint_text: The narrator holds an unshakable certainty that they will recognize Selim in death due to his distinct pale complexion and black eyes.
23aa72c874dd96695786d6e1633e5d6d.source_excerpt: whenever the angel of death summons me to another world, I am quite sure I shall recognize Selim.

4e1bfafb8677d42a9dc023e003f254c4.constraint_text: The speaker has no fear of ghosts and believes the dead have caused less harm than the living in a single day.
4e1bfafb8677d42a9dc023e003f254c4.source_excerpt: I have no fear of ghosts, and I have never heard it said that so much harm had been done by the dead during six thousand years as is wrought by the living in a single day.

3bfe5945c1ce92953c033b1114aa5d9f.source_excerpt: "Ferocity does not exist,--scientifically speaking," replied the geographer.

ecbe2da4469c2a7b2207cc1f485eb657.source_excerpt: left that port on the 30th of May, 1862, to return to Europe by the way of the Indian Ocean and the Cape.

5357ccb2731da0629f5615890a38f4fa.source_excerpt: the very same, who, in 1861, embarked in the Britannia at Glasgow, and of whom nothing has since been heard.

82aceeb13b4bfbda475aae998e777625.constraint_text: No boat could have endured the long voyage to the nearest land
82aceeb13b4bfbda475aae998e777625.source_excerpt: No boat could have endured so long a voyage.

82aceeb13b4bfbda475aae998e777625.source_excerpt: I therefore abandoned my design, and no longer expected deliverance, except through a Divine interposition.

82aceeb13b4bfbda475aae998e777625.constraint_text: Their exile lasted exactly two years and six months
82aceeb13b4bfbda475aae998e777625.source_excerpt: Two years and a half passed thus.

251b55129c7d58b24fff3ac3eb0a4bce.source_excerpt: "May 30, 1862, Callao, Peru, _Britannia_, Captain Grant, bound for Glasgow."

251b55129c7d58b24fff3ac3eb0a4bce.source_excerpt: "the very same, who, in 1861, embarked in the Britannia at Glasgow"

251b55129c7d58b24fff3ac3eb0a4bce.constraint_text: Nothing has been heard of Captain Grant since 1861
251b55129c7d58b24fff3ac3eb0a4bce.source_excerpt: "and of whom nothing has since been heard."

af37d92363df2eabe21605b898c1538d.source_excerpt: Since then he had heard nothing more of the Britannia, and naturally supposed that she had been wrecked, with all on board, on the dangerous reefs of Twofold Bay.

Demonstrated protective behavior toward his sister

ad0bad0f460711e125ad574a0a387b57.constraint_text: Possesses a clear and penetrating judgment
ad0bad0f460711e125ad574a0a387b57.source_excerpt: she has a clear and penetrating judgment

2b929d2be8582014b35b9d22d60c9be1.source_excerpt: "No, mother; from this moment I have done with the past, and accept nothing from it—not even a name, because you can understand that your son cannot bear the name of a man who ought to blush for it before another."

2b929d2be8582014b35b9d22d60c9be1.constraint_text: Albert is 22 years old at the time of this conversation.
2b929d2be8582014b35b9d22d60c9be1.source_excerpt: "you are yet scarcely twenty-two years old"

2b929d2be8582014b35b9d22d60c9be1.source_excerpt: "I will fulfil all your wishes, my dear mother"

5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.constraint_text: Paganel was tattooed from head to foot with an heraldic kiwi biting his heart, a permanent mark from his captivity.
5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.source_excerpt: Jacques Paganel, during his three days' captivity among the Maoris, had been tattooed from head to foot, and bore on his breast the picture of an heraldic kiwi with outstretched wings, in the act of biting at his heart.

5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.constraint_text: Paganel could never be consoled or pardon the New Zealanders for the tattoo incident.
5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.source_excerpt: This was the only adventure of his great voyage for which Paganel could never be consoled or pardon the New Zealanders.

5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.constraint_text: Paganel dared not return to France due to fear of exposing the Geographical Society to ridicule.
5a31a37a8f4c8a4a9181b936962721be.source_excerpt: In spite of the representations of his friends, he dared not go back to France, for fear of exposing the whole Geographical Society in his person to the jests and railleries of the caricaturists.

c388cb8c3789e4efdf03a7ff9bc6c3cb.constraint_text: The captain's confidence is explicitly caused by his strong desire to see Miss Mary happy and consoled.
c388cb8c3789e4efdf03a7ff9bc6c3cb.source_excerpt: Their captain was one of the most confident on board; but his confidence proceeded especially from the desire that he cherished so strongly at heart, of seeing Miss Mary happy and consoled.

c388cb8c3789e4efdf03a7ff9bc6c3cb.constraint_text: The major is explicitly described as indifferent to geographical questions, especially at dinner-time.
c388cb8c3789e4efdf03a7ff9bc6c3cb.source_excerpt: But Paganel had all the passengers on his side except the major, who was very indifferent to geographical questions, especially at dinner-time.

c388cb8c3789e4efdf03a7ff9bc6c3cb.source_excerpt: Having discovered a whole cargo of odd books in the mate's chests... Thanks to his love for philology, he did not despair of speaking this new tongue fluently on arriving at Concepcion.

8994ea8d3102aadfcece2ddeeff406c7.constraint_text: Paganel has a mission from the Geographical Society that he must fulfill.
8994ea8d3102aadfcece2ddeeff406c7.source_excerpt: and a mission from the Geographical Society which I must fulfil.

a525e9bee757ff572697e8f04636a99f.source_excerpt: was looked upon here as a ruined man, separated forever from any fresh connection with France or claim to her throne.

c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.constraint_text: Faria has been imprisoned in Château d’If since 1811
c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.source_excerpt: I have been imprisoned as you know in this Château d’If since the year 1811

c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.constraint_text: Faria was previously confined for three years in the fortress of Fenestrelle
c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.source_excerpt: previously to which I had been confined for three years in the fortress of Fenestrelle

c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.constraint_text: Faria learned about Napoleon’s son being named king of Rome in 1811
c76cdc245c265f72be249c1f6ac4cae3.source_excerpt: It was at this period I learned that the destiny which seemed subservient to every wish formed by Napoleon, had bestowed on him a son, named king of Rome even in his cradle

ddabad45fee752d392de5ddb27c15b16.constraint_text: The castle of Malcolm has belonged to the Glenarvan family since time immemorial
ddabad45fee752d392de5ddb27c15b16.source_excerpt: From time immemorial it has belonged to the Glenarvan family

ddabad45fee752d392de5ddb27c15b16.constraint_text: The Glenarvan family have preserved the hospitable customs of the ancient heroes of Walter Scott
ddabad45fee752d392de5ddb27c15b16.source_excerpt: The castle of Malcolm... preserved in the country... the hospitable customs of the ancient heroes of Walter Scott

b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.constraint_text: He had been married for scarcely three months at the time of the narrative
b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.source_excerpt: He had been married scarcely three months, having espoused Miss Helena Tuffnel

b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.constraint_text: He married Miss Helena Tuffnel because he saw she would make a noble wife
b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.source_excerpt: He saw that the poor girl would make a noble wife, and he married her

b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.constraint_text: His character was thoroughly imbued with the poetry of the Highlands
b43a8ac5273a80a127c392fe1535f35f.source_excerpt: His character thoroughly imbued with the poetry of the Highlands

dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.constraint_text: Glenarvan's nervous and excitable nature prevents him from remaining confined in enclosed spaces.
dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.source_excerpt: His nervous and excitable nature would not submit to an imprisonment between four wooden walls.

dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.constraint_text: Glenarvan's power and hopefulness have suddenly failed, marking a permanent shift in his energetic and courageous demeanor.
dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.source_excerpt: The power and hopefulness of this man, hitherto so energetic and courageous, had suddenly failed.

dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.constraint_text: Glenarvan's expectation of sighting Auckland light is fixed to a specific time frame (36 hours prior).
dd0757e4d43c601450fa7cff5bb5dd3d.source_excerpt: We ought to have sighted Auckland light thirty-six hours ago.

707b121b71e7d0741c0ee246184478d9.constraint_text: Lady Helena consistently avoided discouraging the young people with pessimistic predictions.
707b121b71e7d0741c0ee246184478d9.source_excerpt: Lady Helena often took part in the conversation, and was very careful not to discourage the young people with any sad forebodings.

707b121b71e7d0741c0ee246184478d9.constraint_text: Captain Mangles' initial optimism about the journey duration was explicitly caused by his ignorance of the terrain's difficulties.
707b121b71e7d0741c0ee246184478d9.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles had hoped to make the journey in ten days, but he was ignorant then of the difficulties of the way.

19e0c5b3de319c660c8c85a690c07baa.constraint_text: Thalcave has never encountered a soil so saturated during his time as a guide
