19e0c5b3de319c660c8c85a690c07baa.source_excerpt: Never within his recollection, since he had performed the office of guide, had his feet trodden a soil so saturated.

04078140ad092f24647c98d02b1c0920.constraint_text: The tribes commanded by these caziques were very powerful thirty years ago but were driven beyond the sierras before that time
04078140ad092f24647c98d02b1c0920.source_excerpt: Chiefs of tribes that were very powerful thirty years ago, before they were driven beyond the sierras.

afcfb6381f63215ba54409569240426f.constraint_text: The document admits no new interpretation, fixing the course of action as returning to England.
afcfb6381f63215ba54409569240426f.source_excerpt: The document admitted of no new interpretation.

afcfb6381f63215ba54409569240426f.constraint_text: The supply of coal will not last more than fifteen days, necessitating a stop at Talcahuana Bay.
afcfb6381f63215ba54409569240426f.source_excerpt: The supply of coal would not last more than fifteen days.

e89fecd661fd23a332fa4cabc6a04876.constraint_text: The mountain-top of Tristan d'Acunha is visible from exactly eighty miles away.
e89fecd661fd23a332fa4cabc6a04876.source_excerpt: "if I remember aright, we are eighty miles from it. Is not that the distance from which this mountain is visible?"..."Exactly so," replied the captain.

23190eb7cdd85a7504d2df66c76cc237.constraint_text: The sailor was arrested on the day of the speaker's departure.
23190eb7cdd85a7504d2df66c76cc237.source_excerpt: arrested on the day of my departure

23190eb7cdd85a7504d2df66c76cc237.constraint_text: The speaker left his bride and friends on the day of his betrothal to hasten to the king.
23190eb7cdd85a7504d2df66c76cc237.source_excerpt: on the very day of my betrothal, I left my bride and friends, postponing everything

c3c53961e7e70cfd69cf433788c0c6da.constraint_text: M. Dandré is not a man to be accused of treason
c3c53961e7e70cfd69cf433788c0c6da.source_excerpt: "M. Dandré is not a man to be accused of treason!"

c3c53961e7e70cfd69cf433788c0c6da.constraint_text: The minister of police's silence is equivalent to an avowal
c3c53961e7e70cfd69cf433788c0c6da.source_excerpt: The minister of police maintained a silence which was equivalent to a complete avowal.

672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.constraint_text: The general has taken the oath of allegiance to Louis XVIII and will adhere to it.
672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.source_excerpt: “I am a royalist,” replied the general; “I have taken the oath of allegiance to Louis XVIII., and I will adhere to it.”

672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.constraint_text: The president declares that refusal to swear an oath will result in death.
672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.source_excerpt: “Then you must die,” replied the president calmly.

672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.constraint_text: The general refuses to swear the oath despite pressure.
672600048e33d33d120907ec6045b993.source_excerpt: The general, putting his hand on his sword, exclaimed,—“If you talk of honor, do not begin by disavowing its laws, and impose nothing by violence.” ... “I will not swear.”

8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.constraint_text: Used a bedstead clamp as the sole tool to dig a 50-foot tunnel
8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.source_excerpt: “With one of the clamps of my bedstead; and this very tool has sufficed me to hollow out the road by which I came hither, a distance of about fifty feet.”

8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.constraint_text: The tunnel's 50-foot length resulted from incorrect geometric calculations
8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.source_excerpt: for want of the necessary geometrical instruments to calculate my scale of proportion, instead of taking an ellipsis of forty feet, I made it fifty.

8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.constraint_text: The tunnel path remained along the corridor rather than beneath it
8fbc69a2a33c99313eaf29b2242d06f8.source_excerpt: I have, however, kept along the corridor on which your chamber opens, instead of going beneath it.

0fa504ec81ea44c2977f674ec76e3de4.constraint_text: Dantès has repeatedly demonstrated the ability to hold his breath for extended periods (more than twice an hour) as a pastime.
0fa504ec81ea44c2977f674ec76e3de4.source_excerpt: He could do it in an hour, and how many times had he, for pure pastime, continued in the water for more than twice as long!

cee1d9ccfa604f7f5c89b282a5681c4b.constraint_text: Edmond became 'immovable as fate' after transforming from a good-natured person into a vengeful, cunning, and wicked individual.
cee1d9ccfa604f7f5c89b282a5681c4b.source_excerpt: I became revengeful, cunning, and wicked, or rather, immovable as fate.

cee1d9ccfa604f7f5c89b282a5681c4b.constraint_text: Edmond trained his body and soul to endure violence and suffering, including teaching his arm to slay, his eyes to behold excruciating sufferings, and his mouth to smile at the most horrid spectacles.
cee1d9ccfa604f7f5c89b282a5681c4b.source_excerpt: I taught my arm to slay, my eyes to behold excruciating sufferings, and my mouth to smile at the most horrid spectacles.

5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.constraint_text: Noirtier is completely paralyzed and has lost his voice
5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.source_excerpt: All his limbs have become completely paralysed, he has lost his voice also

5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.constraint_text: Valentine claims to understand Noirtier’s meaning at all times
5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.source_excerpt: I perfectly understand my grandfather’s meaning at all times

5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.constraint_text: The notary cannot act without being convinced he has interpreted the person’s will faithfully
5ebdf99acd3c3875e7431ac42e35526f.source_excerpt: The first thing necessary to render an act valid is, that the notary should be thoroughly convinced that he has faithfully interpreted the will and wishes of the person dictating the act

46686fd7d0096177d15f575f40afc506.constraint_text: Noirtier is described as a paralytic, indicating a persistent physical condition

5af03c9ad1f62fcf3461d9c8370db864.constraint_text: He provided specific historical facts about the 1852 events in Melbourne and the diggings.
5af03c9ad1f62fcf3461d9c8370db864.source_excerpt: he told them... in the year 1852; he told them how the energy and the love of order which characterize the English-speaking peoples had reduced to system...

5af03c9ad1f62fcf3461d9c8370db864.constraint_text: He demonstrated an intense, singular focus on studying the system's workings, neglecting other matters.
5af03c9ad1f62fcf3461d9c8370db864.source_excerpt: he detailed, as though he had studied the subject to the entire neglect of other matters, the working of the system...

2c35501b16120f7582c9a1c12c7988b2.constraint_text: Transported convicts have no legal right to stay in the province of Victoria
2c35501b16120f7582c9a1c12c7988b2.source_excerpt: "I thought," observed Glenarvan, "that those who have been transported had no right to stay in the province of Victoria."

a42cf97610d0be535ab94292f380cfc7.constraint_text: The narrator's voluntary confession of the Auteuil assassination proved their innocence to the listener.
a42cf97610d0be535ab94292f380cfc7.source_excerpt: My voluntary confession of the assassination at Auteuil proved to him that I had not committed that of which I stood accused.

a42cf97610d0be535ab94292f380cfc7.constraint_text: The narrator made a full confession of the Auteuil affair and other transactions under the seal of confession.
a42cf97610d0be535ab94292f380cfc7.source_excerpt: under the seal of which I recounted the Auteuil affair in all its details, as well as every other transaction of my life.

12797e5b1eb1246dde4be97c460947ea.constraint_text: Rothschild stayed away from the capital until a favorable chance presented itself to carry out his wish.
12797e5b1eb1246dde4be97c460947ea.source_excerpt: I stayed away till some favorable chance should present itself of carrying my wish into execution.

12797e5b1eb1246dde4be97c460947ea.constraint_text: Albert is summoned to Paris by his father due to a treaty of marriage.
12797e5b1eb1246dde4be97c460947ea.source_excerpt: a letter received this morning from my father summons me to Paris, in consequence of a treaty of marriage

3867a18994ed888275514eb992dcea53.constraint_text: Dantès was about to be mustered into the Royal Marines when the usurper fell
3867a18994ed888275514eb992dcea53.source_excerpt: I was about to be mustered into the Royal Marines when he fell.

3867a18994ed888275514eb992dcea53.constraint_text: Dantès explicitly states he has never had any political opinions

170397ee4db32254cf41f3f0592dda3f.constraint_text: The son left Marseilles three days ago to travel to Paris.
170397ee4db32254cf41f3f0592dda3f.source_excerpt: three days ago I posted from Marseilles to Paris with all possible speed

630a619dadf02277edec1c1f67797b32.constraint_text: Eugénie will not marry Count Andrea Cavalcanti
630a619dadf02277edec1c1f67797b32.source_excerpt: I will not marry count Andrea Cavalcanti.

630a619dadf02277edec1c1f67797b32.constraint_text: Eugénie did not manifest opposition during the affair until this moment
630a619dadf02277edec1c1f67797b32.source_excerpt: since this little affair began, I have not manifested the slightest opposition

5dd1f32ce56dc754a1b99d4297bbadeb.constraint_text: The man has never tried to understand the signals and therefore does not understand them.
5dd1f32ce56dc754a1b99d4297bbadeb.source_excerpt:
‘None at all.’
‘And have you never tried to understand them?’
‘Never. Why should I?’

5dd1f32ce56dc754a1b99d4297bbadeb.constraint_text: The signals addressed to the man are always the same, meaning ‘Nothing new; You have an hour;’ or ‘Tomorrow’.
Monte Cristo has five minutes before his correspondent speaks, which is more time than he requires.
5dd1f32ce56dc754a1b99d4297bbadeb.source_excerpt: ‘I have, then, five minutes,’ said Monte Cristo to himself; ‘it is more time than I require.’

4a43584fc9f5824e76481c16927c7e9a.constraint_text: joined the Crusades in the thirteenth century
4a43584fc9f5824e76481c16927c7e9a.source_excerpt: One of your ancestors had joined the Crusades, and supposing it to be only that of St. Louis, that makes you mount to the thirteenth century

359fa21388762292f9186c9bdd1ddda9.constraint_text: M. Noirtier conveys 'yes' by closing his eyes and 'no' by winking, a method he has used consistently due to his physical limitations.
359fa21388762292f9186c9bdd1ddda9.source_excerpt: M. Noirtier, being deprived of voice and motion, is accustomed to convey his meaning by closing his eyes when he wishes to signify ‘yes,’ and to wink when he means ‘no.’

40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.constraint_text: A faithful servant of the king does not know conspirators.
40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.source_excerpt: a faithful servant of the king does not know conspirators.

40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.constraint_text: Dantès was entirely ignorant of the contents of the letter.
40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.source_excerpt: I was entirely ignorant of the contents of the letter.

40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.constraint_text: Dantès knew the address because he was forced to read it to know to whom to give the letter.
40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.source_excerpt: I was forced to read the address to know to whom to give it.

40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.constraint_text: Everybody is ignorant that Dantès is the bearer of the letter except the person who gave it to him.
40af200f3347f0a18a2b75c48e883582.source_excerpt: Everybody is ignorant that you are the bearer of a letter from the Island of Elba, and addressed to M. Noirtier?... Everybody, except the person who gave it to me.

a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.constraint_text: The speaker has resolved to desert others and flee to a remote location, contingent on the viscount's accompaniment.
a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.source_excerpt: I am resolved to desert them and go to some remote corner of the earth, and shall be happy if you will accompany me, viscount.

a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.constraint_text: The speaker explicitly states a persistent trait of loving humiliation despite claiming mastery over others.
a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.source_excerpt: I love that humiliation, I, who am master of the universe, as was Augustus.

a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.constraint_text: The speaker definitively identifies as a sailor, fixing their profession as a known fact.
a716971a2452e99b8961535593ee5cbc.source_excerpt: To sea, viscount; you know I am a sailor.

a14b09ff5f3cab96456c2622804017c1.constraint_text: Villefort's lifelong belief that General de Quesnel was assassinated (or killed in a duel) stems from M. Noirtier's deliberate omission of the truth.
a14b09ff5f3cab96456c2622804017c1.source_excerpt: M. Noirtier, who never cared for the opinion of his son on any subject, had always omitted to explain the affair to Villefort, so that he had all his life entertained the belief that General de Quesnel... fell the victim of assassination, and not that he was killed fairly in a duel.

416503716d218aa679d2681a5eaf2488.constraint_text: Noirtier uses specific eye movements to communicate: closing eyes for approval, winking for refusal, raising eyes to heaven for other expressions, and closing specific eyes to request Valentine or Barrois.
416503716d218aa679d2681a5eaf2488.source_excerpt: It had been agreed that the old man should express his approbation by closing his eyes, his refusal by winking them several times, and if he had some desire or feeling to express, he raised them to heaven. If he wanted Valentine, he closed his right eye only, and if Barrois, the left.

843715855722b494aed947b7e790d233.constraint_text: Franz is determined to conquer any feelings of dislike from Noirtier through his devotion, regardless of their nature.
843715855722b494aed947b7e790d233.source_excerpt: I would not lose this opportunity of proving to M. Noirtier how wrong it would be of him to encourage feelings of dislike to me, which I am determined to conquer, whatever they may be, by my devotion.

81f231b6c6cb7b0f0460cd713ce7a34a.constraint_text: Edmond never found an opportunity to land on the Island of Monte Cristo despite passing it twenty times
81f231b6c6cb7b0f0460cd713ce7a34a.source_excerpt: He had passed and re-passed his Island of Monte Cristo twenty times, but not once had he found an opportunity of landing there.

81f231b6c6cb7b0f0460cd713ce7a34a.constraint_text: Edmond's prudence is explicitly attributed to his experience in prison
81f231b6c6cb7b0f0460cd713ce7a34a.source_excerpt: Prison had made Edmond prudent, and he was desirous of running no risk whatever.

67666f049584876ce15a7825b9be2e4d.constraint_text: Franz had never seen a guillotine before this moment
67666f049584876ce15a7825b9be2e4d.source_excerpt: It was the first time Franz had ever seen a guillotine

973fdd003aac5220c9f71383e3a7ea22.constraint_text: The accused was consistently remembered as amiable, handsome, and liberal, leading people to believe he was a victim of conspiracy.
973fdd003aac5220c9f71383e3a7ea22.source_excerpt: many remembered him as being so amiable, so handsome, and so liberal, that they chose to think him the victim of some conspiracy

418b4f8fdc487d26131833a6ab30a737.constraint_text: The colonist had a binding obligation to provide means of conveyance for the journey.
418b4f8fdc487d26131833a6ab30a737.source_excerpt: He had, moreover, engaged to furnish them with the means of conveyance for the journey

35a416a1ec04d726ef861aad2093d4ea.constraint_text: Noirtier had a dark complexion, black hair, eyebrows, and whiskers, wore a blue frock-coat, and a rosette of an officer of the Legion of Honor in his button-hole at the time of General Quesnel's disappearance.
35a416a1ec04d726ef861aad2093d4ea.source_excerpt: “Dark complexion; hair, eyebrows, and whiskers black; blue frock-coat, buttoned up to the chin; rosette of an officer of the Legion of Honor in his button-hole; a hat with wide brim, and a cane.”

f6bd7cb8524639d70d47530211c4682d.constraint_text: It is not customary to defend oneself when attacked by bandits.
f6bd7cb8524639d70d47530211c4682d.source_excerpt: Your excellency knows that it is not customary to defend yourself when attacked by bandits.

81777a867c3c7b6714dd5d736c68ae0d.character: the person addressed by the president
81777a867c3c7b6714dd5d736c68ae0d.constraint_text: The person was invited to join the assembly and accepted, which fixed their participation in the conspiracy at a specific time.
81777a867c3c7b6714dd5d736c68ae0d.source_excerpt: you have been invited to join this assembly—you were not forced here; it was proposed to you to come blindfolded—you accepted.

ec955ddd5b1d8ef06b6cddaec1fa0cd7.constraint_text: The major remained firm despite being deafened by the shock.
ec955ddd5b1d8ef06b6cddaec1fa0cd7.source_excerpt: At last one rose, deafened by the shock, but yet firm. It was the major.

974e4154c255a3c1ba68b388ef5f525e.constraint_text: Stuart reached the extreme point in 1845
974e4154c255a3c1ba68b388ef5f525e.source_excerpt: they arrived at the extreme point reached by Stuart in 1845

974e4154c255a3c1ba68b388ef5f525e.constraint_text: Their arrival at the sea-water point was caused by 'terrible hardships'
974e4154c255a3c1ba68b388ef5f525e.source_excerpt: Burke and Wills, after terrible hardships, arrived at the point where the sea-water flowed up to and inundated the marshes

c67219fb0bc1e4e461a078537ccff6f7.constraint_text: Danglars asserts he will awaken at the posting-house, implying a fixed plan or expectation.
c67219fb0bc1e4e461a078537ccff6f7.source_excerpt: Danglars therefore continued to sleep, saying to himself that he would be sure to awake at the posting-house.

e96266f4095eb26cee00e6ee27c26e90.constraint_text: The malady will reach its height in five minutes and result in death within a quarter of an hour.
e96266f4095eb26cee00e6ee27c26e90.source_excerpt: These horrible chills... in five minutes the malady will reach its height, and in a quarter of an hour there will be nothing left of me but a corpse.

e96266f4095eb26cee00e6ee27c26e90.constraint_text: Administering twelve drops instead of ten is required to counteract the malady, with further action needed if recovery does not occur.
e96266f4095eb26cee00e6ee27c26e90.source_excerpt: If, after having made me swallow twelve drops instead of ten, you see that I do not recover, then pour the rest down my throat.

f43356efc64c048644ffe1b432a8806e.constraint_text: Mercédès is not yet his wife
f43356efc64c048644ffe1b432a8806e.source_excerpt: you have not attained that honor yet. Mercédès is not yet your wife.

e130605bf41eb28efcd2a0cc029519b3.constraint_text: Villefort only interacts with his father when absolutely obliged and makes no effort to please him during these encounters.
e130605bf41eb28efcd2a0cc029519b3.source_excerpt: But as Villefort saw his father but seldom, and then only when absolutely obliged, and as he never took any pains to please or gratify him when he was there...

e130605bf41eb28efcd2a0cc029519b3.constraint_text: Valentine consistently uses her facial expressions to communicate with Noirtier, interpreting his silent cues through her own emotional expressions.
e130605bf41eb28efcd2a0cc029519b3.source_excerpt: Valentine... answered by throwing her whole soul into the expression of her countenance... in this manner were the conversations sustained...

b252148596ffc6aff62fd4e0886b8391.constraint_text: Has abjured his past errors and is currently a firm and zealous friend to religion and order
b252148596ffc6aff62fd4e0886b8391.source_excerpt: "I have already had the honor to observe that my father has—at least, I hope so—abjured his past errors, and that he is, at the present moment, a firm and zealous friend to religion and order"

b252148596ffc6aff62fd4e0886b8391.constraint_text: Must atone for past dereliction, which motivates his current political stance
b252148596ffc6aff62fd4e0886b8391.source_excerpt: "a better royalist, possibly, than his son; for he has to atone for past dereliction, while I have no other impulse than warm, decided preference and conviction"

8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.constraint_text: The stranger is more accustomed to exercising his mental faculties than his physical strength
8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.source_excerpt: His thin face, deeply furrowed by care, and the bold outline of his strongly marked features, betokened a man more accustomed to exercise his mental faculties than his physical strength.

8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.constraint_text: The stranger's apparent age is caused by captivity rather than natural aging
8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.source_excerpt: He...was aged more from captivity than the course of time.

8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.constraint_text: The stranger's affections were chilled prior to this interaction
8535777c263bb9b9418c53369a996796.source_excerpt: as though his chilled affections were rekindled and invigorated by his contact with one so warm and ardent.

f4e819e6802736f451e51ed4fe26d65f.constraint_text: Robert is described as 'courageous', indicating a persistent trait.
Mulready is described as 'equally brave', indicating a persistent trait.

db4f2877dc8ce7ea6a29f934ac3976a0.constraint_text: The raft cannot sail until the tide turns late in the evening
db4f2877dc8ce7ea6a29f934ac3976a0.source_excerpt: the tide would not turn till late in the evening; and, as they did not care to sail in the dark, they anchored for the night

db4f2877dc8ce7ea6a29f934ac3976a0.constraint_text: The apparent movement of the water is caused by oscillation, not actual forward motion
db4f2877dc8ce7ea6a29f934ac3976a0.source_excerpt: The apparent onward movement is only an oscillation of the water, nothing more. Throw a piece of wood into the water, and you will see that it will remain stationary

6998149ef12f629982a0519735dc441a.constraint_text: He was a fiery Jacobin during the French Revolution with remarkable audacity and powerful organization.
6998149ef12f629982a0519735dc441a.source_excerpt: M. Noirtier de Villefort, one of the most fiery Jacobins of the French Revolution; that is to say, he had the most remarkable audacity, seconded by a most powerful organization

6998149ef12f629982a0519735dc441a.constraint_text: A rupture of a blood-vessel on the lobe of the brain destroyed his former traits and beliefs, rendering him an inert mass.
6998149ef12f629982a0519735dc441a.source_excerpt: Well, sir, the rupture of a blood-vessel on the lobe of the brain has destroyed all this, not in a day, not in an hour, but in a second

f9f5c14742d5cf04ea44212f40b99e56.constraint_text: The guest has studied and appreciates the styles of modern artists to the point of instantly identifying their works without needing signatures.
f9f5c14742d5cf04ea44212f40b99e56.source_excerpt: the latter, without seeking for the signatures... named instantly the author of every picture in such a manner that it was easy to see that each name was not only known to him, but that each style associated with it had been appreciated and studied by him.

ad0dbb6f8024e2a1f18528e73c1f7471.constraint_text: The aluminous material in the dead wood prevented Wilson from kindling a fire
ad0dbb6f8024e2a1f18528e73c1f7471.source_excerpt: the great quantity of aluminous material that it contained prevented combustion.

96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.constraint_text: Captain Grant was never on this continent
96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.source_excerpt: This continent--where he was not, nor had ever been--threatened to be fatal to those who were seeking traces of him

96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.constraint_text: They took turns carrying the litter every ten minutes
96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.source_excerpt: Every ten minutes they took turns in carrying the litter

96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.constraint_text: They must rely on the major's rifle for provisions
96243b9a5a41c2d2a67101a3a8581968.source_excerpt: They must hereafter rely on the major's rifle

dab2d6f2b3c64caaa550700a3ad5623b.constraint_text: The red, netted silk purse once belonged to Morrel
dab2d6f2b3c64caaa550700a3ad5623b.source_excerpt: a vague remembrance reminded him that it once belonged to himself

c12068af24723dec18d822dc3871e7e5.constraint_text: He released the shepherd and his band only under the condition that they respect himself and his friends.
c12068af24723dec18d822dc3871e7e5.source_excerpt: ‘upon the simple condition that they should respect myself and my friends.’

c12068af24723dec18d822dc3871e7e5.constraint_text: He gave the narrator a poniard to repay the gold pieces given to him as a child.
c12068af24723dec18d822dc3871e7e5.source_excerpt: he, in order to repay me, gave me a poniard, the hilt of which he had carved with his own hand

499000260fe377395b532f2c7767bee1.constraint_text: Morcerf has only one son and it is the first time he has ever thought of marrying him.
499000260fe377395b532f2c7767bee1.source_excerpt: as I have but one son, and it is the first time I have ever thought of marrying him

39e57da6f53a9ea11320d9fc59df03f2.constraint_text: The grandfather's fortification against poison failed because Valentine's system was already impregnated with poison.
39e57da6f53a9ea11320d9fc59df03f2.source_excerpt: which has failed because your system was already impregnated with it

39e57da6f53a9ea11320d9fc59df03f2.constraint_text: A more deadly medium of death was employed four days ago.
39e57da6f53a9ea11320d9fc59df03f2.source_excerpt: a more deadly medium of death employed four days ago

474d7664b5608167b6ede09493e4c6a3.constraint_text: Dantès is described as 'old enough to be ambitious, but too young to be corrupt' at the time of the events.
474d7664b5608167b6ede09493e4c6a3.source_excerpt: “Old enough to be ambitious, but too young to be corrupt.”

474d7664b5608167b6ede09493e4c6a3.constraint_text: The judge burned the sole evidence (the letter) that could have incriminated Dantès.
474d7664b5608167b6ede09493e4c6a3.source_excerpt: “He burnt the sole evidence that could at all have criminated me.”

0c74acbca8e7a8b8a68d626c7cda89a0.constraint_text: Her religious feelings prevent her from committing suicide.
0c74acbca8e7a8b8a68d626c7cda89a0.source_excerpt: It was not want of courage that prevented her putting this resolution into execution; but her religious feelings came to her aid and saved her.

0c74acbca8e7a8b8a68d626c7cda89a0.constraint_text: He lost all hope at Napoleon’s downfall.
0c74acbca8e7a8b8a68d626c7cda89a0.source_excerpt: Old Dantès, who was only sustained by hope, lost all hope at Napoleon’s downfall.

a2f2c21b34a8031d61709004572be9d8.constraint_text: Ayrton is explicitly identified as a convict.

9d9ac703051e73b94c32deb77b8a1aac.constraint_text: Edmond preserved admirable self-command, avoiding even the faintest smile when considering unattainable benefits.
9d9ac703051e73b94c32deb77b8a1aac.source_excerpt: Edmond preserved the most admirable self-command, not suffering the faintest indication of a smile to escape him at the enumeration of all the benefits he would have reaped had he been able to quit the island

9d9ac703051e73b94c32deb77b8a1aac.constraint_text: Edmond sold four of his smallest diamonds for five thousand francs each to a Jew in Leghorn.
9d9ac703051e73b94c32deb77b8a1aac.source_excerpt: he repaired to the house of a Jew, a dealer in precious stones, to whom he disposed of four of his smallest diamonds for five thousand francs each

0e841b61f8fe29ff7d0d242cbda11cf0.constraint_text: Glenarvan refuses to abandon anyone, regardless of circumstances.
0e841b61f8fe29ff7d0d242cbda11cf0.source_excerpt: "No, my friend," said he; "I will not abandon any one."

7aceb9fe1f352443bf15bfdcbdfccc33.constraint_text: Albert's father, the Comte de Morcerf, is of Spanish origin and holds influence at the courts of France and Madrid.
7aceb9fe1f352443bf15bfdcbdfccc33.source_excerpt: My father, the Comte de Morcerf, although of Spanish origin, possesses considerable influence, both at the court of France and Madrid

7aceb9fe1f352443bf15bfdcbdfccc33.constraint_text: The Count has never visited Paris and has reached an age where this absence is notable.
7aceb9fe1f352443bf15bfdcbdfccc33.source_excerpt: I am wholly a stranger to Paris—it is a city I have never yet seen... Is it possible... that you have reached your present age without visiting the finest capital in the world?

76b8de13817127e604c6bba449e68a67.constraint_text: The Maori feel a binding duty of vengeance that persists regardless of circumstances
76b8de13817127e604c6bba449e68a67.source_excerpt: the terrible duty of vengeance which is felt by the Maori to be so binding

c5e47178b44dac7e8fc52d79b68ff8a0.constraint_text: The superstition of the natives has made this mountain a place of refuge
c5e47178b44dac7e8fc52d79b68ff8a0.source_excerpt: "This is it," replied Paganel. "The superstition of the natives has made this mountain a place of refuge, and this superstition must help us to escape."

6e53a5b687273f1a70ba7f2edb8c52f6.constraint_text: Villefort retains a belief in God despite his distress
6e53a5b687273f1a70ba7f2edb8c52f6.source_excerpt: God was still in his heart.

54fc2db61abb3835373223a346ab4ce9.constraint_text: Thalcave knows that wolves will not abandon a certain prey until daybreak when they return to their holes and dens.
54fc2db61abb3835373223a346ab4ce9.source_excerpt: He knew well that the animals would not abandon a certain prey until at daybreak they returned to their holes and dens.

850fea4821b4e20f5115b8a2a48af28d.constraint_text: Thaouka's agility and speed are known and can be employed for common safety
850fea4821b4e20f5115b8a2a48af28d.source_excerpt: he alone knew Thaouka well enough to employ his marvelous agility and speed for the common safety

46397d30e80a02cc9139e858f1683617.constraint_text: Dantès' current cautious descent is explicitly caused by his prior feigning of an accident.
46397d30e80a02cc9139e858f1683617.source_excerpt: he dreaded lest an accident similar to that he had so adroitly feigned should happen in reality

90313d77b6dda9f988d120f74d8cbcbe.constraint_text: Glenarvan's regret is caused by seeing the exhaustion of his companions.
90313d77b6dda9f988d120f74d8cbcbe.source_excerpt: Glenarvan, seeing the exhaustion of his companions, regretted having engaged in the undertaking.

98b82995bf761f7ca04cd6b6c1e2b244.constraint_text: Albert and Beauchamp cannot harm each other until the 21st of September
98b82995bf761f7ca04cd6b6c1e2b244.source_excerpt: Today is the 29th of August; the 21st of September will, therefore, be the conclusion of the term agreed on, and till that time arrives... till then we will refrain from growling and barking like two dogs chained within sight of each other.

f01b7db563c188306a582ef4d18d525b.constraint_text: The count is described as 'proverbial for his punctilious exactitude in keeping his engagements', indicating a consistent trait.
f01b7db563c188306a582ef4d18d525b.source_excerpt: ‘only let me warn you that I am proverbial for my punctilious exactitude in keeping my engagements.’

f01b7db563c188306a582ef4d18d525b.constraint_text: The count explicitly fixes a future meeting on the '21st of May at the same hour in the forenoon', tying it to a specific date and time.
f01b7db563c188306a582ef4d18d525b.source_excerpt: ‘expect me the 21st of May at the same hour in the forenoon.’

4c8dc759358ed9185a8a3006df66b181.constraint_text: Paganel's interpretation of the documents is accepted as correct and remains unchallenged by the group
4c8dc759358ed9185a8a3006df66b181.source_excerpt: After carefully examining the documents, it was unanimously agreed that Paganel's interpretation was the correct one.

cc2b807621971762ff44d7016f4ecbde.constraint_text: The English-speaking peoples are characterized by energy and love of order, which reduced chaotic conditions to system and method.
cc2b807621971762ff44d7016f4ecbde.source_excerpt: he told them how the energy and the love of order which characterize the English-speaking peoples had reduced to system, method, subordination, the chaotic surgings and restlessness which marked the first weeks and months of this new era

23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.constraint_text: Ben Joyce meditated a hostile attack on O'Moore before being intercepted.
23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.source_excerpt: He was meditating some hostile attack upon the Irishman, when a better opportunity was offered.

23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.constraint_text: Ben Joyce's decision to join the expedition was caused by hearing Glenarvan's shipwreck story.
23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.source_excerpt: He heard Glenarvan's story of the shipwreck, and, like a bold man, he promptly decided to take part in the expedition.

23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.constraint_text: Ben Joyce is characterized as a 'bold and formidable criminal' based on his past actions.
23d3e937820c88d85e90d8e51745ada1.source_excerpt: the wretch appeared as he was,--a bold and formidable criminal.

48592b68ea25e045b6853988372663e0.constraint_text: The sailor has been secretly to the Island of Elba
48592b68ea25e045b6853988372663e0.source_excerpt: This person, a sailor, of turbulent character, and whom I suspected of Bonapartism, has been secretly to the Island of Elba.

b968c0af4c00cfc48c34951ce9f80b04.constraint_text: Ore transport to Melbourne is conducted under government escort and guarantee with a fixed, moderate charge.
b968c0af4c00cfc48c34951ce9f80b04.source_excerpt: it was here that the ore was stored, from hence that it was sent, under government escort and with government guarantee, subject to a fixed, though moderate, charge

b968c0af4c00cfc48c34951ce9f80b04.constraint_text: Paganel's loquacity persists despite being charmed by services.
b968c0af4c00cfc48c34951ce9f80b04.source_excerpt: the Frenchman, who was none the less loquacious, and was in truth able even to enlighten his guides

e1ca968cb6efcc85c695fbdb4e5d922e.constraint_text: Danglars sold his Spanish shares because Don Carlos fled Bourges and returned to Spain
e1ca968cb6efcc85c695fbdb4e5d922e.source_excerpt: Because Don Carlos has fled from Bourges, and has returned to Spain.

cd1cf2e61f99de50ffc6d0aa97a6f040.constraint_text: Ayrton knew Mary and Robert personally and had seen them at Glasgow during the Britannia's departure and at the farewell dinner on board.
cd1cf2e61f99de50ffc6d0aa97a6f040.source_excerpt: He had seen them at Glasgow on the departure of the Britannia. He remembered that they had been present at the farewell dinner given on board to the friends of the captain.

cd1cf2e61f99de50ffc6d0aa97a6f040.constraint_text: Robert's labor at Mr. O'Moore's dwelling secured him a comfortable livelihood.
cd1cf2e61f99de50ffc6d0aa97a6f040.source_excerpt: At last, exhausted and almost dead, he reached the hospitable dwelling of Mr. O'Moore, where his labor insured him a comfortable livelihood.

f66135a68d293922f5628677f1bac62b.constraint_text: Danglars is obsequious to his superiors and insolent to his subordinates, making him disliked by the crew.
f66135a68d293922f5628677f1bac62b.source_excerpt: He was a man of twenty-five or twenty-six years of age, of unprepossessing countenance, obsequious to his superiors, insolent to his subordinates; and this, in addition to his position as responsible agent on board, which is always obnoxious to the sailors, made him as much disliked by the crew as Edmond Dantès was beloved by them.

f66135a68d293922f5628677f1bac62b.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès is beloved by the crew, in contrast to Danglars's unpopularity.
f66135a68d293922f5628677f1bac62b.source_excerpt: as much disliked by the crew as Edmond Dantès was beloved by them.

a1b02537a09e5487103d17282591a247.constraint_text: The voyage will cross the line in ten days and reach Cape Horn in five weeks if current speed continues.
a1b02537a09e5487103d17282591a247.source_excerpt: "We are moving at the rate of seventeen knots an hour. If this continues, we shall cross the line in ten days, and in five weeks shall double Cape Horn."

f9eef5d308cc4bc37f3d038d8f687b5a.constraint_text: The count has followed Eastern customs up to the present time, in contrast to the French (Parisian) way of living.
f9eef5d308cc4bc37f3d038d8f687b5a.source_excerpt: The French way of living is utterly unknown to me, and up to the present time I have followed the Eastern customs, which are entirely in contrast to the Parisian.

f9eef5d308cc4bc37f3d038d8f687b5a.constraint_text: The count is described as a 'most temperate guest,' indicating a consistent trait.
f9eef5d308cc4bc37f3d038d8f687b5a.source_excerpt: The count was, it may be remembered, a most temperate guest.

154559801aec8f0f370cd818b15381d3.constraint_text: Arrived five minutes before the fixed time of half-past, violating punctuality expectations
154559801aec8f0f370cd818b15381d3.source_excerpt: punctuality! You, whom I expected last, you arrive at five minutes to ten, when the time fixed was half-past!

8c4c98801d4c9bb584642ed376f9f69c.constraint_text: Glenarvan's familiarity with the sea caused him to understand the necessity of the arrangements
8c4c98801d4c9bb584642ed376f9f69c.source_excerpt: Glenarvan was familiar enough with the sea to understand the necessity of these arrangements.

de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.constraint_text: His separation from his father was caused by the treachery of his tutor when he was five years old
de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.source_excerpt: I was, at the age of five years, taken away by the treachery of my tutor

de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.constraint_text: He has not seen his father for fifteen years as of the time of narration
de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.source_excerpt: so that for fifteen years I have not seen the author of my existence

de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.constraint_text: He has been constantly seeking his father since reaching years of discretion
de965bae065656facaccf03975dd8b70.source_excerpt: Since I have arrived at years of discretion and become my own master, I have been constantly seeking him

a6170683ecb5f29947740e52111dbd9b.constraint_text: The documents (marriage certificate and baptismal register) are irreplaceable if lost, requiring time-consuming and nearly impossible duplication efforts.
a6170683ecb5f29947740e52111dbd9b.source_excerpt: "In that case," replied the major, "it would be necessary to write to the curé for duplicates, and it would be some time before they could be obtained." "It would be a difficult matter to arrange," said Monte Cristo. "Almost an impossibility," replied the major.

c37470dab5ab6d6d5f23ea133d3e1d36.constraint_text: At the time of parting at Pont du Var, Andrea was explicitly told they would travel through Piedmont and Tuscany, but instead arrived in Paris
c37470dab5ab6d6d5f23ea133d3e1d36.source_excerpt: "When we parted at the Pont du Var, you told me you were going to travel through Piedmont and Tuscany; but instead of that, you come to Paris."

c37470dab5ab6d6d5f23ea133d3e1d36.constraint_text: The speaker has consistently referred to Andrea as 'my child' over an extended period
c37470dab5ab6d6d5f23ea133d3e1d36.source_excerpt: "You know I always did call you my child."

66b8464e18b93ea1413eb8454513521a.constraint_text: Danglars showed the answer from Yanina to Monte Cristo
Danglars had informed Monte Cristo about Fernand's name long before the current conversation
66b8464e18b93ea1413eb8454513521a.source_excerpt: ‘Yes, I had told him that long since’

ae0b064706751761082df4732da5ee12.constraint_text: The character's father was found for them by the Count of Monte Cristo.
The character must remain 'steady' to successfully execute their plan of living a respectable life.
ae0b064706751761082df4732da5ee12.source_excerpt: Come, if you will only put this scheme into execution, and be steady, nothing could be better.

d180cd64172124fa88e593da1cd9268d.constraint_text: Haydée's death is causally linked to the Count's death.
d180cd64172124fa88e593da1cd9268d.source_excerpt: "If you were to die, I should die too."

d180cd64172124fa88e593da1cd9268d.constraint_text: Haydée is explicitly identified as a daughter of Epirus with a lineage tied to goddesses.
d180cd64172124fa88e593da1cd9268d.source_excerpt: "You are a worthy daughter of Epirus, Haydée, and your charming and poetical ideas prove well your descent from that race of goddesses who claim your country as their birthplace."

0677f909cb68ad7f62ec3ede9f46bf7a.constraint_text: She was entirely devoted to the study of music, following it with indefatigable perseverance.
0677f909cb68ad7f62ec3ede9f46bf7a.source_excerpt: to the study of the latter she professed to be entirely devoted, following it with an indefatigable perseverance

b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.constraint_text: Zaccone is identified as a Quaker, with the exception of not wearing the peculiar dress associated with the Quaker faith.
b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.source_excerpt: Exactly, he is a Quaker, with the exception of the peculiar dress.

b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo had not been in France before his current visit, as he applied for information six months ago.
b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.source_excerpt: no, sir, he had not, because he applied to me six months ago for the particulars he required...

b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.constraint_text: Zaccone was made a knight of Jesus Christ by the Pope for services rendered to Christians in the East.
b9bcfcab1861285d99bada45ae32bd60.source_excerpt: Our holy father, the pope, has made him a knight of Jesus Christ for the services he rendered to the Christians in the East...

849cb20a92f208e61d955f5a0da79921.constraint_text: The major explicitly instructed the two huntsmen not to go far during their hunting expedition.
849cb20a92f208e61d955f5a0da79921.source_excerpt: "Do not go far," said the major, gravely, to the two huntsmen.

4a1597ee592995c30c85ebb15fa01987.constraint_text: He was not wicked, only a poor mad priest
4a1597ee592995c30c85ebb15fa01987.source_excerpt: he was not wicked, he was only a poor mad priest.

0c4bba10fb7c88506def205eb2d84a2f.constraint_text: She had been standing at the door to prevent Monte Cristo from going out without seeing her until sleep overpowered her.
0c4bba10fb7c88506def205eb2d84a2f.source_excerpt: She had been standing at the door, to prevent his going out without seeing her, until sleep, which the young cannot resist, had overpowered her frame, wearied as she was with watching.

e9a8d23d1c747ec57642be3fa5d85621.constraint_text: Faria possesses an acuteness of hearing that is peculiar to prisoners.
e9a8d23d1c747ec57642be3fa5d85621.source_excerpt: I am not mad,' replied Faria, with that acuteness of hearing peculiar to prisoners.

ed5e793edcd63835659e765266102b9f.constraint_text: Danglars will kill a mad dog when he encounters one, believing it serves society.
ed5e793edcd63835659e765266102b9f.source_excerpt: "Sir," replied Danglars, pale with anger and fear, "I warn you, when I have the misfortune to meet with a mad dog, I kill it; and far from thinking myself guilty of a crime, I believe I do society a kindness."

b69bfc3030f3fe3c6a76d62ccd19584a.constraint_text: The speaker's continued existence is explicitly attributed to their mother's support, as they would have ceased to live on the day they doubted their father and renounced his name without her.
b69bfc3030f3fe3c6a76d62ccd19584a.source_excerpt: but for you I should have ceased to live on the day I doubted my father and renounced his name.

11f95239416f7d517f5ca8bb70136c01.constraint_text: Albert and Franz could not escape their guides because only guides are permitted to visit monuments with torches.
11f95239416f7d517f5ca8bb70136c01.source_excerpt: the guides alone are permitted to visit these monuments with torches in their hands.

c5800140b705a75cb13bfa895f98b240.constraint_text: The mountain is tabooed, so the savages will not climb it.
c5800140b705a75cb13bfa895f98b240.source_excerpt: The mountain is tabooed, and if it shall itself devour its profaners the taboo will be still more rigorous.

c5800140b705a75cb13bfa895f98b240.constraint_text: They will remain in the tomb for three to five days.
c5800140b705a75cb13bfa895f98b240.source_excerpt: Where we shall remain three, four, or five days, if necessary, till the savages are convinced of our death, and abandon the siege.

129ac197486efc1420f7256e9273bb17.constraint_text: The mules' instinct enables them to avoid the swamp.
129ac197486efc1420f7256e9273bb17.source_excerpt: the instinct of the mules enabled them to avoid

5fa1308512d0e55e4c206d0210853e81.constraint_text: Andrea previously stated he would be condemned to die like the worst criminals.
5fa1308512d0e55e4c206d0210853e81.source_excerpt: “Why, you said,” answered Mademoiselle Danglars, “that you would be condemned to die like the worst criminals.”

b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.constraint_text: His name signifies 'he who eats the limbs of his enemy' in the native language
b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.source_excerpt: He was called Kai-Koumou, a terrible name, which signified in the native language 'he who eats the limbs of his enemy.'
He was brave and bold, but his cruelty equaled his bravery.

b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.constraint_text: A price has been set on his head by the governor of New Zealand
b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.source_excerpt: a price had been set upon his head by the governor of New Zealand.

b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.constraint_text: He feels obligated to set an example of fortitude to his wife and companions as their chief
b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.source_excerpt: He felt that he ought to set an example of fortitude to his wife and his companions, as being the husband and chief.

b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.constraint_text: He is ready to die first for the common safety if circumstances require it
b8e561f6b5f122412e52cc6646e882ea.source_excerpt: He was ready to die first for the common safety, if circumstances should require it.

ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.constraint_text: The count visits Lord Ruthven at his own house and elsewhere, and considers him his most intimate friend.
ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.source_excerpt: I assure you he is my most intimate friend, and M. de Château-Renaud has also the honor of his acquaintance.

ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.constraint_text: The count adopted the name 'Vampa' from the bandit who once imprisoned him.
ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.source_excerpt: Why, do you not recollect the name of the celebrated bandit by whom I was made prisoner? [...] He called himself Vampa. You see, it’s evident where the count got the name.

ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.constraint_text: The count is certain that the horse 'Vampa' was owned by Lord Ruthven.
ee0fadd2fe3f524732ada6731d1124b9.source_excerpt: Was not the winning horse entered by the name of Vampa?

2bfc2a22879af218760e80b33ae477d7.constraint_text: Peppino cares little for being recognized now that he is in his own territories.
2bfc2a22879af218760e80b33ae477d7.source_excerpt: Peppino, who cared little for being recognized now that he was in his own territories

8f487c29874afbc40812769ea0bb34a0.constraint_text: Robert's rashness caused him to approach the kangaroo closely, leading to his fall.
8f487c29874afbc40812769ea0bb34a0.source_excerpt: Robert narrowly escaped being the victim of his rashness.

c12549326a050a2c4d1308bac7089ecb.constraint_text: The man asserts he is not a dishonest man, a belief that persists as evidenced by his action of leaving a valuable pin as a pledge.
c12549326a050a2c4d1308bac7089ecb.source_excerpt: I have no money to pay my bill, but I am not a dishonest man; I leave behind me as a pledge this pin, worth ten times the amount.

c12549326a050a2c4d1308bac7089ecb.constraint_text: The man's ability to slip into the chimney is attributed to prior experience with such gymnastic exercises.
c12549326a050a2c4d1308bac7089ecb.source_excerpt: slipping into the chimney like a man accustomed to that kind of gymnastic exercise

d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.constraint_text: The father's fate is decided on the day the firman arrives.
d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.source_excerpt: ‘today arrives the firman of the master, and my fate will be decided.’

d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.constraint_text: The narrator possesses the unsophisticated innocence of childhood.
d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.source_excerpt: admiring everything I saw with that unsophisticated innocence of childhood

d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.constraint_text: The mother's wretchedness is caused by the father's uncertain fate.
d5e1ccaf6d54cf148786c6ad86724108.source_excerpt: my mother had been crying all the night, and was very wretched

b1ff224a054210cfbe25add0093e92d9.constraint_text: Danglars had cared little for curiosities
b1ff224a054210cfbe25add0093e92d9.source_excerpt: Danglars, who had cared little for curiosities, was mechanically tearing off the blossoms of a splendid orange-tree, one after another.

07ef343eceb1b9934d84de6b3682e62b.constraint_text: Danglars had cared little for curiosities
07ef343eceb1b9934d84de6b3682e62b.source_excerpt: Danglars, who had cared little for curiosities, was mechanically tearing off the blossoms of a splendid orange-tree, one after another.

8da49af2badb70add754dcb14b764dc4.constraint_text: The ship 'Pharaon' cannot sail without its captain
Must return to the ship within three months to resume command
8da49af2badb70add754dcb14b764dc4.source_excerpt: only be back again in three months, for the _Pharaon_

38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.constraint_text: Andrea's journey followed a fixed route from Nice to Paris via Genoa, Turin, Chambéry, and Pont-de-Beauvoisin.
38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.source_excerpt: A carriage was to await you at Nice?... and that is how we have been able to trace your journey to this place.

38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.constraint_text: Andrea's father took the same route from Nice to Paris as Andrea's journey.
38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.source_excerpt: for it is exactly the same route which he himself took

38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.constraint_text: Andrea's appearance has changed significantly since his father last saw him.
38f95ab24c437247a1daa965f68d670f.source_excerpt: I must be somewhat altered since he last saw me

caed675b970cfb22b899e4c87eb0e20b.constraint_text: Rescue from the island is only possible through a providential interposition, as the island lies outside regular shipping routes.
caed675b970cfb22b899e4c87eb0e20b.source_excerpt: We were out of the regular course of ships, and could not be rescued except by a providential interposition.

caed675b970cfb22b899e4c87eb0e20b.constraint_text: The narrator accepted their trial with fortitude despite thinking of loved ones they expected never to see again.
caed675b970cfb22b899e4c87eb0e20b.source_excerpt: Although thinking of those who were dear to me, and whom I never expected to see again, still I accepted this trial with fortitude

ebfa1d309296d694c5aad1a4af5e979b.character: the speaker (implied to be the one who took the child)
ebfa1d309296d694c5aad1a4af5e979b.constraint_text: The speaker explicitly states they never intended to keep the child and immediately sought to place it in an asylum.
ebfa1d309296d694c5aad1a4af5e979b.source_excerpt: I had not for a moment the idea of keeping it, but I knew that at Paris there was an asylum where they receive such creatures.

36289d3189ef5471df3c462c934857f4.constraint_text: The priest's knowledge of Valentine's name and death stems from information provided by servants who fled the house.
36289d3189ef5471df3c462c934857f4.source_excerpt: I also know that her name is Valentine, and I have already prayed for her.

36289d3189ef5471df3c462c934857f4.constraint_text: The priest believes it is his mission to 'forestall our duties' as a priest.
36289d3189ef5471df3c462c934857f4.source_excerpt: it is our mission to forestall our duties

32385609974e56a5a2e56895e7e47886.constraint_text: M. de Villefort would not resign his post as king’s attorney except to become a deputy.
32385609974e56a5a2e56895e7e47886.source_excerpt: he would not have resigned but to be made deputy

32385609974e56a5a2e56895e7e47886.constraint_text: M. de Villefort made and returned very few visits, with his wife acting on his behalf.
32385609974e56a5a2e56895e7e47886.source_excerpt: Ordinarily M. de Villefort made and returned very few visits

80e024e689df20e40089d7c75365bf8f.constraint_text: Monte Cristo asserts that unless he dies, his nature and capabilities will remain unchanged throughout his life.
80e024e689df20e40089d7c75365bf8f.source_excerpt: Unless I die, I shall always be what I am...

204a8dcd2f267110868345a6c49bbc24.constraint_text: Bertuccio respected one chamber alone in the house
204a8dcd2f267110868345a6c49bbc24.source_excerpt: One chamber alone had been respected by the magnificent Bertuccio.

5388cf20045b7e73bd8f28f31821fb3d.constraint_text: Dantès acquired perfect self-possession during his acquaintance with Faria, which he maintained during his interaction with the gendarme.
5388cf20045b7e73bd8f28f31821fb3d.source_excerpt: but with that perfect self-possession he had acquired during his acquaintance with Faria, Dantès coolly presented an English passport he had obtained from Leghorn

5388cf20045b7e73bd8f28f31821fb3d.constraint_text: The English passport obtained from Leghorn explicitly caused the authorities to permit immediate debarkation, as a French passport would not have.
5388cf20045b7e73bd8f28f31821fb3d.source_excerpt: as this gave him a standing which a French passport would not have afforded, he was informed that there existed no obstacle to his immediate debarkation

9d786a5d7a450abe88694f464516355c.constraint_text: Taking command of the vessel was Edmond's duty as captain’s mate
9d786a5d7a450abe88694f464516355c.source_excerpt: “As to taking command of the vessel,” replied Morrel, “that was his duty as captain’s mate;...

031a53459b694a1a48010e11475a96d7.constraint_text: The day and a half lost at the Island of Elba was caused by Dantès' whim, not necessity
031a53459b694a1a48010e11475a96d7.source_excerpt: this day and a half was lost from pure whim, for the pleasure of going ashore, and nothing else

a1e980809617f744293a5b5b9b4515ed.constraint_text: Monte Cristo looks around with an expression implying he has fulfilled his duty and expects others to do the same.
a1e980809617f744293a5b5b9b4515ed.source_excerpt: Monte Cristo stopped, looking around him with that expression peculiar to a certain class, which seems to say, 'I have done my duty, now let others do theirs.'

afc4dc9384243746bc5639cbe73afb9f.constraint_text: Valentine's shame is explicitly caused by the recollection of the count's 'luminous eye' and his 'adventurous and devoted friendship'.
afc4dc9384243746bc5639cbe73afb9f.source_excerpt: the recollection overwhelmed her with so much shame that she asked herself whether any amount of gratitude could ever repay his adventurous and devoted friendship.

afc4dc9384243746bc5639cbe73afb9f.constraint_text: The count was watching at the exact moment the clock struck the half-hour, as evidenced by the sound of his fingernails against the door.
afc4dc9384243746bc5639cbe73afb9f.source_excerpt: the sound of finger-nails slightly grating against the door of the library informed Valentine that the count was still watching

15f0d058c22fc033ce14d2565c661402.character: the character (implied to be the one holding the two hundred thousand francs)
15f0d058c22fc033ce14d2565c661402.constraint_text: If he had seen the accusation, he would have prioritized his two hundred thousand francs over opposing the Englishman's actions, regardless of their irregularity
15f0d058c22fc033ce14d2565c661402.source_excerpt: But it must be said that if he had seen it, he attached so little importance to this scrap of paper, and so much importance to his two hundred thousand francs, that he would not have opposed whatever the Englishman might do, however irregular it might be.

0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.constraint_text: Appears for exactly a quarter of an hour at his annual balls
0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.source_excerpt: He gave a ball every year, at which he appeared for a quarter of an hour only,—that is to say, five-and-forty minutes less than the king is visible at his balls.

0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.constraint_text: Never attends theatres, concerts, or public resorts
0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.source_excerpt: He was never seen at the theatres, at concerts, or in any place of public resort.

0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.constraint_text: Maintains the same grave and measured demeanor as his earlier career
0767a89812472750f2956e3e5270a2df.source_excerpt: The procureur entered with the same grave and measured step he would have employed in entering a court of justice. He was the same man, or rather the development of the same man, whom we have heretofore seen as assistant attorney at Marseilles.

15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.constraint_text: Dantès was assured during his stay in Leghorn that he ran no risk of recognition due to his looking-glass confirmation.
15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.source_excerpt: His looking-glass had assured him, during his stay at Leghorn, that he ran no risk of recognition;

15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.constraint_text: Dantès's departure for the Château d’If occurred on a specific night that is fixed in his memory as 'never-to-be-forgotten.'
15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.source_excerpt: on the never-to-be-forgotten night of his departure for the Château d’If

15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.constraint_text: Dantès acquired perfect self-possession during his acquaintance with Faria, a trait he maintains.
15f6a38e3433278abcd1cf43f70b606d.source_excerpt: with that perfect self-possession he had acquired during his acquaintance with Faria

c4c8150422896f9afae93d799a903362.constraint_text: The count is described as a prudent man who had provided for all emergencies.
c4c8150422896f9afae93d799a903362.source_excerpt: The glass-cutter was a prudent man who had provided for all emergencies.

d6bb931b210306d0033134b10c0cdfe8.constraint_text: Eugénie has previously adopted the garb of the opposite sex before this moment
d6bb931b210306d0033134b10c0cdfe8.source_excerpt: promptitude which indicated that this was not the first time she had amused herself by adopting the garb of the opposite sex

d6bb931b210306d0033134b10c0cdfe8.constraint_text: Eugénie's long black hair was permanently altered by being cut
d6bb931b210306d0033134b10c0cdfe8.source_excerpt: the rich and splendid hair, which fell in a cluster at her feet as she leaned back to keep it from her coat

3938c99e868a8a3f0bbf12ecaf1dfb1b.constraint_text: The count has a fixed appointment at No. 27, Rue du Helder on the 21st of May at half-past ten in the morning.
3938c99e868a8a3f0bbf12ecaf1dfb1b.source_excerpt: "Now then," said the count, returning his tablets to his pocket, "make yourself perfectly easy; the hand of your time-piece will not be more accurate in marking the time than myself."

3938c99e868a8a3f0bbf12ecaf1dfb1b.constraint_text: The count is compelled to travel to Naples and will not return before Saturday evening or Sunday morning.
3938c99e868a8a3f0bbf12ecaf1dfb1b.source_excerpt: "In that case I must say adieu to you, as I am compelled to go to Naples, and shall not return hither before Saturday evening or Sunday morning."

a87e63de7879e3442af6f0e9981e1e2e.constraint_text: Departure to Normandy is fixed for the evening rather than being postponed to tomorrow or the next day
a87e63de7879e3442af6f0e9981e1e2e.source_excerpt: I intend going this evening to Normandy, instead of tomorrow or the next day.

22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.constraint_text: Monte Cristo possesses explicit knowledge of a house with specific characteristics (garden, master, physician) and three sudden deaths.
22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.source_excerpt: I know the house where you heard it, or one very similar to it; a house with a garden, a master, a physician, and where there have been three unexpected and sudden deaths.

22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.constraint_text: Monte Cristo claims to know all details of the secret without having intercepted Morrel’s confidence.
22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.source_excerpt: I have not intercepted your confidence, and yet I know all that as well as you, and I have no conscientious scruples.

22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.constraint_text: Monte Cristo explicitly attributes the deaths in the house to 'God’s justice' rather than mere anger.
22e6e03bd2aa57d1fe5190b64b662757.source_excerpt: If it is God’s justice, instead of his anger, which is walking through that house, Maximilian, turn away your face and let his justice accomplish its purpose.

afa57867a0fecf0cc9b48e04c5ddcfbc.constraint_text: Faria pretended to have a skin disorder to obtain sulphur for matches
afa57867a0fecf0cc9b48e04c5ddcfbc.source_excerpt: "I pretended that I had a disorder of the skin, and asked for a little sulphur, which was readily supplied."

afa57867a0fecf0cc9b48e04c5ddcfbc.constraint_text: Faria's mind demonstrates persistent perseverance and strength
afa57867a0fecf0cc9b48e04c5ddcfbc.source_excerpt: Dantès [...] stood with his head drooping on his breast, as though overwhelmed by the perseverance and strength of Faria’s mind.

7d8ed6d4b2f75736deb35f6b777e7edd.constraint_text: The news of the Pharaon's arrival had not yet reached him at this specific time
7d8ed6d4b2f75736deb35f6b777e7edd.source_excerpt: The news of the arrival of the _Pharaon_ had not yet reached the old man

c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.constraint_text: Left France a long time before and no longer speaks the language fluently
c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.source_excerpt: This honest man had left France a long time before; and the native language was no longer perfectly familiar to him: he had forgotten, if not words, at least the manner of combining them.

c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.constraint_text: Served as a sergeant in the French army
c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.source_excerpt: he had been a sergeant in the French army.

c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.constraint_text: Has not left the fort since its foundation
c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.source_excerpt: Since the foundation of the fort he had not left it, and commanded it by appointment from the Argentine government.

c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.constraint_text: Was naturalized a year after arriving in the country
c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.source_excerpt: A year after his arrival in the country, Sergeant Manuel was naturalized, joined the Argentine army
He was by parentage a Basque, and his name was Manuel Ipharaguerre.

c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.constraint_text: Married an Indian woman who had twin boys
c6c48a84f22d7be2a58687324ae17e86.source_excerpt: married an honest Indian woman, who had twins,--boys, to be sure

577fd6129b45f3b21228b44630f2cea4.constraint_text: Paganel has traveled in this country
577fd6129b45f3b21228b44630f2cea4.source_excerpt: "You have traveled in this country?" 'Certainly,' replied Paganel gravely.

15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.constraint_text: The speaker speaks five modern languages (German, French, Italian, English, Spanish) and has learned modern Greek through ancient Greek.
15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.source_excerpt: I speak five of the modern tongues—that is to say, German, French, Italian, English, and Spanish; by the aid of ancient Greek I learned modern Greek

15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.constraint_text: The speaker’s ability to learn modern Greek is attributed to their knowledge of ancient Greek.
15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.source_excerpt: by the aid of ancient Greek I learned modern Greek

15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.constraint_text: The speaker knows nearly one thousand words in modern Greek.
15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.source_excerpt: I know nearly one thousand words

15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.constraint_text: The speaker’s method of improving modern Greek involves creating and arranging a vocabulary of known words.
15ff0b086237d7d0fe2cf87627733cbe.source_excerpt: I made a vocabulary of the words I knew; turned, returned, and arranged them, so as to enable me to express my thoughts through their medium

8721f6e478d3071dc4373f35fc739682.constraint_text: The abbé asserts that it will take no more than two years to communicate his stock of learning to Dantès.
8721f6e478d3071dc4373f35fc739682.source_excerpt: Now, it will scarcely require two years for me to communicate to you the stock of learning I possess.

8721f6e478d3071dc4373f35fc739682.constraint_text: The abbé explicitly states that philosophy cannot be taught, only applied through sciences to truth.
8721f6e478d3071dc4373f35fc739682.source_excerpt: Philosophy cannot be taught; it is the application of the sciences to truth...

3d07a86761cdcfff9f7245767474eec0.constraint_text: The captain explicitly forbids abandoning the pumps by threatening to shoot the first man who leaves.
3d07a86761cdcfff9f7245767474eec0.source_excerpt: ‘I will blow the brains out of the first man who leaves the pump,’ said he.

3d07a86761cdcfff9f7245767474eec0.constraint_text: The sailor asserts that 'good reasons' are the source of courage, presenting this as an unchanging principle.
3d07a86761cdcfff9f7245767474eec0.source_excerpt: There’s nothing gives you so much courage as good reasons

b35eceb5213df22b9bbf9510959388be.constraint_text: Tom received a letter signed by Glenarvan that explicitly ordered him to leave Melbourne without delay and travel to the eastern shores of a location (disputed as Australia or New Zealand).
b35eceb5213df22b9bbf9510959388be.source_excerpt: "It ordered me to leave Melbourne without delay, and come to the eastern shores of----"

68caec3362aa81b9d443010eeb6d31cb.constraint_text: Albert vowed eternal friendship to Beauchamp, to be transmitted to future generations.
68caec3362aa81b9d443010eeb6d31cb.source_excerpt: which shall be transmitted to our children’s children, and shall always remind me that I owe my life and the honor of my name to you

68caec3362aa81b9d443010eeb6d31cb.constraint_text: Albert’s destruction of the papers was motivated by the fear of self-destruction or fleeing if the contents were revealed.
68caec3362aa81b9d443010eeb6d31cb.source_excerpt: for had this been known, oh, Beauchamp, I should have destroyed myself; or,—no, my poor mother! I could not have killed her by the same blow,—I should have fled from my country

13d7693aad154fc82f9f379ee22fa8b1.constraint_text: The abbé firmly believes that the good will be rewarded and the wicked punished, regardless of temporal circumstances.
13d7693aad154fc82f9f379ee22fa8b1.source_excerpt: "I am firmly persuaded that, sooner or later, the good will be rewarded, and the wicked punished."

e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.constraint_text: The speaker has prostrated himself daily for the last ten years
e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.source_excerpt: I have prostrated myself daily for the last ten years

e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.constraint_text: The speaker's survival was caused by God needing him
e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.source_excerpt: God needed me, and I lived

e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.constraint_text: The speaker views his fortune as entrusted to him for a divine purpose
e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.source_excerpt: I must have been blind not to be conscious that God had endowed me with it to work out his own great designs

e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.constraint_text: The speaker's youth was marked by 'the most dreadful misfortunes, the most frightful sufferings'
e71be321f0894bd5c6826ddafb440467.source_excerpt: the most dreadful misfortunes, the most frightful sufferings, the abandonment of all those who loved me, the persecution of those who did not know me, formed the trials of my youth

57c5e3c5d8f5d497c73cfaa00fe73b3a.constraint_text: Villefort's position of eminence requires him to have acquired 'finesse and certainty' in discerning people's true nature through observation
57c5e3c5d8f5d497c73cfaa00fe73b3a.source_excerpt: “...must have acquired so much _finesse_ and certainty, to divine, at a glance, the kind of man by whom you are confronted?”

5661837a25d4cbdf5638585cb20f52de.constraint_text: Benedetto's criminal roles progressed sequentially from forger to thief to assassin
5661837a25d4cbdf5638585cb20f52de.source_excerpt: "First I was a forger," answered Andrea, as calmly as possible; "then I became a thief, and lately have become an assassin."

5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.constraint_text: Mercédès is to live in Marseilles as part of a decision made with Albert.
5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.source_excerpt: it is decided that you are to live at Marseilles, and that I am to leave for Africa

5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.constraint_text: Albert engaged himself as a substitute in the Spahis yesterday.
5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.source_excerpt: I yesterday engaged myself as substitute in the Spahis

5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.constraint_text: Albert sold himself for 2,000 francs by taking the place of another.
5eb9af5622de4c2234c944eba5537463.source_excerpt: I sold myself for more than I thought I was worth... I fetched 2,000 francs

749611f50947216309af0b4404c4fc05.constraint_text: M. de Nargonne killed himself because he had no cash to save his wife
749611f50947216309af0b4404c4fc05.source_excerpt: Why did he kill himself instead of you? Because he had no cash to save.

749611f50947216309af0b4404c4fc05.constraint_text: M. de Nargonne discovered his wife was pregnant six months after his nine-month absence
749611f50947216309af0b4404c4fc05.source_excerpt: after an absence of nine months, that you had been _enceinte_ six.

fbf3c8abebddc23e055c9372f0c19494.constraint_text: Communication with Melbourne becomes impossible after passing the Lucknow road
fbf3c8abebddc23e055c9372f0c19494.source_excerpt: added that they could no longer communicate with Melbourne after passing the Lucknow road

4a9c621625eaa8704381b7122e5244f3.constraint_text: Villefort has consistently found proof of human perversity or error throughout his life.
4a9c621625eaa8704381b7122e5244f3.source_excerpt: I have always found them; and more,—I repeat it with joy, with triumph,—I have always found some proof of human perversity or error.

4a9c621625eaa8704381b7122e5244f3.constraint_text: Villefort attributes the orphan's lack of mourners to divine ordination.
4a9c621625eaa8704381b7122e5244f3.source_excerpt: it has been so ordained that he may have none to weep his fate.

4a9c621625eaa8704381b7122e5244f3.constraint_text: Villefort has already given instructions that prevent delaying the trial.

5dbe803d7790d0dad97345c47a649331.constraint_text: Noirtier has become Valentine's physician and is trusted because he knows everything.
5dbe803d7790d0dad97345c47a649331.source_excerpt: And grandpapa has become my physician, and I have the greatest confidence in him, because he knows everything.

5dbe803d7790d0dad97345c47a649331.constraint_text: Valentine increased her dosage of the mixture from one to four spoonfuls.
5dbe803d7790d0dad97345c47a649331.source_excerpt: I began by one—now I take four.

5dbe803d7790d0dad97345c47a649331.constraint_text: Noirtier is described as knowing everything, which is the basis for Valentine's trust in him.

e805879270df5b17cf809496c73b1bac.constraint_text: Assunta's refusal to comply with Benedetto's demands was explicitly caused by the narrator's advice
e805879270df5b17cf809496c73b1bac.source_excerpt: Acting by my advice, my poor sister had refused to comply with the unreasonable demands of Benedetto

8de2d7306d67148414bf64840c2c1c92.constraint_text: Must do something to distract his thoughts
8de2d7306d67148414bf64840c2c1c92.source_excerpt: "I must do something to distract my thoughts."

2a0253e27b63e2d99322a43596a7b71b.constraint_text: M. de Villefort has already recorded multiple death sentences against political conspirators in the past.
2a0253e27b63e2d99322a43596a7b71b.source_excerpt: I have already recorded sentence of death, five or six times, against the movers of political conspiracies

7a4e6003932ca9713820032dee65c949.constraint_text: People who share information under initial assurances of safety often face later persecution and trouble.
7a4e6003932ca9713820032dee65c949.source_excerpt: Nothing is easier than to begin with fair promises and assurances of nothing to fear; but when poor, silly folks... have been persuaded to tell all they know, the promises and assurances of safety are quickly forgotten; and at some moment when nobody is expecting it, behold trouble and misery, and all sorts of persecutions, are heaped on the unfortunate wretches...

7a4e6003932ca9713820032dee65c949.constraint_text: Any future evils experienced by the husband and woman will not be caused by the abbé's actions.
7a4e6003932ca9713820032dee65c949.source_excerpt: Whatever evils may befall you, they will not be occasioned by my instrumentality, that I solemnly promise you.

9094697537bcdece914e013f4187904a.constraint_text: Miss Mary played on her father's ships as a child, indicating a long-standing familiarity with ships
9094697537bcdece914e013f4187904a.source_excerpt: "When a mere child, I played on my father's ships. He ought to have made a sailor of me."

b6c1ef9006c3622fa99c0c6de673f24e.constraint_text: Villefort has continuously searched and inquired without ceasing.
b6c1ef9006c3622fa99c0c6de673f24e.source_excerpt: I never ceased to search and to inquire.

b6c1ef9006c3622fa99c0c6de673f24e.constraint_text: Villefort allowed himself a respite for the last two or three years.
b6c1ef9006c3622fa99c0c6de673f24e.source_excerpt: the last two or three years I had allowed myself some respite.

54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has resolved to seek revenge for fourteen years and maintains this resolve.
54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.source_excerpt: I must revenge myself, for I suffered fourteen years,—fourteen years I wept, I cursed; now I tell you, Mercédès, I must revenge myself.

54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.constraint_text: Monte Cristo justifies his revenge by citing the biblical principle that 'the sins of the fathers shall fall upon their children to the third and fourth generation.'
54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.source_excerpt: It is written in the good book... that the sins of the fathers shall fall upon their children to the third and fourth generation.

54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's fourteen-year period of suffering and hatred is explicitly fixed as the foundation for his current resolve.
54c706773f37f6e3ac8d9b42aac3d076.source_excerpt: I suffered fourteen years,—fourteen years I wept, I cursed; now I tell you, Mercédès, I must revenge myself.

4181bf1c0d0694d937c35336da2dc565.constraint_text: Monte Cristo possesses comprehensive knowledge of English, Turkish, Japanese, Hindu, and French laws, equivalent to his familiarity with French laws.
4181bf1c0d0694d937c35336da2dc565.source_excerpt: The English, Turkish, Japanese, Hindu laws, are as familiar to me as the French laws

4181bf1c0d0694d937c35336da2dc565.constraint_text: Villefort consistently evaluates matters through a materialistic and socially restricted perspective, failing to recognize higher, divine influences.
4181bf1c0d0694d937c35336da2dc565.source_excerpt: you look at everything from the material and vulgar view of society... the most restricted, most narrow view which it is possible for human understanding to embrace

5699e6245e3a3689ff1b6b3574dc5dca.constraint_text: The speaker has always found weaknesses in others and proof of human perversity or error.
5699e6245e3a3689ff1b6b3574dc5dca.source_excerpt: I have always found them; and more,—I repeat it with joy, with triumph,—I have always found some proof of human perversity or error.

5699e6245e3a3689ff1b6b3574dc5dca.constraint_text: The speaker never rests until tearing disguises from others and exposing their weaknesses.
5699e6245e3a3689ff1b6b3574dc5dca.source_excerpt: I never rest till I have torn the disguises from my fellow-creatures, and found out their weaknesses.

611d8aad91c5d0ced2eb5f31edc3d67d.constraint_text: Morrel has resolved to die and will not change his decision.
611d8aad91c5d0ced2eb5f31edc3d67d.source_excerpt: I come to die in the arms of a friend. [...] No, I feel that I have reached the goal, and I will go no farther.

611d8aad91c5d0ced2eb5f31edc3d67d.constraint_text: Morrel maintains a calm and steady state of mind during this moment.
611d8aad91c5d0ced2eb5f31edc3d67d.source_excerpt: my pulse does not beat slower or faster than usual. [...] I am calm.

9f7d7b457879828431efccdc3d2b16df.constraint_text: Mercédès believes Edmond Dantès is lost to her and had her love, a belief that has persisted over a long period.
9f7d7b457879828431efccdc3d2b16df.source_excerpt: One is that of Edmond Dantès, lost to me long, long since. He had my love!

9f7d7b457879828431efccdc3d2b16df.constraint_text: Mercédès' comparison between Edmond and other men will always be a source of her greatest torment.
9f7d7b457879828431efccdc3d2b16df.source_excerpt: the comparison I draw between you and other men will ever be one of my greatest tortures

246ea2ece8a97ef2a1e6513d0d95517f.constraint_text: The priest explicitly acknowledges the narrator's Corsican nature as a fixed and unchangeable trait that he understands and admires.
246ea2ece8a97ef2a1e6513d0d95517f.source_excerpt: ‘I know and admire the Corsican nature too well to fear you.’

14ac5ce304188cc22c0cc461a978b3f3.constraint_text: The keeper of the seals has the right of entry at the Tuileries and can procure audience at any hour of the day or night.
14ac5ce304188cc22c0cc461a978b3f3.source_excerpt: the keeper of the seals; he has the right of entry at the Tuileries, and can procure you audience at any hour of the day or night.

95c19031c7dbf54f5d3b0b6483571a82.constraint_text: The father was murdered on February 5th, 1815.
95c19031c7dbf54f5d3b0b6483571a82.source_excerpt: “February 5th, 1815!” said he; “it is the day my father was murdered.”

37cbc05acccb6841a9a7844d8a701342.constraint_text: He cannot break his vow in favor of the ex-emperor after declaring himself for Louis XVIII due to the timing being 'too soon'.
37cbc05acccb6841a9a7844d8a701342.source_excerpt: “I say that it is too soon after declaring myself for Louis XVIII. to break my vow in behalf of the ex-emperor.”

d3e5ca553af2c64aac65f6e0a7dea253.constraint_text: The count has an energetic and violent temper that is a known, unchanging characteristic.
d3e5ca553af2c64aac65f6e0a7dea253.source_excerpt: They knew the count’s energetic and violent temper

55499b8054a109938c38545bcace7cb2.constraint_text: The general is bound by an oath not to reveal what he saw and heard on the 5th of February, 1815, between nine and ten o’clock in the evening, under penalty of death.
55499b8054a109938c38545bcace7cb2.source_excerpt: ‘It is this:—‘I swear by my honor not to reveal to anyone what I have seen and heard on the 5th of February, 1815, between nine and ten o’clock in the evening; and I plead guilty of death should I ever violate this oath.’

ccb1fe8d2e3f12dda26523db70579247.constraint_text: Andrea explicitly states his father's name is Villefort

7b6b2daf6b23150b1b966207a2a065f7.constraint_text: Mercédès' change occurred within the last few days
7b6b2daf6b23150b1b966207a2a065f7.source_excerpt: Mercédès was much changed within the last few days

7b6b2daf6b23150b1b966207a2a065f7.constraint_text: Mercédès' spirit was broken by losing her exalted position, not by poverty or lack of courage
