7b6b2daf6b23150b1b966207a2a065f7.source_excerpt: It was not poverty which had broken her spirit; it was not a want of courage which rendered her poverty burdensome

74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.constraint_text: Paganel's vocabulary is restricted to repeating 'The Duncan' during this moment
74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.source_excerpt: He kept repeating those fatal words: 'The Duncan! the Duncan!' He could find no others in his vocabulary.

74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.constraint_text: Paganel's mission to India was fixed in schedule before the Duncan's voyage to Chili
74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.source_excerpt: But what will M. de Quatrefages say, the President of the Central Commission? How shall I represent myself at the sessions of the Society?

74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.constraint_text: Paganel explicitly assigns responsibility for the adventure to himself
74c65bfc0e3d76b94b0de59cb7a23a1a.source_excerpt: we can say this is an extraordinary adventure, which would not have happened but for me

e612ccc56f5d50407d5be698f247e0ef.constraint_text: They must follow the thirty-seventh parallel without deviating half a degree.
e612ccc56f5d50407d5be698f247e0ef.source_excerpt: "follow it, without deviating half a degree, to the point where it strikes the Atlantic."

279eca71dee338442d5b5d71b379e827.constraint_text: Monte Cristo purchased the island to prevent the Tuscan government from claiming it, ensuring his continued use of the property.
279eca71dee338442d5b5d71b379e827.source_excerpt: he has wisely enough purchased the island, and taken its name.

76b5083ce3c4e3d0c77a98b33769785f.constraint_text: Faria did not have access to pens, ink, or paper during his imprisonment and had to make them himself.
76b5083ce3c4e3d0c77a98b33769785f.source_excerpt: I had none but what I made for myself.

76b5083ce3c4e3d0c77a98b33769785f.constraint_text: Faria consistently engaged in writing or studying during his imprisonment.

10523497992e420d4c043eb9f60f0f7e.constraint_text: The deputy procureur will use a letter that might have ruined him to make his fortune
10523497992e420d4c043eb9f60f0f7e.source_excerpt: from this letter, which might have ruined me, I will make my fortune

2b5edd2cc211fc4713e6949efe06e1c3.constraint_text: There had been no prisoners confined in the Château d’If since the revolution of July; it was only inhabited by a guard, kept there for the prevention of smuggling.
2b5edd2cc211fc4713e6949efe06e1c3.source_excerpt: There had been no prisoners confined in the Château d’If since the revolution of July; it was only inhabited by a guard, kept there for the prevention of smuggling.

25465c3f34bf85a44744d20f417c7c04.constraint_text: Maximilian became a gardener to avoid being sent to prison as a thief, which would compromise the honor of the French army.
25465c3f34bf85a44744d20f417c7c04.source_excerpt: "...I became weary of ranging fields and scaling walls, and seriously alarmed at the idea suggested by you, that if caught hovering about here your father would very likely have me sent to prison as a thief. That would compromise the honor of the French army... so I have become a gardener..."

491e0dd0e2e8cf4041726f0ff52c4b38.constraint_text: Was wholly devoted to the emperor
491e0dd0e2e8cf4041726f0ff52c4b38.source_excerpt: while mine was wholly devoted to the emperor

491e0dd0e2e8cf4041726f0ff52c4b38.constraint_text: Was a zealous partisan of the Bourbons
491e0dd0e2e8cf4041726f0ff52c4b38.source_excerpt: your father was, as you know, a zealous partisan of the Bourbons

a6093034a979f80ebc2899f7d9c390d0.constraint_text: Guides are the only permitted individuals to carry torches at the Colosseum, restricting Albert and Franz's ability to act independently.
a6093034a979f80ebc2899f7d9c390d0.source_excerpt: the guides alone are permitted to visit these monuments with torches in their hands

a6093034a979f80ebc2899f7d9c390d0.constraint_text: Franz has made seven or eight prior excursions to the Colosseum, establishing a fixed count of his past visits.
a6093034a979f80ebc2899f7d9c390d0.source_excerpt: Franz had already made seven or eight similar excursions to the Colosseum

25852602038b2c9a12bf872fe7d47459.constraint_text: Valentine has no mother (Renée is deceased)
Villefort was obliged to provide a stepmother for his child
25852602038b2c9a12bf872fe7d47459.source_excerpt: you forget that I was obliged to give a mother to my child

25852602038b2c9a12bf872fe7d47459.constraint_text: Valentine cannot marry under the recent death's sad auspices
25852602038b2c9a12bf872fe7d47459.source_excerpt: You would not have me marry under such sad auspices?

05394d2f83cf5c85b9b70bcb78f94313.constraint_text: Andrea's journey route from Nice to Paris is identical to his father's route, enabling the father to trace Andrea's journey.
05394d2f83cf5c85b9b70bcb78f94313.source_excerpt: "Indeed? Then your father ought to have met with you on the road, for it is exactly the same route which he himself took, and that is how we have been able to trace your journey to this place."

75f3cdf814aaf070bf5bf3fa70de5894.constraint_text: Purchased a house at Auteuil specifically to establish a lunatic asylum modeled after the Count of Pisani's institution in Palermo.
75f3cdf814aaf070bf5bf3fa70de5894.source_excerpt: Do you know with what design M. de Monte Cristo purchased a house at Auteuil? ... To make a lunatic asylum of it, similar to that founded by the Count of Pisani at Palermo.

f6adce17a9c771818fa7ad883e39fd57.constraint_text: A man of Fernand's disposition never kills himself because he constantly hopes.
f6adce17a9c771818fa7ad883e39fd57.source_excerpt: But Fernand was mistaken; a man of his disposition never kills himself, for he constantly hopes.

f6adce17a9c771818fa7ad883e39fd57.constraint_text: Fernand departed during the empire's last conscription.
f6adce17a9c771818fa7ad883e39fd57.source_excerpt: During this time the empire made its last conscription, and every man in France capable of bearing arms rushed to obey the summons of the emperor. Fernand departed with the rest...

f29ce3da16347c0c7192e0a07e850a86.constraint_text: Danglars and Fernand were in conversation at Père Pamphile’s the evening before the day fixed for Dantès’s wedding
f29ce3da16347c0c7192e0a07e850a86.source_excerpt: I recollect——... sitting at table together under an arbor at Père Pamphile’s the evening before the day fixed for my wedding

120fc00f004d783e384986d36d157efe.constraint_text: The prisoner's desire to escape is stronger than the jailer's desire to prevent escape because the prisoner cannot forget they are guarded while the jailer may forget their duty.
120fc00f004d783e384986d36d157efe.source_excerpt: It is said that, between the jailer who watches and the prisoner who wishes to escape, the chances are on the side of the latter. Indeed, the design of one is stronger than that of the other, for the first may forget that he is guarding, but the second cannot forget that he is guarded; the captive thinks oftener of escaping than his guardian thinks of preventing his escape.

ec7e1944ed12f7f5ab968b32e43d8117.constraint_text: Dantès was made to swear an oath never to utter the name 'Noirtier' under threat of consequences.
ec7e1944ed12f7f5ab968b32e43d8117.source_excerpt: made you swear never to utter the name of Noirtier?

a2c70276e2703c60227e7d31c27c9640.constraint_text: The narrator's decision to take the money to his brother in person was caused by his tender love for his brother.
a2c70276e2703c60227e7d31c27c9640.source_excerpt: I loved my brother tenderly, as I told your excellency, and I resolved not to send the money, but to take it to him myself.

a2c70276e2703c60227e7d31c27c9640.constraint_text: The narrator possessed exactly a thousand francs at the time of the described events.

af1979ea982ba5ed1d58a738f86824f9.constraint_text: The gendarme will shoot Dantès if he moves
af1979ea982ba5ed1d58a738f86824f9.source_excerpt: "...I will not disobey the second; and if you move, I will blow your brains out."

b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.constraint_text: The Spada family remained in a state of 'doubtful ease' and obscurity after the cardinal's death, with public rumors attributing their decline to political actions by Cæsar.
b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.source_excerpt: The Spadas remained in doubtful ease, a mystery hung over this dark affair, and the public rumor was, that Cæsar, a better politician than his father, had carried off from the pope the fortune of the two cardinals.

b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.constraint_text: Over time, the descendants of the Spada family pursued varied paths (soldiers, diplomats, churchmen, bankers) with mixed outcomes (rich or ruined).
b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.source_excerpt: Years rolled on, and amongst the descendants some were soldiers, others diplomatists; some churchmen, some bankers; some grew rich, and some were ruined.

b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.constraint_text: The Count of Spada is explicitly identified as the last member of the Spada family.
b47fc83b95b5b8964ee3f8dc54deb750.source_excerpt: I come now to the last of the family, whose secretary I was—the Count of Spada.

73843dacb1dc6f49733b278f00d67ec8.constraint_text: The cardinal likely created the guide-marks with the purpose of aiding his nephew during a potential catastrophe.
73843dacb1dc6f49733b278f00d67ec8.source_excerpt: Might it not have been the cardinal himself who had first traced them, in order that they might serve as a guide for his nephew in the event of a catastrophe, which he could not foresee would have been so complete.

b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.constraint_text: Paid for being made a cardinal and for the offices held before his elevation
b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.source_excerpt: The result was, that Rospigliosi and Spada paid for being cardinals, and eight other persons paid for the offices the cardinals held before their elevation

b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.constraint_text: Paid for being made a cardinal and for the offices held before his elevation
b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.source_excerpt: The result was, that Rospigliosi and Spada paid for being cardinals, and eight other persons paid for the offices the cardinals held before their elevation

b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.constraint_text: Was required to arrange his affairs and take up residence at Rome after being made a cardinal
b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.source_excerpt: The pope heaped attentions upon Rospigliosi and Spada, conferred upon them the insignia of the cardinalate, and induced them to arrange their affairs and take up their residence at Rome

b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.constraint_text: Was required to arrange his affairs and take up residence at Rome after being made a cardinal
b13c1fc7e908d0680a1e6fbe43c834de.source_excerpt: The pope heaped attentions upon Rospigliosi and Spada, conferred upon them the insignia of the cardinalate, and induced them to arrange their affairs and take up their residence at Rome

9becaa307414d96af54edfc2b523e156.constraint_text: Albert's skill as a pugilist caused him to send the masks rolling in the street.
9becaa307414d96af54edfc2b523e156.source_excerpt: Albert, a first-rate pugilist, sent them rolling in the street, one after the other, and continued his course towards the church of San Giacomo.

c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.constraint_text: The countess must leave the opera before its conclusion due to a prearranged party.
c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.source_excerpt: I have a party at my house tonight, and therefore cannot possibly remain till the end of the opera.

c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.constraint_text: Franz experiences superstitious dread rooted in corroborative recollections.
c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.source_excerpt: Franz himself could not resist a feeling of superstitious dread—so much the stronger in him, as it arose from a variety of corroborative recollections

c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.constraint_text: The countess's terror stems from an instinctive belief shaped by wild tales she internalized as truths.
c7565342e4aea3f64b090c141ebc0eb0.source_excerpt: the terror of the countess sprang from an instinctive belief, originally created in her mind by the wild tales she had listened to till she believed them truths

2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.constraint_text: The stepmother's infernal project originated from questioning a man about aqua tofana at Perugia
2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.source_excerpt: Do you recollect in the arbor of the Hôtel des Postes, at Perugia, seeing a man in a brown cloak, whom your stepmother was questioning upon aqua tofana? Well, ever since then, the infernal project has been ripening in her brain.

2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.constraint_text: Valentine must blindly take what is given to her
2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.source_excerpt: You must blindly take what I give you.

2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.constraint_text: Valentine must not confide in anyone, including her father
2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.source_excerpt: You must not confide in anyone—not even in your father.

2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.constraint_text: Committing the crime against Valentine would be folly if her death would not alter inheritance
2393ca7c386aa889841fafb72eca73c8.source_excerpt: It was considered, that you dead, the fortune would naturally revert to your brother, unless he were disinherited; and besides, the crime appearing useless, it would be folly to commit it.

3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.constraint_text: The president cannot use the general’s carriage because the coachman’s knowledge of the route would undermine the purpose of blindfolding the general.
3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.source_excerpt: the president told him it was impossible for him to use it, since it was useless to blindfold the master if the coachman knew through what streets he went.

3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.constraint_text: The general attended the meeting willingly, not under compulsion.
3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.source_excerpt: We insert this joke to prove that the general was not in the least compelled to attend the meeting, but that he came willingly.

3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.constraint_text: The general agreed to have his eyes bandaged during the carriage ride and did not oppose the president’s reminder of this promise.
3d296170a61a2e8fee20bd87775598f4.source_excerpt: When they were seated in the carriage the president reminded the general of his promise to allow his eyes to be bandaged, to which he made no opposition.

3e6705f10aa184804a0d9f869a2b0f23.constraint_text: His unfamiliarity with Paris is explicitly caused by having just arrived there that morning and not yet being settled.
3e6705f10aa184804a0d9f869a2b0f23.source_excerpt: "I got out of my travelling carriage at your door this morning, and I am ignorant how I am installed in Paris, which I scarcely know"

f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.constraint_text: Must be eternally ignorant of the meeting place
f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.source_excerpt: one of the conditions of his introduction was that he should be eternally ignorant of the place of meeting

f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.constraint_text: Must not attempt to remove the blindfold
f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.source_excerpt: swearing that he would not endeavor to take off the bandage

f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.constraint_text: Cannot use his own carriage because the coachman knows the route
f77f57d9de343f3ff6616a2250a4cc92.source_excerpt: it was useless to blindfold the master if the coachman knew through what streets he went

b0bd17aa0fe2106cf8983d2d3b45f714.constraint_text: The Indian gave an item to the narrator before returning to Thaouka.
b0bd17aa0fe2106cf8983d2d3b45f714.source_excerpt: "He thought it might be useful to us, and gave it to me before going back to Thaouka."

17cfb4f6664937bd07e33cd3bf25dc98.constraint_text: Paganel's presence on the vessel was caused by a moment of providential absent-mindedness
17cfb4f6664937bd07e33cd3bf25dc98.source_excerpt: when Paganel, in a moment of providential absent-mindedness, embarked on board our vessel

17cfb4f6664937bd07e33cd3bf25dc98.constraint_text: Paganel holds the belief that persisting in error is madness while being mistaken is human
17cfb4f6664937bd07e33cd3bf25dc98.source_excerpt: Yes, we are mistaken,' repeated Paganel; 'but to be mistaken is only to be human, while it is the part of a madman to persist in his error'

bf593f6fbf4de29e85ed9b51e23859b8.constraint_text: He had been educated in the Wesleyan Methodist day-school at Melbourne
bf593f6fbf4de29e85ed9b51e23859b8.source_excerpt: He had been educated in the Wesleyan Methodist day-school at Melbourne

bf593f6fbf4de29e85ed9b51e23859b8.constraint_text: He had been in the train to which the accident had happened
bf593f6fbf4de29e85ed9b51e23859b8.source_excerpt: He had been in the train to which the accident had happened

ae2384738bfc9393debbd99d3c1bf7b7.constraint_text: Caderousse habitually bolts and bars doors at night as a precautionary measure.
ae2384738bfc9393debbd99d3c1bf7b7.source_excerpt: he closed, and, by way of still greater precaution, bolted and barred it, as he was accustomed to do at night

5205e1c8147bccf01cd653c7db9f85df.constraint_text: Glenarvan's bold and resolute character prevents him from accepting disappointment calmly.
5205e1c8147bccf01cd653c7db9f85df.source_excerpt: His lordship's bold and resolute character did not permit him to accept this disappointment calmly.

5205e1c8147bccf01cd653c7db9f85df.constraint_text: The major is always confident and unaffected by discouragement.
5205e1c8147bccf01cd653c7db9f85df.source_excerpt: The major, always confident, performed his duties like a man upon whom discouragement can have no effect.

ff44fdc1e8a0bd59cc12d8f7b96e6626.constraint_text: Paganel did not leave the Indian (Thalcave) and became his constant companion
ff44fdc1e8a0bd59cc12d8f7b96e6626.source_excerpt: He became Thalcave's shadow, and could not remain quiet in the presence of a real Patagonian

ff44fdc1e8a0bd59cc12d8f7b96e6626.constraint_text: Paganel's motivation to learn Spanish from Thalcave is explicitly stated as a cause for his linguistic efforts
ff44fdc1e8a0bd59cc12d8f7b96e6626.source_excerpt: "If I do not get the accent," said he to the major, "you must not be angry with me. Who would have thought that one day a Patagonian would teach me Spanish!"

f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.constraint_text: Thaouka's resistance was restrained by his master's voice, not strength
f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.source_excerpt: It was not so much the strength as the voice of his master which restrained him
the animal, if he did not answer, at least comprehended him

f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.constraint_text: Thaouka perceived moisture in the air through superior instincts
f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.source_excerpt: The intelligent animal, through his superior instincts, had perceived a moisture in the air

f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.constraint_text: Thalcave could not be deceived by his horse's behavior
f8a0f01baf28ad07c0ff047d545f7cdf.source_excerpt: The Patagonian could not be deceived

cc49473e938d1eefe7f39b50ab01cce4.constraint_text: Robert believes it was his duty to sacrifice himself after Thalcave saved his life and before Glenarvan could save his father.
cc49473e938d1eefe7f39b50ab01cce4.source_excerpt: "My lord," replied he, in accents of the liveliest gratitude, "was it not my duty to sacrifice myself, when Thalcave has saved my life, and you are going to save my father?"

8ead4e5485bc2ffb451d49727235aeca.source_excerpt: Thalcave, who smiled with his accustomed calmness

8ead4e5485bc2ffb451d49727235aeca.constraint_text: Search for Robert must wait until dawn
8ead4e5485bc2ffb451d49727235aeca.source_excerpt: They must wait for day to start in search of Robert

8ead4e5485bc2ffb451d49727235aeca.constraint_text: Horses cannot overtake Robert in the darkness
8ead4e5485bc2ffb451d49727235aeca.source_excerpt: their horses could not overtake the boy

02e91169193696e35467344e169f5773.constraint_text: Thalcave possesses knowledge of the nature of the enemies he faces (aguaras)
02e91169193696e35467344e169f5773.source_excerpt: He knew with what enemies he had to deal.

99d3577b395614cd7ea820e92abba642.constraint_text: Thalcave's intention to save his friends by sacrificing himself is explicitly stated as the cause of his actions.
99d3577b395614cd7ea820e92abba642.source_excerpt: In truth the Indian was about to make a venture, not to leave his friends, but to save them by sacrificing himself.

97b6e706dc43297e14116b4cd67c2494.constraint_text: Thalcave explicitly prohibits them from firing their weapons during the wolf encounter.
97b6e706dc43297e14116b4cd67c2494.source_excerpt: "He prohibits us from firing," answered Glenarvan.

e79788c453b40757553ea29dafd27e92.constraint_text: Thalcave did not stir, spoke no more, and fixed his eyes on the sand figures after the geography lesson.
e79788c453b40757553ea29dafd27e92.source_excerpt: Thalcave did not stir. He no longer spoke. His eyes were fixed upon the figures traced on the sand...

0ed223469820ca764cfc49bcdfb84f96.constraint_text: The Indian explicitly states that Thaouka is a 'good horse' and 'swift,' traits that will reliably draw the wolves away.
0ed223469820ca764cfc49bcdfb84f96.source_excerpt: "Thaouka--good horse--swift--will draw the wolves after him."

e1ac704a24fe082a8c46fffa30c553e7.constraint_text: Robert was alive at the moment he was found by Glenarvan and the party.
e1ac704a24fe082a8c46fffa30c553e7.source_excerpt: To Glenarvan's joy, Robert was there, alive, borne by the noble Thaouka...

438c702f679e4b03e7a460af37dde96d.constraint_text: When the barometer rises, the 'pampero' wind does not create long-lasting tempests
438c702f679e4b03e7a460af37dde96d.source_excerpt: "...when the barometer rises as it does now, you are free from these furious hurricanes in a few hours."

a6cda213c7f12e68535524955af1a529.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès had not heard anyone speak except his jailer for four or five years prior to this interaction
a6cda213c7f12e68535524955af1a529.source_excerpt: Edmond had not heard anyone speak save his jailer for four or five years

a6cda213c7f12e68535524955af1a529.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès has been imprisoned since February 28, 1815
The unnamed prisoner has been imprisoned since 1811

8979500622a08dc86342f5f0be1dcc32.constraint_text: The narrator's survival depends on the existence of Abbé Busoni; if the Abbé does not exist, the narrator is 'lost past redemption.'
8979500622a08dc86342f5f0be1dcc32.source_excerpt: One only chance was left me, that of beseeching the magistrate before whom I was taken to cause every inquiry to be made for the Abbé Busoni, who had stopped at the inn of the Pont du Gard on that morning. 'If Caderousse had invented the story relative to the diamond, and there existed no such person as the Abbé Busoni, then, indeed, I was lost past redemption'

41c61b2ae717ac6391039002b3a99e67.constraint_text: Bertuccio's brother raised him as his own son after they became orphans
41c61b2ae717ac6391039002b3a99e67.source_excerpt: He brought me up as if I had been his son, and in 1814 he married.

87d4437125644cc29c98e5654acbbf32.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès has been the bearer of a letter from Murat to the usurper and has taken charge of another letter from the usurper to the Bonapartist club in Paris.
87d4437125644cc29c98e5654acbbf32.source_excerpt: 'The king’s attorney is informed by a friend to the throne and the religious institutions of his country, that one named Edmond Dantès, mate of the ship _Pharaon_, this day arrived from Smyrna, after having touched at Naples and Porto-Ferrajo, has been the bearer of a letter from Murat to the usurper, and again taken charge of another letter from the usurper to the Bonapartist club in Paris.'

9b80d698c0f75ec0b79345156f5a3f60.constraint_text: Dantès was arrested on February 28, 1815, when he was 19 years old.
9b80d698c0f75ec0b79345156f5a3f60.source_excerpt: All I do know is, that I was just nineteen when I was arrested, the 28th of February, 1815.

1efbaf4d17da2e59d9c472f7741ae8cb.constraint_text: Dantès wanted but little of being utterly mad
1efbaf4d17da2e59d9c472f7741ae8cb.source_excerpt: The jailer was right; Dantès wanted but little of being utterly mad.

f866b72404ee62b89d377e2c56cc02ef.constraint_text: One drop restores life, but five or six drops inevitably kill without altering wine's flavor.
f866b72404ee62b89d377e2c56cc02ef.source_excerpt: One drop will restore life, as you have seen; five or six will inevitably kill, and in a way the more terrible inasmuch as, poured into a glass of wine, it would not in the slightest degree affect its flavor.

f866b72404ee62b89d377e2c56cc02ef.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has an engagement he cannot break at the time of the conversation.
f866b72404ee62b89d377e2c56cc02ef.source_excerpt: but I have an engagement which I cannot break.

0cd4ff4c03a8562eb4db2261a31b9308.constraint_text: Villefort did not stop at his father’s house after his journey and instead went directly to the Hotel de Madrid.
0cd4ff4c03a8562eb4db2261a31b9308.source_excerpt: "No, sire," he replied, "I alighted at the Hotel de Madrid, in the Rue de Tournon."

e7293030ee7271bef31178ee78704ae2.constraint_text: The concierge's actions are governed by precise orders from M. de Villefort, which he cannot deviate from.
e7293030ee7271bef31178ee78704ae2.source_excerpt: his orders are precise, and M. de Villefort begged me to tell you that he could not act otherwise.

1b4cfd017879c7ec03d763e100e43876.constraint_text: Villefort must order the execution of the accused if the charges against him are proven correct.
1b4cfd017879c7ec03d763e100e43876.source_excerpt: To give you pleasure, my sweet Renée, I promise to show all the lenity in my power; but if the charges brought against this Bonapartist hero prove correct, why, then, you really must give me leave to order his head to be cut off.

1b4cfd017879c7ec03d763e100e43876.constraint_text: Villefort is bound to fulfill his duty as the king’s servant by responding to wherever his service is required.
1b4cfd017879c7ec03d763e100e43876.source_excerpt: You are the king’s servant, and must go wherever that service calls you.

90f3ec6425810e371b261d27547b5696.constraint_text: Luigi Vampa is explicitly identified as the chief of the band.
90f3ec6425810e371b261d27547b5696.source_excerpt: This was the chief of the band, Luigi Vampa.

a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.constraint_text: Caderousse's absorption by the 'demon of gain' caused his meticulous counting and handling of the gold and notes.
a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.source_excerpt: absorbed as they were all three with the demon of gain

a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.constraint_text: La Carconte's absorption by the 'demon of gain' caused her to repeatedly count the money and replace the letters in the pocket-book.
a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.source_excerpt: absorbed as they were all three with the demon of gain

a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.constraint_text: The jeweller's absorption by the 'demon of gain' caused him to focus on the diamond's sparkle and ignore the storm's warnings.
a3586dde19f9a0fbe2a4383e6cf161b8.source_excerpt: absorbed as they were all three with the demon of gain

15b226c0ad7d218ebcaf239488e30da4.constraint_text: A rope with a slip-noose confined the shark's tail and paralyzed its movements
15b226c0ad7d218ebcaf239488e30da4.source_excerpt: A rope with a slip-noose confined his tail and paralyzed his movements.

7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.constraint_text: His assassination was caused by attending a Bonapartist meeting under the assumption he favored Napoleon's cause
7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.source_excerpt: was he not the person who was assassinated one evening on leaving a Bonapartist meeting to which he had been invited on the supposition that he favored the cause of the emperor?

7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.constraint_text: His decision to unite the children of enemies was motivated by a desire to prevent the renewal of old feuds
7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.source_excerpt: it was to prevent the renewal of old feuds that M. de Villefort formed the idea of uniting in the bonds of affection the two children of these inveterate enemies

7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.constraint_text: Maintained a never-varying smile as a habitual expression
7382201020906c997a4e3c2824a1794b.source_excerpt: the never-varying smile he was so constantly in the habit of assuming

fb11c52fd39f839962f82ad6e28d6337.constraint_text: Villefort secluded himself and gave orders not to be disturbed except for important business during this period.
fb11c52fd39f839962f82ad6e28d6337.source_excerpt: Villefort had secluded himself, not to study, but to reflect; and with the door locked and orders given that he should not be disturbed excepting for important business...

fb11c52fd39f839962f82ad6e28d6337.constraint_text: Villefort has maintained a secret list of enemies compiled from his political career, financial dealings, legal work, and love affairs.
fb11c52fd39f839962f82ad6e28d6337.source_excerpt: ...he opened the drawer of his desk... and drew out a parcel of cherished memoranda, amongst which he had carefully arranged, in characters only known to himself, the names of all those who, either in his political career, in money matters, at the bar, or in his mysterious love affairs, had become his enemies.

30b0029d08b4eb62f43ccfc82887a224.constraint_text: The speaker believes a son ought not to submit to a stain on his father’s honor.
30b0029d08b4eb62f43ccfc82887a224.source_excerpt: A son ought not to submit to such a stain on his father’s honor.

30b0029d08b4eb62f43ccfc82887a224.constraint_text: The speaker is not impervious to good advice when it comes from a friend.
30b0029d08b4eb62f43ccfc82887a224.source_excerpt: Not when it comes from a friend.

d9dd2cc47ecd27134d6696cac4d756ba.constraint_text: Her memory retains every detail of the Yanina affair due to its deep personal significance
d9dd2cc47ecd27134d6696cac4d756ba.source_excerpt: ‘I was four years old; but as those events deeply concerned me, not a single detail has escaped my memory.’

d9dd2cc47ecd27134d6696cac4d756ba.constraint_text: She is the daughter of Ali Tepelini, pasha of Yanina, and Vasiliki
d9dd2cc47ecd27134d6696cac4d756ba.source_excerpt: ‘I am Haydée, the daughter of Ali Tepelini, pasha of Yanina, and of Vasiliki, his beloved wife.’

11f483e411fcf4fdf50e22900e51e542.constraint_text: She has a persistent prejudice against the Danglars family that prevents her from approving the marriage.
11f483e411fcf4fdf50e22900e51e542.source_excerpt: she has a clear and penetrating judgment, and does not smile on the proposed union. I cannot account for it, but she seems to entertain some prejudice against the Danglars.

9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.constraint_text: The Morrel family gave trouble due to their violent Bonapartism around 1815
9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.source_excerpt: ‘...the Morrel family who lived at Marseilles, and gave us so much trouble from their violent Bonapartism—I mean about the year 1815.’

9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.constraint_text: The Morrel family lived in Marseilles
9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.source_excerpt: ‘...the Morrel family who lived at Marseilles...’

9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.constraint_text: The son is the child of the old shipowner
9dacaaeec7ac043f3ec84241055a0675.source_excerpt: ‘...he is the son of the old shipowner.’

9bfd246b8c939ddfbd079a7beb7d4f78.constraint_text: A father's faults cannot be inherited by their children in this changing age
9bfd246b8c939ddfbd079a7beb7d4f78.source_excerpt: "...the faults of a father cannot revert upon his children."

4189ec44ad34072aa2876dc2e641c79d.constraint_text: Albert's father is Fernand Mondego, Count of Morcerf
4189ec44ad34072aa2876dc2e641c79d.source_excerpt: "He is merely my father," said Albert—"M. Fernand Mondego, Count of Morcerf, an old soldier who has fought in twenty battles and whose honorable scars they would denounce as badges of disgrace."

4189ec44ad34072aa2876dc2e641c79d.constraint_text: Beauchamp has committed to retracting the assertion immediately
4189ec44ad34072aa2876dc2e641c79d.source_excerpt: "You will retract this assertion, will you not, Beauchamp?" said Albert... "Yes," replied Beauchamp. "Immediately?" said Albert.

aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.constraint_text: They must patiently endure their present condition.
aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.source_excerpt: They then conversed, but not about their present condition, which they must patiently endure.

aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.constraint_text: Glenarvan had no consoling answer to make for the first time.
aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.source_excerpt: Glenarvan, for the first time, had no consoling answer to make.

aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.constraint_text: All hope of finding Captain Grant and his sailors is considered irrevocably lost.
aa9a642bf0fd6786e6e18529772130f1.source_excerpt: after this failure, after this vain search in South America, as if all hope of finding them were irrevocably lost.

0b8d47923bbae6e95f57cb5ff2d55a67.constraint_text: Morrel must not leave the Count of Monte Cristo.
0b8d47923bbae6e95f57cb5ff2d55a67.source_excerpt: "On the contrary," said the count, "after this time you must live with me—you must not leave me, and in a week we shall have left France behind us."

d08a104ff010ac5b131d3654b036202a.constraint_text: The probable expenditure for the first year is fixed at six million.
d08a104ff010ac5b131d3654b036202a.source_excerpt: we may as well fix a sum as the probable expenditure of the first year, suppose we say six millions to——

d08a104ff010ac5b131d3654b036202a.constraint_text: Monte Cristo intends not to remain in France for more than a year.
d08a104ff010ac5b131d3654b036202a.source_excerpt: my present intention is not to remain in France more than a year, and during that period I scarcely think I shall exceed the sum I mentioned.

bb0ec09df3baec2482a913b0def1e0fc.constraint_text: A withdrawal from Paris is absolutely necessary after the double catastrophe of Mademoiselle Danglars’ broken contract and M. Danglars’ disappearance.
bb0ec09df3baec2482a913b0def1e0fc.source_excerpt: In my opinion, a withdrawal from Paris is absolutely necessary after the double catastrophe of Mademoiselle Danglars’ broken contract and M. Danglars’ disappearance.

bb0ec09df3baec2482a913b0def1e0fc.constraint_text: The baroness is explicitly confirmed as 'deserted' by her own admission, aligning with Debray’s assertion.
bb0ec09df3baec2482a913b0def1e0fc.source_excerpt: Deserted?... You are right, sir, and no one can doubt my position.

2781be3509bd129424b009b2048db4be.constraint_text: Mercédès thinks only of herself and no one else.
2781be3509bd129424b009b2048db4be.source_excerpt: she thought of herself—of no one but herself.

7846ba752ada3fb91b1772955b0df5f2.constraint_text: If Monte Cristo dies, Haydée explicitly refuses to accept his fortune and requires nothing from him
7846ba752ada3fb91b1772955b0df5f2.source_excerpt: "Well, if you die, bequeath your fortune to others, for if you die I shall require nothing;"

f8b0bd508047d32c3cd7b3ab69fc07f6.constraint_text: Her belief that the king was 'Louis the well-beloved' and Napoleon was 'Napoleon the accursed' persists as an unchanging conviction
f8b0bd508047d32c3cd7b3ab69fc07f6.source_excerpt: we were content to follow the fortunes of a falling monarch... while their wretched usurper has been, and ever will be, to them their evil genius, their 'Napoleon the accursed'

39cafa23c3848c1ec500de6605b9b1c7.constraint_text: Cucumetto became enamoured of Teresa and swore she should be his because he was saved by the two young peasants
39cafa23c3848c1ec500de6605b9b1c7.source_excerpt: From the day on which the bandit had been saved by the two young peasants, he had been enamoured of Teresa, and had sworn she should be his.

e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.constraint_text: The seraskier must not harm the honor of Ali's widow
e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.source_excerpt: 'Kill,' said she, 'but spare the honor of the widow of Ali.'

e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.constraint_text: The authority to act lies with Haydée's new master
e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.source_excerpt: 'It is not to me to whom you must address yourself,' said Kourchid. 'To whom, then?'—'To your new master.'

e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.constraint_text: Her father's death was caused by the new master
e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.source_excerpt: And Kourchid pointed out one who had more than any contributed to the death of my father

e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.constraint_text: She did not become the property of the new master
e519d72b0ccc2f07787af2d271190faa.source_excerpt: 'No,' replied Haydée, 'he did not dare to keep us'

4c94483d2824b89f93f80b7bcea2f5df.constraint_text: Believes that divine vengeance is delayed but becomes more effective over time
4c94483d2824b89f93f80b7bcea2f5df.source_excerpt: "My God! thy vengeance is sometimes delayed, but only that it may fall the more effectually."

204055f260eee75f339c1d4ca7a70145.constraint_text: His mother died at his birth
204055f260eee75f339c1d4ca7a70145.source_excerpt: his mother having died at his birth
his father having been assassinated in 1815

204055f260eee75f339c1d4ca7a70145.constraint_text: He has seldom acknowledged any authority other than his own will
204055f260eee75f339c1d4ca7a70145.source_excerpt: he has, therefore, seldom acknowledged any other authority but that of his own will

6a66d048c7dc2b88414247ba806ea827.constraint_text: The countess has consistently warned Albert against new acquaintances throughout his life.
6a66d048c7dc2b88414247ba806ea827.source_excerpt: I have always put you on your guard against new acquaintances.

fb5d40f549bd9b65034b44dd1477d12f.constraint_text: Ayrton cannot escape from the island.
fb5d40f549bd9b65034b44dd1477d12f.source_excerpt: from which I shall not be able to escape.

fb5d40f549bd9b65034b44dd1477d12f.constraint_text: Ayrton acts frankly because he relies upon Glenarvan's loyalty.
fb5d40f549bd9b65034b44dd1477d12f.source_excerpt: I act frankly, because I rely upon your loyalty.

6f1e5d3b567a31b44cd24ef6ceab09dc.constraint_text: Andrea will say and do nothing until convinced his protector has abandoned him.
6f1e5d3b567a31b44cd24ef6ceab09dc.source_excerpt: I will say and do nothing until I am convinced that he has quite abandoned me

6f1e5d3b567a31b44cd24ef6ceab09dc.constraint_text: Andrea suffers from being naked, dirty, and hungry due to prolonged privation.
6f1e5d3b567a31b44cd24ef6ceab09dc.source_excerpt: he suffered from being naked, dirty, and hungry

4a8073730ceb8f76c0dc69ff8de44625.constraint_text: Louis XVIII refuses to be overly confiding in others
4a8073730ceb8f76c0dc69ff8de44625.source_excerpt: "...but you must not expect me to be too confiding."

902d4e8009169784bf2d3795e17d6d65.constraint_text: Caderousse's silence during Dantès's arrest is explicitly stated as the cause of his current 'abject condition'.
902d4e8009169784bf2d3795e17d6d65.source_excerpt: I often ask pardon of God, I swear to you, because this action, the only one with which I have seriously to reproach myself in all my life, is no doubt the cause of my abject condition.

902d4e8009169784bf2d3795e17d6d65.constraint_text: Caderousse was physically restrained from speaking by Danglars during Dantès's arrest.
902d4e8009169784bf2d3795e17d6d65.source_excerpt: but Danglars restrained me. ‘If he should really be guilty...’ said he... I confess I had my fears... and I held my tongue.

fcba2bb872ac45d1b2289b079cae089e.constraint_text: Beauchamp possesses definitive knowledge about the fate of Vasiliki and Haydée.
fcba2bb872ac45d1b2289b079cae089e.source_excerpt: I know what is become of Vasiliki and Haydée.

91119d9b68f51f1ff63fd66b3d358e11.constraint_text: If Captain Grant is alive, he must be in Australia
91119d9b68f51f1ff63fd66b3d358e11.source_excerpt: if Captain Grant still lives, you must seek him in Australia

91119d9b68f51f1ff63fd66b3d358e11.constraint_text: Ayrton was a companion of Mary's father and a survivor of the Britannia shipwreck
91119d9b68f51f1ff63fd66b3d358e11.source_excerpt: This sailor had been a companion of her father, one of the shipwrecked survivors of the Britannia

bc8d52be6fb7c79be0fd9cc98219ba48.constraint_text: Ayrton's silence persisted despite attempts to extract information
bc8d52be6fb7c79be0fd9cc98219ba48.source_excerpt: hence he persisted in his silence, and was greatly enraged, especially towards the sailors who would accuse him of an evil design

896b2f838a0929b2113cb9c9e6f6de9b.constraint_text: Captain Grant must have fallen victim to the sea or savages if he did not appear within two years of the disaster.
896b2f838a0929b2113cb9c9e6f6de9b.source_excerpt: Because, admitting that Captain Grant was wrecked on the coast of New Zealand, as long as he has not made his appearance for two years since the disaster, he must have fallen a victim to the sea or the savages.

896b2f838a0929b2113cb9c9e6f6de9b.constraint_text: The seamen of the Britannia have perished.
896b2f838a0929b2113cb9c9e6f6de9b.source_excerpt: That we might perhaps find some traces of the shipwreck, but that the seamen of the Britannia have perished.

47eb927d4898d5dbbf1ed430517c71ad.constraint_text: Will Halley refused to take the precaution of cutting away the waistcloth to facilitate water egress.
47eb927d4898d5dbbf1ed430517c71ad.source_excerpt: but Will Halley refused to take this precaution.

45ad92631efb9705f1f89fff99afb148.constraint_text: Ayrton adheres to his determination to be abandoned on Tabor Island.
45ad92631efb9705f1f89fff99afb148.source_excerpt: "Do you still adhere, Ayrton, to this determination to be abandoned?" ... "Yes, my lord."

45ad92631efb9705f1f89fff99afb148.constraint_text: Ayrton will be left alone on Tabor Island with no communication to others.
45ad92631efb9705f1f89fff99afb148.source_excerpt: "You will be far removed from every land, and deprived of all communication with your fellow-men."

8ea9abeeabed57d7abba8c8974a1b80c.constraint_text: The island Maria Theresa is absolutely isolated, with no ships or communication reaching it, making it the only viable location for Ayrton's exile.
8ea9abeeabed57d7abba8c8974a1b80c.source_excerpt: No ship ever came within hail of this solitary isle; no tidings from the world ever reached it.

27b719545dcac930a55d042667bac3a9.constraint_text: Beauchamp will not act against Albert until the 21st of September
27b719545dcac930a55d042667bac3a9.source_excerpt: Today is the 29th of August; the 21st of September will, therefore, be the conclusion of the term agreed on, and till that time arrives—and it is the advice of a gentleman which I am about to give you—till then we will refrain from growling and barking like two dogs chained within sight of each other.

27b719545dcac930a55d042667bac3a9.constraint_text: Beauchamp refuses to split Albert's skull until the 21st of September
27b719545dcac930a55d042667bac3a9.source_excerpt: I cannot throw you out of window for three weeks—that is to say, for twenty-four days to come—nor have you any right to split my skull open till that time has elapsed.

6a7faf6d1e2daee477ca799c716000fa.constraint_text: Andrea, being twenty-one, has the ability to forget the past, unlike the older speaker who must remember it.
6a7faf6d1e2daee477ca799c716000fa.source_excerpt: Ah, you are only one-and-twenty, and can forget the past; I am fifty, and am obliged to recollect it.

b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.constraint_text: The Count is compelled by both inclination and necessity to visit Paris.
b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.source_excerpt: "I pledge you my honor," returned the count, "that I mean to do as I have said; both inclination and positive necessity compel me to visit Paris."

b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.constraint_text: The Count explicitly fixes his arrival in Paris to May 21st at half-past ten o'clock.
b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.source_excerpt: "today is the 21st of February;" ... "expect me the 21st of May at the same hour in the forenoon."

b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.constraint_text: The Count is described as proverbially punctilious in keeping engagements.
b85429b6d65b8360e40740fc57c47618.source_excerpt: "only let me warn you that I am proverbial for my punctilious exactitude in keeping my engagements."

25d0323930a13bfd2b13d4cc954a6237.constraint_text: The misfortunes that occurred to the young man were entirely beyond his control.
The young man was taken from his father and intended to be sold again, which was calculated to preserve and increase his personal and hereditary worth.
25d0323930a13bfd2b13d4cc954a6237.source_excerpt: Those who took me from my father, and who always intended, sooner or later, to sell me again to my original proprietor, as they have now done, calculated that, in order to make the most of their bargain, it would be politic to leave me in possession of all my personal and hereditary worth, and even to increase the value, if possible.

a7ccb905ebad581df99c561d304d765c.constraint_text: He is left five hundred thousand livres by his father in the will.
a7ccb905ebad581df99c561d304d765c.source_excerpt: He leaves me five hundred thousand livres.

a7ccb905ebad581df99c561d304d765c.constraint_text: His father acknowledges him in a codicil to the will.
a7ccb905ebad581df99c561d304d765c.source_excerpt: in that codicil he acknowledges me.

c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.constraint_text: Danglars has always intended to give his daughter 500,000 francs as her dowry
c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.source_excerpt: "I have always intended giving my daughter 500,000 francs as her dowry"

c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.constraint_text: Danglars's daughter is explicitly stated to be his sole heiress
c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.source_excerpt: she is, besides, my sole heiress.

c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.constraint_text: Cavalcanti's low-born nature is described as an inherent trait that occasionally surfaces despite his aristocratic pretensions
c3baab563760c600151062072603b334.source_excerpt: Cavalcanti, yielding to his low-born nature, which would escape sometimes through the aristocratic gloss with which he sought to conceal it.

2d1563a97c7024ebf23fcaec2c8e965b.constraint_text: Danglars possesses five million in bonds payable at sight, demonstrating his access to immediate liquidity and high credit.
2d1563a97c7024ebf23fcaec2c8e965b.source_excerpt: ‘To the Governor of the Bank. Please pay to my order, from the fund deposited by me, the sum of a million, and charge the same to my account. “Baron Danglars.”’ “One, two, three, four, five,” said Monte Cristo; “five millions—why what a Crœsus you are!” “This is how I transact business,” said Danglars. “It is really wonderful,” said the count; “above all, if, as I suppose, it is payable at sight.” “It is, indeed,” said Danglars.

4d9680cf2a49170d3b1617577ddf84eb.constraint_text: Danglars never gives more than four percent interest, typically only three and a half percent
4d9680cf2a49170d3b1617577ddf84eb.source_excerpt: "I never give more than four per cent, and generally only three and a half; but to my son-in-law I would give five, and we would share the profits."

4d9680cf2a49170d3b1617577ddf84eb.constraint_text: Cavalcanti's low-born nature periodically escapes through his aristocratic demeanor
4d9680cf2a49170d3b1617577ddf84eb.source_excerpt: yielding to his low-born nature, which would escape sometimes through the aristocratic gloss with which he sought to conceal it

56e9f9e3a222d8f2d5a92e6fef67e200.constraint_text: The five and a half million belong to charitable institutions, not to the banker.
56e9f9e3a222d8f2d5a92e6fef67e200.source_excerpt: my title of popular banker has gained me the confidence of charitable institutions, and the five millions and a half belong to them

56e9f9e3a222d8f2d5a92e6fef67e200.constraint_text: Using the five and a half million for purposes other than their intended deposit would cause a disgraceful bankruptcy.
56e9f9e3a222d8f2d5a92e6fef67e200.source_excerpt: if I had employed it for another purpose, I should bring on me a disgraceful bankruptcy

539afa150512be67c8412109b2310de7.constraint_text: Faria's sanity is evidenced by his fixed, convincing gaze
539afa150512be67c8412109b2310de7.source_excerpt: Faria fixed his eyes on him with an expression that would have convinced anyone else of his sanity.

b27e65c43097cb0f237312f9bba334a2.constraint_text: Dantès is an inveterate Bonapartist with a long-standing political allegiance.
b27e65c43097cb0f237312f9bba334a2.source_excerpt: An inveterate Bonapartist; took an active part in the return from the Island of Elba.

b27e65c43097cb0f237312f9bba334a2.constraint_text: Dantès is kept in strict solitary confinement and under constant surveillance.
b27e65c43097cb0f237312f9bba334a2.source_excerpt: To be kept in strict solitary confinement, and to be closely watched and guarded.

16ab29fb9dde994ed29b36448b4880cb.constraint_text: The banker cannot use the five and a half million deposit for other purposes, as doing so would cause a 'disgraceful bankruptcy'.
16ab29fb9dde994ed29b36448b4880cb.source_excerpt: That deposit may be at any moment withdrawn, and if I had employed it for another purpose, I should bring on me a disgraceful bankruptcy.

ea8de29521eac7b0f542c1feabd44e7c.constraint_text: Cavalcanti presented a bond of 40,000 francs payable at sight, signed by Busoni and endorsed by Monte Cristo.
ea8de29521eac7b0f542c1feabd44e7c.source_excerpt: he presented himself this morning with a bond of 40,000 francs, payable at sight, on you, signed by Busoni, and returned by you to me, with your endorsement—of course, I immediately counted him over the forty bank-notes.

ea8de29521eac7b0f542c1feabd44e7c.constraint_text: Cavalcanti allows his son a monthly allowance of 5,000 francs (60,000 francs per year).
ea8de29521eac7b0f542c1feabd44e7c.source_excerpt: he has opened an account with my house for his son... Five thousand francs per month.

503120f31d037428aa8b166ba9dafdc8.constraint_text: Debray's decision to put money out to interest was explicitly permitted by the baroness
503120f31d037428aa8b166ba9dafdc8.source_excerpt: "I had your permission to do so, and I have made use of it."

6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.constraint_text: Danglars will not tolerate Hermine interfering with his cash box.
6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.source_excerpt: Do as you like with your own, but do not fill or empty mine.

6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.constraint_text: Danglars claims he has never interfered in Hermine's affairs except for her good.
6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.source_excerpt: I have never interfered in your affairs excepting for your good; treat me in the same way.

6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.constraint_text: The apprenticeship cost of 700,000 francs per month cannot continue indefinitely.
6b2e468d96e4026ceebc36b43e0b560b.source_excerpt: Stop there, madame, for this cannot last.

cb46907e785edb1334e4fe75bb53d96e.constraint_text: Andrea's wish to be addressed as 'your excellency' caused others to use this title when speaking to him.
cb46907e785edb1334e4fe75bb53d96e.source_excerpt: Andrea had expressed a wish to be thus addressed.

b738188b82e54e1f3e6e058f05601a7c.constraint_text: Bankers require written documents to be valid
b738188b82e54e1f3e6e058f05601a7c.source_excerpt: "You know that with bankers nothing but a written document will be valid."

52bc32176a4f3fdb3080d1d4707348f5.constraint_text: She was ordinarily querulous and indifferent to all who approached her
52bc32176a4f3fdb3080d1d4707348f5.source_excerpt: the woman, who was ordinarily so querulous and indifferent to all who approached her

6ec741739615e8ba8221d28665d5ed34.constraint_text: Her independent, proud spirit makes marriage to Debray 'utterly impossible' despite his recurring consideration of the idea.
6ec741739615e8ba8221d28665d5ed34.source_excerpt: when he recollected the independent, proud spirit of Eugénie, he positively rejected it as utterly impossible, though the same thought again continually recurred and found a resting-place in his heart.

a1df447cb884bc44636489ea9f6f4644.constraint_text: M. Debray must either bear his share of the 700,000 francs loss or face bankruptcy and disappearance.
a1df447cb884bc44636489ea9f6f4644.source_excerpt: M. Debray has made me lose 700,000 francs; let him bear his share of the loss, and we will go on as before; if not, let him become bankrupt for the 250,000 livres, and do as all bankrupts do—disappear.

d74edbc4cf8bb9a5d2dc44d30550f2c2.constraint_text: A recurring thought about Eugénie continually finds a resting-place in his heart despite his rejection of it as impossible
d74edbc4cf8bb9a5d2dc44d30550f2c2.source_excerpt: still, when he recollected the independent, proud spirit of Eugénie, he positively rejected it as utterly impossible, though the same thought again continually recurred and found a resting-place in his heart

d74edbc4cf8bb9a5d2dc44d30550f2c2.constraint_text: Women of a certain grade seldom return home after twelve o’clock
d74edbc4cf8bb9a5d2dc44d30550f2c2.source_excerpt: Women of a certain grade are like prosperous grisettes in one respect, they seldom return home after twelve o’clock

f763bfe386db46cce3a99cbfbecbbe22.constraint_text: She no longer indulges in speculation, despite having been fond of it in the past.
f763bfe386db46cce3a99cbfbecbbe22.source_excerpt: I was once very fond of it, but I do not indulge now.

b4df42d0d8aafa8cfc4d65cdda4bb245.constraint_text: Danglars knew only that the ship was loaded with cotton and took freight from specific warehouses, and was not required to know further details.
b4df42d0d8aafa8cfc4d65cdda4bb245.source_excerpt: I know she was loaded with cotton, and that she took in her freight at Alexandria from Pastret’s warehouse, and at Smyrna from Pascal’s; that is all I was obliged to know, and I beg I may not be asked for any further particulars.

b4df42d0d8aafa8cfc4d65cdda4bb245.constraint_text: Dantès communicated to his father about a case of coffee and tobacco for him the day before the current events.
b4df42d0d8aafa8cfc4d65cdda4bb245.source_excerpt: my poor boy told me yesterday he had got a small case of coffee, and another of tobacco for me!

9c47e8ca0020f213871ac18ffd49a77d.constraint_text: Valentine had considered a chain of circumstances as irrefragable (unbreakable) prior to this moment
9c47e8ca0020f213871ac18ffd49a77d.source_excerpt: breaking with a single blow the chain which she had been accustomed to consider as irrefragable

32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.constraint_text: The nurse locked the door after placing the beverage within reach of the patient.
32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.source_excerpt: The nurse, having placed the beverage prepared by the doctor within reach of the patient, and locked the door

32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.constraint_text: Ten minutes had elapsed since the nurse left the room.
32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.source_excerpt: Ten minutes had elapsed since the nurse had left

32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.constraint_text: Valentine suffers from a nightly fever that incapacitates her control over her thoughts.
32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.source_excerpt: Valentine, who for the last hour had been suffering from the fever which returned nightly, incapable of controlling her ideas

32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.constraint_text: The recurrence of Valentine’s fever causes her to lose control over her thoughts.
32edd1a1b610ca7d889a2e946d0e76a7.source_excerpt: suffering from the fever which returned nightly, incapable of controlling her ideas

986710ad0fffb85aad90f1a4c8e74001.constraint_text: Madame de Villefort's orders cannot be infringed with impunity due to her high position and reputation
986710ad0fffb85aad90f1a4c8e74001.source_excerpt: he is not a person whose orders may be infringed with impunity; protected as he is by his high position and firmly established reputation for talent and unswerving integrity, no one could oppose him

e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.constraint_text: The count has no pretension to nobility and calls himself a 'chance count'.
e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.source_excerpt: Except this, he has no pretension to nobility, and calls himself a chance count

e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.constraint_text: The general opinion at Rome is that the count is a man of very high distinction.
e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.source_excerpt: the general opinion at Rome is that the count is a man of very high distinction

e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.constraint_text: The countess asserts that the count's manners surpass those of the leading aristocracy of England, Spain, and Germany.
e9997044ce35aae9643c08e8e8a877b2.source_excerpt: They are perfect... so perfect, that they surpass by far all I have known in the leading aristocracy of the three proudest nobilities of Europe—the English, the Spanish, and the German

c34663d7b7974445173d7300183536ab.constraint_text: Albert de Morcerf's title as 'count' is invalid because he 'made himself' a count rather than being officially granted the title.
c34663d7b7974445173d7300183536ab.source_excerpt: "I have been made a baron, so that I actually am one; he made himself a count, so that he is not one at all."

b195f6fc3ba734725e448c8018cd9b2a.constraint_text: The countess is described as 'quite beautiful enough to represent a Madonna', establishing a persistent trait of her appearance.
b195f6fc3ba734725e448c8018cd9b2a.source_excerpt: the countess is quite beautiful enough to represent a Madonna.

a6f417269a85dda2b9bc47d2c390613c.constraint_text: Louis XVIII is described as a man who likes a pleasant jest, indicating a consistent personal trait.
a6f417269a85dda2b9bc47d2c390613c.source_excerpt: Man of ability as he was, Louis XVIII. liked a pleasant jest.

7d1a8cbe7d4711cf24ece92f50a3cbbf.constraint_text: Her belief that Napoleon is 'their evil genius' persists indefinitely
7d1a8cbe7d4711cf24ece92f50a3cbbf.source_excerpt: '...their wretched usurper has been, and ever will be, to them their evil genius, their 'Napoleon the accursed.'

3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.constraint_text: Maximilian's prospects of military preferment are certain and encouraging.
3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.source_excerpt: my prospects of military preferment are most encouraging as well as certain.

3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.constraint_text: Maximilian's fortune is small but free and unfettered.
3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.source_excerpt: My fortune, though small, is free and unfettered,

3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.constraint_text: The memory of Maximilian's late father is respected as that of the most upright and honorable merchant in their country.
3b36698f840d99293ef53929deaea5b7.source_excerpt: the memory of my late father is respected in our country, Valentine, as that of the most upright and honorable merchant of the city

83e7c80a998007a22f216282377c4c0c.constraint_text: Her injuries have not yet been repaired
83e7c80a998007a22f216282377c4c0c.source_excerpt: her injuries cannot yet have been repaired

4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.constraint_text: Kara-Tété's name means 'The Irascible' in the native language.
4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.source_excerpt: His name was Kara-Tété, which means in the native language 'The Irascible.'

4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.constraint_text: Kara-Tété is described as having a fierce and cruel aspect.
4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.source_excerpt: He was a man of about forty, robust, and of fierce and cruel aspect.

4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.constraint_text: Kai-Koumou rules the powerful tribes of the Waikato with equal rank to Kara-Tété.
4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.source_excerpt: They both ruled the powerful tribes of the Waikato with equal rank.

4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.constraint_text: Kara-Tété rules the powerful tribes of the Waikato with equal rank to Kai-Koumou.
4381c846bad2559f0175a81b720ae513.source_excerpt: They both ruled the powerful tribes of the Waikato with equal rank.

28e1b215ff43d2d9223d3a0a6757c294.constraint_text: They resolved to feign proud indifference to influence the savages
28e1b215ff43d2d9223d3a0a6757c294.source_excerpt: By common consent, at Glenarvan's suggestion, they had resolved to feign a proud indifference in the presence of the savages. It was the only way of influencing those fierce natures.

28e1b215ff43d2d9223d3a0a6757c294.constraint_text: They had scarcely spoken to each other since leaving the encampment
28e1b215ff43d2d9223d3a0a6757c294.source_excerpt: Since leaving the encampment, the natives, taciturn like all savages, had scarcely spoken to each other.

63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.constraint_text: The taboo prohibits all connection with the object or person tabooed
63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.source_excerpt: The taboo... has the power to prohibit at once all connection with the object or person tabooed

63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.constraint_text: Violation of the taboo results in death by the offended god or priestly intervention
63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.source_excerpt: whoever should lay his sacrilegious hand on what is declared taboo would be punished with death by the offended god... the priests would not fail to excite his anger

63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.constraint_text: His death is the only atonement for the murder of a chief
63daf6a3e6eedca3ec7d5907c4ad1b52.source_excerpt: Only his death could atone for the murder of a chief

fb21d1b1cd10e61a78ca750f6de0bbaf.constraint_text: M. de Morcerf entered the room at the last stroke of eight o’clock.
fb21d1b1cd10e61a78ca750f6de0bbaf.source_excerpt: At eight o’clock all were in their places, and M. de Morcerf entered at the last stroke.

fb21d1b1cd10e61a78ca750f6de0bbaf.constraint_text: The Vizier of Yanina honored M. de Morcerf with entire confidence because he was involved in a negotiation of life and death with the emperor.
fb21d1b1cd10e61a78ca750f6de0bbaf.source_excerpt: He produced documents proving that the Vizier of Yanina had up to the last moment honored him with his entire confidence, since he had interested him with a negotiation of life and death with the emperor.

034fc254b01b03fb727ae2932549937a.constraint_text: Possesses a scrutinizing glance that is 'so rarely deceived', indicating a persistent and reliable observational ability
034fc254b01b03fb727ae2932549937a.source_excerpt: with that scrutinizing glance which was so rarely deceived

fa442942e71ea443186741516f92e989.constraint_text: Captain Mangles' promise to watch over Robert caused Miss Grant's apprehension for her brother's safety to be allayed
fa442942e71ea443186741516f92e989.source_excerpt: Captain Mangles had promised to watch over him, a fact which tended not a little to allay Miss Grant's apprehension for her brother's safety.

9002c236795b08dd7c16d1d441c152dd.constraint_text: The convicts could not have attacked due to insufficient numbers
9002c236795b08dd7c16d1d441c152dd.source_excerpt: "They cannot have been in sufficient force to attack us," added Mulready.

9002c236795b08dd7c16d1d441c152dd.constraint_text: The convicts' cowardice is cited as the reason for their hesitation to attack
9002c236795b08dd7c16d1d441c152dd.source_excerpt: "These rascals are cowards. They know we are well armed, and are perhaps waiting for darkness to commence their attack."

1a0d663474d292a891e99071891eb456.constraint_text: Despite his sister's injunctions, young Robert was always ahead and the first to fire during the hunt.
1a0d663474d292a891e99071891eb456.source_excerpt: The intrepid boy, in spite of his sister's injunctions, was always ahead, and the first to fire.

af9ec9f7666212a397788baf3a42ff2a.constraint_text: Ali must remain concealed in the dark and only act if explicitly called by Monte Cristo
af9ec9f7666212a397788baf3a42ff2a.source_excerpt: “Remain here, concealed in the dark, and whatever noise you hear, whatever passes, only come in or show yourself if I call you.” Ali bowed in token of strict obedience.

63fb547279b6cdb081cbea64f4208a08.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's true identity is Edmond Dantès, as confirmed by the veiled woman's use of his birth name and his reaction to it.
63fb547279b6cdb081cbea64f4208a08.source_excerpt: What name did you pronounce then, Madame de Morcerf?

d35caed18c7d8f7e64f98765b9204301.constraint_text: The missionary was driven by the war far from the principal dwellings of the insurrectionists
d35caed18c7d8f7e64f98765b9204301.source_excerpt: The missionary had been driven by the war far from the principal dwellings of the insurrectionists.

500a6b4e64a11da9e7a597bfefc7b126.constraint_text: The captain has sufficient provisions and coal, having procured ample supplies at Talcahuana and the ability to restock at Cape Town.
500a6b4e64a11da9e7a597bfefc7b126.source_excerpt: "Yes, my lord, I procured ample supplies at Talcahuana, and, besides, we can lay in a fresh stock of fuel at Cape Town."

3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.constraint_text: O'Moore's agricultural knowledge was a direct cause of his success in farming.
3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.source_excerpt: His agricultural knowledge was a great aid to him.

3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.constraint_text: At the time of the narrative, O'Moore owned 500 acres of land and 500 head of cattle.
3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.source_excerpt: he owned at that moment five hundred acres of well-cultivated land and five hundred head of cattle

3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.constraint_text: O'Moore consistently refrained from pressuring others to share confidence, even when he expected it.
3f1582b31bdc8a1d209a87a6afcbfb28.source_excerpt: He doubtless expected a similar confidence, but did not urge it.

309632fde8c4375864913508a58d4246.constraint_text: The major cannot possibly live outside Lucca.
309632fde8c4375864913508a58d4246.source_excerpt: "As for me, you must know I cannot possibly live out of Lucca; therefore I shall return to Italy as soon as I can."

309632fde8c4375864913508a58d4246.constraint_text: Andrea is accustomed to reading documents like baptismal registers and marriage certificates.
309632fde8c4375864913508a58d4246.source_excerpt: "he read them with a facility which proved that he was accustomed to similar documents"

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The speaker was alone during their conversation with Captain Leclere.
Danglars passed by during the exchange of the packet with Captain Leclere.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: Danglars himself passed by just as Captain Leclere was giving me the packet for the grand marshal.

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The speaker traveled to the port of Elba without accompaniment.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: Did you take anybody with you when you put into the port of Elba? Nobody.

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The grand marshal exchanged the packet for a letter during the speaker's visit to Elba.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: Somebody there received your packet, and gave you a letter in place of it, I think? Yes; the grand marshal did.

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The speaker left the portfolio on board the ship.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: You are right; it was left on board.

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The speaker placed the letter in the portfolio before returning to the ship.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: Then it was not till your return to the ship that you put the letter in the portfolio? No.

acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.constraint_text: The speaker carried the letter in their hand while returning from Porto-Ferrajo to the ship.
acb292be66997bea1615719b0d853b39.source_excerpt: I carried it in my hand.

edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.constraint_text: The selected estate must have a small harbor, creek, or bay to accommodate the count's corvette.
edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.source_excerpt: It will be absolutely necessary that the place you may select have a small harbor, creek, or bay, into which my corvette can enter and remain at anchor.

edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.constraint_text: The corvette must be kept in constant readiness to sail immediately upon the count's signal.
edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.source_excerpt: She must be kept in constant readiness to sail immediately I think proper to give the signal.

edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.constraint_text: The estate must be purchased in Bertuccio's own name.
edcdbe984b8b5b4c185346eeb184988f.source_excerpt: purchase it at once in your own name.

b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.constraint_text: Ali's fate is determined by the arrival of the firman today
b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.source_excerpt: today arrives the firman of the master, and my fate will be decided

b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.constraint_text: Ali has been parched by violent fever and drinks iced water constantly since his sojourn at the kiosk
b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.source_excerpt: since his sojourn at the kiosk he had been parched by the most violent fever... he was in the habit of constantly drinking

b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.constraint_text: The mother's sighs are caused by her knowledge that Ali's consolations do not come from his father's heart
b490631e213a73abfa899d1bf2a43764.source_excerpt: My mother only answered by sighs to consolations which she knew did not come from my father’s heart

0542d49873bc8129e914a1a3b38f781f.constraint_text: Glenarvan's hat was pierced by two bullets, indicating exposure to gunfire during this specific encounter.
0542d49873bc8129e914a1a3b38f781f.source_excerpt: Glenarvan's hat had been pierced by two bullets.

0542d49873bc8129e914a1a3b38f781f.constraint_text: Kara-Tété wore his best night-robes in the tomb, which were used as protective coverings during this escape.
0542d49873bc8129e914a1a3b38f781f.source_excerpt: Kara-Tété wore in the tomb his best night-robes, warm, flaxen coverings...

ae0f75e4d91bed09fa9e9d72864cadff.constraint_text: The emperor has granted a full pardon to the Vizier Ali, restoring his life, fortune, and possessions.
ae0f75e4d91bed09fa9e9d72864cadff.source_excerpt: ‘Long live the emperor!’ said the figure. ‘He grants a full pardon to the Vizier Ali, and not only gives him his life, but restores to him his fortune and his possessions.’

ae0f75e4d91bed09fa9e9d72864cadff.constraint_text: Selim has not yet received the ring, which is a prerequisite for proceeding.
ae0f75e4d91bed09fa9e9d72864cadff.source_excerpt: ‘Stop,’ said Selim, seeing that she was about to go out; ‘you see I have not yet received the ring,’—‘True,’ said my mother.

9018cc7902ad413b9ecf4168eee928aa.constraint_text: The Patagonian's face denotes real intelligence despite the colors that adorn it
9018cc7902ad413b9ecf4168eee928aa.source_excerpt: The figure of this Patagonian was fine, and his face denoted real intelligence in spite of the colors that adorned (!) it.

65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.constraint_text: Paganel was physically restrained by strong flaxen ropes, especially at night, by Chief Hihy.
65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.source_excerpt: not only by his benefits, but by strong flaxen ropes, especially at night.

65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.constraint_text: Paganel was a prisoner of the Maoris under Chief Hihy.
65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.source_excerpt: he was a prisoner, and, except for the prospect of immediate torture, his condition did not seem more enviable...

65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.constraint_text: Paganel's capture by the Maoris was caused by his falling upon their encampment after escaping.
65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.source_excerpt: he had fallen upon an encampment of Maoris, who were commanded by a chief...

65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.constraint_text: Paganel's captivity lasted exactly three days.
65b5e358fa378c9eb95693c5ac6a6bdb.source_excerpt: This novel situation lasted three long days.

ddede9e8928325306f7c6222aebf38f4.constraint_text: The father killed two men by firing pistols during the confrontation.
ddede9e8928325306f7c6222aebf38f4.source_excerpt: he had fired them himself, and had killed two men.

ddede9e8928325306f7c6222aebf38f4.constraint_text: The father's loud laugh was explicitly described as more frightful than threats.
ddede9e8928325306f7c6222aebf38f4.source_excerpt: My father answered with a loud laugh, which was more frightful than even threats would have been

1c780f4d4b888933b6b8a4a1eab65e05.constraint_text: Glenarvan's decision to hunt was caused by his belief that the banks of the Guamini are the haunt of surrounding plains' game.
1c780f4d4b888933b6b8a4a1eab65e05.source_excerpt: Glenarvan had conceived this idea because the banks of the Guamini seemed to be the haunt of the game of the surrounding plains.

dd274ce11a6cb75ab1336cbdd95b2281.constraint_text: The black may call the 'reserved' territory their own despite the white man's liberty to invade it.
dd274ce11a6cb75ab1336cbdd95b2281.source_excerpt: Though the white man is at perfect liberty to invade this 'reserved' territory, yet the black may call it his own.

abef72cc5a2021a8093ea903a90fd51e.constraint_text: Robert does not fear anything as long as he is with Glenarvan.

fcaa26bad841d89a8e6dea06611d1f2d.constraint_text: Louis XVIII has decided to change de Blacas's armorial bearings to an eagle with outstretched wings holding prey and the device 'Tenax.'
fcaa26bad841d89a8e6dea06611d1f2d.source_excerpt: "I must change your armorial bearings; I will give you an eagle with outstretched wings, holding in its claws a prey which tries in vain to escape, and bearing this device—_Tenax_."

fcaa26bad841d89a8e6dea06611d1f2d.constraint_text: De Blacas exhibits impatience, as evidenced by biting his nails while listening to Louis XVIII.
fcaa26bad841d89a8e6dea06611d1f2d.source_excerpt: "Sire, I listen," said De Blacas, biting his nails with impatience.

082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.constraint_text: A gun was Vampa's greatest ambition for a long time
082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.source_excerpt: For a long time a gun had been the young man’s greatest ambition.

082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.constraint_text: Vampa devoted all his leisure time to mastering his weapon starting from a specific moment
082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.source_excerpt: From this moment Vampa devoted all his leisure time to perfecting himself in the use of his precious weapon

082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.constraint_text: Vampa became an expert marksman with lasting accuracy
082035c7852475809341b0996930fd1d.source_excerpt: he soon became so expert, that Teresa overcame the terror she at first felt at the report, and amused herself by watching him direct the ball wherever he pleased, with as much accuracy as if he placed it by hand

ebda8c050b9b0ea9bf8ef5b6b70fd861.constraint_text: Monte Cristo must die because he was publicly outraged in front of a theater audience and challenged by a boy, making it impossible for him to wish to live.
ebda8c050b9b0ea9bf8ef5b6b70fd861.source_excerpt: "You do not suppose that, publicly outraged in the face of a whole theatre, in the presence of your friends and those of your son—challenged by a boy who will glory in my forgiveness as if it were a victory—you do not suppose that I can for one moment wish to live."

8799d7f57b4440808913e16d4050bd36.constraint_text: Maximilian is explicitly described as 'a man of honor' by his father, which establishes a fixed trait influencing his actions.
8799d7f57b4440808913e16d4050bd36.source_excerpt: ‘Maximilian,’ replied Morrel, looking fixedly at his son, ‘you are a man, and a man of honor.’

f45dff0dbae2c5fe58dfbd1f2a711f73.constraint_text: Upon receiving the letter, the baroness no longer has a husband.
f45dff0dbae2c5fe58dfbd1f2a711f73.source_excerpt: "When you receive this, you will no longer have a husband."

69b3927e3a5ae51c649220d9b664f76d.constraint_text: Danglars' daughter is seventeen years old and Morcerf's son is twenty-one years old at the time of the conversation.
69b3927e3a5ae51c649220d9b664f76d.source_excerpt: My daughter is only seventeen years old, and your son twenty-one.

69b3927e3a5ae51c649220d9b664f76d.constraint_text: During the conversation, Morcerf never asked if Danglars' refusal was specifically about him.
69b3927e3a5ae51c649220d9b664f76d.source_excerpt: Danglars observed that during the whole conversation Morcerf had never once dared to ask if it was on his own account that Danglars recalled his word.

cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.constraint_text: Morrel could not obtain credit from banks for negotiating bills, even at ninety days.
cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.source_excerpt: Morrel now tried to negotiate bills at ninety days only, and none of the banks would give him credit.

cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.constraint_text: Morrel was able to meet his engagements only when funds arrived by the end of July.
cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.source_excerpt: he found himself in a condition to meet his engagements when the end of July came.

cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.constraint_text: Morrel’s knowledge of Captain Gaumard’s brave conduct during the storm caused him to console the captain.
cbf4166c9a9e64477c63169207f340f8.source_excerpt: The worthy shipowner knew, from Penelon’s recital, of the captain’s brave conduct during the storm, and tried to console him.

bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.constraint_text: The marriage discussion between Danglars and Morcerf began eight years prior to the current conversation.
bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.source_excerpt: have you not had enough time for reflection during the eight years which have elapsed since this marriage was first discussed between us?

bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.constraint_text: Unforeseen circumstances affecting the marriage decision occurred during the last fortnight.
bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.source_excerpt: during the last fortnight unforeseen circumstances have occurred

bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.constraint_text: Danglars is a frequent associate of M. de Monte Cristo and describes him as a 'particular friend'.
bd0dff1152c8bef791491fbc3d04532e.source_excerpt: I see him very often... he is a particular friend of mine

0fccd21233203b0362516f427f637da3.constraint_text: In business dealings, Morrel maintained only professional relationships ('correspondents') rather than personal friendships.
0fccd21233203b0362516f427f637da3.source_excerpt: as he had said, in business he had correspondents, and not friends.

fa1e128c96accf63eac57886ddc43a5b.constraint_text: Valentine's attempts to influence an outcome through tears, entreaties, and prayers have failed definitively.
fa1e128c96accf63eac57886ddc43a5b.source_excerpt: Tears, entreaties, prayers, have availed me nothing.

6e567dc3b584dc8dc5915fc2ce6aa495.constraint_text: Valentine’s future husband must consent to live with Noirtier and the family to prevent separation between Noirtier and Valentine.
6e567dc3b584dc8dc5915fc2ce6aa495.source_excerpt: we have fully ascertained beforehand that Valentine’s future husband will consent, not to live in this house, for that might not be pleasant for the young people, but that you should live with them

eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.constraint_text: No one could enter the sick-room except through Madame de Villefort and little Edward's room.
