eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.source_excerpt: de Villefort, so that no one could reach the sick-room excepting through that of Madame de Villefort and little Edward.

eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.constraint_text: If Valentine was not dead within two hours of Monte Cristo's statement, she would survive. Four days later, she was still alive.
eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.source_excerpt: Monte Cristo had told him when, half distracted, he had rushed to the count’s house, that if she were not dead in two hours she would be saved. Now four days had elapsed, and Valentine still lived.

eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.constraint_text: Valentine's nervous excitement persisted even in her sleep or somnolence.
eb0a492128d64e4bbce0139e444da28b.source_excerpt: the nervous excitement of which we speak pursued Valentine even in her sleep, or rather in that state of somnolence which succeeded her waking hours

8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.constraint_text: The threat against Valentine is inescapable and will pursue her everywhere.
8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.source_excerpt: Valentine, the hand which now threatens you will pursue you everywhere; your servants will be seduced with gold, and death will be offered to you disguised in every shape.

8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.constraint_text: Valentine's servants will be bribed with gold to facilitate her harm.
8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.source_excerpt: Valentine, the hand which now threatens you will pursue you everywhere; your servants will be seduced with gold, and death will be offered to you disguised in every shape.

8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.constraint_text: Death will be disguised in every possible form to target Valentine.
8ecf0b1cf6a710f82d91e41525260855.source_excerpt: Valentine, the hand which now threatens you will pursue you everywhere; your servants will be seduced with gold, and death will be offered to you disguised in every shape.

66422d438487c8c942f0396535432e7f.constraint_text: The nurse’s decision to rest in the armchair was caused by her inability to resist the temptation offered by Valentine’s sleep.
66422d438487c8c942f0396535432e7f.source_excerpt: she could not resist the temptation offered by Valentine’s sleep, so she threw herself into an armchair to snatch a little more rest.

276e1936ba0237f2c28c1ece1c637ab7.constraint_text: Three months ago, the guest was in Rome
276e1936ba0237f2c28c1ece1c637ab7.source_excerpt: "when I invited him three months ago, he was then at Rome, but since that time who knows where he may have gone?"

6a3e84939b25d217a317de6657bf595e.constraint_text: The gentleman was made an Academician within the last week.
6a3e84939b25d217a317de6657bf595e.source_excerpt: "Within the last week he has been made one of the learned assembly."

c31fd029f8e7dd0e524924d011470696.constraint_text: His profound study of national phenomena explains his expertise in poison-related matters.
c31fd029f8e7dd0e524924d011470696.source_excerpt: the worthy Abbé Adelmonte of Taormina, in Sicily, who has studied these national phenomena very profoundly.

c01face061f75cba2f24fbcd7fe347f0.constraint_text: The count studied chemistry and natural sciences as an amateur, not as a professional medical practitioner.
c01face061f75cba2f24fbcd7fe347f0.source_excerpt: I have studied chemistry and the natural sciences somewhat deeply, but still only as an amateur, you understand.

c01face061f75cba2f24fbcd7fe347f0.constraint_text: The count's success in curing patients is explicitly attributed to his lack of formal medical training.
c01face061f75cba2f24fbcd7fe347f0.source_excerpt: Molière or Beaumarchais would reply to you, madame, that it was precisely because I was not, that I had cured my patients

c01face061f75cba2f24fbcd7fe347f0.constraint_text: Madame de Villefort acknowledges knowledge of the aqua Tofana secret being preserved in Perugia.

a4d7a807697726c9e427564bd82d4bcc.constraint_text: His claims to the peerage are attributed to composing two or three comic operas, writing four or five articles in the _Siècle_, and voting five or six years on the ministerial side.
a4d7a807697726c9e427564bd82d4bcc.source_excerpt: He has composed two or three comic operas, written four or five articles in the _Siècle_, and voted five or six years on the ministerial side.

ed7a3ac948727aff9f6e69735ee34f24.constraint_text: The count attributes his possession of liberty, knowledge, and riches to the Abbé Faria's past actions.
ed7a3ac948727aff9f6e69735ee34f24.source_excerpt: thou who hast given me liberty, knowledge, riches; thou who, like beings of a superior order to ourselves, couldst understand the science of good and evil;

ed7a3ac948727aff9f6e69735ee34f24.constraint_text: The count assigns the cause of his understanding of good and evil to the Abbé Faria's superior comprehension.
ed7a3ac948727aff9f6e69735ee34f24.source_excerpt: thou who, like beings of a superior order to ourselves, couldst understand the science of good and evil;

bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.constraint_text: The prisoner's death is fixed as an irreversible outcome of the fall from ninety feet.
bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.source_excerpt: he must either have fallen flat, in which case the blow, from a height of ninety feet, must have killed him instantly, or he must have fallen upright, and then the weight would have dragged him to the bottom

bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.constraint_text: The prisoner's confinement was explicitly caused by plotting with the Bonapartists.
bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.source_excerpt: the report was that he had been a naval officer, who had been confined for plotting with the Bonapartists

bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.constraint_text: The prisoner's identity is permanently fixed as 'No. 34'.
bdd4ba22d598dd136df496ca2185c37f.source_excerpt: Was his name ever known?... Oh, yes; but only as No. 34

c4c80aafb5775dcaeb7325759813a41e.constraint_text: His identity as Lieutenant-General and Count of Morcerf is explicitly tied to a history of desertion, espionage, and betrayal
c4c80aafb5775dcaeb7325759813a41e.source_excerpt: Are you not the soldier Fernand who deserted on the eve of the battle of Waterloo? Are you not the Lieutenant Fernand who served as guide and spy to the French army in Spain? Are you not the Captain Fernand who betrayed, sold, and murdered his benefactor, Ali? And have not all these Fernands, united, made Lieutenant-General, the Count of Morcerf, peer of France?

c4c80aafb5775dcaeb7325759813a41e.constraint_text: His shame over past actions is presented as an unchangeable aspect of his identity
c4c80aafb5775dcaeb7325759813a41e.source_excerpt: Oh, cried the general, as if branded with a hot iron, 'wretch,—to reproach me with my shame when about, perhaps, to kill me!'

69515771fe03a1ec99aac58c81d7392f.constraint_text: Andrea has been at war with society since his youth
69515771fe03a1ec99aac58c81d7392f.source_excerpt: Andrea, at war with society ever since his youth

69515771fe03a1ec99aac58c81d7392f.constraint_text: Andrea is as deep as a gendarme regardless of rank
69515771fe03a1ec99aac58c81d7392f.source_excerpt: Andrea, at war with society ever since his youth, was quite as deep as a gendarme, even though he were advanced to the rank of brigadier

377577e047d302e35bce4f77279ec60f.constraint_text: Andrea has been at war with society since his youth
377577e047d302e35bce4f77279ec60f.source_excerpt: Andrea, at war with society ever since his youth

6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.constraint_text: Only the dead can pass freely from the dungeon.
6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.source_excerpt: Since none but the dead pass freely from this dungeon

6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.constraint_text: He must not allow his thoughts to be distracted during his resolution.
6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.source_excerpt: Without giving himself time to reconsider his decision, and, indeed, that he might not allow his thoughts to be distracted from his desperate resolution

6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.constraint_text: The jailer brings the evening meal when the prisoner is asleep.
6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.source_excerpt: so that the jailer might, when he brought the evening meal, believe that he was asleep, as was his frequent custom

6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.constraint_text: He sews himself into the sack to mimic the dead body's position.
6f95450f091f8b4aa4ad2f1c0a7c8c5f.source_excerpt: and sewed up the mouth of the sack from the inside

964ceefca5f30a5308f1c64cb56a302b.constraint_text: His paleness is attributed to having been long entombed, making it impossible for him to resume a healthy glow.
964ceefca5f30a5308f1c64cb56a302b.source_excerpt: His pallor was so peculiar, that it seemed to pertain to one who had been long entombed, and who was incapable of resuming the healthy glow and hue of life.

386f75c0abaad638486267bcc1a455b2.constraint_text: Danglars invoked the name of God twice within an hour, a practice he had not engaged in for ten years prior.
386f75c0abaad638486267bcc1a455b2.source_excerpt: "Oh, God be praised," he said; "it is a real bed!" This was the second time within the hour that he had invoked the name of God. He had not done so for ten years before.

386f75c0abaad638486267bcc1a455b2.constraint_text: Danglars was physically imprisoned after the door to his cell was bolted shut.
386f75c0abaad638486267bcc1a455b2.source_excerpt: A bolt grated and Danglars was a prisoner.

2431dcf39be618cca0b0c148ae6a17f9.constraint_text: The captain could not be relied upon to restrain the drunken sailors.
2431dcf39be618cca0b0c148ae6a17f9.source_excerpt: the captain could not be relied upon to restrain them

3fc68bbb765eb276ab3db36d651b2765.constraint_text: The old man died in the bed, calling for his son.
3fc68bbb765eb276ab3db36d651b2765.source_excerpt: on that spot the old man had breathed his last, vainly calling for his son

3fc68bbb765eb276ab3db36d651b2765.constraint_text: Edmond has stern and immovable features as his default demeanor.
3fc68bbb765eb276ab3db36d651b2765.source_excerpt: his otherwise stern and immovable features

c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.constraint_text: Valentine and Morrel will conform to circumstances and follow friends' wishes unless those wishes separate them
c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.source_excerpt: we will conform to circumstances, and be guided by the wishes of our friends, so long as those wishes do not tend finally to separate us

c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.constraint_text: Morrel vows to make all sacrifices required by Valentine's commitment
c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.source_excerpt: And I swear to make all the sacrifices which this word imposes, sir

c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.constraint_text: Valentine and Morrel will abandon inconsiderate/rash actions starting from this moment
c1cbb5b1752664c438bb1276e83c8c2d.source_excerpt: no more inconsiderate actions—no more rash projects; for you surely would not wish to compromise one who from this day regards herself as destined

552d8e3b630f29a10b17677edcef2be7.constraint_text: Morrel is the betrothed of 'her' (the noble girl) and considers her his only blessing in the world
552d8e3b630f29a10b17677edcef2be7.source_excerpt: "Tell them that I am her betrothed. Tell them she was my beloved, my noble girl, my only blessing in the world."

23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.constraint_text: The landlord considers himself the principal customer for the gin, brandy, and whisky of his tavern.
23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.source_excerpt: The landlord of 'Bush Inn' was a coarse man, of forbidding appearance, who had to consider himself as the principal customer for the gin, brandy, and whisky of his tavern

23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.constraint_text: The landlord has a forbidding appearance.
23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.source_excerpt: The landlord of 'Bush Inn' was a coarse man, of forbidding appearance

23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.constraint_text: The landlord replies in an ill-humored way to questions.
23dbc59b357b122ff54cfd2e07dfb8dd.source_excerpt: He replied in an ill-humored way to the questions that were addressed him

648d311e32fd5b86cce06684632e738a.constraint_text: If Captain Grant is alive, he is in Australia.
648d311e32fd5b86cce06684632e738a.source_excerpt: if Captain Grant is living he is in Australia.

648d311e32fd5b86cce06684632e738a.constraint_text: The shipwreck took place on the east coast of Australia at latitude thirty-seven.
648d311e32fd5b86cce06684632e738a.source_excerpt: the Britannia was driving towards the coast of Australia, which was not two cable-lengths distant. The shipwreck, therefore, took place at that point.

648d311e32fd5b86cce06684632e738a.constraint_text: The shipwreck occurred on the night of June 27th, 1862.

e2f5bb7a0205e183a9439e6fee079301.constraint_text: Ben Joyce is a bold and formidable criminal whose past has been definitively reviewed and confirmed.
e2f5bb7a0205e183a9439e6fee079301.source_excerpt: His past had just been reviewed by the major, and the wretch appeared as he was,--a bold and formidable criminal.

e2f5bb7a0205e183a9439e6fee079301.constraint_text: Ayrton's treachery is explicitly identified as the cause of the destroyed hope and Mary Grant's grief.
e2f5bb7a0205e183a9439e6fee079301.source_excerpt: The discovery of Ayrton's treachery destroyed all hope. The convict, to entice Glenarvan on, had invented a shipwreck.

d869d0ff9f03ca686e85114603b20f2b.constraint_text: Every Englishman is considered an enemy due to their people's invasion, theft of fields, and burning of villages.
d869d0ff9f03ca686e85114603b20f2b.source_excerpt: "Every Englishman is our enemy. Your people have invaded our island. They have stolen away our fields; they have burned our villages."

d869d0ff9f03ca686e85114603b20f2b.constraint_text: The god Nouï-Atoua commands the Maori to ransom the life of the captured high-priest Tohonga.
d869d0ff9f03ca686e85114603b20f2b.source_excerpt: "Our god commands us to ransom his life."

d869d0ff9f03ca686e85114603b20f2b.constraint_text: The decision to spare Glenarvan and his companions is explicitly caused by the god Nouï-Atoua's command.

4f31d978acb5c1f476ab8f9f99ce266c.constraint_text: Fernand's attainment of fortune and position is causally linked to his military service during Napoleon's return, including being drafted into the active army and participating in the Battle of Ligny.
4f31d978acb5c1f476ab8f9f99ce266c.source_excerpt: Some days before the return of the emperor, Fernand was drafted... and was at the battle of Ligny.

872ada1dd34dfc5df06dc6e31403f72c.constraint_text: Among the Maoris, exchanges follow a strict one-for-one ratio
872ada1dd34dfc5df06dc6e31403f72c.source_excerpt: "Among the Maoris," said Kai-Koumou, "it is one for one."

872ada1dd34dfc5df06dc6e31403f72c.constraint_text: Glenarvan is neither a chief nor a priest among his people
872ada1dd34dfc5df06dc6e31403f72c.source_excerpt: "I am neither a chief nor a priest among my people."

af93f5f34a30129885c6f2643170442d.constraint_text: The young man refuses to acknowledge the thieves as comrades because the keeper's manner has insulted him.
af93f5f34a30129885c6f2643170442d.source_excerpt: "I am no comrade of these people," said the young man, proudly, "you have no right to insult me thus."

0d85fe2e3f2de34ff0785e6bfe7ea2b5.constraint_text: Roman peasants are always ready to aid Roman brigands due to innate sympathy
0d85fe2e3f2de34ff0785e6bfe7ea2b5.source_excerpt: there is an innate sympathy between the Roman brigand and the Roman peasant and the latter is always ready to aid the former

5cfd615d26f4def24a6b5b3e3f3a357f.constraint_text: The young man refuses to acknowledge solidarity with the prisoners, asserting a rigid distinction between himself and 'these people'.
5cfd615d26f4def24a6b5b3e3f3a357f.source_excerpt: "I am no comrade of these people," said the young man, proudly, "you have no right to insult me thus."

078654303b2a524ff82f2ee711782590.constraint_text: Danglars will not give his signature again under any circumstances.
078654303b2a524ff82f2ee711782590.source_excerpt: You may torture, torment, kill me, but you shall not have my signature again!

bf5b70fd66bd2105cc9eba39b55865d2.constraint_text: Morcerf is bound by a promise not to mention a specific circumstance involving Monte Cristo's rescue by bandits.
bf5b70fd66bd2105cc9eba39b55865d2.source_excerpt: Monte Cristo said, 'you promised me never to mention that circumstance.'

4479e6318a236ae119224f639e9ffc22.constraint_text: Debray instructs the baroness to sell Spanish bonds because Don Carlos has fled from Bourges and returned to Spain.
4479e6318a236ae119224f639e9ffc22.source_excerpt: "Because Don Carlos has fled from Bourges, and has returned to Spain."

d1c2d7184b121560cb039d93fb294cba.constraint_text: The narrator has never entered Nîmes since their brother’s assassination there.
d1c2d7184b121560cb039d93fb294cba.source_excerpt: Since my brother’s assassination in the streets of Nîmes, I had never entered the town

d1c2d7184b121560cb039d93fb294cba.constraint_text: The narrator’s fear of gendarmes and custom-house officers stems from the risk of an inquiry that would revisit the past.
d1c2d7184b121560cb039d93fb294cba.source_excerpt: I had a double motive for fearing the gendarmes and custom-house officers, as my appearance before the judges would cause an inquiry, and an inquiry always looks back into the past

b523863a707900f6fa9c9a02b2ff2130.constraint_text: Cannot bear duelling due to past trauma involving breaking a friend's arm
b523863a707900f6fa9c9a02b2ff2130.source_excerpt: I cannot bear duelling ever since two seconds, whom I had chosen to arrange an affair, forced me to break the arm of one of my best friends, one whom you all know—poor Franz d’Épinay.

85b5d953b2f87a705f4b65633298bbed.constraint_text: Château-Renaud cannot bear duelling because two seconds he chose forced him to break the arm of his friend Franz d'Épinay.
85b5d953b2f87a705f4b65633298bbed.source_excerpt: "I cannot bear duelling ever since two seconds, whom I had chosen to arrange an affair, forced me to break the arm of one of my best friends, one whom you all know—poor Franz d’Épinay."

01b203cb39d38cf540b877ab4f0600ed.constraint_text: Paganel cannot understand the native's Spanish dialect (Araucanian)
01b203cb39d38cf540b877ab4f0600ed.source_excerpt: "May I be hanged," said he, "if I understand a word of this infernal jargon! It is certainly Araucanian."

4fe09285e35358b6e0b97dff65719414.constraint_text: Paganel and the major have misread the document in the past
4fe09285e35358b6e0b97dff65719414.source_excerpt: "Yes," said he, in a tone of conviction, "yes, we have gone astray in our search, and have read in the document what is not written there."

4fe09285e35358b6e0b97dff65719414.constraint_text: Paganel previously struck upon a false interpretation of the document
4fe09285e35358b6e0b97dff65719414.source_excerpt: "Like you, I was in error; like you, I struck upon a false interpretation."

f7a38530015d98dbc1a3e54ed057cea4.constraint_text: Preferring death to capture restricts past actions and decisions
f7a38530015d98dbc1a3e54ed057cea4.source_excerpt: So, preferring death to capture, I accomplished the most astonishing deeds...

f7a38530015d98dbc1a3e54ed057cea4.constraint_text: Devoting life to enterprises makes one unequal to others, with doubled strength and resources
f7a38530015d98dbc1a3e54ed057cea4.source_excerpt: when you have once devoted your life to your enterprises, you are no longer the equal of other men...

321db1f24d255ffda0e1e10208fda662.constraint_text: The character has two specific methods of self-destruction available: hanging with his handkerchief or refusing food to die of starvation.
321db1f24d255ffda0e1e10208fda662.source_excerpt: Two methods of self-destruction were at his disposal. He could hang himself with his handkerchief to the window bars, or refuse food and die of starvation.

df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.constraint_text: Third-rate fortunes are never more than a fourth of what they appear to be, like the locomotive magnified by smoke and steam.
df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.source_excerpt: for third-rate fortunes are never more than a fourth of what they appear to be, like the locomotive on a railway, the size of which is magnified by the smoke and steam surrounding it.

df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.constraint_text: Losing two million from his real capital directly diminishes his credit and fictitious fortune.
df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.source_excerpt: Well, out of the five or six millions which form your real capital, you have just lost nearly two millions, which must, of course, in the same degree diminish your credit and fictitious fortune;

df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.constraint_text: If the loss of capital is repeated three or four times, it will cause his financial death.
df0025aefd686f708c529aa4ee830cdd.source_excerpt: your skin has been opened by bleeding, and this if repeated three or four times will cause death—so pay attention to it, my dear Monsieur Danglars.

d40b8c9ff0cc42ceebf7a12abbc2c0da.constraint_text: Mercédès learned drawing, music, and other subjects to distract her mind and alleviate emotional pain from her past.
d40b8c9ff0cc42ceebf7a12abbc2c0da.source_excerpt: she did this in order to distract her mind, that she might forget; and she only filled her head in order to alleviate the weight on her heart.

d40b8c9ff0cc42ceebf7a12abbc2c0da.constraint_text: Mercédès' education was driven by Fernand’s growing fortune, which provided the means and opportunity for her to develop intellectually.
d40b8c9ff0cc42ceebf7a12abbc2c0da.source_excerpt: Fernand’s fortune was already waxing great, and she developed with his growing fortune. She learned drawing, music—everything.

ea39ac56049030708e4a9e2d14ccfd62.constraint_text: Edward studied chemistry to follow the example of King Mithridates due to his determination to live in eastern climates.
ea39ac56049030708e4a9e2d14ccfd62.source_excerpt: I have studied chemistry because, having determined to live in eastern climates I have been desirous of following the example of King Mithridates.

ea39ac56049030708e4a9e2d14ccfd62.constraint_text: Edward has a habit of never giving way, demonstrated by his refusal to leave until given the album.
ea39ac56049030708e4a9e2d14ccfd62.source_excerpt: according to his habit of never giving way

2c34d4a2e4d0b3768afaf966bb9969a1.constraint_text: The major confirmed he was a bachelor, aligning with the general opinion about his marital status.
2c34d4a2e4d0b3768afaf966bb9969a1.source_excerpt: That was the general opinion, sir," said the major, "and I——" "Yes," replied the count, "and you confirmed the report."

9952f684f0b7b1e4b59ce16057ebcb6f.constraint_text: Dantès has experienced a great and undeserved misfortune in his life.
9952f684f0b7b1e4b59ce16057ebcb6f.source_excerpt: It has been long enough to inflict on me a great and undeserved misfortune.

9952f684f0b7b1e4b59ce16057ebcb6f.constraint_text: The abbé attributes his focused mental faculties to captivity.
9952f684f0b7b1e4b59ce16057ebcb6f.source_excerpt: Captivity has brought my mental faculties to a focus

6ab2e4e03c66b8c611b872c418166aaf.constraint_text: The grandfather's pleasure is explicitly caused by the belief that M. Morrel (a stranger to him) was made an officer of the Legion of Honor.
6ab2e4e03c66b8c611b872c418166aaf.source_excerpt: He signified assent; only think of the poor old man’s being so pleased to think that you, who were a perfect stranger to him, had been made an officer of the Legion of Honor!

ea4fa5cf76848c46442ac4e2250550bc.constraint_text: The major wished to conceal a past 'fault' from public view.
ea4fa5cf76848c46442ac4e2250550bc.source_excerpt: I did wish this fault to be hidden from every eye.

ea4fa5cf76848c46442ac4e2250550bc.constraint_text: The major's desire to conceal the 'fault' was motivated by concern for 'the mother.'
ea4fa5cf76848c46442ac4e2250550bc.source_excerpt: But for the sake of the mother?

849e6b8301cf6daa407b594439b32775.constraint_text: Vampa and Teresa agreed to marry only when Vampa reaches 20 years of age and Teresa 19 years of age
849e6b8301cf6daa407b594439b32775.source_excerpt: the two young people had agreed to be married when Vampa should be twenty and Teresa nineteen years of age

849e6b8301cf6daa407b594439b32775.constraint_text: Vampa and Teresa have already obtained their employers' permission for marriage
849e6b8301cf6daa407b594439b32775.source_excerpt: which had been already sought and obtained

9af93e336a85f5e1148032d261815654.constraint_text: Eugénie obtained a man’s passport from M. de Monte Cristo after expressing fears of traveling as a woman
9af93e336a85f5e1148032d261815654.source_excerpt: he perfectly understood them, and undertook to procure for me a man’s passport, and two days after I received this

9af93e336a85f5e1148032d261815654.constraint_text: Eugénie has resolved to stop considering financial matters and prioritize action
9af93e336a85f5e1148032d261815654.source_excerpt: I am done with considering! I am tired of hearing only of market reports, of the end of the month, of the rise and fall of Spanish funds, of Haitian bonds.

914aa8c3264cd065bdc214526b40ee66.constraint_text: The man was poisoned three weeks ago and will die in a month.
914aa8c3264cd065bdc214526b40ee66.source_excerpt: ‘That man was poisoned three weeks ago; he will be a dead man in a month.’

ef2714952de39a7094132c0cfa5d18eb.constraint_text: The unknown man has a fixed physical description: 50-52 years old, dark, black eyes with shaggy eyebrows, thick moustache, wearing a blue frock-coat buttoned to the chin with a Legion of Honor rosette.
ef2714952de39a7094132c0cfa5d18eb.source_excerpt: He is a man of from fifty to fifty-two years of age, dark, with black eyes covered with shaggy eyebrows, and a thick moustache. He was dressed in a blue frock-coat, buttoned up to the chin, and wore at his button-hole the rosette of an officer of the Legion of Honor.

11d4893f6dc51a3cc602cbfcb34686ed.constraint_text: Villefort takes pride in making the accused pale, agitated, and visibly overwhelmed by his eloquence during trials.
11d4893f6dc51a3cc602cbfcb34686ed.source_excerpt: “My pride is to see the accused pale, agitated, and as though beaten out of all composure by the fire of my eloquence.”

11d4893f6dc51a3cc602cbfcb34686ed.constraint_text: Villefort recently handled a trial involving a man accused of murdering his father.
11d4893f6dc51a3cc602cbfcb34686ed.source_excerpt: “What a splendid business that last case of yours was, my dear Villefort!” [...] “I mean the trial of the man for murdering his father.”

165f1da67c58f2e639fef8428d041b32.constraint_text: M. Bertuccio is gloomy and brooding over an old vendetta
165f1da67c58f2e639fef8428d041b32.source_excerpt: "I knew you were gloomy, and always brooding over some old history of the vendetta;"

50954e4da0bf23072fd38547a96be4db.constraint_text: The count is explicitly tasked with attempting to persuade the Comte de Morcerf to make an arrangement with the baron.
50954e4da0bf23072fd38547a96be4db.source_excerpt: I am charged with the commission of endeavoring to induce the Comte de Morcerf to make some definite arrangement with the baron.

50954e4da0bf23072fd38547a96be4db.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has resolved to maintain good relations with everyone, regardless of circumstances.
50954e4da0bf23072fd38547a96be4db.source_excerpt: I am determined to try and be on good terms with everybody, at all events.

b8eaea2ebd30405da2b229f6b65e5ab8.constraint_text: Morcerf had been preparing documents against this storm for a long time prior to the investigation
b8eaea2ebd30405da2b229f6b65e5ab8.source_excerpt: he had to collect the documents he had long been preparing against this storm

b8eaea2ebd30405da2b229f6b65e5ab8.constraint_text: Albert knows his father is guilty based on Beauchamp's confidence
b8eaea2ebd30405da2b229f6b65e5ab8.source_excerpt: from Beauchamp’s confidence he knew his father was guilty

555766aac6414833f90070e6500057a6.constraint_text: Ayrton is Ben Joyce, a sailor of the Britannia, now chief of a band of convicts
555766aac6414833f90070e6500057a6.source_excerpt: Let us not, therefore, be led astray by vain conjectures, but only be certain that Ayrton is Ben Joyce, a sailor of the Britannia, now chief of a band of convicts.

555766aac6414833f90070e6500057a6.constraint_text: Ayrton has been quartermaster on board the Britannia
555766aac6414833f90070e6500057a6.source_excerpt: It is certain that he knows Harry Grant, and has been quartermaster on board the Britannia.

a453659098a3eba63d28b5add115fbb8.constraint_text: The attempt to extract information from Ayrton during the one-hour meeting failed to produce results.
a453659098a3eba63d28b5add115fbb8.source_excerpt: For an hour the two ladies were closeted with the quartermaster, but nothing resulted from this conference.

a453659098a3eba63d28b5add115fbb8.constraint_text: The specific arguments and methods used during the interrogation of Ayrton remained unknown.
a453659098a3eba63d28b5add115fbb8.source_excerpt: What they said, the arguments they used to draw out the convict's secret, all the details of this examination, remained unknown.

49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.constraint_text: Ayrton claims the ability to extricate himself from situations where others would fail.
49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.source_excerpt: I can extricate myself where another would fail.

49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.constraint_text: Glenarvan explicitly states Ayrton is brave and intelligent.
49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.source_excerpt: You are a brave and intelligent man, Ayrton, and will succeed.

49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.constraint_text: The search for the Brittania or Captain Grant will not resume until Ayrton returns from his mission.
49578e8ef42c0afa1431ad4612ef5d9c.source_excerpt: that it was not proposed to resume the search without him

0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.constraint_text: Maximilian Morrel held the rank of sub-lieutenant for one year.
0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.source_excerpt: For a year he had held this rank, and expected promotion on the first vacancy.

0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.constraint_text: Maximilian Morrel was noted for rigid observance of soldierly obligations and personal duties.
0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.source_excerpt: In his regiment Maximilian Morrel was noted for his rigid observance, not only of the obligations imposed on a soldier, but also of the duties of a man;

0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.constraint_text: Maximilian Morrel earned the name 'the stoic' due to his rigid observance of duties.
0b2f091faf7dc11c6373de73ef927a89.source_excerpt: In his regiment Maximilian Morrel was noted for his rigid observance, not only of the obligations imposed on a soldier, but also of the duties of a man; and he thus gained the name of 'the stoic.'

926eb91af226e3cf16764b51fee60c9b.constraint_text: The Abbé Faria was confined in the Château d’If.
926eb91af226e3cf16764b51fee60c9b.source_excerpt: I have since learned that he was confined in the Château d’If

926eb91af226e3cf16764b51fee60c9b.constraint_text: M. de Boville has served as the inspector of prisons for fourteen years.
926eb91af226e3cf16764b51fee60c9b.source_excerpt: I have been so these fourteen years.

a4af4fe869a92e2299fbe64798bd921a.constraint_text: Beauchamp refuses to tolerate threats from both enemies and friends
a4af4fe869a92e2299fbe64798bd921a.source_excerpt: I never allow them from my enemies, and therefore shall not put up with them from my friends.

427abdfb1c0d6f4feb96c99a3f213e5a.constraint_text: Morcerf will furnish the house with all necessary information.
427abdfb1c0d6f4feb96c99a3f213e5a.source_excerpt: "I will furnish the house with all necessary information."

427abdfb1c0d6f4feb96c99a3f213e5a.constraint_text: The examination is set to take place today at eight o’clock in the committee-room.
427abdfb1c0d6f4feb96c99a3f213e5a.source_excerpt: The investigation would begin at eight o’clock that evening in the committee-room, and if postponement were necessary, the proceedings would be resumed each evening at the same hour.

d043fc0c8c59f3510ede2483a58639ac.constraint_text: Morcerf explicitly states that his marriage to Mademoiselle Eugénie Danglars is 'still in projection,' indicating it is not yet finalized.
d043fc0c8c59f3510ede2483a58639ac.source_excerpt: The affair is still in projection.

f2a8d9b998396cd296b04b9afb6e4aa7.constraint_text: The king explicitly asserts that Villefort possesses 'great judgment and discretion' as a young man, which are traits that persist and influence his professional trajectory.
f2a8d9b998396cd296b04b9afb6e4aa7.source_excerpt: 'Villefort,' said his majesty, 'is a young man of great judgment and discretion, who will be sure to make a figure in his profession; I like him much, and it gave me great pleasure to hear that he was about to become the son-in-law of the Marquis and Marquise de Saint-Méran.'

ed008324d8b2ef980abbbdcb5e54f09e.constraint_text: Benedetto is not the real Prince Andrea Cavalcanti but an imposter.
ed008324d8b2ef980abbbdcb5e54f09e.source_excerpt: the false Cavalcanti had formed a host of acquaintances

ed008324d8b2ef980abbbdcb5e54f09e.constraint_text: M. Cavalcanti's ability to convincingly play the nobleman depends on his silence and avoidance of arithmetical calculations.
ed008324d8b2ef980abbbdcb5e54f09e.source_excerpt: the old patrician, who certainly played the nobleman very well, so long as he said nothing, and made no arithmetical calculations

b2d8c6a7f20f1288f41cfa92dd55d927.constraint_text: Villefort was protected from losing his office by Noirtier's influence at court during the Hundred Days
b2d8c6a7f20f1288f41cfa92dd55d927.source_excerpt: Napoleon would, doubtless, have deprived Villefort of his office had it not been for Noirtier, who was all powerful at court, and thus the Girondin of ’93 and the Senator of 1806 protected him who so lately had been his protector.

f6178792d5b7f7009e026dd295caba04.constraint_text: Noirtier maintained calmness throughout the entire conversation and while leaving the room.
f6178792d5b7f7009e026dd295caba04.source_excerpt: Noirtier left the room when he had finished, with the same calmness that had characterized him during the whole of this remarkable and trying conversation.

ee1b2cad55643951b0eac7845c266ced.character: the person addressed by Monte Cristo
ee1b2cad55643951b0eac7845c266ced.constraint_text: The person addressed possesses a name, fortune, and talent that inherently grant them social access and acceptance in Parisian society.
ee1b2cad55643951b0eac7845c266ced.source_excerpt: "you have no need of anyone to introduce you—with your name, and your fortune, and your talent... you can present yourself everywhere, and be well received."

7105bb143898a83c637d5e974139415a.constraint_text: Villefort arrived in Paris on the 3rd of March, as explicitly stated in the conversation with M. Noirtier.
7105bb143898a83c637d5e974139415a.source_excerpt: “But, my dear fellow,” replied M. Noirtier, seating himself, “I might say the same thing to you, when you announce to me your wedding for the 28th of February, and on the 3rd of March you turn up here in Paris.”

ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.constraint_text: The letter was carried in his hand while returning from Porto-Ferrajo to the vessel, visible to others including Danglars.
ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.source_excerpt: I carried it in my hand. So that when you went on board the _Pharaon_, everybody could see that you held a letter in your hand?

ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.constraint_text: The portfolio containing the letter was left on board the ship until his return.
ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.source_excerpt: You are right; it was left on board.

ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.constraint_text: The letter in question was explicitly formulated as evidence of his alleged treason.
ac2965d24e92a18abcbe1449ea62710d.source_excerpt: This is it, word for word: ‘The king’s attorney is informed by a friend to the throne and religion...'

cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.constraint_text: The execution is fixed for the day after tomorrow.
cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.source_excerpt: the execution is fixed for the day after tomorrow

cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.constraint_text: The character has only one day to work in order to obtain the reprieve.
cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.source_excerpt: you have but one day to work in

cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.constraint_text: The character has 86,400 seconds to act within the day.
cdf82a507aef1d3dcdefdee4f3fbf669.source_excerpt: in 86,400 seconds very many things can be done

a1713626abc1b0b48889e297ad940896.constraint_text: It was the first time Franz had ever seen a guillotine
a1713626abc1b0b48889e297ad940896.source_excerpt: It was the first time Franz had ever seen a guillotine,—we say guillotine, because the Roman _mandaïa_ is formed on almost the same model as the French instrument.

9893c0fe2ee82ee3c323214b8cbedbdd.constraint_text: Danglars believed he was not aware of Dantès' involvement in a conspiracy and considered the situation a joke.
9893c0fe2ee82ee3c323214b8cbedbdd.source_excerpt: Not I. As I before said, I thought the whole thing was a joke, nothing more.

8e9ec715f67e2602b87af84058907293.constraint_text: The deputy's age (26-27 years) is cited as the cause for his ambition but lack of corruption.
8e9ec715f67e2602b87af84058907293.source_excerpt: Old enough to be ambitious, but too young to be corrupt.

c2dc19e4ed14d840d65179778a3c1d19.constraint_text: The blood-stained waistcoat containing the letter that stopped the marriage-contract signature was found in his house
c2dc19e4ed14d840d65179778a3c1d19.source_excerpt: You know that the famous waistcoat was found in his house, containing the letter which stopped the signature of the marriage-contract. ... There it is, all blood-stained, on the desk, as a testimony of the crime.

c2dc19e4ed14d840d65179778a3c1d19.constraint_text: His calm expression has remained undisturbed by personal griefs
c2dc19e4ed14d840d65179778a3c1d19.source_excerpt: Everyone looked with astonishment on that grave and severe face, whose calm expression personal griefs had been unable to disturb

371933e5865fed533d3e38bd74bcaa00.constraint_text: Benedetto was condemned at the age of sixteen for five years to the galleys for forgery.
371933e5865fed533d3e38bd74bcaa00.source_excerpt: 'Benedetto, condemned, at the age of sixteen, for five years to the galleys for forgery.'

371933e5865fed533d3e38bd74bcaa00.constraint_text: Benedetto was first a runaway, then an assassin.
371933e5865fed533d3e38bd74bcaa00.source_excerpt: 'He promised well, as you see—first a runaway, then an assassin.'

c27e6924ce79b14402c20030cc42499b.constraint_text: The magistrate must fulfill the task of delivering the arrest order despite personal reluctance
c27e6924ce79b14402c20030cc42499b.source_excerpt: "although I most reluctantly perform the task assigned me, it must, nevertheless, be fulfilled."

ea95a08f9d82f0a3516f1f9716def50d.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo consistently dresses with habitual simplicity, as evidenced by his black attire and minimal jewelry.
ea95a08f9d82f0a3516f1f9716def50d.source_excerpt: the count was dressed in black and with his habitual simplicity

888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.constraint_text: The man's name is either Franz d’Épinay or Albert de Morcerf.
888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.source_excerpt: “A man whose name is Franz d’Épinay or Albert de Morcerf has not much difficulty in procuring them.”

888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo caused his own ransom to be paid by saying two words to the chief.
888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.source_excerpt: “He said two words to the chief and I was free.”

888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo caused the captors to apologize for abducting him.
888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.source_excerpt: “And they apologized to him for having carried you off?”

888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo is not known to exist in the European nobility.
888d9b886146a531b8a4d5baf1319462.source_excerpt: “There is no Count of Monte Cristo’ said Debray. ‘I do not think so,’ added Château-Renaud, with the air of a man who knows the whole of the European nobility perfectly.”

717127882ee22bf261786e0738abf4ca.constraint_text: The Count of Morcerf has a history of secret griefs that have persisted over his lifespan.
717127882ee22bf261786e0738abf4ca.source_excerpt: read on the careworn and livid features of the count a whole history of secret griefs written in each wrinkle time had planted there

717127882ee22bf261786e0738abf4ca.constraint_text: The Count of Morcerf and his house hold eternal gratitude towards Monte Cristo for saving their only heir.
717127882ee22bf261786e0738abf4ca.source_excerpt: a service which insures him our eternal gratitude

4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.constraint_text: Benedetto is the natural son of the Count of Monte Cristo
4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.source_excerpt: Benedetto has become the son of a great lord... the Count of Monte Cristo, the very same in whose house we are.

4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.constraint_text: Benedetto is to inherit 500,000 francs from the Count of Monte Cristo's will
4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.source_excerpt: the count gives him four thousand francs a month, and leaves him 500,000 francs in his will.

4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.constraint_text: Benedetto is known by the name Andrea Cavalcanti
4e11f18ea4502eea1404106a42f58b16.source_excerpt: And what name does the young man bear meanwhile?... Andrea Cavalcanti.

b068d159dd33a26307cf181809afd7a2.constraint_text: Must wear uniform and crosses on grand occasions
b068d159dd33a26307cf181809afd7a2.source_excerpt: "On grand occasions you must wear your uniform; that will look very well. Do not forget your crosses."

b068d159dd33a26307cf181809afd7a2.constraint_text: Recognized by Baptistin due to matching the master's physical description
b068d159dd33a26307cf181809afd7a2.source_excerpt: He was certainly the tall young man with light hair, red beard, black eyes, and brilliant complexion, whom his master had so particularly described to him.

35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.constraint_text: If the mother notices him, he must be remarkable
35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.source_excerpt: My mother has noticed him, and he must therefore, perforce, be remarkable.

35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.constraint_text: His turnout causes his horses to be ranked second by connoisseurs
35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.source_excerpt: the Count of Monte Cristo had laid his hands on a 'turnout' which sent his bays down to second place in the opinion of connoisseurs

35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.constraint_text: Believes men are not equal and this belief must be formally asserted
35d2af76fcd0e9e2c9bbde47a3a0cd90.source_excerpt: Most decidedly,' said he, 'men are not equal, and I must beg my father to develop this theorem in the Chamber of Peers'

22ca6bf4a821f80a7ca85a202f3110da.constraint_text: The Count of Monte Cristo was cheated out of 100,000 francs by the Cavalcanti using false letters of credit, which prevented him from appearing in public.
22ca6bf4a821f80a7ca85a202f3110da.source_excerpt: he has been the dupe of the Cavalcanti, who, it appears, presented themselves to him with false letters of credit, and cheated him out of 100,000 francs upon the hypothesis of this principality.

31adb5abef30fe6aa0d11fbd581bac5f.constraint_text: Remaining with Mercédès would have made the son's life a 'hateful burden' and prevented him from participating in her griefs
31adb5abef30fe6aa0d11fbd581bac5f.source_excerpt: Had he remained with you, his life must have become a hateful burden, nor would he have participated in your griefs.

b044e0f63bfd434d1ea61a5da56b823b.constraint_text: Purchased the island to prevent the Tuscan government from seizing it
b044e0f63bfd434d1ea61a5da56b823b.source_excerpt: he has wisely enough purchased the island, and taken its name.

002bd8b7b4271dfe9a277b73bd00c052.constraint_text: The abbé promised to devote his prayers to Valentine and his attentions to Noirtier.
002bd8b7b4271dfe9a277b73bd00c052.source_excerpt: the abbé promised to devote his prayers to Valentine and his attentions to Noirtier.

002bd8b7b4271dfe9a277b73bd00c052.constraint_text: The priest bolted the doors to avoid being disturbed while fulfilling his sacred mission.
002bd8b7b4271dfe9a277b73bd00c052.source_excerpt: In order, doubtless, that he might not be disturbed while fulfilling his sacred mission, the priest rose... and bolted the door...

4dc5ea63740349f9228dd986d33532c1.constraint_text: The telegraph operator is employed for twelve hundred francs a year and spends his entire monotonous life watching a distant insect.
4dc5ea63740349f9228dd986d33532c1.source_excerpt: hired for twelve hundred francs a year, and employed all day... all his monotonous life was passed in watching his white-bellied, black-clawed fellow insect

3482b15a8f1050ed836e495d2d74d691.constraint_text: Morrel's decision to drop the pistol is explicitly caused by hearing his daughter Julie's voice.
3482b15a8f1050ed836e495d2d74d691.source_excerpt: Suddenly he heard a cry—it was his daughter’s voice. He turned and saw Julie. The pistol fell from his hands.

fb1373ae1afcc41084635e3151b5753c.constraint_text: Robert's escape from the savages was caused by the uproar.
fb1373ae1afcc41084635e3151b5753c.source_excerpt: Somehow, during the uproar, I succeeded in escaping their vigilance.

fb1373ae1afcc41084635e3151b5753c.constraint_text: Robert kept hidden behind the bushes for two days.
fb1373ae1afcc41084635e3151b5753c.source_excerpt: For two days I kept hidden behind the bushes.

b024b4b5e7bd05e117bf176642d81dc9.constraint_text: Villefort will carry out the action he has promised, as he explicitly states, 'what I have said I will do.'
b024b4b5e7bd05e117bf176642d81dc9.source_excerpt: "It is well, sir," replied Villefort from below,—"it is well; have patience but one day longer; what I have said I will do."

584777ad501dc578b247fb1dabd8cbd4.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's current suffering is explicitly caused by his past actions of watching and laughing at others' misfortunes.
584777ad501dc578b247fb1dabd8cbd4.source_excerpt: "I, who was looking on, an eager and curious spectator,—I, who was watching the working of this mournful tragedy,—I, who like a wicked angel was laughing at the evil men committed protected by secrecy... I am in my turn bitten by the serpent whose tortuous course I was watching, and bitten to the heart!"

8420b4c649b72abcb328698d36a5a60a.constraint_text: Valentine's escape from poisoning was caused by M. Noirtier's precautions
8420b4c649b72abcb328698d36a5a60a.source_excerpt: though she escaped, owing to the precautions of M. Noirtier.

bebcd7a0971bb21d8b2ba52601a1c535.constraint_text: Penelon's embarrassment and bashfulness are attributed to his new attire and employment on another vessel, not self-initiated mourning for the _Pharaon_
bebcd7a0971bb21d8b2ba52601a1c535.source_excerpt: Morrel attributed Penelon’s embarrassment to the elegance of his attire; it was evident the good fellow had not gone to such an expense on his own account; he was, no doubt, engaged on board some other vessel, and thus his bashfulness arose from the fact of his not having... worn mourning for the _Pharaon_ longer.

f7dad1b169fb72651675e984301547ec.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has vowed to provide loaded pistols and poison to Morrel if he is not consoled within a month, to the exact hour.
f7dad1b169fb72651675e984301547ec.source_excerpt: In a month, to the day, the very hour and the date is a sacred one, Maximilian.

583ae08153f696b0cb9d456987db9fad.constraint_text: Edmond would not break his oath, even when tempted by hunger.
583ae08153f696b0cb9d456987db9fad.source_excerpt: he thought of his oath, and he would not break it

02b5dbf41a52653d59afd8ec5874f200.constraint_text: Valentine believes all nocturnal phantoms are products of her imagination and disappear by morning.
02b5dbf41a52653d59afd8ec5874f200.source_excerpt: Her reason told her that all the visions she beheld were but the children of her imagination, and the conviction was strengthened by the fact that in the morning no traces remained of the nocturnal phantoms, who disappeared with the coming of daylight.

02b5dbf41a52653d59afd8ec5874f200.constraint_text: Drinking the doctor's prepared beverage is the method Valentine uses to dispel illusions caused by her fever.
02b5dbf41a52653d59afd8ec5874f200.source_excerpt: the best method of dispelling such illusions was to drink, for a draught of the beverage prepared by the doctor to allay her fever seemed to cause a reaction of the brain

81671005fc518ecfef98260350b6cc50.constraint_text: Andrea cannot provide his own name because his parents abandoned him
81671005fc518ecfef98260350b6cc50.source_excerpt: They ask my name, I cannot give it, since my parents abandoned me.

81671005fc518ecfef98260350b6cc50.constraint_text: Andrea claims his father is named M. de Villefort and states he can prove it
81671005fc518ecfef98260350b6cc50.source_excerpt: my father is named M. de Villefort, and I am ready to prove it.

973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.constraint_text: The abbé's malady is a hereditary condition that has caused death in his father and grandfather during their third attack.
973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.source_excerpt: it is a family inheritance; both my father and grandfather died of it in a third attack.

973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.constraint_text: The physician Cabanis explicitly predicted the abbé's death from the same malady, despite prior successful treatments.
973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.source_excerpt: The physician who prepared for me the remedy I have twice successfully taken, was no other than the celebrated Cabanis, and he predicted a similar end for me.

973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.constraint_text: The abbé has resolved to remain at his current location until his death, regardless of external circumstances.
973e0e7a4a963d0a1bb9ceb32b1e8126.source_excerpt: Here I shall remain till the hour of my deliverance arrives, and that, in all human probability, will be the hour of my death.

553cf7d77b11605ce361064e77bf0d7b.constraint_text: No one could ascend the mountain under penalty of death after the burial
553cf7d77b11605ce361064e77bf0d7b.source_excerpt: now no one could ascend it under penalty of death, for it was tabooed.

553cf7d77b11605ce361064e77bf0d7b.constraint_text: The captives were not to leave their prison until the summit of the Wahiti mountains kindled with the first beams of the day
553cf7d77b11605ce361064e77bf0d7b.source_excerpt: They were not to leave it again until the summit of the Wahiti mountains should kindle with the first beams of the day.

47bb514be4575358f5bd7dd183361c09.constraint_text: The old man would not have attempted to escape for fifty years.
47bb514be4575358f5bd7dd183361c09.source_excerpt: he would have stayed here fifty years, I’ll answer for it, without any attempt to escape.

33e63a78f364a961f3445c8f6a483bcf.constraint_text: Mary's willingness to die by John Mangles' hand is explicitly tied to Lady Helena's precedent of a wife dying by her husband's hand to escape degradation.
33e63a78f364a961f3445c8f6a483bcf.source_excerpt: "...if a wife can die by the hand of her husband to escape a degrading existence, a maiden can likewise die by the hand of her lover."

84f4099837e9f781d86df1cdc8f0d9cc.constraint_text: Preserved his reason during the general intoxication
84f4099837e9f781d86df1cdc8f0d9cc.source_excerpt: Kai-Koumou had preserved his reason in the midst of the general intoxication.

84f4099837e9f781d86df1cdc8f0d9cc.constraint_text: Allowed the bloody orgy to reach its intensity for exactly one hour
84f4099837e9f781d86df1cdc8f0d9cc.source_excerpt: He allowed this bloody orgy an hour to reach its utmost intensity.

6a8b73a741cf3421acfb8ed543acd46b.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has passed beyond the bounds of vengeance and can no longer claim divine justification for his actions.
6a8b73a741cf3421acfb8ed543acd46b.source_excerpt: he felt that he had passed beyond the bounds of vengeance, and that he could no longer say, 'God is for and with me.'

48e185b2d546572fc693dc04e0298821.constraint_text: Paganel expected to act prudently and avoid venturing to extremes when addressing the volcano's risks.
48e185b2d546572fc693dc04e0298821.source_excerpt: Paganel had foreseen these difficulties, but he expected to act prudently, and not to venture to extremes.

5887cd7f8a02038457b2d12f4becfda2.constraint_text: The taboo's effectiveness is contingent on the preservation of Kara-Tété's tomb; destruction of the tomb would render the taboo ineffective.
5887cd7f8a02038457b2d12f4becfda2.source_excerpt: It was important that this structure should be spared by the eruption, for otherwise the taboo would become ineffective.

c1cae100b0459adce0e1a93e4a7eb196.constraint_text: The Maoris are still cannibals and will remain so for some time to come.
c1cae100b0459adce0e1a93e4a7eb196.source_excerpt: No, the Maoris are still cannibals, and will remain so for some time to come.

c1cae100b0459adce0e1a93e4a7eb196.constraint_text: Paganel's usual characteristic is not pessimism, but he is a pessimist on this specific point.
c1cae100b0459adce0e1a93e4a7eb196.source_excerpt: Paganel was on this point a pessimist, contrary to his usual characteristic.

7718d08ed71a469035606478ef5b37fd.constraint_text: Franz had never experienced such a sudden transition from gayety to sadness in his entire life
7718d08ed71a469035606478ef5b37fd.source_excerpt: In his whole life, perhaps, Franz had never before experienced so sudden an impression, so rapid a transition from gayety to sadness, as in this moment.

207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.constraint_text: The character attributes his misery to human enmity rather than divine vengeance.
207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.source_excerpt: He told himself that it was the enmity of man, and not the vengeance of Heaven, that had thus plunged him into the deepest misery.

207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.constraint_text: The character believes tranquility is equivalent to death, necessitating other forms of torment.
207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.source_excerpt: he began to reflect on suicide... tranquillity was death, and if punishment were the end in view other tortures than death must be invented

207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.constraint_text: The character believes death ends suffering, making torture insufficient.
207ead285b18f1b687d73721cf7552f6.source_excerpt: after torture came death, and after death, if not repose, at least the boon of unconsciousness

8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.constraint_text: Villefort secluded himself more than ever to avoid applications for court tickets.
8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.source_excerpt: He had been obliged to seclude himself more than ever, to evade the enormous number of applications presented to him for the purpose of obtaining tickets of admission to the court on the day of trial.

8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.constraint_text: The recent death of Valentine (so short a time had elapsed) caused others to overlook Villefort’s absorption in work.
8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.source_excerpt: And then so short a time had elapsed since the death of poor Valentine, and the gloom which overshadowed the house was so recent, that no one wondered to see the father so absorbed in his professional duties...

8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.constraint_text: Villefort saw his father only once, specifically after Bertuccio’s second visit to Benedetto.
8a2809c1b88fe2aa7573e93ad244d165.source_excerpt: Once only had Villefort seen his father; it was the day after that upon which Bertuccio had paid his second visit to Benedetto...

2b4339693e89f210c053c41182bfc0f9.constraint_text: Noirtier consistently displays tenderness towards Valentine during their interaction.
2b4339693e89f210c053c41182bfc0f9.source_excerpt: The old gentleman continued to dwell upon her with the same expression.

2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.constraint_text: Noirtier's eyes are the sole medium through which he communicates, replacing the functions of his paralyzed body.
2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.source_excerpt: the speaking eye sufficed for all. He commanded with it; it was the medium through which his thanks were conveyed.

2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.constraint_text: Only three individuals (Villefort, Valentine, and the old servant) can understand Noirtier's language of the eyes.
2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.source_excerpt: Three persons only could understand this language of the poor paralytic; these were Villefort, Valentine, and the old servant of whom we have already spoken.

2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.constraint_text: Noirtier's eyes concentrate all his mental activity due to the paralysis of his other physical faculties.
2659f66356e39d492cba7b1264214598.source_excerpt: in his eyes... was concentrated, as it often happens with an organ which is used to the exclusion of the others, all the activity, address, force, and intelligence which were formerly diffused over his whole body

d91bc48ab500d7f14cb8763bf003a2aa.constraint_text: Villefort resolves that the man holding the blade of justice must strike wherever there is guilt today.
d91bc48ab500d7f14cb8763bf003a2aa.source_excerpt: "Today," he said with an effort,—"today the man who holds the blade of justice must strike wherever there is guilt."

ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.constraint_text: Sight and hearing are the only senses remaining in Noirtier's body.
ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.source_excerpt: Sight and hearing were the only senses remaining, and they, like two solitary sparks, remained to animate the miserable body which seemed fit for nothing but the grave

ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.constraint_text: Noirtier's body is described as 'fit for nothing but the grave' due to his immobility and lack of physical function.
ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.source_excerpt: the miserable body which seemed fit for nothing but the grave

ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.constraint_text: Noirtier's eyes are the sole means of expressing his thoughts and feelings.
ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.source_excerpt: it was only, however, by means of one of these senses that he could reveal the thoughts and feelings that still occupied his mind

ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.constraint_text: Noirtier lacks the ability to move his arms, speak, or demonstrate physical agility.
ddae4fd50d1b0552d5f46b6abadac17b.source_excerpt: the movement of the arm, the sound of the voice, and the agility of the body, were wanting

6f2c169066081c3201c56ba204941dba.constraint_text: Dantès' appearance changed after entering the Château d’If
Dantès' refined intellectual expression resulted from profound learning he acquired
6f2c169066081c3201c56ba204941dba.source_excerpt: the profound learning he had acquired had besides diffused over his features a refined intellectual expression

834529d9185eb142db956a7766da9ee5.constraint_text: If Andrea attempts to fly, he must be shot by the commissary.
834529d9185eb142db956a7766da9ee5.source_excerpt: "Well, you guard the exterior, and if he attempts to fly, fire upon him; he must be a great criminal, from what the telegraph says."

834529d9185eb142db956a7766da9ee5.constraint_text: Andrea entered the room with more speed and noise than intended due to his foot slipping.
834529d9185eb142db956a7766da9ee5.source_excerpt: Andrea had very cleverly managed to descend two-thirds of the chimney, but then his foot slipped, and notwithstanding his endeavors, he came into the room with more speed and noise than he intended.

c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.constraint_text: Andrea's current downfall is explicitly attributed to the absence of his protector.
c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.source_excerpt: An unhappy lapse of fortune and the absence of my protector have cast me down, certainly, but not forever.

c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.constraint_text: Andrea chose to maintain rigid silence instead of using his privilege to wait to be claimed upon entering La Force.
c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.source_excerpt: the wily youth, instead of making use of his privilege of waiting to be claimed on his entry into La Force, had maintained a rigid silence.

c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.constraint_text: Andrea's cautious behavior is explicitly justified by the risk of alienating his protector.
c9e7ca224c9a0129463adb2a3fd22062.source_excerpt: Why should I risk an imprudent step? It might alienate my protector.

b987b78df6ad5d88a9a81bb087320d5a.constraint_text: Ayrton is determined to overcome the difficulty at any cost.
b987b78df6ad5d88a9a81bb087320d5a.source_excerpt: Ayrton, however, who seemed determined to overcome the difficulty at any cost

b987b78df6ad5d88a9a81bb087320d5a.constraint_text: Ayrton must stop his exertions at the moment Lord Glenarvan intervenes.

aa7110b147e9c0d55878e23ca8bb05c0.character: the pirates who plunder the vessel
aa7110b147e9c0d55878e23ca8bb05c0.constraint_text: The pirates transfer valuables to their boat, bind the crew hand and foot, attach 24-pound balls to their necks, and sink the vessel by chopping a hole in its bottom.
aa7110b147e9c0d55878e23ca8bb05c0.source_excerpt: they transfer from the vessel to their own boat whatever they think worth taking, then they bind the crew hand and foot, they attach to everyone’s neck a four-and-twenty-pound ball, a large hole is chopped in the vessel’s bottom, and then they leave her.

f4de19be41939ba9774888efc2860aaa.constraint_text: Glenarvan has committed to devote his entire life to finding Captain Grant.
f4de19be41939ba9774888efc2860aaa.source_excerpt: I shall do everything possible to find Captain Grant, as I have undertaken to do, and shall devote my entire life, if necessary, to this object.

0e9b820f384c6f08129dc3cc2929426f.constraint_text: Paganel possesses extensive and fluent knowledge of Australian history, presented as an inherent trait.
0e9b820f384c6f08129dc3cc2929426f.source_excerpt: poured forth the history of the discovery of Australia... as fluently as though his sole calling in life was to be professor of Australian history

829d9ee227d62be1b7031dc931609d32.constraint_text: Harry Grant must have been made prisoner by the natives as soon as he landed, due to his knowledge of his position and absence from English colonies.
829d9ee227d62be1b7031dc931609d32.source_excerpt: "He knew his position exactly, as the document proves, and, as he has not reached any English colony, he must have been made prisoner by the natives as soon as he landed."

829d9ee227d62be1b7031dc931609d32.constraint_text: Ayrton was captured by the natives in the same manner as Harry Grant.
829d9ee227d62be1b7031dc931609d32.source_excerpt: "That is precisely what happened to his quartermaster, Ayrton," replied Captain Mangles.

8d30a530372207efab1a4b606f65c65c.constraint_text: The mountain is tabooed, making it inaccessible to superstitious savages due to the chief's burial there.
8d30a530372207efab1a4b606f65c65c.source_excerpt: Indeed, the mountain was tabooed, and by this consecration had become inaccessible by the superstitious savages.

1ec0245981ad3cc832dfd7436b73d884.constraint_text: Paganel was not deterred from rehearsing how settlers began to inhabit the island despite his fears.
1ec0245981ad3cc832dfd7436b73d884.source_excerpt: However, he was not deterred from rehearsing how one and another not merely visited, but began to settle, on the island...

416ef2e8db9ec438be3cc24bec9e731b.constraint_text: If no traces of the Britannia are found at Cape Bernouilli, Lord Glenarvan must return to Europe and abandon the search.
416ef2e8db9ec438be3cc24bec9e731b.source_excerpt: it was decided that, if no traces of the Britannia were found at Cape Bernouilli, Lord Glenarvan should return to Europe, relinquishing all hope of finding the object of their search.

ebe709af3d48c8cd76a8a1da85544480.constraint_text: Glenarvan is resolved to bring assistance to the unfortunates or they are lost.
ebe709af3d48c8cd76a8a1da85544480.source_excerpt: "Bring them assistance or they are lost." [Sidenote: A NOBLE RESOLVE.]

67d41354ea06cccf4d7fcbe21c8439db.constraint_text: The ship was never wrecked on the reefs of Twofold Bay
67d41354ea06cccf4d7fcbe21c8439db.source_excerpt: The Britannia had never been wrecked on the reefs of Twofold Bay!

67d41354ea06cccf4d7fcbe21c8439db.constraint_text: He never set foot on the Australian continent
67d41354ea06cccf4d7fcbe21c8439db.source_excerpt: Harry Grant had never set foot on the Australian continent!

be573eb2eb5a42cd28661dd605ff189f.constraint_text: The letter from Caderousse was sealed perfectly and could not have been read by anyone before Andrea examined it.
be573eb2eb5a42cd28661dd605ff189f.source_excerpt: it was so carefully folded, that no one could have read it, and the seal was perfect.

be573eb2eb5a42cd28661dd605ff189f.constraint_text: Andrea burned Caderousse’s letter immediately after reading it, making its contents irretrievable.
be573eb2eb5a42cd28661dd605ff189f.source_excerpt: In two seconds the young man had reached his room and burnt Caderousse’s letter.

b62a7cfa6c94a9dbc7bca86559ea1dd9.constraint_text: The servant withdrew because the unknown man displayed an ironic expression and a frightful smile
b62a7cfa6c94a9dbc7bca86559ea1dd9.source_excerpt: "I am not begging, my fine fellow," said the unknown to the servant, with so ironical an expression of the eye, and so frightful a smile, that he withdrew;

b62a7cfa6c94a9dbc7bca86559ea1dd9.constraint_text: Andrea maintained sufficient nerve to conceal his agitation during the encounter
b62a7cfa6c94a9dbc7bca86559ea1dd9.source_excerpt: "Come," said Andrea, with sufficient nerve for his servant not to perceive his agitation,

a79851f6490a5c281c620401fe735d76.constraint_text: The count possesses a vigorous and daring mind that denies anything to be impossible, with energy characteristic of a great man.
a79851f6490a5c281c620401fe735d76.source_excerpt: We know the count’s vigorous and daring mind, denying anything to be impossible, with that energy which marks the great man.

6b8c784afea675c85f9cc5df48b8a32b.constraint_text: If Captain Grant was wrecked on New Zealand's coast and has not appeared for two years since the disaster, he must have fallen victim to the sea or the savages.
6b8c784afea675c85f9cc5df48b8a32b.source_excerpt: "Because, admitting that Captain Grant was wrecked on the coast of New Zealand, as long as he has not made his appearance for two years since the disaster, he must have fallen a victim to the sea or the savages."

431e2464f4d59b79a82cd35345f99e50.constraint_text: The sister is sixteen years old.

62398d45b93b06e53d50375389ae072f.constraint_text: Her hand was placed in Captain Mangles' hand during a marriage ceremony
62398d45b93b06e53d50375389ae072f.source_excerpt: "My lord and lady, join with me to bless our children!"

62398d45b93b06e53d50375389ae072f.constraint_text: He was abandoned on the Australian coast
62398d45b93b06e53d50375389ae072f.source_excerpt: his having been abandoned on the Australian coast

62398d45b93b06e53d50375389ae072f.constraint_text: His ruin was caused by his passions

ebde13166503181185d5f615adff348c.constraint_text: Mary has long been John's betrothed in his heart, indicating a persistent emotional commitment
ebde13166503181185d5f615adff348c.source_excerpt: have I not long been your betrothed in the depths of your heart?

ebde13166503181185d5f615adff348c.constraint_text: Glenarvan's death is fixed to occur at sunrise the following day
ebde13166503181185d5f615adff348c.source_excerpt: You shall die to-morrow at sunrise.

7535a4dd38289edc0bb87973e17080de.constraint_text: Glenarvan's party lacks sufficient men to sacrifice any more.
7535a4dd38289edc0bb87973e17080de.source_excerpt: Glenarvan's little party did not number enough men to sacrifice any more.

ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.constraint_text: Married Miss Tuffnel because he believed she would make a noble wife
ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.source_excerpt: He saw that the poor girl would make a noble wife, and he married her.

ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.constraint_text: Her love for her husband exceeded gratitude and persisted as if roles were reversed
ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.source_excerpt: Her love for her husband exceeded even her gratitude. She loved him as if she had been the rich heiress, and he the friendless orphan.

ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.constraint_text: They were perpetually loyal to Lady Glenarvan, willing to lay down their lives for her
ba0002ec57f281e062140aee78e89d7e.source_excerpt: they were ready to lay down their lives for her whom they called 'our good lady of Luss.'

c55dd4f9c0bc78f0083ee095c926d3ed.constraint_text: Mary Grant is unlikely to gain access to the Queen.
c55dd4f9c0bc78f0083ee095c926d3ed.source_excerpt: he doubted whether Mary Grant would gain access to her; for but few suppliants reach the steps of a throne.

199e1ff520ad53226644e41f581d2b0b.constraint_text: Heaven has decreed that they will die tomorrow, and they must accept this decree as unchangeable.
199e1ff520ad53226644e41f581d2b0b.source_excerpt: "If Heaven has decreed that we shall die to-morrow, we can, I am sure, die like brave people, like Christians, ready to appear fearlessly before the final Judge."

dbb09b05c0ce2b99b9e00636c8f85748.constraint_text: She must remain at the castle until Lord Glenarvan's return.
dbb09b05c0ce2b99b9e00636c8f85748.source_excerpt: "Till Lord Glenarvan's return you will remain at the castle."

6e7621ff8ec46d55fd1b482a51eb5c41.constraint_text: Paganel cannot climb the peak of Teneriffe because Humboldt and Bonpland have already done so, rendering his attempt futile.
6e7621ff8ec46d55fd1b482a51eb5c41.source_excerpt: "What is the use, I ask you, after Humboldt and Bonpland? What can I do after these great men?"

8dfe76412dc4641409de7eea0e137fca.constraint_text: Paganel fulfills his duties with customary precision
8dfe76412dc4641409de7eea0e137fca.source_excerpt: Paganel was charged with this duty, and fulfilled it with his customary precision.

8dfe76412dc4641409de7eea0e137fca.constraint_text: The women do not shrink from traversing long distances on foot if necessary
8dfe76412dc4641409de7eea0e137fca.source_excerpt: The courageous women did not shrink from traversing the entire distance on foot, if necessary.

5311aab92d85e3b6f6f6ab75408ae40f.constraint_text: M. Noirtier has been incapable of moving or speaking while retaining a clear mind.
5311aab92d85e3b6f6f6ab75408ae40f.source_excerpt: his mind perfectly clear, but the same incapability of moving or speaking.

ddf36ebe7e54c73bffe519ba21f89b16.constraint_text: Eugénie is determined she will not marry
ddf36ebe7e54c73bffe519ba21f89b16.source_excerpt: who is determined she will not marry

5d31738f1a12016cbec7b3604671ea50.constraint_text: Albert has resolved to reject his past entirely, including his name, due to its association with shame.
5d31738f1a12016cbec7b3604671ea50.source_excerpt: from this moment I have done with the past, and accept nothing from it—not even a name, because you can understand that your son cannot bear the name of a man who ought to blush for it before another.

7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.constraint_text: Morrel's father died in his arms, happy, respected, rich, and full of years
7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.source_excerpt: “Yes; but your father died in your arms, happy, respected, rich, and full of years; his father died poor, despairing, almost doubtful of Providence; and when his son sought his grave ten years afterwards, his tomb had disappeared, and no one could say, ‘There sleeps the father you so well loved.’”

7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.constraint_text: Morrel's father's tomb had disappeared ten years after his death
7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.source_excerpt: and when his son sought his grave ten years afterwards, his tomb had disappeared

7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.constraint_text: The woman was faithless and married one of the persecutors of her betrothed
7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.source_excerpt: You are deceived, Morrel, that woman——‘She was dead?’‘Worse than that, she was faithless, and had married one of the persecutors of her betrothed.’

7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.constraint_text: Morrel is expected at the Island of Monte Cristo on the 5th of October
7ab8f1c281581ef8d407ed5e3bc58f06.source_excerpt: On the 5th of October, Morrel, I shall expect you at the Island of Monte Cristo.

d5dc189e22faf9159220d96736407527.constraint_text: Danglars has decided that his daughter shall marry, overriding her own determination not to.
d5dc189e22faf9159220d96736407527.source_excerpt: "My daughter," continued the banker, "you have perfectly explained to me the sentiments which influence a girl like you, who is determined she will not marry; now it remains for me to tell you the motives of a father like me, who has decided that his daughter shall marry."

76f3bc510ebbcd0a52b175e554c8f27c.constraint_text: The iron box has remained untouched since the narrator's birth, hidden under the fig-tree planted by their father on that day.
76f3bc510ebbcd0a52b175e554c8f27c.source_excerpt: The iron box was there—no one had touched it—under a beautiful fig-tree my father had planted the day I was born

76f3bc510ebbcd0a52b175e554c8f27c.constraint_text: The narrator's mother has persistently returned only the piece of black bread to the woman she loved since the day she was separated from her.
76f3bc510ebbcd0a52b175e554c8f27c.source_excerpt: since the day I was torn from her I loved... return her only the piece of black bread forgotten under my poor roof

1c2bcfedc2c11b319745a2caed3d7523.constraint_text: Poverty cannot cause a person to open a secretaire in an inhabited house, only to commit minor thefts like stealing bread.
1c2bcfedc2c11b319745a2caed3d7523.source_excerpt:
Poverty——
"Pshaw!" said Busoni disdainfully; "poverty may make a man beg, steal a loaf of bread at a baker’s door, but not cause him to open a secretaire in a house supposed to be inhabited."

833c55f3ebf921eb7fec8e39f2f943d0.constraint_text: Ayrton possesses knowledge of the country and the ability to navigate difficult regions, which distinguishes him as capable of extricating himself from challenging situations.
833c55f3ebf921eb7fec8e39f2f943d0.source_excerpt: "If it please your lordship, I will go. I am acquainted with the country, and have often crossed more difficult regions. I can extricate myself where another would fail."

189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.constraint_text: The narrator's voluntary confession of the Auteuil assassination proved their innocence in the eyes of the person they spoke to
189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.source_excerpt: My voluntary confession of the assassination at Auteuil proved to him that I had not committed that of which I stood accused.

189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.constraint_text: The narrator's trial was postponed due to the abbé's efforts
189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.source_excerpt: I had speedy proofs that the excellent abbé was engaged in my behalf... and I was told that my trial was to be postponed to the assizes following those now being held.

189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.constraint_text: The narrator's release was directly caused by Caderousse's full confession
189d9b8d624ab9081373672e0d1d4499.source_excerpt: the apprehension of Caderousse... and brought back to France, where he made a full confession... and I was immediately set at liberty.

45ca591a626e14e235d711b9718fb0b2.constraint_text: Villefort's advancement in his career was caused by his zeal and being one of the first to inform the government about Napoleon's departure from Elba.
45ca591a626e14e235d711b9718fb0b2.source_excerpt: His zeal had procured him advancement, and he was said to be one of the first who had informed the government of the departure from the Island of Elba.

f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.constraint_text: M. Noirtier's anger stems from Valentine's marriage in general, not the specific groom
f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.source_excerpt: It is not because Mademoiselle Valentine is going to marry you that he is angry, but because she will marry, a union with any other would have caused him the same sorrow.

f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.constraint_text: M. Noirtier has forgotten the name of his intended grandson
f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.source_excerpt: M. Noirtier has even forgotten the name of his intended grandson.

f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.constraint_text: Valentine cannot remain a companion to M. Noirtier after marriage
f90cd2b7d013a97a5765b8696da0b500.source_excerpt: Mademoiselle Valentine has been a faithful companion to M. Noirtier, which she cannot be when she becomes the Baroness d’Épinay.

ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.constraint_text: Maintained high position in magistracy regardless of political changes
ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.source_excerpt: maintained his eminence like a Harlay or a Molé

ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.constraint_text: Adherence to traditional customs and rigid etiquette caused by the influence of his young wife and daughter
ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.source_excerpt: under the regenerating influence of a young wife and a daughter by his first marriage, scarcely eighteen, was still one of the well-regulated Paris salons where the worship of traditional customs and the observance of rigid etiquette were carefully maintained

ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.constraint_text: Supported by some but not genuinely liked by anyone
ea85d8f3a84fb3e70adf927e62ed60c4.source_excerpt: hated by many, but warmly supported by others, without being really liked by anybody

07bf38da339b8b7f9ce008a3ef9c7621.constraint_text: M. de Villefort insists that his will must be respected in his family, overriding the 'folly of an old man and the caprice of a child'.
07bf38da339b8b7f9ce008a3ef9c7621.source_excerpt: Nevertheless, it is necessary that my will should be respected in my family, and that the folly of an old man and the caprice of a child should not be allowed to overturn a project which I have entertained for so many years.

4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.constraint_text: The Marquis of Saint-Méran had not visited the house for five years prior to its sale.
4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.source_excerpt: it is five years since he was here last

4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.constraint_text: The Marquis of Saint-Méran was the previous owner of the house.
4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.source_excerpt: The Marquis of Saint-Méran. Ah, I am sure he has not sold the house for what he gave for it.

4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.constraint_text: The Marquis of Saint-Méran had an only daughter who married M. de Villefort.
4731af90930807135ca9f19290b7ad9c.source_excerpt: an old gentleman... who had an only daughter, who married M. de Villefort

2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.constraint_text: M. de Saint-Méran and Noirtier had never been on strict terms of friendship
2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.source_excerpt: M. de Saint-Méran and Noirtier had never been on strict terms of friendship

2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.constraint_text: Noirtier uses closing one eye as a method of inquiry
2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.source_excerpt: then he closed one eye, in token of inquiry
