2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.constraint_text: Valentine was at the ball because she came to say goodbye in full dress
2af909db7177afac514c64c2e0bbbddc.source_excerpt: She is at the ball, as you know, since she came to say good-bye to you in full dress

94f9fd05bccae5e2693b32a86c4ce6d0.constraint_text: The Marquis de Saint-Méran died two days after the events described in the first part of the passage.
94f9fd05bccae5e2693b32a86c4ce6d0.source_excerpt: Two days after, a considerable crowd was assembled... contained the corpse of the Marquis de Saint-Méran

94f9fd05bccae5e2693b32a86c4ce6d0.constraint_text: The Marquis de Saint-Méran was a zealous and faithful dignitary of Louis XVIII and King Charles X, a trait that preserved many friends for him.
94f9fd05bccae5e2693b32a86c4ce6d0.source_excerpt: The Marquis de Saint-Méran, one of the most zealous and faithful dignitaries of Louis XVIII. and King Charles X., had preserved a great number of friends

4a50641cd84dc4c8405332608cf263c9.constraint_text: Noirtier's sentencing occurred on the day he made the speaker his heir, directly causing the speaker's death sentence.
4a50641cd84dc4c8405332608cf263c9.source_excerpt: Noirtier was sentenced the day he made you his heir; that is why you, in your turn, are to die—it is because your father would inherit your property, and your brother, his only son, succeed to his.

4a50641cd84dc4c8405332608cf263c9.constraint_text: If the speaker dies, their fortune would naturally revert to their brother unless the brother is disinherited.
4a50641cd84dc4c8405332608cf263c9.source_excerpt: It was considered, that you dead, the fortune would naturally revert to your brother, unless he were disinherited; and besides, the crime appearing useless, it would be folly to commit it.

cb9e837899af764d6bac60681b52cd42.constraint_text: Morrel keeps a secret due to a promise made to Valentine
cb9e837899af764d6bac60681b52cd42.source_excerpt: But he recalled the promise he had made to Valentine, and kept his secret.

b76f3b52ebf25a29c89a3cb1bca5fc0e.constraint_text: M. de Villefort displayed freezing politeness, strict fidelity to government principles, contempt for theories, and hatred of ideality in both private and public life.
b76f3b52ebf25a29c89a3cb1bca5fc0e.source_excerpt: A freezing politeness, a strict fidelity to government principles, a profound contempt for theories and theorists, a deep-seated hatred of ideality,—these were the elements of private and public life displayed by M. de Villefort.

b76f3b52ebf25a29c89a3cb1bca5fc0e.constraint_text: M. de Villefort's position was unassailable due to his 'impregnable fortress' status, preventing removal despite potential opposition.
b76f3b52ebf25a29c89a3cb1bca5fc0e.source_excerpt: but, like the feudal barons who rebelled against their sovereign, he dwelt in an impregnable fortress.

82513c963cfecccf951c5f14f18da18a.constraint_text: M. de Villefort is currently located in Toulouse, not Marseille
82513c963cfecccf951c5f14f18da18a.source_excerpt: "M. Villefort is no longer at Marseilles; he is now at Toulouse."

82513c963cfecccf951c5f14f18da18a.constraint_text: The inmate progressively increases his offer of francs for release by one million each year
82513c963cfecccf951c5f14f18da18a.source_excerpt: "The first year he offered government a million of francs for his release; the second, two; the third, three; and so on progressively."

61cac0c8728b7d74b2aad691a8c42064.constraint_text: To throw a bottle into the sea, the sea must be present, or alternatively, rivers flowing into it.
61cac0c8728b7d74b2aad691a8c42064.source_excerpt: "Or, in the absence of the sea," added Paganel, "the rivers which flow into it."

b352b12c5c8b1af02a56dd3fee95bcfe.constraint_text: They agreed that it was necessary to have courage for every fortune and be contented with a tree when one has neither palace nor cottage.
b352b12c5c8b1af02a56dd3fee95bcfe.source_excerpt: They were agreed on this point, that it was necessary to have courage for every fortune, and be contented with a tree when one has neither palace nor cottage.

8c1579ad7127700377d39f129a438a2f.constraint_text: Paganel's behavior combines 'childish good-nature and scientific and national pride' in a persistent manner that cannot be altered.
8c1579ad7127700377d39f129a438a2f.source_excerpt: All this was done with such a mingling of childish good-nature and scientific and national pride that it was useless to do anything but laugh...

e154fb60b540ed1750979376a796b9a0.source_excerpt: "for an Indian understands nothing of geography."
"Ah, MacNabb," said Paganel, "you still doubt my Spanish!"

1079028d8ae89ee0033c23cb766724cb.constraint_text: Jacques Paganel is noted for absent-mindedness and making geographical blunders.
1079028d8ae89ee0033c23cb766724cb.source_excerpt: he is noted for such blunders. He once published a celebrated map of America, in which he located Japan.

1079028d8ae89ee0033c23cb766724cb.constraint_text: Jacques Paganel published a map of America with an error in Japan's location.
1079028d8ae89ee0033c23cb766724cb.source_excerpt: He once published a celebrated map of America, in which he located Japan.

62b4e1bb7ba6d6f56ab0ce45c804b5f3.constraint_text: Paganel is loquacious and remains so despite being charmed by services rendered.
62b4e1bb7ba6d6f56ab0ce45c804b5f3.source_excerpt: the services thus rendered charmed the Frenchman, who was none the less loquacious

48b5323f9cc7a608b334899311b68b07.constraint_text: Paganel's declaration directly answers Glenarvan's question at the moment of the disclosure
48b5323f9cc7a608b334899311b68b07.source_excerpt: This declaration of Paganel was a direct answer to the question the former had asked.

eb015c7f7188ea596ca625bb3996cbc6.constraint_text: Paganel explicitly states a persistent preference for 'a fine spectacle, especially when I cannot avoid it.'
eb015c7f7188ea596ca625bb3996cbc6.source_excerpt: "So much the better," replied the enthusiastic Paganel. "I like a fine spectacle, especially when I cannot avoid it."

74f999e9dfee87d25a9506fbe38e31c4.constraint_text: Paganel was assigned the first watch and did not lie down.
74f999e9dfee87d25a9506fbe38e31c4.source_excerpt: Paganel, to whom fell the first watch, did not lie down, but, rifle on shoulder, guarded the encampment, walking to and fro that he might the better resist sleep.

74f999e9dfee87d25a9506fbe38e31c4.constraint_text: Paganel guarded the encampment with a rifle on his shoulder.
74f999e9dfee87d25a9506fbe38e31c4.source_excerpt: Paganel, to whom fell the first watch, did not lie down, but, rifle on shoulder, guarded the encampment, walking to and fro that he might the better resist sleep.
the geographer amused himself in reading the great book of the firmament, which is always open.

4edb89e7be97d744fe8fc86718b1990b.constraint_text: Visited Guzerat and Golconda during a voyage in his earliest youth
4edb89e7be97d744fe8fc86718b1990b.source_excerpt: "...which he could just recollect having visited during a voyage made in his earliest youth."

9a2498d3040ac44a1ea65781917508ea.constraint_text: Luigi must learn to write after the initial instruction proves insufficient.
9a2498d3040ac44a1ea65781917508ea.source_excerpt: This was not enough—he must now learn to write.

9a2498d3040ac44a1ea65781917508ea.constraint_text: Luigi learned to write at the end of three months of practice.
9a2498d3040ac44a1ea65781917508ea.source_excerpt: At the end of three months he had learned to write.

6e133376517140c3113fbe14b3ecc4f4.constraint_text: Lord Wilmore is precision and punctuality personified, returning exactly at the appointed time
6e133376517140c3113fbe14b3ecc4f4.source_excerpt: Lord Wilmore, who was precision and punctuality personified, was not yet come in, but that he would be sure to return as the clock struck.

9825dbfd6aac13523747e39974179dd7.constraint_text: The second grotto must be located in the farthest angle of the second opening as specified in the cardinal’s will.
9825dbfd6aac13523747e39974179dd7.source_excerpt: "In the farthest angle of the second opening," said the cardinal’s will.

33dea496ab5e7412d6db51f0c7a0e9aa.constraint_text: Dantès had refrained from talking about the treasure for an unspecified period until the day Faria revealed its significance.
33dea496ab5e7412d6db51f0c7a0e9aa.source_excerpt: Until this day and for how long a time!—he had refrained from talking of the treasure, which had brought upon the abbé the accusation of madness.

635b4cd8c56b84d6bbad9b98264632ed.constraint_text: Monte Cristo possesses extensive knowledge of antiquities, being able to instantly identify the origin, date, and country of artifacts.
635b4cd8c56b84d6bbad9b98264632ed.source_excerpt: Monte Cristo quickly appreciated all that Albert had collected here... everything was familiar to him; and at the first glance he recognized their date, their country, and their origin.

28d95712afdba7415f2054403aa3eb01.constraint_text: Albert cultivated fencing, boxing, and single-stick with greater perseverance than music and drawing, indicating a persistent trait of sustained interest in these activities compared to his earlier hobbies.
28d95712afdba7415f2054403aa3eb01.source_excerpt: for, following the example of the fashionable young men of the time, Albert de Morcerf cultivated, with far more perseverance than music and drawing, the three arts that complete a dandy’s education, i.e., fencing, boxing, and single-stick

40192605d7134667a596796581c0bff6.constraint_text: The pale-faced man observed and likely overheard Mercédès arranging her property and shutting her drawers.
40192605d7134667a596796581c0bff6.source_excerpt: He who was thus looking, without being heard or seen, probably heard and saw all that passed in Madame de Morcerf’s apartments.

fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.constraint_text: The house was transformed from a sad, gloomy state to a lively, scented, and well-regulated environment within a single day.
fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.source_excerpt: this house which appeared only the night before so sad and gloomy... had in a single day acquired the aspect of life

fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.constraint_text: The equipages in the coach-houses appeared to have been installed for the last fifty years, despite being restored the previous day.
fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.source_excerpt: the equipages, encased and numbered, appeared to have been installed for the last fifty years

fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.constraint_text: The servants behaved as if they had always inhabited the house, despite being restored the previous day.
fbd06e1b129806e5dde2ddfbd0ce2af7.source_excerpt: some, belonging to the kitchens, gliding down the stairs, restored but the previous day, as if they had always inhabited the house

b0e2ea0866cd13489e3b97fe0cd8fc2d.constraint_text: M. Albert de Morcerf believed Monte Cristo was the cause of his father’s dishonor and his family’s ruin.
b0e2ea0866cd13489e3b97fe0cd8fc2d.source_excerpt: Yet he considered you the cause of his father’s dishonor, the cause of the fearful ruin which has fallen on my house.

b0e2ea0866cd13489e3b97fe0cd8fc2d.constraint_text: M. Albert de Morcerf apologized to Monte Cristo during their meeting.
b0e2ea0866cd13489e3b97fe0cd8fc2d.source_excerpt: I explained nothing, and it is he who apologized to me.

e8e2d3c923655977e4afdd7f0a8914e8.constraint_text: The speaker has promised to adhere to Wilmore's instructions regarding the young man's future.
e8e2d3c923655977e4afdd7f0a8914e8.source_excerpt: I have promised to adhere to his instructions.

e8e2d3c923655977e4afdd7f0a8914e8.constraint_text: Wilmore's wealth allows him to indulge eccentricities without financial risk.
e8e2d3c923655977e4afdd7f0a8914e8.source_excerpt: he is sincere, and as rich as a gold mine, consequently, he may indulge his eccentricities without any fear of their ruining him

a67512df7cd300c3e7e0d99cf0243a71.constraint_text: Ayrton was perfectly familiar with Australia
a67512df7cd300c3e7e0d99cf0243a71.source_excerpt: He gave some interesting information concerning Australia, with which he was perfectly familiar.

4b3c2b180c81d05a0653370d56a0474e.constraint_text: It is customary for witnesses to be present at every contract or negotiation between two parties.
4b3c2b180c81d05a0653370d56a0474e.source_excerpt: It is customary for witnesses to be present at every contract or negotiation between two parties.

4b3c2b180c81d05a0653370d56a0474e.constraint_text: Glenarvan was accustomed to Ayrton's manners, indicating a long-standing familiarity.
4b3c2b180c81d05a0653370d56a0474e.source_excerpt: Glenarvan, who was accustomed to Ayrton's manners, betrayed no surprise...

5cdc6c00e5b7058e49325624f8fc1eba.constraint_text: Both sides maintained silence due to a shared objective, as indicated by the explicit statement about the 'object in keeping silent.'
5cdc6c00e5b7058e49325624f8fc1eba.source_excerpt: Not a word had been uttered on either side. There was plainly an object in keeping silent.

b727a9b27fdc7e34c1a9a254fb90e388.constraint_text: The president explicitly chose to use his own cane sword rather than exchanging weapons, overriding the general's proposal to cast lots.
b727a9b27fdc7e34c1a9a254fb90e388.source_excerpt: The general proposed to cast lots for the swords, but the president said it was he who had given the provocation, and when he had given it he had supposed each would use his own arms.

ad1d6bbb18586c7557165804e597a607.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has promised to carry out the commission from the baron regarding the Comte de Morcerf.
ad1d6bbb18586c7557165804e597a607.source_excerpt: "Certainly I shall, Albert, as I have promised to do it."

ad1d6bbb18586c7557165804e597a607.constraint_text: Monte Cristo is determined to maintain good relations with everyone.
ad1d6bbb18586c7557165804e597a607.source_excerpt: "I am determined to try and be on good terms with everybody, at all events," said Monte Cristo.

6ceaf2e3ab8af93c248050b617a4a0e0.constraint_text: The character's lack of suspicion caused them to not resist the deep sleep.
6ceaf2e3ab8af93c248050b617a4a0e0.source_excerpt: having no suspicion of anything wrong, I sought not to shake it off.

62863967e3ee5b8ebb5e8c23a04cd455.constraint_text: Maintained a rigorously straight-line course across South America without deviation from their path
62863967e3ee5b8ebb5e8c23a04cd455.source_excerpt: Thus had our travelers accomplished the journey across South America on a rigorously straight line. Neither mountains nor rivers had turned them aside from their course

14d02412df6f8bc3c8f77cfa65c497cd.constraint_text: Mr. Olbinett maintains exactness even in critical situations
14d02412df6f8bc3c8f77cfa65c497cd.source_excerpt: he, with his usual exactness, even in critical situations, thought the bill of fare rather scanty

2cc86467cd810a1cc21edfd200d783f6.constraint_text: The major preserves calmness in the midst of petty annoyances of life
2cc86467cd810a1cc21edfd200d783f6.source_excerpt: If the major preserved his calmness in the midst of the petty annoyances of life, Paganel, on the contrary, could not treat the matter so indifferently.

7d883d31851410475a6965ddadb383ff.constraint_text: Ayrton commits to either finding Captain Grant's track or guiding them to the wreck site of his vessel.
7d883d31851410475a6965ddadb383ff.source_excerpt: "Yes, my lord, I will follow you; and, if I do not set you upon the track of Captain Grant, I will at least guide you to the place where his vessel was wrecked."

8090f2e722a1599767866d1f7081f84d.constraint_text: The journey to Eden will take at least fifteen to twenty days due to the difficulty of the terrain.
8090f2e722a1599767866d1f7081f84d.source_excerpt: "say fifteen or twenty days to make seventy-five miles!"

8090f2e722a1599767866d1f7081f84d.constraint_text: Ayrton possesses expert knowledge about the journey's challenges.
8090f2e722a1599767866d1f7081f84d.source_excerpt: Ayrton's tone was that of a man who is thoroughly acquainted with his subject.

7688f760ca7e269f1c6a826974195a2b.constraint_text: Ayrton asserts that his oxen are sure-footed and capable of keeping them on the right track during the river crossing.
7688f760ca7e269f1c6a826974195a2b.source_excerpt: "My oxen are sure-footed, and I will engage to keep them in the right track."

540340fb1210bcac221541017bdd3cad.constraint_text: Beauchamp will not join Lucien's party until a minister holds office for six months
540340fb1210bcac221541017bdd3cad.source_excerpt: "I only await one thing before following your advice; that is, a minister who will hold office for six months."

95bc2425486779ea03e352d8b4a3456a.constraint_text: His earliest and most indelible recollections are permanently fixed in the streets and trees of the area
95bc2425486779ea03e352d8b4a3456a.source_excerpt: Each step he trod oppressed his heart with fresh emotion; his first and most indelible recollections were there; not a tree, not a street, that he passed but seemed filled with dear and cherished memories.

1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.constraint_text: Faria's arrest was caused by his hasty departure and the imperial police's suspicion, which arose from their prior surveillance due to political tensions.
1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.source_excerpt: my hasty departure, the cause of which they were unable to guess, having aroused their suspicions, I was arrested at the very moment I was leaving Piombino.

1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.constraint_text: Faria explicitly states that the treasure has no legitimate possessor because the family is extinct.
Faria establishes a binding rule about treasure division: half to Dantès if they escape together, and the whole to Dantès if Faria dies in captivity.
1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.source_excerpt: If we ever escape together, half this treasure is yours; if I die here, and you escape alone, the whole belongs to you.

1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.constraint_text: The imperial police had been monitoring Faria for an unspecified period prior to his arrest, driven by their desire for provincial partition.
1e1c97402edbbaba45252f5650700198.source_excerpt: the imperial police ... had their eyes on me; and my hasty departure ... I was arrested at the very moment I was leaving Piombino.

8317fb90f75f60ac051957e34231abaf.constraint_text: Villefort did not reveal the whole secret to prevent others from benefiting
8317fb90f75f60ac051957e34231abaf.source_excerpt: Villefort, who did not choose to reveal the whole secret, lest another should reap all the benefit of the disclosure

8317fb90f75f60ac051957e34231abaf.constraint_text: Napoleon's conversion is attributed to his exhortation to veterans to serve the good king
8317fb90f75f60ac051957e34231abaf.source_excerpt: Napoleon lately had a review, and as two or three of his old veterans expressed a desire to return to France, he gave them their dismissal, and exhorted them to ‘serve the good king.’ These were his own words, of that I am certain.

9002b0f3328f7e1acd7884ac413d2c7e.constraint_text: Noirtier's tenacity and longevity are attributed to an agreement with death to outlive all his heirs
9002b0f3328f7e1acd7884ac413d2c7e.source_excerpt: "he must have made an agreement with death to outlive all his heirs, and he appears likely to succeed"

2d227a0c389bec38fd19cc90aeca06a5.constraint_text: Has not visited Madame Danglars more than twice in her entire life
2d227a0c389bec38fd19cc90aeca06a5.source_excerpt: the baroness very rarely comes to the house, and my mother, has not, I think, visited Madame Danglars twice in her whole life.

d0884e1221a80aa42fb946cb4bd48d85.constraint_text: The host affirms with absolute certainty that no vessel has been lost on the coast recently, and specifically that the Britannia's sailors were not cast ashore on the western shore two years prior.
d0884e1221a80aa42fb946cb4bd48d85.source_excerpt: as the shipwreck had occurred only two years before, he could affirm with absolute certainty that the sailors had not been cast on that part of the western shore.

13d01e219b60a30cd804879bd76da55f.constraint_text: The Duncan's arrival in New Zealand was caused by following instructions in Lord Glenarvan's letter
13d01e219b60a30cd804879bd76da55f.source_excerpt: "The Duncan is here by your lordship's orders." ... "I only conformed to the instructions contained in your letter."

7adba31357afdf81dba8a9c43541d33e.constraint_text: The rising barometer directly causes the absence of hurricanes within a few hours.
7adba31357afdf81dba8a9c43541d33e.source_excerpt: "...when the barometer rises as it does now, you are free from these furious hurricanes in a few hours."

6a2c87f6b30cdb8eae6c68d124a6b3a4.constraint_text: Mr. Olbinett fulfilled his duties as steward with his accustomed zeal despite personal grief over his wife's fate.
6a2c87f6b30cdb8eae6c68d124a6b3a4.source_excerpt: The poor man, since the loss of the Duncan, had often lamented the unhappy fate of his wife, who had remained on board, and would be, consequently, the victim of the convicts' brutality. However, he fulfilled his duties as steward with his accustomed zeal

6a2c87f6b30cdb8eae6c68d124a6b3a4.constraint_text: Mulready's recovery would be completed after a few hours at sea.
6a2c87f6b30cdb8eae6c68d124a6b3a4.source_excerpt: He scarcely felt his wound, which had so nearly proved fatal. A few hours at sea would complete his recovery

c8407d22da75636b72319eaae539aa2c.constraint_text: Captain Mangles must not expose himself to danger because he is the captain of the Duncan.
c8407d22da75636b72319eaae539aa2c.source_excerpt: "He is the captain of the Duncan, and must not, therefore, expose himself."

c8407d22da75636b72319eaae539aa2c.constraint_text: Glenarvan cannot leave the encampment because his wound is not yet healed.
c8407d22da75636b72319eaae539aa2c.source_excerpt: "Separate you from Lady Helena, when your wound is not yet healed?" ... "Glenarvan," ... "you cannot leave the encampment."

ea809a9e3b33ade43d860a4e70f558e4.constraint_text: Glenarvan deliberately concealed the fact that one of the captives was his wife to avoid revealing this relationship to Kai-Koumou.
ea809a9e3b33ade43d860a4e70f558e4.source_excerpt: he saw that he was watched by Kai-Koumou, and, not wishing to show that one of the captives was his wife, he prudently kept his thoughts to himself

7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.constraint_text: Harry Grant is considered forever lost
7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.source_excerpt: "I fear that he is forever lost!"

7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.constraint_text: Paganel did not speak earlier because others would not have believed him
7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.source_excerpt: "I did not speak before, because you would not have believed me. Besides, it was useless."

7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.constraint_text: Paganel's blunder had a reason that saved them
7f6ecc1353d9803692e3c4e2dc2aa7df.source_excerpt: "I did not commit the blunder that saved us, without reason."

b2a0c8541fe4bbda7d2f138475ca450e.constraint_text: Young Robert would not refuse to join the expedition under any circumstances, even if forced to serve as a cabin-boy.
b2a0c8541fe4bbda7d2f138475ca450e.source_excerpt: he would have hidden in the hold sooner than not go; even if he had been compelled to serve as cabin-boy, like Lord Nelson and Sir John Franklin, he would have embarked on board the Duncan.

b2a0c8541fe4bbda7d2f138475ca450e.constraint_text: Young Robert was taken aboard the Duncan in a non-passenger role (cabin-boy or sailor) due to his insistence.
b2a0c8541fe4bbda7d2f138475ca450e.source_excerpt: They were even obliged to take him other than as passenger, for as cabin-boy or sailor he _would serve_.

90fdbbdefe1c047543140589b922ce07.constraint_text: If any prisoner had fallen into the hands of the Indians on the Atlantic coast, Sergeant Manuel would certainly have been informed.
90fdbbdefe1c047543140589b922ce07.source_excerpt: If any prisoner had fallen into the hands of the Indians on the Atlantic coast, Sergeant Manuel would certainly have been informed.

90fdbbdefe1c047543140589b922ce07.constraint_text: Paganel asserts that Captain Grant is not in America because he is not on the Pampas.
90fdbbdefe1c047543140589b922ce07.source_excerpt: Since Captain Grant is not on the Pampas, he is not in America.

f0936d60f446813f0eb256ddf75347a9.constraint_text: Cannot join the expedition because he must remain to watch over the ladies on board
f0936d60f446813f0eb256ddf75347a9.source_excerpt: My dear fellow," replied Glenarvan, "we shall leave the ladies on board, the dearest objects we have in the world. Who would watch over them, if not the devoted captain of the Duncan?'

3137f86baad81dddf9b987cddb41d2a4.constraint_text: Must be conducted to Echuca, care of Jeff Smith, Railway Porter
3137f86baad81dddf9b987cddb41d2a4.source_excerpt: "TOLINÉ*, to be conducted to Echuca, care of Jeff Smith, Railway Porter. Prepaid."

3e1b3e9b57f592d0269c43aef674389a.constraint_text: The landlord's ill-humored demeanor is caused by his isolation and role as the primary customer of his tavern.
3e1b3e9b57f592d0269c43aef674389a.source_excerpt: The landlord of 'Bush Inn' was a coarse man, of forbidding appearance, who had to consider himself as the principal customer for the gin, brandy, and whisky of his tavern, and scarcely ever saw any one but squatters or herdsmen. He replied in an ill-humored way to the questions that were addressed him;

300fb998326f44796ebaf2555650f597.constraint_text: Thalcave's ability to manage his steed remains unaffected by the horse's agitated behavior
300fb998326f44796ebaf2555650f597.source_excerpt: Thalcave, whom his antics could not unseat, managed his steed without difficulty.

bc6be38c49648ae92a07c03feb53938b.constraint_text: The major was the first to rise after the shock stopped their gliding vehicle.
bc6be38c49648ae92a07c03feb53938b.source_excerpt: At last one rose, deafened by the shock, but yet firm. It was the major.

e9f1a138b7fc076ea3f8b126f1c1bf15.constraint_text: Had not been satisfied with edible ferns prior to this meal
e9f1a138b7fc076ea3f8b126f1c1bf15.source_excerpt: Mary Grant and the major, who had not hitherto been very well satisfied with the edible ferns, made this time a hearty meal of them.

6c4d2bcf6187a3a8dab054bfa36479b9.constraint_text: Robert Grant was missing after the earthquake and descent from the mountain
6c4d2bcf6187a3a8dab054bfa36479b9.source_excerpt: if one of the feeblest, Robert Grant, had not been missing.

d5165268d8878aceedd6a3491f17168e.constraint_text: Was charged with delivering an oral message to a Bonapartist in Paris
d5165268d8878aceedd6a3491f17168e.source_excerpt: There he saw the grand-marshal, who charged him with an oral message to a Bonapartist in Paris

d5165268d8878aceedd6a3491f17168e.constraint_text: Postponed his marriage engagement due to urgency of the mission
d5165268d8878aceedd6a3491f17168e.source_excerpt: I left my bride and friends, postponing everything, that I might hasten to lay at your majesty’s feet the fears which impressed me

a592d4b9db30d909d14de752036ed1b2.constraint_text: De Villefort is known for being kind and equitable, as this is described as his consistent behavior.
a592d4b9db30d909d14de752036ed1b2.source_excerpt: de Villefort, be, as you always are, kind and equitable, and give him back to us soon.

a592d4b9db30d909d14de752036ed1b2.constraint_text: De Villefort claims to perform his duty impartially and will act according to the law regardless of personal feelings.
a592d4b9db30d909d14de752036ed1b2.source_excerpt: you may rest assured I shall perform my duty impartially, and that if he be innocent you shall not have appealed to me in vain; should he, however, be guilty... I must do my duty.

8f7f6b3a4821f30d394e8c74f77f850b.constraint_text: Dantès has ceased all intercourse with the world and considers himself dead due to prolonged isolation.
8f7f6b3a4821f30d394e8c74f77f850b.source_excerpt: he had so long ceased to have any intercourse with the world, that he looked upon himself as dead

b7c215b867b4445f5da8e5ebb65e7450.constraint_text: Villefort's duty to protect Edmond Dantès is causally tied to his current service under Napoleon, whereas his prior service under Louis XVIII precluded showing favor to Dantès.
b7c215b867b4445f5da8e5ebb65e7450.source_excerpt: "You then served Louis XVIII., and you did not show any favor—it was your duty; today you serve Napoleon, and you ought to protect him—it is equally your duty"

dce3a6c4fc6b8fcc40d149cd43514de4.constraint_text: Louis XVIII annotates texts during conversations, indicating a persistent habit of engaging with literature even while discussing urgent matters.
dce3a6c4fc6b8fcc40d149cd43514de4.source_excerpt: "_Mala ducis avi domum_,' continued Louis XVIII., still annotating.

b7a4d4dc21f90737809cc6fb16ed3751.constraint_text: Dantès' natural repugnance to committing crimes caused him not to consider violent escape methods.
b7a4d4dc21f90737809cc6fb16ed3751.source_excerpt: "Because," said the old man, "the natural repugnance to the commission of such a crime prevented you from thinking of it; and so it ever is because in simple and allowable things our natural instincts keep us from deviating from the strict line of duty."

b7a4d4dc21f90737809cc6fb16ed3751.constraint_text: Dantès possesses a persistent natural repugnance to committing violent acts.
b7a4d4dc21f90737809cc6fb16ed3751.source_excerpt: "Because," said the old man, "the natural repugnance to the commission of such a crime prevented you from thinking of it; and so it ever is because in simple and allowable things our natural instincts keep us from deviating from the strict line of duty."

bf006c2c9d2379b23c970059fc1c409c.constraint_text: Believes it is easier to descend from the whole to a part in studying the human race, following an algebraic axiom of proceeding from known to unknown quantities
bf006c2c9d2379b23c970059fc1c409c.source_excerpt: "I have believed it was much easier to descend from the whole to a part than to ascend from a part to the whole. It is an algebraic axiom, which makes us proceed from a known to an unknown quantity, and not from an unknown to a known"

c60b915b2b036a3aeb5d9205c81b1501.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's dissatisfaction stems from his inability to clearly appreciate the past
c60b915b2b036a3aeb5d9205c81b1501.source_excerpt: The reason why I am now dissatisfied is that I have not a clear appreciation of the past.

c60b915b2b036a3aeb5d9205c81b1501.constraint_text: Monte Cristo was conducted by a silent and nocturnal guard through the Rue de la Caisserie 24 years ago
c60b915b2b036a3aeb5d9205c81b1501.source_excerpt: It was the same through which, twenty-four years ago, he had been conducted by a silent and nocturnal guard

676c360b4f1ec18739200a14f1e584f0.constraint_text: Faria explicitly warned that Dantès would drown if he sought escape without properly exercising and preparing his strength
676c360b4f1ec18739200a14f1e584f0.source_excerpt: "Dantès, you must not give way to this listlessness; you will be drowned if you seek to escape, and your strength has not been properly exercised and prepared for exertion."

390c4a8df9ba4e4aacb1facb26c2e581.constraint_text: The yacht is currently under the traveller's authority
390c4a8df9ba4e4aacb1facb26c2e581.source_excerpt: to whose orders the yacht was for the time submitted

9326166ccc35b7b53e9204d414465e04.constraint_text: Albert resides in the Rue du Helder, appears daily on the Boulevard de Gand, and dines frequently at the Café de Paris.
9326166ccc35b7b53e9204d414465e04.source_excerpt: It is of course understood that Albert resided in the aforesaid street, appeared every day on the fashionable walk, and dined frequently at the only restaurant where you can really dine, that is, if you are on good terms with its waiters.

53f6b1afdc483bd5feaadbbe744a2c7a.constraint_text: Caderousse habitually occupies his place of observation before the door, maintaining this behavior as a fixed routine.
53f6b1afdc483bd5feaadbbe744a2c7a.source_excerpt: Caderousse, then, was, as usual, at his place of observation before the door

c80b4d6bdc69e7c07d4b7f78c547d2e1.constraint_text: Maximilian's father threw himself into his arms after being saved from death and dishonor by Monte Cristo
c80b4d6bdc69e7c07d4b7f78c547d2e1.source_excerpt: the good old man, whom you saved from death and dishonor, threw himself into my arms

237dbea16c16019120492bb08d827f94.constraint_text: The standard procedure for arranging such contracts involves solicitors meeting to sign, exchange portions with receipts, and release funds after marriage.
237dbea16c16019120492bb08d827f94.source_excerpt: "This is the way such affairs are generally arranged when it is wished to do them stylishly: Your two solicitors appoint a meeting, when the contract is signed, for the next or the following day; then they exchange the two portions, for which they each give a receipt; then, when the marriage is celebrated, they place the amount at your disposal as the chief member of the alliance."

0628bfaa10847d1f45646c1edc1fc73f.constraint_text: Valentine and Maximilian must not see each other from this moment until the contract is signed to avoid being discovered.
0628bfaa10847d1f45646c1edc1fc73f.source_excerpt: let us not tempt Providence, let us not see each other. It is a miracle, it is a providence that we have not been discovered. If we were surprised, if it were known that we met thus, we should have no further resource.

077cc3a577dc4a57a730a3124aa88dc5.constraint_text: A father's faults cannot revert upon his children in this changing age.
077cc3a577dc4a57a730a3124aa88dc5.source_excerpt: "...the faults of a father cannot revert upon his children."

077cc3a577dc4a57a730a3124aa88dc5.constraint_text: Albert irrevocably destroyed all physical evidence of the secret by burning every fragment.
077cc3a577dc4a57a730a3124aa88dc5.source_excerpt: he approached the wax-light... and burned every fragment.

6b5d507c71d51feefde701d925e91fac.constraint_text: M. de Villefort's absence is caused by an incident involving Monte Cristo
6b5d507c71d51feefde701d925e91fac.source_excerpt: "As a matter of fact," said Monte Cristo, approaching, "I am much afraid that I am the involuntary cause of his absence."

49b5fa65fba1a044e0b8a94cb26a337e.source_excerpt: They saw that they had to deal with an uneducated man, whose manners were not different from those of the five sailors of his crew.

49b5fa65fba1a044e0b8a94cb26a337e.constraint_text: Will Halley has a brutish appearance.
49b5fa65fba1a044e0b8a94cb26a337e.source_excerpt: A coarse red face, big hands, a flat nose, a blinded eye, lips blackened by his pipe, and a specially brutish appearance, made Will Halley a very forbidding character.

484b8da598abfe6b36cff2044c8e2645.constraint_text: Tom Austin will never take the responsibility of changing or delaying the execution of an order.
484b8da598abfe6b36cff2044c8e2645.source_excerpt: He is a man devoted to duty and discipline, and will never take the responsibility of changing or delaying the execution of an order.

3d695e9c9fcbfdcfcb11e66e1209e990.constraint_text: Only one of the two prisoners will die; the other will live many years
3d695e9c9fcbfdcfcb11e66e1209e990.source_excerpt: "Yes; but only one of these two is about to die; the other has many years to live."

3d695e9c9fcbfdcfcb11e66e1209e990.constraint_text: Peppino has been granted a pardon and will not be executed
3d695e9c9fcbfdcfcb11e66e1209e990.source_excerpt: "A pardon for Peppino, called Rocca Priori," said the principal friar.

440355dbc17b8efeb1bf338bb45e5db5.constraint_text: Caderousse's selfish action in the past is explicitly stated as the cause of his current abject condition.
440355dbc17b8efeb1bf338bb45e5db5.source_excerpt: this action, the only one with which I have seriously to reproach myself in all my life, is no doubt the cause of my abject condition.

e6788d3698308932a5fa51e2f9d68433.constraint_text: The gardener's time belongs to the government and must not be wasted.
e6788d3698308932a5fa51e2f9d68433.source_excerpt: "Ah, my time is not valuable," replied the man with a melancholy smile. "Still it belongs to government, and I ought not to waste it;"

e6788d3698308932a5fa51e2f9d68433.constraint_text: The count can deliberately control his smile to appear either terrible or benevolent.
e6788d3698308932a5fa51e2f9d68433.source_excerpt: "Calm yourself, my friend," said the count, with the smile which he made at will either terrible or benevolent, and which now expressed only the kindliest feeling;

b2db3fee04805b2694e4ea68c0a12556.constraint_text: Danglars feels obligated to use precise bonds for charity payments, as he believes deviating from this would constitute 'robbing' the charity.
b2db3fee04805b2694e4ea68c0a12556.source_excerpt: "I intended this money for the charity fund, and I seemed to be robbing them if I did not pay them with these precise bonds."

f94a3b78324b1cab0c0605130039adda.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès had never served in the marines before entering the merchant service.
f94a3b78324b1cab0c0605130039adda.source_excerpt: “Oh, no, monsieur, he is very young.”

f94a3b78324b1cab0c0605130039adda.constraint_text: Edmond Dantès was nineteen or twenty years old at the time of his arrest.
f94a3b78324b1cab0c0605130039adda.source_excerpt: “How old?” “Nineteen or twenty at the most.”

18f2cd061ac3be4d997c0a588e7231e4.constraint_text: Fernand has repeatedly taken on the role of Mercédès' friend and protector
18f2cd061ac3be4d997c0a588e7231e4.source_excerpt: Fernand, who had now again become the friend and protector of Mercédès

11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.constraint_text: Has served as the inspector of prisons for fourteen years
11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.source_excerpt: "I have been so these fourteen years."

11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.constraint_text: Died in February of the previous year
11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.source_excerpt: "Yes, sir, five or six months ago, last February."

11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.constraint_text: Was confined in the Château d’If
11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.source_excerpt: "he was confined in the Château d’If"

11b54ce855768f9baefe7863ee6c8615.constraint_text: Was considered crazy by M. de Boville

13846e8d2e6cf4b66285959aeeee9df2.constraint_text: His arrest and imprisonment were caused by a letter written by Danglars and posted by Fernand, which accused him of carrying incriminating letters for Bonapartists.
13846e8d2e6cf4b66285959aeeee9df2.source_excerpt: I was arrested and became a prisoner because, under the arbor of La Réserve, the day before I was to marry you, a man named Danglars wrote this letter, which the fisherman Fernand himself posted.

13846e8d2e6cf4b66285959aeeee9df2.constraint_text: He obtained the incriminating letter from Danglars by taking it from the file against himself on the day he paid 200,000 francs to M. de Boville.
13846e8d2e6cf4b66285959aeeee9df2.source_excerpt: It was Danglars’ letter to the king’s attorney which the Count of Monte Cristo... had taken from the file against Edmond Dantès, on the day he had paid the two hundred thousand francs to M. de Boville.

c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.constraint_text: The major cannot possibly live out of Lucca
c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.source_excerpt: As for me, you must know I cannot possibly live out of Lucca; therefore I shall return to Italy as soon as I can.

c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.constraint_text: Andrea is accustomed to reading documents like baptismal registers and marriage certificates
c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.source_excerpt: he read them with a facility which proved that he was accustomed to similar documents

c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.constraint_text: The documents in question are necessary to prove Andrea's descent
c193acfa5d01d3053e63feed1b8a0131.source_excerpt: I am come expressly on that account; it has cost me much trouble to find you, but I had resolved on giving them into your hands

9b09db30dec6e73d392b573df5b32d20.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's connection to the Morcerf family causes him to be annoyed by the young man's actions.
9b09db30dec6e73d392b573df5b32d20.source_excerpt: Well, I acknowledge it annoys me, knowing your connection with the Morcerf family, to see him throw himself in the way.

22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.constraint_text: The narrator was registered under the number 37 at the foundling asylum in Paris.
22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.source_excerpt: The man carried me to the foundling asylum, where I was registered under the number 37.

22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.constraint_text: The narrator was brought up in Corsica after being claimed by a woman from Rogliano.
22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.source_excerpt: Thus, you see, though born in Paris, I was brought up in Corsica.

22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.constraint_text: The narrator's 'perverse disposition' persisted over time, leading to increased wickedness.
22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.source_excerpt: my perverse disposition prevailed over the virtues which my adopted mother endeavored to instil into my heart. I increased in wickedness till I committed crime.

22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.constraint_text: The narrator's fate is explicitly attributed to the crime of his biological father.
22ea71a1303a360f81735adede537529.source_excerpt: the crime is that of your father, not yours,—of your father, who consigned you to hell if you died, and to misery if a miracle preserved you alive.

3336585410125aacf772db3fd17c2daa.constraint_text: The child's insensibility is caused by terror and will pass
3336585410125aacf772db3fd17c2daa.source_excerpt: "...his insensibility is merely the effects of terror, and will soon pass."

e7316aab57c88521d7fa62fcc74b80da.constraint_text: In private, Danglars consistently exhibits brutal and domineering behavior as a husband and father, replacing his public persona of geniality.
e7316aab57c88521d7fa62fcc74b80da.source_excerpt: in private the genial side descended to the level of the other, so that generally the indulgent man disappeared to give place to the brutal husband and domineering father.

aa4549c218c3317403dfd86771ea5e94.constraint_text: The elixir administered by the count has dosage-dependent effects: one drop revives a dying child, three drops cause violent palpitations, six drops suspend respiration, and ten drops destroy the subject.
aa4549c218c3317403dfd86771ea5e94.source_excerpt: "Oh, do not place any reliance on that, madame; _one_ drop of that elixir sufficed to recall life to a dying child, but three drops would have impelled the blood into his lungs in such a way as to have produced most violent palpitations; six would have suspended his respiration, and caused syncope more serious than that in which he was; ten would have destroyed him."

32ce4de8d0a4cc5989389e64ef450b89.constraint_text: The child's perverse nature is inherent and not caused by upbringing
32ce4de8d0a4cc5989389e64ef450b89.source_excerpt: Never did a perverse nature declare itself more prematurely, and yet it was not owing to any fault in his bringing up.

a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.constraint_text: Villefort has always entertained a high respect for his father due to his moral superiority.
a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.source_excerpt: I have always entertained a high respect for my father, because, to the natural feeling of relationship was added the consciousness of his moral superiority.

a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.constraint_text: Villefort will continue to preserve the same respect toward M. Noirtier despite their conflict.
a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.source_excerpt: I shall still continue to preserve the same respect toward M. Noirtier;

a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.constraint_text: Villefort will suffer pecuniary deprivation without complaint.
a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.source_excerpt: I will suffer, without complaint, the pecuniary deprivation to which he has subjected me;

a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.constraint_text: Villefort's decision to marry his daughter to Baron Franz d’Épinay is explicitly attributed to his own choice.
a3b78f688295f5fd8e3aae7e7fd4e48e.source_excerpt: I shall marry my daughter to the Baron Franz d’Épinay, because I consider it would be a proper and eligible match for her to make, and, in short, because I choose to bestow my daughter’s hand on whomever I please.

a68c2e85680124727b32bb5fcd49e878.constraint_text: The young girl explicitly states she does not love anyone, which is presented as a persistent trait.
a68c2e85680124727b32bb5fcd49e878.source_excerpt: I actually love no one, sir; you know it, do you not?

e6ca986cc1e702dd5c6b9ec42e38ab09.constraint_text: If the man turns his head while his right-hand correspondent is telegraphing, he will be fined 100 francs for failing to repeat the signals.
e6ca986cc1e702dd5c6b9ec42e38ab09.source_excerpt: ‘Not having repeated them, through negligence, I should be fined.’ ‘How much?’ ‘A hundred francs.’

0d303694b59bb9f84cfbc43519c1812f.constraint_text: The count has seen almost all known tortures.
0d303694b59bb9f84cfbc43519c1812f.source_excerpt: "There are, at least, few that I have not seen," said the count coldly.

0d303694b59bb9f84cfbc43519c1812f.constraint_text: The count's reaction to witnessing tortures progressed through three fixed stages: horror, indifference, and curiosity.
0d303694b59bb9f84cfbc43519c1812f.source_excerpt: "My first sentiment was horror, the second indifference, the third curiosity."

5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.constraint_text: Her proud glance and charming smile were lost due to the surrounding misery
5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.source_excerpt: The beautiful Catalane and noble countess had lost both her proud glance and charming smile, because she saw nothing but misery around her

5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.constraint_text: She has lived in the described location since leaving her house
5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.source_excerpt: Madame de Morcerf had lived there since leaving her house

5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.constraint_text: She maintained a forced monotonous smile to conceal her feelings
5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.source_excerpt: she constrained herself to assume a monotonous smile of the lips alone

5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.constraint_text: Luxury remnants prevent him from accepting his current position
5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.source_excerpt: the remains of luxury prevented him from sinking into his actual position

5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.constraint_text: His polished boots and white hands prevent him from freely moving through the town
5f130cbaaa20984db5631d6398ff532b.source_excerpt: If he wished to go out without gloves, his hands appeared too white; if he wished to walk through the town, his boots seemed too highly polished

59d7c586ddf541efac4b815d860eb1ec.constraint_text: Albert's preference for a softer, gentler, and more feminine type of beauty over the 'Diana, the huntress' archetype is a consistent trait.
59d7c586ddf541efac4b815d860eb1ec.source_excerpt: "Handsome, certainly," replied Albert, "but not to my taste, which I confess, inclines to something softer, gentler, and more feminine."

80a9984d1b31cb1a377470c417cd3929.constraint_text: Noirtier's body is rendered utterly incapable of obeying his will, despite possessing a powerful mind.
80a9984d1b31cb1a377470c417cd3929.source_excerpt: whose body could scarcely be called a living one, but who, nevertheless, possessed a fund of knowledge and penetration, united with a will as powerful as ever although clogged by a body rendered utterly incapable of obeying its impulses.

80a9984d1b31cb1a377470c417cd3929.constraint_text: Valentine has solved the problem of understanding Noirtier's thoughts and conveying her own through expressions.
80a9984d1b31cb1a377470c417cd3929.source_excerpt: Valentine had solved the problem, and was able easily to understand his thoughts, and to convey her own in return.

e35056a1582426b1458f89230f345bf7.constraint_text: Dantès swears by his honor as a sailor, his love for Mercédès, and the life of his father, establishing these as unbreakable commitments.
e35056a1582426b1458f89230f345bf7.source_excerpt: "I swear by my honor as a sailor, by my love for Mercédès, by the life of my father——"

864c71f5137d6b2444e3fa0fef37c084.constraint_text: The letter from Murat and the Bonapartist club directly caused Edmond Dantès' arrest.
864c71f5137d6b2444e3fa0fef37c084.source_excerpt: “You well know, madame, was my arrest; but you do not know how long that arrest lasted.”

5d17b1e2aed581f8cae82537d6872a79.constraint_text: Noirtier refuses to pardon de Villefort.
Noirtier does not sanction the project.

462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.constraint_text: His mother died at his birth
462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.source_excerpt: his mother having died at his birth

462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.constraint_text: His father was assassinated in 1815 when he was two years old
462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.source_excerpt: his father having been assassinated in 1815, that is to say, when he was but two years old

462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.constraint_text: He seldom acknowledged any authority other than his own will due to being permitted to choose his own pursuits
462110e2b7cfec6aeab9e5cb4a73213e.source_excerpt: the child was permitted to choose his own pursuits, and he has, therefore, seldom acknowledged any other authority but that of his own will

3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.constraint_text: has nursed and tended him for six years
3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.source_excerpt: it is she who has nursed and tended him for six years

3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.constraint_text: was not deceived by the false assent given by Madame de Villefort’s words and manner
3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.source_excerpt: The eye of Noirtier clearly showed by its expression that he was not deceived by the false assent given by Madame de Villefort’s words and manner to the motives which she supposed him to entertain.

3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.constraint_text: significantly winked his eye in token of dissent
3a91020f53533ec13df3d95f17a3550c.source_excerpt: The old man... significantly winked his eye in token of dissent.

1bb498fc97473a42242a0afa753c8e60.constraint_text: There could have been no contact between Villefort and de Monte Cristo in any period, case, or circumstance.
1bb498fc97473a42242a0afa753c8e60.source_excerpt: He appears certain and clear in my opinion—that in no period, in no case, in no circumstance, could there have been any contact between him and me.'

4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.constraint_text: Benedetto is a very commonplace, silly rascal and altogether unworthy of the experiments that will be made on his phrenological organs after his death.
4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.source_excerpt: he told me that Benedetto, who is considered a serpent of subtlety and a giant of cunning, is really but a very commonplace, silly rascal, and altogether unworthy of the experiments that will be made on his phrenological organs after his death.

4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.constraint_text: Château-Renaud discovers a gentleman by instinct and scents out an aristocratic family like a very bloodhound of heraldry.
4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.source_excerpt: but not for me, who discover a gentleman by instinct, and who scent out an aristocratic family like a very bloodhound of heraldry.

4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.constraint_text: It was impossible for Beauchamp to have been with the procureur for the last week.
4dd44de4c33c5704662956ea758b5713.source_excerpt: It was an impossibility; for the last week M.

0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.constraint_text: Faria is dead due to a burn in his heel
0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.source_excerpt: You see, sir, he is really dead," said the doctor; "this burn in the heel is decisive.

0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.constraint_text: Faria was intractable about his treasure despite being rational on other matters
0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.source_excerpt: He was, too, very learned, and rational enough on all points which did not relate to his treasure; but on that, indeed, he was intractable.

0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.constraint_text: Faria's obsession with treasure is attributed to monomania
0898a8269a2174726b1d82343143cb92.source_excerpt: It is the sort of malady which we call monomania," said the doctor.

5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has no relations and is alone in the world.
5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.source_excerpt: "No, sir, I am alone in the world."

5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.constraint_text: Monte Cristo's end will be achieved before he grows old.
5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.source_excerpt: "My end will be achieved before I grow old."

5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.constraint_text: Death is the only thing that can check Monte Cristo's plans.
5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.source_excerpt: "You say you fear nothing but death? I did not say that I feared it; I only said that death alone could check the execution of my plans."

5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.constraint_text: Monte Cristo would make the same sacrifice again if given the chance.
5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.source_excerpt: "If the thing were to do again, I would again do it."

5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.constraint_text: Monte Cristo will not experience madness again due to the axiom 'non bis in idem'.
5ee9ed4322432ca4289b2a3bcb228826.source_excerpt: "I have been nearly mad; and you know the axiom,—_non bis in idem_."

942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.constraint_text: Benedetto is described as a 'very commonplace, silly rascal' and 'altogether unworthy' of his reputation for cunning.
942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.source_excerpt: he told me that Benedetto, who is considered a serpent of subtlety and a giant of cunning, is really but a very commonplace, silly rascal, and altogether unworthy of the experiments that will be made on his phrenological organs after his death.

942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.constraint_text: Château-Renaud claims to 'scent out an aristocratic family like a very bloodhound of heraldry', indicating a persistent belief in aristocratic lineage.
942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.source_excerpt: but not for me, who discover a gentleman by instinct, and who scent out an aristocratic family like a very bloodhound of heraldry.

942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.constraint_text: Château-Renaud 'never believed in the prince' despite acknowledging the principality, establishing a fixed belief.
942561182c7084f4fae379a49930ceda.source_excerpt: Then you never believed in the principality? 'Yes.—in the principality, but not in the prince.'

7e90d5a399765ce90a08717d21959e49.constraint_text: The truth of the general's death in a loyal duel is fixed by their signed document to prevent accusations of murder or infringement of honor laws.
7e90d5a399765ce90a08717d21959e49.source_excerpt: In proof of this we have signed this paper to establish the truth of the facts, lest the moment should arrive when either of the actors in this terrible scene should be accused of premeditated murder or of infringement of the laws of honor. “‘Signed, Beaurepaire, Duchampy, and Lecharpal.’”

dd39293c91d44da4c6939db888904c72.constraint_text: Monte Cristo has maintained a long-term watch over Valentine, observing visitors, nourishment, and beverages.
dd39293c91d44da4c6939db888904c72.source_excerpt: during my long watch over you, all I have observed has been what people visited you, what nourishment was prepared, and what beverage was served

dd39293c91d44da4c6939db888904c72.constraint_text: Monte Cristo substituted a healthful draught for poison, directly causing life to circulate in Valentine's veins.
dd39293c91d44da4c6939db888904c72.source_excerpt: substituted, in the place of the poison, a healthful draught; which, instead of producing the death intended, caused life to circulate in your veins

fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.constraint_text: Valentine's escape from poison four days ago was due to M. Noirtier's precautions
fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.source_excerpt: Valentine’s life was attempted by poison four days ago, though she escaped, owing to the precautions of M. Noirtier.

fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.constraint_text: Valentine's death resulted from a doubled dose and changed poison
fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.source_excerpt: the dose has been double, the poison changed, and that this time it has succeeded.

fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.constraint_text: The fatality discussed in the garden about Madame de Saint-Méran’s death caused Valentine’s murder
fba63d5235b1b3d74fddfc84f4ebb3de.source_excerpt: the fatality you mentioned then is the same which has caused the murder of Valentine.

6f9fa03fd920c818dc97d33ee41f9b59.constraint_text: The general died in a duel, not in ambush, as confirmed by the signed document
6f9fa03fd920c818dc97d33ee41f9b59.source_excerpt: The general fell, then, in a loyal duel, and not in ambush as it might have been reported. In proof of this we have signed this paper to establish the truth of the facts

7e50d22dfd243fe4b37a01efae901c69.constraint_text: One member of the party died due to the hardships endured during the expedition
7e50d22dfd243fe4b37a01efae901c69.source_excerpt: for one of the party had succumbed to the hardships

7e50d22dfd243fe4b37a01efae901c69.constraint_text: Their companions departed the encampment seven hours before Burke and Wills arrived, after waiting five months
7e50d22dfd243fe4b37a01efae901c69.source_excerpt: only seven hours before, after five months of waiting in vain, their companions had taken their departure

7857c3f50537dae3c828f3af0bac4939.constraint_text: Morcerf must submit to the resolution under penalty of breaking his word.
7857c3f50537dae3c828f3af0bac4939.source_excerpt: you must submit to it under penalty of breaking your word.

7857c3f50537dae3c828f3af0bac4939.constraint_text: The resolution became a reality today.
7857c3f50537dae3c828f3af0bac4939.source_excerpt: today you see it was a reality

cb68a215eaebe063ffbfcb265299c5d7.constraint_text: The speaker would hate and despise himself as a coward if he deserted the brave fellow in his extremity.
cb68a215eaebe063ffbfcb265299c5d7.source_excerpt: I should hate and despise myself as a coward did I desert the brave fellow in his present extremity.

d8ed34dfd8d6fc955d96a964361747f0.constraint_text: The sale of Haydée and her mother to the Armenian merchant El-Kobbir was documented and signed by the French officer who orchestrated the transaction.
d8ed34dfd8d6fc955d96a964361747f0.source_excerpt: ‘...the record of the sale of my person and that of my mother to the Armenian merchant El-Kobbir, by the French officer, who, in his infamous bargain with the Porte, had reserved as his part of the booty the wife and daughter of his benefactor, whom he sold for the sum of four hundred thousand francs.’

2457c6774841657a6c542dd0d219cb14.source_excerpt: Danglars, who thought himself threatened (certain consciences are never calm),—Danglars even before his guests showed a countenance of abject terror.

ab6319a3ae50af30bab1481daea5bed4.constraint_text: The concierge chose not to share Lucien's name with his wife despite learning it
ab6319a3ae50af30bab1481daea5bed4.source_excerpt: still, as he was the very perfection of a door-keeper, he made up his mind not to tell his wife

ab6319a3ae50af30bab1481daea5bed4.constraint_text: M. Danglars left the location the previous night
ab6319a3ae50af30bab1481daea5bed4.source_excerpt: a great event has happened!... M. Danglars left last night!

cb1b7b8f3a5650424ec8ee3a4ef3c7ed.constraint_text: Ali is wholly absorbed in the enjoyment of his favorite occupation (smoking his chibouque) at this moment.
cb1b7b8f3a5650424ec8ee3a4ef3c7ed.source_excerpt: the regularity with which the Nubian puffed forth the smoke of his chibouque proved that he at least was wholly absorbed in the enjoyment of his favorite occupation

c46d5070b72f6bc13a8fc8394e375de7.constraint_text: Andrea is explicitly labeled as 'the murderer' by a character (Eugénie or Mademoiselle Danglars).
c46d5070b72f6bc13a8fc8394e375de7.source_excerpt: "Andrea, the murderer!" cried one of the ladies.

41aabd930c1f10f06175de7add97ea57.constraint_text: The narrator resolved not to break the rule of avoiding the door that opens onto the road
41aabd930c1f10f06175de7add97ea57.source_excerpt: I resolved not to break through the rule, so climbing over the garden-hedge

02ad46831a3e30bacd6f4cb50c18f57d.constraint_text: Fernand's unhappiness in love is attributed to his inherent nature or 'make', implying it was not his destiny to experience such sorrow.
02ad46831a3e30bacd6f4cb50c18f57d.source_excerpt: a lad of his make was not born to be unhappy in love

af0c4c56313cfba99a6bede2f0dd47c0.constraint_text: The sailor possesses a level of courage that surpasses what would appall a less courageous heart.
af0c4c56313cfba99a6bede2f0dd47c0.source_excerpt: This departure on a dark and stormy night, over a road beset with dangers, across the unknown stretches of a desert, would have appalled a heart less courageous than that of the sailor.

b8ff54541269085279ff293376e55cbf.constraint_text: Burke's request to have a pistol placed in his right hand and be left without burial was fulfilled after his death
b8ff54541269085279ff293376e55cbf.source_excerpt: "When I am dead, place a pistol in my right hand, and leave me without burial." His forebodings were realized, and the next morning he died.

43c2b64d84bab5893946df85c37e28f6.constraint_text: Robert O'Hara Burke set out on the expedition on the 20th of August, 1860
43c2b64d84bab5893946df85c37e28f6.source_excerpt: He told them that it was on the 20th of August, 1860, that Robert O'Hara Burke set out...

43c2b64d84bab5893946df85c37e28f6.constraint_text: Robert O'Hara Burke left several companions behind on the 20th of November
43c2b64d84bab5893946df85c37e28f6.source_excerpt: ...on the 20th of November, he still further diminished his numbers by leaving behind at an encampment several of his companions...

f1e10ead041056f7160c50503748c8e0.constraint_text: The narrator attributes his belief that he is not cursed to the act of saving the child's life, which he explicitly links to 'the life I have taken away.'
f1e10ead041056f7160c50503748c8e0.source_excerpt: ‘God has not cursed me then,’ I cried, ‘since he permits me to save the life of a human creature, in exchange for the life I have taken away.’

f1e10ead041056f7160c50503748c8e0.constraint_text: The narrator explicitly states he could not keep the child during his escape, fixing this as a condition at the time of the event.
f1e10ead041056f7160c50503748c8e0.source_excerpt: It was an embarrassing load for a man seeking to escape.

b6496f2e3f6ba93e8cd481885fff25a9.constraint_text: Wilson is explicitly assigned responsibility for managing the water-bottles
b6496f2e3f6ba93e8cd481885fff25a9.source_excerpt: Wilson has charge of the water-bottles.

45b4ca75895234a94210015f39717d96.constraint_text: The Morcerfs are depending on this union
45b4ca75895234a94210015f39717d96.source_excerpt: the Morcerfs are depending on this union

45b4ca75895234a94210015f39717d96.constraint_text: The countess is described as 'proud' and 'disdainful', scarcely speaking to her oldest acquaintances
45b4ca75895234a94210015f39717d96.source_excerpt: the proud Mercédès, the disdainful Catalane, who will scarcely open her lips to her oldest acquaintances

f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.constraint_text: The Count of Morcerf is too aristocratic to consent to a mésalliance for two million francs
f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.source_excerpt: The king has made him a baron, and can make him a peer, but he cannot make him a gentleman, and the Count of Morcerf is too aristocratic to consent, for the paltry sum of two million francs, to a _mésalliance_.

f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.constraint_text: The Viscount of Morcerf can only wed a marchioness
f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.source_excerpt: The Viscount of Morcerf can only wed a marchioness.

f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.constraint_text: Morcerf has seven martlets on his arms
f7c3390246741fedf90e8e4447ddd2e0.source_excerpt: You have seven martlets on your arms; give three to your wife, and you will still have four; that is one more than M.

bdde6f1b3e0c02a3c3bfe8321d276ce0.constraint_text: The count and countess have remained as united as on their wedding day despite being married for more than twenty years, with only one disagreement ever occurring between them.
bdde6f1b3e0c02a3c3bfe8321d276ce0.source_excerpt: This disagreement is the only one that has ever taken place between the count and countess, who are still as much united, although married more than twenty years, as on the first day of their wedding.

391d47ac073780e413478ba2001fae88.constraint_text: The engagement between her daughter and Albert de Morcerf was contingent on the general's insistence and M. Danglars' coercion, which narrowly avoided a negative outcome.
391d47ac073780e413478ba2001fae88.source_excerpt: The general depended much on it; he even came to force M. Danglars. We have had a narrow escape.

391d47ac073780e413478ba2001fae88.constraint_text: Albert apologized for challenging M. de Monte Cristo at the Opera yesterday, and this occurred 'on the ground today.'
391d47ac073780e413478ba2001fae88.source_excerpt: It appears that after having challenged M. de Monte Cristo at the Opera yesterday, he apologized on the ground today.

08ea300b2f6ffd82e6688afc8026f24a.constraint_text: M. de Villefort has consistently been perceived as severe but just
08ea300b2f6ffd82e6688afc8026f24a.source_excerpt: M. de Villefort has always passed for a severe but a just man.

239eb5e59776e9765f8aa341e5246a5a.constraint_text: Her leniency toward Edward is caused by his brightness
239eb5e59776e9765f8aa341e5246a5a.source_excerpt: But I can’t be severe with him, he is really _so_ bright.

239eb5e59776e9765f8aa341e5246a5a.constraint_text: She is the daughter of M. de Villefort by his first marriage
239eb5e59776e9765f8aa341e5246a5a.source_excerpt: The daughter of M. de Villefort by his first marriage

ec52c7094ce9228b4214c94cd948582d.constraint_text: Franz refuses to break his promise despite attempts to persuade him otherwise
ec52c7094ce9228b4214c94cd948582d.source_excerpt: he invariably answered: 'My eccentricity may be great, but it will not make me break my promise.'

a71c38ebac1ae3d6aff4abfa27b2a999.constraint_text: His current zeal for religion and order is explicitly attributed to needing to atone for past dereliction
a71c38ebac1ae3d6aff4abfa27b2a999.source_excerpt: "...that he is, at the present moment, a firm and zealous friend to religion and order—a better royalist, possibly, than his son; for he has to atone for past dereliction, while I have no other impulse than warm, decided preference and conviction."

ba91be5871886f8e77e2dc30b0a1c6cf.constraint_text: Noirtier is the father of Villefort
ba91be5871886f8e77e2dc30b0a1c6cf.source_excerpt: “Oh, if he knows the contents of this!” murmured he, “and that Noirtier is the father of Villefort, I am lost!”

0a09703dc5dc803dca29262e4e55c086.constraint_text: There was no contact between Villefort and another person in any period, case, or circumstance.
0a09703dc5dc803dca29262e4e55c086.source_excerpt: ‘in no period, in no case, in no circumstance, could there have been any contact between him and me’

864f61e7f046ef5ee85b7eeddc1c03fa.constraint_text: Ali's life belongs to the Count of Monte Cristo, not himself, due to the Count having saved Ali from death.
864f61e7f046ef5ee85b7eeddc1c03fa.source_excerpt: His life, madame, belongs not to him; it is mine, in return for my having myself saved him from death.

864f61e7f046ef5ee85b7eeddc1c03fa.constraint_text: Ali is defined as a slave whose duty to the Count supersedes any expectation of personal reward.
864f61e7f046ef5ee85b7eeddc1c03fa.source_excerpt: Ali is my slave, and in saving your life he was but discharging his duty to me.

dde7c23943bb65e8ee548048035ca5f1.constraint_text: Villefort insists his will must be respected in his family, overriding the 'folly of an old man' and 'caprice of a child'.
dde7c23943bb65e8ee548048035ca5f1.source_excerpt: it is necessary that my will should be respected in my family, and that the folly of an old man and the caprice of a child should not be allowed to overturn a project which I have entertained for so many years.

dde7c23943bb65e8ee548048035ca5f1.constraint_text: Villefort has entertained a specific project for 'so many years', fixing its origin in the past.
dde7c23943bb65e8ee548048035ca5f1.source_excerpt: a project which I have entertained for so many years.

338cbe88dcfb9397d82994772bfc89d7.constraint_text: Robert was rocked to sleep on his father's knees and heard an old Scottish song during his childhood.
338cbe88dcfb9397d82994772bfc89d7.source_excerpt: He rocked me to sleep on his knees, when I was little, and kept humming an old Scottish song which is sung around the lakes of our country.

74ec97e10fcea8266151c001131c1df2.constraint_text: Beauchamp refuses to engage in a duel without a justified cause, prioritizing family reputation and social interests over personal conflict.
74ec97e10fcea8266151c001131c1df2.source_excerpt: ‘If I strike with the sword, or discharge the contents of a pistol at man with whom, for three years, I have been on terms of intimacy, I must, at least, know why I do so; I must meet him with a heart at ease, and that quiet conscience which a man needs when his own arm must save his life.’

74ec97e10fcea8266151c001131c1df2.constraint_text: Beauchamp has recently traveled to Yanina, as evidenced by his passport visa records.
74ec97e10fcea8266151c001131c1df2.source_excerpt: ‘Here is my passport; examine the visa—Geneva, Milan, Venice, Trieste, Delvino, Yanina.’

1d61260f7b031295b3b59e1c7bd05dbb.constraint_text: Prisoners cannot physically interact with visitors due to structural barriers
1d61260f7b031295b3b59e1c7bd05dbb.source_excerpt: divided by two upright gratings placed at a distance of three feet from one another to prevent a visitor from shaking hands with or passing anything to the prisoners

3c57fea14f6aff19e600fd006914d601.constraint_text: Bertuccio has always been an honest man
3c57fea14f6aff19e600fd006914d601.source_excerpt: I have always been an honest man, and, as far as lay in my power, I have done good.

3c57fea14f6aff19e600fd006914d601.constraint_text: Bertuccio's past actions were motivated by vengeance

14f910b9cb5d44f12d8bf98bc9ae5af4.constraint_text: Beauchamp believes that probabilities are insufficient to justify a deadly combat with a friend; only verifiable facts can justify such an action.
14f910b9cb5d44f12d8bf98bc9ae5af4.source_excerpt: money, time, and fatigue are nothing compared with the reputation and interests of a whole family; probabilities will not suffice, only facts will justify a deadly combat with a friend.

eb89352cf5cf838b1db6b4ae14164ad6.constraint_text: The stranger's lack of awareness about human justice is explicitly attributed to his time spent in Oriental countries.
eb89352cf5cf838b1db6b4ae14164ad6.source_excerpt: you are a stranger, and I believe you say yourself that a portion of your life has been spent in Oriental countries, so you are not aware how human justice, so expeditious in barbarous countries, takes with us a prudent and well-studied course.

35b34e3b005f6d9ba0e178f02e9f8135.constraint_text: Italians 'grow according to their race and species' and 'pursue the same lines, and often the same uselessness, all their lives'
35b34e3b005f6d9ba0e178f02e9f8135.source_excerpt: we do not act thus in Italy; we grow according to our race and our species, and we pursue the same lines, and often the same uselessness, all our lives.

d0a57dfe1b5d93986b923eed91124ed3.constraint_text: The traveller has an enduring ability to instantly identify the author and style of every artwork described, indicating deep and persistent knowledge of modern artists and their styles.
d0a57dfe1b5d93986b923eed91124ed3.source_excerpt: the latter, without seeking for the signatures, many of which, indeed, were only initials, named instantly the author of every picture in such a manner that it was easy to see that each name was not only known to him, but that each style associated with it had been appreciated and studied by him.

7489ce9d65ed64f567e5ea53c8b75c5a.constraint_text: Their establishment attained present prosperity at the end of three years
7489ce9d65ed64f567e5ea53c8b75c5a.source_excerpt: At the end of three years their establishment had attained its present prosperity.

6ddaad4f9a2e1df68073cac79aa91072.constraint_text: The colony's existence ended in 1587 when its last members died of hunger after being weakened by cold and famine.
6ddaad4f9a2e1df68073cac79aa91072.source_excerpt: in 1587 the explorer Cavendish found the last of these four hundred unfortunates dying of hunger amid the ruins of a city only six years in existence.

3c428c851ca10dfce37566f7f54d9506.constraint_text: Paganel consistently provides detailed historical and political information when appealed to.
3c428c851ca10dfce37566f7f54d9506.source_excerpt: Paganel, as usual, upon being appealed to, could tell them of the rise, extension, and consolidation of the British power upon the island; he informed them of the beginnings--and, to his belief, of the causes--of the strife which for years decimated the aborigines...

62f71d358d582cbbf085f984f303e710.constraint_text: The man on the beach is definitively identified as Captain Grant, the father of Mary and Robert Grant.
62f71d358d582cbbf085f984f303e710.source_excerpt: It was, indeed, the man whom the children had so often described. Their hearts had not deceived them. It was their father, it was Captain Grant!

62f71d358d582cbbf085f984f303e710.constraint_text: Harry Grant is explicitly described as a 'pious Scotchman' whose first action upon returning to land is to thank God.
62f71d358d582cbbf085f984f303e710.source_excerpt: The pious Scotchman, on touching what was to him the soil of his country, wished, first of all, to thank God for his deliverance.

4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.constraint_text: The letter was written on the day Maximilian's father took a desperate resolution
4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.source_excerpt: this letter was written by him the day that my father had taken a desperate resolution

4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.constraint_text: The diamond was given by an unknown person as her dowry
4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.source_excerpt: this diamond was given by the generous unknown to my sister as her dowry

4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.constraint_text: They have never met the unknown benefactor
4815ccf1a9e85cb295315d0770d07cc7.source_excerpt: we have never had the happiness of pressing his hand

f4ebe32521cb7a86a1d0c000a7eefcab.constraint_text: Valentine's stepmother is watchful, her maid is overly devoted, and her brother is troublesome and teases her about embroidery.
f4ebe32521cb7a86a1d0c000a7eefcab.source_excerpt: I had to use no little diplomacy to get rid of my watchful stepmother, my too-devoted maid, and my troublesome brother, who is always teasing me about coming to work at my embroidery

f4ebe32521cb7a86a1d0c000a7eefcab.constraint_text: The young man's social station is lower than Valentine's, which restricts him from openly expressing his love without fear of offending her.
f4ebe32521cb7a86a1d0c000a7eefcab.source_excerpt: the difference between our respective stations makes me fear to offend you by speaking of my love

7bbd27e999e37e86e65b71b94320fe4b.constraint_text: The violets remained in Albert's buttonhole until at least their next encounter with the carriage.
7bbd27e999e37e86e65b71b94320fe4b.source_excerpt: the one who had thrown the violets to Albert, clapped her hands when she beheld them in his button-hole.

b39e11f0fd935354f3e65baf9039157a.constraint_text: Only two people (Cocles and Julie) have the key to the first door
b39e11f0fd935354f3e65baf9039157a.source_excerpt: "There are only two persons who have the key to that door," murmured Morrel, "Cocles and Julie."

26b359869e125c7ba023b5b4d3a5117a.constraint_text: The linen he kept has the letters H and N surmounted by a baron’s coronet.
26b359869e125c7ba023b5b4d3a5117a.source_excerpt: ‘An H and an N, surmounted by a baron’s coronet.’

26b359869e125c7ba023b5b4d3a5117a.constraint_text: His knowledge of heraldry stems from his service to Monte Cristo.
26b359869e125c7ba023b5b4d3a5117a.source_excerpt: ‘In your service, excellency, where everything is learned.’
No excellency, I do not recollect telling you that.” “I thought you did; I must have been mistaken.” “No, you were not, for it was in reality a little boy.

0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.constraint_text: Caderousse is Edmond's testamentary executor, not his heir.
Caderousse is one of Edmond's four named friends.
0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.source_excerpt: the name of one of the four friends is Caderousse

0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.constraint_text: Danglars is one of Edmond's four named friends.
0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.source_excerpt: Another of the number... is called Danglars

0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.constraint_text: Fernand is one of Edmond's four named friends.
Mercédès is the confirmed name of Edmond's betrothed.
0583a7d83b025727004456aa9b73bdf2.source_excerpt: Mercédès... True, said the abbé, with a stifled sigh, Mercédès it was.

cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.constraint_text: A man saved Maximilian's father from suicide, preventing the family's ruin and disgrace
cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.source_excerpt: this has touched the hand of a man who saved my father from suicide, us from ruin, and our name from shame and disgrace

cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.constraint_text: The letter was written by 'Sinbad the Sailor' on the day Maximilian's father took a desperate resolution
cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.source_excerpt: It was the letter written (as our readers know) to Julie, and signed 'Sinbad the Sailor.'

cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.constraint_text: They have never met the man who saved their family
cd30c989e55c39a2369c2dc88b71cca1.source_excerpt: we have never had the happiness of pressing his hand

6cd9e1e8936b2d32388062c76712a1e5.constraint_text: The husband's friendship with Edmond Dantès in 1814-1815 is explicitly cited as the cause for the diamond's acquisition
6cd9e1e8936b2d32388062c76712a1e5.source_excerpt: 'My husband was a great friend, in 1814 or 1815, of a sailor named Edmond Dantès.'

889c97c2386893ab63078a0de3f3c6cd.constraint_text: Their deaths were caused by eating mushrooms, as declared by a physician
889c97c2386893ab63078a0de3f3c6cd.source_excerpt: An hour afterwards a physician declared they were both poisoned through eating mushrooms.

8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.constraint_text: Benedetto asserts that the narrator cannot strike him because the narrator is not his father.
8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.source_excerpt: ‘You cannot beat me,’ said he; ‘you are not my father.’

8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.constraint_text: Benedetto’s character is revealed as defiant and audacious from childhood.
8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.source_excerpt: this answer, in which the child’s whole character revealed itself

8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.constraint_text: Benedetto’s audacity is directly caused by his earlier victory over the narrator.
8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.source_excerpt: this victory rendered him so audacious

8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.constraint_text: By age eleven, Benedetto had already chosen companions known as the worst characters in Corsica.
8357d51539da61c12fb326a169274770.source_excerpt: When he was only eleven, he chose his companions from among the young men of eighteen or twenty, the worst characters in Bastia, or, indeed, in Corsica

777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.constraint_text: Dantès has always entertained the greatest horror of pirates.
777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.source_excerpt: Dantès had always entertained the greatest horror of pirates

777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.constraint_text: Dantès resolved to adopt starvation as his method of death and began carrying it out on that day.
777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.source_excerpt: he resolved to adopt the second, and began that day to carry out his resolve.

777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.constraint_text: Dantès had taken an oath to die.
777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.source_excerpt: he had taken an oath to die.

777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.constraint_text: The recollection of his oath is the cause that gave Dantès strength to continue casting out his meals.
777b88b24b899a14d83e1fa866593c25.source_excerpt: Nothing but the recollection of his oath gave him strength to proceed.

0bdde2d2ce069c0e9faf808505a59255.constraint_text: Benedetto's character was well-nigh, if not quite, corrupt at the age of twelve
0bdde2d2ce069c0e9faf808505a59255.source_excerpt: which was now well-nigh, if not quite, corrupt

2af80c23f32c5e3f1d0ddc404aafcdae.constraint_text: Maintained a facade of calmness despite internal emotional conflict during the encounter with the hostile crowd.
2af80c23f32c5e3f1d0ddc404aafcdae.source_excerpt: Lady Helena affected a calmness that she could not feel in her heart.
